Game Boy (via separate adapter)
Also works as an adapter for Genesis/SNES controllers!


Seedi with Retrode Adapter (sold separately)
Multimedia
Play DVDs
Play media from a NAS
Play audio CDs and DVDs
YouTube and other add-ons


Enhanced gaming:
Online multiplayer for some systems
Video filters
Save state
Backup/share saved games


Technical specs:
1080p, 720p
HDMI
Wi-Fi
Bluetooth (wireless controllers)
Works with various original controllers and USB controllers
32 GB storage (included SD card)
Quad-core ARM processor
Region free
“Open” system (software and hardware)


More games!
DOS games (for ~386 and below, via CD in DOSBox, smartphone keyboard input)
Computer adventure games (via CD in ScummVM)
Optimized ports of classic games (Doom, Quake, etc)


Case
Small form factor
Horizontal or vertical orientation


Network optical drive:
Preserve existing discs (backup to Seedi/computer)
CD burner!


 * Limited Edition Seedi! *During the 90's there were a few especially timeless designs for special versions of game consoles. In that tradition we are also offering a LIMITED EDITION version of Seedi in old school transparent green plastic! Order while supplies last! Project StatusWe started working on Seedi over a year ago in our free time. Since then, it has evolved to the point where we have several functional prototypes and very positive alpha feedback.We are gamers and engineers that love to tinker and build things, with careers in consumer electronics.But now we need your help to make this for real! RisksAll projects, including Seedi, have the potential for things to go wrong.What you see here is a proposal for what we believe can be done - what we have developed, tested, planned for, and know will work. We both have a good bit of experience in product development, but there is still some uncertainty. Specifically, we will be working with all new suppliers and relying on them to follow through with promised lead times and consistency in quality when we begin production. Rest assured that we will absolutely not ship any product that compromises on quality.*Note to our 12 BETA unit backers: Obviously you will be receiving the earliest software and first-run units - they will not be perfect. We thank you for joining the team in a sense and providing us the feedback we'll need to get everything dialed in before full-scale production! You guys will also be the first to receive the finalized software. Finally, there's the matter of legality. We researched this early on and found that relevant lawsuits have historically ruled in our favor (Sony v. Bleem, Sony v. Connectix, Sega v. Accolade) and in fact there are multiple clone consoles that have been on the market for a while (but we'll be the first CD based system!). All software helping to run Seedi is either free open source  or licensed by us for commercial use.    FAQsLatest QuestionsDo any of the consoles/emulators require a BIOS file to work?The short answer is yes - most of the CD based systems will require you to copy a BIOS (.bin) file over to the system initially. This can be done easily through the Wi-Fi connection and we will provide simple instructions on how to do this.We expect that many of you have done this at some point or another using other emulators in the past. Once this step is done, Seedi just works.One exception to this is for PlayStation, which does not require a BIOS file - however, we recommend adding one for better compatibility.So, to repeat:
PlayStation: BIOS file not required but recommended
TurboGrafx CD: BIOS file required
Sega CD: BIOS file required
Neo Geo CD: BIOS file required
All other systems (NES, Genesis, Game Boy, Atari, TurboGrafx-16): Ready to go!
What is a BIOS?Does Seedi support XYZ console? Why not?Here is a list of systems not supported:
PS2, Xbox, Gamecube
Sega Dreamcast/GD-ROMs
PSP/UMDs
Various technical and cost limitations prevent us from supporting these systems.Perhaps Seedi version 2…Not supported at this time but potentially in the future:
SNES
Sega Saturn
3DO
CD-i
PC-FX
Amiga CD32
Jaguar CD
FM Towns Marty
Pippin
Is this just a Raspberry Pi? What’s the point?Seedi does not use Raspberry Pi - but it does use another great processor board, the Orange Pi! Check out this video for more detail. The idea behind Seedi is to be a frustration-free way of playing your old CD and other console games on your TV.We love Raspberry Pi though!Hardware specs?Initial specs (may change depending on level of funding):CPU: Quad-core ARM H3 @ 1.2GHzRAM: 512 MB DDR3GPU: Mali400This system is a performer!Haven’t I seen that controller before…?During development we knew the controller would be an essential part of the experience. After researching many different options, we decided to go with a 3rd Party version of the DualShock 3. As many of you know, these 3rd Party, or “P3”, controllers are widely available. It turns out there are MANY different suppliers and versions of them and their quality varies considerably. We evaluated a dozen or more different varieties until we found the right one based on feel, responsiveness, and quality of assembly. We are confident that the model we’ve selected will provide a great gaming experience with Seedi. And for those who have a particular controller they love, no problem! Seedi is available sans controller as well.Can’t I just do this stuff on my computer?Certainly, if you want to figure that all out and play on your computer – which we do think is a great way to play!The idea behind Seedi is to be a frustration-free way of playing your old CD and other console games on your TV. More FAQsIs this like the NES Classic or SNES Classic? Or a hypothetical “PS1 Classic”?A: Kind of. The main difference is that Seedi does not come with any games, and that it can actually play your original CD games with the built-in optical drive.Does Seedi come with any games?A: No - bring your own! :)For CD games, do I need to wait for the game to be copied to the system before playing?A: No! Seedi can read games from the disc on the fly, so they can be played immediately.Does Seedi work with multi-disc games?A: Yes!What controllers can I use?A: A bunch! Seedi has Bluetooth built in, and we recommend wireless controllers.The controllers that come with Seedi are similar to PS3 controllers.However you can hook up your own wired Xbox 360 controllers, etc. with a USB hub.Can I use a wired PS1 controller?A: Yes! We have tested out many PSX-USB adapters and they work great.How many controllers can I connect?A: You can hook up 8 controllers.How will keyboard & mouse input work for DOS?A: You can map the mouse and keys to your gamepad, use our phone app as a keyboard, or even hook up a real mouse and keyboard (wired or Bluetooth!)How do I copy over ROMs/files?A: The system has built-in WiFi. Connect Seedi to your home network, and it will appear as a shared drive folder.Can I play my cartridge games?A: Yes, with the addition of a Retrode adapter.You can separately purchase a Retrode adapter device and plug it into Seedi.The Retrode has 2 slots, Sega Genesis and SNES (SNES is not currently supported by Seedi), and also has ports to plug in Genesis/SNES controllers.Just insert your Genesis cartridge and Seedi will detect it and start up your game!There are also additional adapters for Retrode to work with Game Boy and more.Retrode can be purchased here: https://www.dragonbox.de/en/183-cart-readerWhat ports are there for expansion?A: Seedi has one USB “OTG” port, and it comes with an adapter to plug in normal USB peripherals. To plug in multiple devices you can use a USB hub!Can I play imported games?A: Yes!Can I play DVDs from different regions?A: Yes!How well can I expect games to play?A: Emulation is not always perfect, and we accept that.Take a look at this breakdown for how we classify compatibility:Key:“Fantastic” - 95% of games work without any issues“Good” - 80% of games work without issues
PlayStation
with BIOS - fantastic
without BIOS - good


Sega CD - fantastic (requires BIOS)
TurboGrafx CD - fantastic (requires BIOS)
Neo Geo CD - fantastic (requires BIOS)
NES - fantastic
Sega Genesis - fantastic
Game Boy - fantastic
Atari 2600 - fantastic
Neo Geo - fantastic
TurboGrafx - fantastic
PC adventure games - see https://www.scummvm.org/compatibility/

DOS - Games requiring a 386 processor or below should run fine
How does game saving work?A: Your game progress is saved to the main SD card. You can use traditional built-in saves, or emulator “save anywhere” - your choice.What setup will be required?A: You will be up and running in no time.-Plug the system into TV and power-Pair the included controller(s) (first time only)-Connect to WiFi-Copy over any game files you want to play*For CD based systems you must also provide a BIOS file (simple instructions included)-Have fun!What does the button on Seedi do?A: The default behavior will be to set the system to sleep, and wake it back up.What open source projects does this use?A: Front-end/media player: KodiEmulators: Various. Please read this article for the full list.OS: LinuxCD emulation: Seedi (will be open source upon launch)Is this an official product by/licensed by Sony/Sega/etc.?A: No.Does it support the PS1 multitap?A: Unfortunately no. If you want to use a bunch of PS1 controllers, what you can do though is use a USB hub with multiple PS1-USB adapters.Can I use my PS1 memory card?A: No. Seedi uses a virtual memory card. It is possible though to copy PS1 save files onto the virtual memory card.How does Seedi make my games look good on my TV?A: Old TVs and game systems had various analog properties that resulted in a blurred picture, which made them look great, and they were designed for this environment.When you hook up your classic systems to high-definition TVs they lose a lot of these effects and end up looking weird/bad. Seedi uses a few techniques (enabled by default) to automatically correct these issues so that games look like they were supposed to.How should I place Seedi in my room?A: Seedi can sit flat, or you can use the included stand to hold it vertically (either on the left side or right side). Just make sure to give it a little air to ventilate.Can I also listen to music with Seedi?A: Sure, just pop in an audio CD or DVD-Audio disc. You can also stream audio files from a NAS or other source.What output resolutions are supported?A: 720p, 1080pHow much storage space does Seedi have?A: There are 32 GBs, so you should have plenty of space to store files locally. You could also use your own SD card instead, or plug in a USB drive.Is Seedi based on FPGA hardware?A: No. We have found that good old emulation is just fine :)Is the Seedi hardware locked down (“Tivo-ized”) at all?A: No! You can repurpose the hardware for anything you want. And you can reinstall the Seedi package as well.What's with the name?A: Phonetically it sounds like “CD” - the medium that changed the game. It also represents the seed that was planted with this wave of games in the 90s.Who are these guys?A: Chris is a mechanical engineer who grew up playing NES with his mom.Bryan is a software engineer who grew up playing DOS games.Together we have 20 years of industry experience in consumer electronics and design.    Work in progress disclaimerAll preview photos/screenshots/etc on this page represent our goals for the final product - not the final product itself. Seedi is still in development so changes may be made.Open Source ComplianceSeedi is predominantly powered by a collection of free open source software. We have selected programs that are licensed explicitly allowing sale/redistribution (such as GPL). When Seedi ships, this code and our modifications will be made publicly available according to their licenses. To learn more please read our statment here.ROM/BIOS filesA "ROM" is a digital backup of a console game (which can normally only be run on the system it was originally designed for). A "BIOS" file is a digital copy of the operating system software from a gaming system. The legality of using ROMs/BIOS files depends on the laws in your country and/or other conditions like owning an original copy of the game and/or the original hardware it ran on.

story:
Asteidus: free online RPG where you make mythology

Platforms: PC with plans for Xbox and PlayStation in future

Key features

  • Engage in a world with unique history mythology and entities
  • A World with its own day and night cycle, calendar, alphabet
  • Level your character through story driven quest that minimizes grinding
  • Best players have a chance to impact the world
  • Every player has a chance to become Asteidus
  • PvP combat and lots of events
  • Huge battle events that are part of the story

Asteidus is a mortal that has powers and features of a god

The Largest rank that player can achieve is to become Asteidus

Opportunity to become Asteidus

In the epic 50v50 battle where best clans of both races are at war, the winner clan gets to advance into the enemy territory with the future events.

In those events most of the leaders have a quest to conquer enemy territory and are accompanied by Teidos, the first humans that consumed long vanished gods and achieved godhood themselves.

Each of them has an underlying mission for entering the enemy territory but in the final battle to conquer the main city only the best clan will remain and its leader will have a chance to help Their Teidos to fulfill their quest.

If they succeed their last mission will be to battle current Asteidus. If the player wins they will have all ingredients to do the ritual of Asteidus.

 

Features of Asteidus

  • Becomes Game master
  • Obtain special armor of Asteidus
  • Ultimate weapon that corresponds to its class
  • People bow to you
  • A Monument put up in your honor
  • The Future story develops around the name of your character
  • Your name is permanently noted

Lands

 

Amakona

The holy land where civilization was born. In the right center of the land there is Mana lake which is only source of Mana and magic in the whole world.

It is a reason that whole civilization developed from simple minded ancestors to a fully developed civilization across almost whole map. Believed to be created from Mionas tears now it hides more than 2000 years old magic academy at the bottom with only a little visible peak. With only one main city Amakona it is the only peaceful land where battle between Bardokor and Thelamos is prohibited.

Even if city of Amakona was built to forget the past there are ruins of Qiramos civilization across the whole map with many evidence of ancient life.


In alpha version only a part of Amakona will be available for exploration

Vastitera

Once an unexplored peaceful land now is a place of eternal battle between two races.

Every race has its own base that they have to defend in case of enemy attack. In the center there is Bowl that maintains a protective shield for civilians and weak that happen to be in the center of the battle.

For the brave there are also a places to explore that give many opportunities.

Mythology

The sun Lutuen is considered to be the creator of everything and people mostly fear him because he is least understood of them all. When Lutuen disappears there comes the night and in the night two moons appear in the sky. They are called Aven and Miona which are considered to also fear of Lutuen but are on good nature because they light the world in the darkness.

They are true descendants of now ancient race Qiramos. Many years have passed and since then they evolved into more advanced looking races. Most of them still worship Tehelal but there are some that don’t believe in that religion anymore. As Tehelal was created by their prayer and belief most of them stayed loyal to him. Physically they can be strong as warriors but are more developed through intellect. In their kingdom to be most respected is to be of highest rank in magic, while warriors are considered to be more on the brute side.

 

Before many hundreds of years they were the ones that couldn’t bear the winter that ultimate evil Barkodah reigned. He made their hearth and body built to endure the cold and become his army. After the great separation they sailed with ships to the east, where eternal winter dwells. Because of their body transformations it was harder to cast magic so they developed more towards blood and strength.
 

 

Warrior

Strength in your arms is matched to that of gods.

Your sword cuts to the bone.

Your axe smashes through stone

The Armor you carry shines so that even the King nods.

 

 

 

Rogue

You lurk in the shadows where is no light

Nor Aven nor Miona can see you in the night

There is no target that you can’t shoot with an arrow

Your blade moves faster than the eyes of sparrow

 

 

 

Mage

When Miona cries

Mana drops from her eyes

Drink her tears to get the magic might

Summon a fireball and knock down a knight

Knight may carry the strength in his arms

But the power of your spells sounds the alarms

 

 

 

Priest

You are kissed by the skies

You can heal others when Miona cries

Pray for the damned

Enchant with your hand

Equip the robe like the mage

Smash your mace with rage

 

 

Our history begins long before Lutuen decided to hide his sunlight, which gave birth to Aven and Miona who protect our people from the darkness every night.

It begins in the age when people were of the same race called Qiramos.

One day a man, an old man stumbled onto a magnificent site of a lake filled with a strange kind of water that was actually tears of Miona. You see Aven is very angry with Miona and every night she collides with her happiness which makes Miona very sad.

Old man shared his discovery with people and it sparked revolution and a civilization flourished. The power it carried was not from this world so they called it magic and the magic water Mana. Centuries have passed and the Civilization became so huge that it needed to be divided in two parts with two rulers.

To connect two separate parts the ultimate building was built to gather all the knowledge and to teach others the magic. That was Elu Thalor.

All was well until one detrimental day when mad king of the south city Nopheon decided to bring Riuxxo to his Castle. Riuxxo was imprisoned in Elu Thalor because of his innovative but very sinister use of magic. Riuxxo took the power from Nopheon and after consuming the life from the whole south city, he created the ultimate evil called Barkodah.

It was in fact a God without physical form and though invisible you could feel it playing with your soul and talking to your mind. King Aephial of the upper city and master wizards needed to take action fast before eternal winter overcomes their land and Barkodah consumes them all. They created their God called Tehelal which was not summoned by sacrificing people but with a willpower, prayers and belief in him.

Unfortunately the winter spread, taking lives and moral of the people. Some decided to bow to Barkodah for salvation from the cold. In order to become his army he transformed them into Bardokors which marked them forever by carrying symbols of ultimate evil, though able to endure even the cold like this.

The day finally came for the ultimate battle between the gods and their armies on the bridges of Elu Thalor. The might of Tehelal and Barkodahs crash was so strong that it has sent them into the sky almost touching Lutuen but it ended in an explosion leaving most of the great civilization in ruins.

On that day no one knew what happened but their gods never returned including Riuxxo. With their cities now in ruins and with no leaders, the two distinct races Thelamos and Bardokor went separate ways to rebuild their civilizations. The land has been declared as the land of peace and honor to avoid such devastation again and the City of Amakona was built in that honor. After the city was built, everyone went their separate ways to build their civilization.

2000 years have passed since then and now 2 races are ruled by kings and Teidoses with a war between them lasting for many years. Every Teidos has their problems and you have a chance to help them in their suffering and earn an honor to become Asteidus.

 

We are a small team of two from Croatia. Maxko also has history in creating games. In 2008. They created MMORPG called Titan that is still active.

Damir Flekac(To the right) - Programmer, MAXKO CEO

Dario Magdic(To the left) – 3D Game designer

 

 

We started creating this game for fun fueled only by passion, but as the project got bigger we decided to reach out for your help to make the process easier. This process allows us to create Asteidus exactly the way you want. This way you will be able to participate in game development and interact with us as we continue our work.

Right now we are making the game each at separate venues but with funding we would be able to work in an office and fill it with better computers and grow our team which would speed up the development process significantly.

story:
WHO AM I?

I am Chase, an avid Total War series afficiando and am MEGA excited about Rome 2.

This whole thing is a dare from my mate mitch for ME to don the full set of legionare equipment and parade around handing out additional paid for copies, getting photos and just being generally roman in nature.

He'll film and we'll do a short documentary to showcase the event if it happens :)

While its going to be pretty hilarious, i'm almost 100% positive its not going to be funded.

WHY THE INFERNUS DO YOU WANT A SUIT OF ROMAN SOLDIERS EQUIPMENT

I have been dared to march on EB games to aquire my collectors edition in FULL roman attire.

I will also be hanging around for the day and engage in photos and general antics, i'de also like to film the day!

I have the equipment for filming this, just not the roman armor.

WHERE DOES MY MONEY GO?

Your money goes to me, which then goes to www.armorvenue.com, any left over funds will be used go buying extra copies to give out to people on the day.
I will be getting the roman trooper armor with the premium lorica and legionary belt.

WHY SHOULD I DONATE?

Pretty much just for a laugh, My friend will film the event and we will put up a nicely edited video for you to witness, or you can come down to whichever EB we end up going to if this passes!

If the goal is not reached, you dont pay anything, and i dont embarress myself in public!

HEY I HAVE A SUIT OF ROMAN ARMOR CAN I JOIN

Hell yes you can glorious Evocatus.

I'M BROKER THEN A PLEB IN A PIGSTYE WHAT CAN I EVEN DO

Spread this around i guess! tweet, facebook, whatever you feel like =]

story:
‘Henry Attacks’ is a small but really nice adventurous game. The main peculiarities of the game are dynamic firefights, numerous monsters and an ability to travel in both 2D and 3D worlds.

A great emphasis will be made on a deep plot and dialogs. This part has lately been forgotten in the platformer games.

You will be able to fight effectively in 2D as all the adversaries will be your targets. But meeting a more serious 2D opponent you won’t be ready to avoid your collapse due to the same plane, and you won’t have an opportunity to escape.

3D technology will present a wonderful ability to move further into the level, which will give you a chance to escape monsters and bypass almost all obstacles. Due to Henry’s ambiguity and ability to stretch space, he may move in any direction, but has only right and left directions for shooting. That will make confrontation with 3D monsters look more like a game of tags.

 

 

Money collected thanks to this campaign, will go for production of music (which is very important), models, game art, support and development of the website, and purchase of the licensed software.

If you have no chance to contribute any sum of money, I will understand this, but you may still be helpful for us. A word of mouth is a great mechanism. You may spread information of this campaign. Tell it to your friends, share a link in your social network account. The more people see this campaign, the more chances I’ve got to finish the game and tell a story of its heroes. To enrich our world with new spots, bonuses, adversaries, and secret places.

Thank you for your support.

story:
THE STORY

While flying home from an SIA trade show in Denver, I noticed a gentleman across the aisle. His laptop barely fit on the seatback tray as he struggled to use a traditional mouse on the limited space of his laptop. Right then, the idea came to me – wouldn’t it be cool if I could control my PC functions just by moving my finger?

I immediately pulled out my project notebook and started drawing – and the concept for a wireless, 3-D mouse that fits on your finger was born – the Mycestro.

Since then, the Mycestro has been featured CNET, Techcrunch, Gizmag, Crains Cleveland, Wired, Engadget, and many more. Also, Mycestro was selected as a semifinalist in the COSE Live Your Dream contest. It also gained the honor of semifinalist at the prestigious TiEQuest, an international entrepreneurship competition.

You can also check out these videos on YouTube: Mycestro and IPTV, Mycestro using 3D CAD, and the Mycestro Introduction.

HOW DOES IT WORK

  • Mycestro is a 3-D mouse, which means it has the ability to track hand motion in 3-D space.
  • Mycestro is activated by your thumb. When you’re not touching the Mycestro, the cursor and cursor function pause until you begin to use it again.
  • The touch-sensitive panel initiates cursor movement. To use the Mycestro, simply touch anywhere on the panel. You can control the cursor position by moving your hand in the direction you want it to go. To make selections, release the touch panel and then tap it again on the left, middle or right button section.
  • Range: Mycestro has a range of up to 30 feet.
  • Wireless: Mycestro incorporates Bluetooth 4.0 Low Energy Protocol, making it compatible with Bluetooth Smart Ready devices like iPad®3 and newer iPad Mini, iPhone® 4S and newer, iPod Touch Gen5, Apple® MacBook® Air, Mac® mini and MacBook Pro, and any PC with a compatible BLE dongle. Android devices should be available by the end of the year.

Features:

  • Mycestro is about the size of a wireless earpiece, appox 1.8 inches long.
  • Mycestro is very light, weighing .3 oz, next to nothing.
  • Its internal battery can be charged via USB.
  • Battery life is estimated to be eight hours depending on usage.
  • Two different replaceable clip sizes.

WHERE ARE WE

Mycestro is a patent-pending technology. The Mycestro project was started about two years ago. Since then I have made significant product enhancements, conducted dozens of demonstrations and received publicity via Engadget and COSE, to name a few. I also have a few videos on YouTube.

I knew that in order to get Mycestro into the hands of consumers, I needed to enhance our corporate team and our strategic alliances with professional organizations and educational institutions. I put together a terrific management, business development, technology and strategic team and continue to strengthen our professional staff and alliances.

WHO ARE WE

David Greenspan, Chief Executive Officer and Director

The company is led by David Greenspan, CEO. Dave previously served as CEO for a couple of successful start-ups, COO of the PGA TOUR Radio Network, and CFO for two publicly traded companies, Exchange BLVD, Inc. and MyTurn.com, Inc., a NASDAQ-listed company. Dave has over fifteen years of experience working with emerging companies in various executive, financial and operational positions. Prior to this period, Dave's experience was with large multi-national corporations. The diversity of projects and experience in both a small, start-up environment as well as a large multi-national company environment has provided him with a unique set of skills, experiences and perspective.

(Me) Nick Mastandrea, Founder, Chief Technology Officer and Director

I have a combination of twenty-five years of experience in product design and engineering for consumer, medical and industrial products. I have been a business owner since 1999 when I started Great Lakes Engineering & Design, Inc., an engineering consulting firm. In 2003, I started MT Manufacturing, Inc., designing sunless spray tanning booths, including a proprietary revolutionary product, the VersaSpa, which became the top-selling product in the industry. I sold my interest in that company in May 2009.

I have authored/co-authored 16 patents, along with four provisional patent applications, in the last two years. I received my associate degree in electrical engineering from the Electronics Technology Institute and then went on to receive my Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering from Cleveland State University.

Anthony Crisalli, Director

Mr. Crisalli is a results-driven financial services executive with a successful track record of delivering rapid and sustainable revenue growth in the commercial, middle‐market and institutional sectors. He was responsible for building and managing a diverse group of businesses within financial services including capital markets, commercial and investment banking, and venture capital/private equity. Anthony’s operating/transaction experience includes financial modeling, budgeting and planning, equity and debt financing, risk management, cash management and financial reporting.

Michael Finn, Director

Mr. Finn has been an adviser to the company since 2011, bringing more than 30 years of experience in venture capital, private equity, mergers and acquisitions, and institutional investment to the project. He is a seasoned investment executive with extensive experience building private and public companies and has served as a corporate director for more than 35 companies. Mr. Finn’s areas of expertise include manufacturing, software, staffing, technology, health care and financial services.

Stephen Chiles

Mr. Chiles is a successful business leader with a focus on building high-impact programs and cross-functional teams that heavily leverage digital marketing and emerging cloud technologies to drive significant revenue growth. He has built critical marketing, sales and operational value in key C-level roles within the Internet start-up space with ShareFile, acquired by Citrix in 2011; Insurance.com, acquired by Quinstreet in 2010; and Reprise Media, acquired by The Interpublic Group in 2007. Prior to Mr. Chiles’ experience with Internet start-ups, he held a variety of interactive marketing leadership roles at AOL during the birth and subsequent growth of marketing on the Web, as we know it today.

WHAT’S LEFT TO DO

My goal is to make Mycestro as compatible as possible for the ever-growing number of laptops, tablets, smartphones and PCs in the marketplace. I have spent more than a year preparing to launch Mycestro on Indiegogo to ensure that you, our backers, are completely satisfied with the product and are completely confident that we can deliver. I have a working prototype with finalized housing and electronics designs. The packaging is being finalized – and Dave and I have finalized distribution, warehousing, manufacturing, testing and customer service plans.

WE NEED YOU

Your support will go toward all efforts to manufacture Mycestro. Donations generated on Indiegogo will help fund plastic injection mold tooling, a preproduction prototype run of the electronics, and a pilot run for manufacturing complete units, testing and packaging. We are committed to getting Mycestro into production as quickly as possible, with an estimated release date between October and November 2013.

Comfortable enough for typing
Touch sensitive
A 3D mouse at your fingertips
Semi-rigid finger clip
Semi-rigid finger clip
Semi-rigid finger clip
Semi-rigid finger clip snapping in place
Place Mycestro on you index finger
Begin wraping the semi-rigid strap around your finger
Form semi-rigid strap
Mycestro stays secure without cutting off circulation
Mycestro Color Palette
Mycestro Application for Windows/Mac - Preferences
Mycestro Application for Windows/Mac - Diagnostics
Mycestro Application for Windows/Mac - Advanced Preferences
 

Risks and challenges

 

Innovative Developments, LLC has a prototype completed and is working on enhancements to its current platform. ID is looking to Indiegogo backers to help speed up the development and product delivery of the Mycestro™. The main risk in this project is delays. We're projecting an October 2013 delivery timeframe – we hope to have the Mycestro ™ in your hands before that, but we need to admit it's not a guarantee. We are very busy in reaching our goals and development and product delivery is our number one priority. Innovative Developments, LLC plans to regularly update everyone on its progress on the Mycestro.com website.

story:
Latest update:

You can now receive your share of the studios profits in return for your donation. check the updates tab for more info.

Please check the updates regularly 

 

 

 

Now the time has come to realise a dream of mine that I have been planning and building for the past 18 months which is to bring to gamers something truly special. To do this I aim to build BlueBlaze studio into a super social games studio where everyone can follow, gain an unrivalled perspective of the development process and see our games progress live through every stage of development, via our forums, social media and daily live streams.

 

Our first project will be PAPER. A truly unique top down action game which will give players a fantastic new gaming experience.

An unseen war has been raging between the raindrops and the cretins. By chance one of the rain drops dripped from your umbrella and landed in the open ink pot on your desk. Here he manifests into our hero Inkun destined to protect you pages of paper from the evil cretins that invade the paper.

Cretins tear through a random place on the paper and pour out onto the page and its Inkuns job to fight them off and patch that hole in the paper with sticky tape.

 

you view the action from a top down perspective and control Inkuns movements by tilting the tablet in the direction you want him to go and he will react in the way that you would expect a droplet of Ink to.

He will attack any cretin in range and in the direction that he is facing, some times even when moving.

 

He will have special powers and abilities which you can activate through the touch screen

Abilities such as:

  • flicking Inkun through a crowd of Cretins

  • raining ink down on to a section of the paper

  • picking inkun up and placing him into a different location on the paper.

These powers will be unlocked as the player progresses through the game.

 

Inkun has the ability hide behind objects that are on the paper to use them as cover and he does this automatically if the player moves him into the object.

To enhance the replay value of paper we plan to place these objects randomly on the map.

 

Gameplay is wave based with each wave getting progressively harder with many different cretins in larger numbers. Boss waves are also planned.

 Player progression is based around a player leveling system where the player gains experience from the cretins that are killed. Upp on leveling up the player unlocks new customizable options for inkun which can make him stronger tougher and grant him different abilities. This allows the player great freedom to create new builds that better suit their playing style.

  • We will be able to rent an office space and cover the cost of utilities

  • We will be able to Hire some great fresh talent

  • We will be able to buy the necessary equipment and hardware needed to create great games

  • We will be able to purchase various software and licences need for this project

  • Legal and other business costs related to running the studio will be covered

  • We will be able to publish and launch the complete game

  • We will be able to market the game and let everyone know about it.

 

In short it will allow us to create great studio environment where a small group of talented people will dedicate themselves to making truly unique and player centric games for you and allow us to develop and launch our first project, PAPER.

 

If we manage to raise an extra $16000 we are planing to create for Paper an online co-op multiplayer where you and 2 other friends can battle the crettins together and build your characters to complement each others playing style and roles within the team. difficulty levels will be adjusted appropriately. Online scoreboards will also be introduced. We believe this would be a really special gameplay experience to share with your friends and co-op multiplayer would be the icing on papers cake offering even more epic chaos and destruction on a tiny scale.

 

We are looking into an extra funding option to try and bring this aspect of the game to you even if the extra funding is not reached.

 

If we manage to raise $16000 on top of this we plan to create a version of of paper for PC gamers with many aspects of the game maximised to suite the PC including a more indepth options menu with plenty of graphical options and if we are able to we would like to see integration with the steam network to allow matchmaking using your steam friends list.

 

If we reach a further milestone of $26000 we would love to deliver a wii ware and playstation store version of the game which make use of the motion controls of both systems. In a similar way to the PC version we would try to maximise the game for each of the consoles.

 

Any further funding will go into marketing the game and the creation of further BlueBlaze Studio titles.

 

Well firstly we will continue to push new boundaries for gamers and strive to bring new experiences to gamers.

 

Secondly we would like to return the favour and use our success to encourage and support the others with our gaming mentality whether that be offering help and guidance from our experience of financial help to others struggling to get an amazing game into production. we will pledge at least the equivalent amount raised to help us into other projects and plan to pledge a whole lot more to those who are trying to create something worth while.

As well as getting a future of great games to look forward to from us starting with PAPER.

 

You will also get the opportunity to get involved with all that the studio dose through the planned array of social studio features.

 

As well as this there are prizes, yeay ,

 

if you look to the right of the screen there is a list of gifts you can expect to get for sending your much needed donations our wayincluding the oppotunity to share our profits as well as our eternal thanks for bringing life to BlueBlaze Studio.

story:
New, true-to-source tabletop RPG based on Edgar Rice Burroughs' sword-and-planet tales, set on the dying and war-torn red planet.


Click here, or check out our perks on the right. Find one that appeals to you, and click on it. You'll then be given the option to pay with your credit card or PayPal account.

PULP ADVENTURE ON MARS!

Warlord of Mars: the Role-playing Game™ is a new way to vividly experience pulp fantasy on the world of Barsoom - a world imagined first by Edgar Rice Burroughs (the creator of Tarzan) in his sword-and-planet story, A Princess of Mars.

The core of this game is storytelling. You and your friends may tell a story together, guiding your heroes through quests for lost cities; battles with deadly Martians; daring rescues; courtly romance; and much more.

This basic rulebook includes:

  • rapid character creation to get you going ASAP;
  • fast-paced, cinematic-style combat system, based on D6 Legend;
  • skill lists unique to Barsoom;
  • rules for Martian trappings (gear), weapons and fliers;
  • tips and tricks for the GM to create authentic, ERB-style pulp adventures;
  • more than a dozen character templates; 
  • and an introductory adventure!

Despite going to great lengths to be true to our source material, playing Warlord of Mars: the Role-playing Game™ is not meant to be an exercise in nostalgia or to express a longing for a different time. This new game treats these stories with the respect they deserve while giving players innovative and fresh material for this genre.

Click here, or check out our perks on the right. Find one that appeals to you, click on it. You'll then be given the option to pay with your credit card or PayPal account.

THE ARTWORK OF MARS

Our funding goal of $2,000 will allow us to commission the fantastic artwork required to help bring Burroughs' world to life. And in doing so, we aim to present a new, unique take on the many alien lifeforms Burroughs created for his world.

Check out some of our sample artwork below.

The first is the famous Martian lion, the banth, as interpreted by D. J. Burgess Digital Design:

And the famous Green Martians, here interpreted by Viktor Tóth:
And here we have a gorgeous Red princess, also by Tóth:

And this is a Red chieftain by Hendra Adriyasa:

And a Martian bulldog - the calot - by Sleazyfish Studios:


STRETCH GOAL


If we reach the stretch goal of $6,900, we'll be able to work with old-school pulp printers, the Newspaper Club, to create a unique form of the rulebook: the basic rulebook will be printed as four authentic pulp magazines, together encompassing all the basic rules. 


As with every independent publisher, there are bound to be challenges with the printer. The advantage for us, however, is that for our softcover print-run for this book, we'll be using a local printer with whom we have a pre-existing relationship - we've worked together on projects for the past several years. So rather than having to deal with remote printers via e-mail or 1-800 numbers at a distance, we can physically attend at the printer's shop, assess proofs, and sort out problems first-hand.

Editing is often an important part of a publication that new independent publishers overlook. For us, we already have in place a team of editors, headed by Tim Snider - the Amazing Sniderman!

We also bring a broad range of experience from our various day jobs to tackle the unexpected: on our team we have a marketing expert; a lawyer; several actors, and - most importantly - several more long-time RPGamers.

Playtesting is a vital part of developing this game. Along with out own in-house playtesting, we'll be making playtest versions of the rules available to fans for New Year's, and holding regular gaming sessions at the Interactivity Board Game Cafe in beautiful Victoria, B.C.

N.B. This game is not licensed or authorized by, or in any way affiliated with Dynamite® Entertainment, or Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc, or any other entity associated with the Edgar Rice Burroughs estate.
story_txt:
New, true-to-source tabletop RPG based on Edgar Rice
 Burroughs' sword-and-planet tales, set on the dying and war-torn red 
planet.

Click here, or check out our perks on the right. Find one that appeals to you, and click on it. You'll then be given the option to pay with your credit card or PayPal account.PULP ADVENTURE ON MARS!Warlord of Mars: the Role-playing Game™ is a new way to vividly experience pulp fantasy on
 the world of Barsoom - a world imagined first by Edgar Rice Burroughs (the creator of Tarzan) in his sword-and-planet story, A Princess of Mars.The core of this game is storytelling. You and 
your friends may tell a story together, guiding your heroes through 
quests for lost cities; battles with deadly Martians; daring rescues; 
courtly romance; and much more.This basic rulebook includes:
rapid character creation to get you going ASAP;
fast-paced, cinematic-style combat system, based on D6 Legend;
skill lists unique to Barsoom;
rules for Martian trappings (gear), weapons and fliers;
tips and tricks for the GM to create authentic, ERB-style pulp adventures;
more than a dozen character templates; 
and an introductory adventure!
Despite going to great lengths to be true to our source material, playing Warlord of Mars: the Role-playing Game™ is not meant to be an exercise in nostalgia or to express a longing for a different time. This new game treats these stories with the respect they deserve while giving players innovative and fresh material for this genre.Click  here, or check out our perks on the right. Find one that appeals to you, click on it. You'll then be given the option to pay with your credit card or PayPal account.THE ARTWORK OF MARSOur funding goal of $2,000 will 
allow us to commission the fantastic artwork required to help bring 
Burroughs' world to life. And in doing so, we aim to present a new, 
unique take on the many alien lifeforms Burroughs created for his world.Check out some of our sample artwork below.The first is the famous Martian lion, the banth, as interpreted by D. J. Burgess Digital Design: And the famous Green Martians, here interpreted by Viktor Tóth:And here we have a gorgeous Red princess, also by Tóth:And this is a Red chieftain by Hendra Adriyasa:And a Martian bulldog - the calot - by Sleazyfish Studios:STRETCH GOAL
If we reach the stretch goal of $6,900, we'll be able to work with old-school pulp printers, the Newspaper Club, to create a unique form of the rulebook: the basic rulebook will be printed as four authentic pulp magazines, together encompassing all the basic rules. As with every independent publisher, there are bound to be challenges
 with the printer. The advantage for us, however, is that for our 
softcover print-run for this book, we'll be using a local printer with 
whom we have a pre-existing relationship - we've worked together on 
projects for the past several years. So rather than having to deal with 
remote printers via e-mail or 1-800 numbers at a distance, we can 
physically attend at the printer's shop, assess proofs, and sort out 
problems first-hand.
Editing is often an important part of a publication that new 
independent publishers overlook. For us, we already have in place a team
 of editors, headed by Tim Snider - the Amazing Sniderman!
We also bring a broad range of experience from our various day jobs 
to tackle the unexpected: on our team we have a marketing expert; a 
lawyer; several actors, and - most importantly - several more long-time 
RPGamers.

own in-house playtesting, we'll be making playtest versions of the rules
 available to fans for New Year's, and holding regular gaming sessions 
at the Interactivity Board Game Cafe in beautiful Victoria, B.C.N.B. This game is not licensed or authorized by, or in any way
affiliated with Dynamite® Entertainment, or Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc, or any
other entity associated with the Edgar Rice Burroughs estate.

story:
Who is 'Sleepy Dragon Games'?

We are a small team that are passionate about gaming and great artwork. This is the first of (hopefully) many games that we will create by merging those two passions. At present, our team consists of Amanda (the founder and game’s mastermind) and Beth Porter (a compulsive doodler, and our artist). We have also added Matthew Lapierre to our art team. In addition, all of our awesome campaign artwork and the framed perk rewards were created by the incredibly talented Jonathan Powell. Unfortunately, as a small start-up style group we don’t have the funds to match our enthusiasm. Which is where you come in!

 

What We Need

Our goal is to be able to add amazing artwork to the card game, Story Builder, and then be able to distribute it to every gamer who wants to play. Towards that end we are asking for $45,000, which breaks down as follows:

  • $25,000 for artwork
  • $15,000 for the initial manufacturing run
  • $5,000 for distribution and marketing costs.

The cost of the artwork is the lion’s share of the money we are asking for because we feel that the way to make an amazing game is to make it look as amazing as it plays! Which is why we don’t want to skimp when it comes to paying our artists.

If we are able to surpass the $45,000 goal then the money will be used to fund the following:

  • Creating a second, non-exclusive, expansion pack
  • Covering future, and on-going, manufacturing
  • Hiring our team full time to work on future new games (and expansions).

For more details, check out Stretch Goals & Rewards lower down the page.

We’ve opted for a Fixed Funding style campaign because while we truly believe that this is a great game and want to see it get made, we won't be able to realize that dream without your help.

 

Updates

As the campaign progresses we'll post updates, which you can view by clicking the 'Update' tab at the top. If you follow us you'll get an e-mail when we post, which makes it super simple for you to stay up-to-date with what's happening with this campaign!

Currently, there is a new video posted under the 'Update' tab at the top. It's just a quick look, in more detail, at how a game plays out.

 

What You Get

Now on to the part that you’re all really here for… the Perks!

We’ve got some amazing things up for grabs at every pledge level. From the $3 Dreamer package to the $250 Scribbler package, each pledge will receive great goodies. All goodies outside of the game and expansion pack are expected to ship 2 weeks after the campaign closes. The game and expansion packs should ship within 6 months. Of course as we get closer to the campaign close we’ll keep you all posted on any shipping date changes.

 

Detailed Perk Descriptions

Each pledge level gets something cool. Here is the list of their full descriptions!

Please remember that if you live outside of North America to add $5-$15 to your pledge to help cover the cost of shipping.

Dreamer ($2) –The most basic pledge, but no less important! With this you will get a "thank you" shout out on Amanda's twitter account as well as on the Sleepy Dragon Games Facebook page. Plus, your name will forever grace Sleepy Dragon's own website under the tab "Our Supporters".

Poet ($9) –You will recieve a custom postcard with some of the first game art we've finished, plus a personalized thank you note signed by all of our team (not including Jonathon Powell). Plus everything at the Dreamer level.

(Image to come later)

Doodler ($20) –Choose from 1 of 7 sketches by Jonathan Powell. Your choice will be printed on glossy photo paper and put in a nice frame. We’ll also add a short personalized note for no extra charge and it can be signed by any or all of our team (Jonathan’s signature will automatically grace each picture, but he lives apart from us so he can’t sign any notes). Plus you’ll get everything in the Dreamer level.

Artist ($40) –Choose from 1 of 4 full colour pictures by Jonathan Powell. Your choice will be printed on glossy photo paper and put in a nice frame. We’ll also add a short personalized note for no extra charge and it can be signed by any or all of our team (Jonathan’s signature will automatically grace each picture, but he lives apart from us so he can’t sign any notes). Plus you’ll get everything in the Dreamer level.

Journeyman Poet ($50) –This pledge level gets you a full copy of the game once the art is finished and the game printed. Plus everything from the Poet level, and for only $10 extra you can get a framed sketch, or $20 for a framed full colour picture.

Master Poet ($70) –Here is where you get not only the game but the Indiegogo-only, expansion pack. Plus everything from the Poet level, and for only $10 extra you can get a framed sketch, or $20 for a framed full colour picture.

Bard ($75) –We know you think the game is awesome, and you’re going to want to share it with your friends. This pledge level gets you 2 full games! Plus everything from the Poet level, and for only $8 extra you can get a framed sketch, or $16 for a framed full colour picture.

Journeyman Bard ($105) –If you’re getting two games, why not get two expansion packs to go along with them? That’s what this level gets you! Plus everything from the Poet level, and for only $8 extra you can get a framed sketch, or $16 for a framed full colour picture.

Master Bard ($115) –Sometimes it can be hard to decide who gets the totally awesome gift of a new and epic game like Story Builder. So this pledge level gets you 3 full games! Plus everything from the Poet level, and for only $6 extra you can get a framed sketch, or $12 for a framed full colour picture.

Epic Bard ($160) –You, my friend, are a paragon of true generosity. This level gets you 3 full games plus 3 expansion packs! Plus everything from the Poet level, and for only $6 extra you can get a framed sketch, or $12 for a framed full colour picture.

Scribbler ($250) -You are our hero! This level gets you a signed copy of the full game, plus the Indiegogo exclusive expansion pack (signed as well if you want). Even more awesome, your name will be forever emblazoned on the bottom of the game box as one of our special contributors. Plus, of course, everything at the Poet level. Add $6 for a framed sketch, or $12 for a full colour picture. If you want an extra game or two for your friends, add $20 for each game you would like, and $10 for each extra Indiegogo exclusive expansion pack. And because we like you just so much we'll even sign the extra games!

 

What Your Pledge Means

Every pledge, from $1 and up, means so much to us! Each one is a confirmation that our passion and enthusiasm is shared by all of you. That you want to see Story Builder succeed just as much as we do! There really is no way we can say thank you enough!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t make a contribution you can help us out anyway! It’s a simple as using Indiegogo’s share tools and telling your friends and family about us. You can also follow Amanda on Twitter, or Like Sleepy Dragon Games on Facebook for updates during and after the campaign has finished.

 

Stretch Goals & Rewards

If we can surpass the $45,000 goal we've set we will be exstatic! Each milestone beyond our goal will mean some new cool perks for our contributors!

$55,000 - A second, non-exclusive expansion pack will be made, and everyone who pledged at a level to recieve the game will get a special discount code to purchase it!

$65,000 - A third, non-exclusive expansion pack will be made, and everyone who pledged at a level to recieve the game will get a special discount code to purchase it. PLUS, those same people will get the second expansion pack for free!

$75,000 - Hidden Reward... for now... :D

Higher still? - If it looks like you all want to fund even more of our future endeavours we will gladly add more rewards. But for now, the rewards for such genoristy shall remain a mystery.

story:
What is it?

This is ultimate script for doing one-click leveling your chars from level 1 to 85 in Lineage 2 using L2Tower bot.

Script is done from scratch by me. It took dozens of hours and days debugging and testing. More than 200 chars leveled during testing this script!

Time needed for leveling depends on selected class and your mentor. For example, your new Wynn Spectral Master will be ready in only 5 days!

Probably, it's most advanced auto leveling script of all ever been made by anyone.


Features

Multi Class. Made for doing following classes: Othell Rogue (from Adventurer and Fortune Seeker), Iss Enchanter (from Sword Muse and Spectral Dancer), Wynn Summoner (from Spectral Master, Elemental Master and Warlock), Tyrr Warrior (from Duelist).

Valiance Ready. Script is done for Lindvior and then adapted to Valiance.

Adena-free mode. Char is leveling fine even if you don't put any adena on it.

Mentor-free mode. Char is leveling fine if it has mentor or not, it has mentor buffs detection.

No need Path-of-Awakening stuff. Script uses only quests and self-farmed adena for buying stuff.

Questing. Script does a lot of quests, including all quests from Kekropus series for getting Steel Coins. At 61+ char has enough coins for buying A grade weapon and armor.

Pailaka. Script does Pailaka quest at level 73+ to get Pailaka Shirt.

Auto Class Change. Script automatically does all class changes at 19, 38, 76 and 85 level.

Auto Resume. If you get disconnected at any stage, script automatically finds current stage and continue leveling after you relogin char.

Auto Return. If char is dead at any stage because of any reason (mobs/pk), it will automatically returns to current stage and continue leveling.

Auto Rebuff. If char is out of buffs, it automatically goes to town for rebuff, then returns to exp spot or continue doing current quest.

Auto Restock. Script detects grade of current weapon and automatically buys soe/spirit ore and according shots from npc shop. Also it sells all farmed crap to shop.

Auto Equip. It detects class and level of char to buy according equipment for Proofs of Courage and Steel Coins.

Auto Config. Script detects char's skills and automatically setup configuration for nukes/selfbuffs.

Smart Watchdog. Script monitors current progress and restarts, if it stopped or stuck for any reason.

Highly Customizable. It has a set of config files, and they are already pre-configured. But if you want, you can easily add/remove items to pickup, mobs to attack, weapons to use, paths to move and so on. And all this can be done without any scripting knowledge.

Extremely simple to use. Only thing you need to do is to create a new char and type /wynn, /othell, /iss, /tyrr command. No need to edit scripts, move files or do any other actions.

Advanced Logging. Script logs all activity to ingame chat and to a very detailed log file.

Modular Structure. Script consists of many files, which use common functions. It's good structured, so it's easy to modify script and add new functions and quests (only if you buy perk for unencrypted version).

And a lot of small goodies, like clan detection and getting 10% exp academy circlet, buying a shirt, doing a quest for a wolf pet, auto learning skills, auto resummoning pet when it got new level and more.


Important information:

You will get this script ONLY if you buy any $100+ perk.

You need L2Tower premium license to run this script.

story:
Spud's Quest is an adventure game for Windows that draws it's inspiration from retro classics like the Dizzy series, The Legend of Zelda, and Metroid. The game is scheduled for release in Spring 2013.

The Spud's Quest Indiegogo campaign has been set up due to requests from those who wish to support the project via paypal.

The Story

Players take on the role of Spud and his friend Prince Charming, who has been cursed by an evil wizard and turned into a frog. The pair set on a journey to uncover four ancient stones that have the power to banish the evil and remove the curse.

 

Features

Some of the features include:

  • A large fantasy game world featuring varied locales and characters
  • Four dungeons brimming with puzzles and enemies
  • Day / night / weather system that affects characters schedule
  • Abilities / Powerups to further your progress
  • Control switching mechanic (Spud / frog)

Gameplay

Like the Dizzy games, it's a flip screen adventure in which you use items to progress (eg. use a hatchet found in a woodcutters lodge on a tree elsewhere to form a bridge over a swamp). Kind of like a point and click adventure game, without the point and click. It has powerups & abilities like Metroid, and the Zelda/Tomb Raider inspirations come in the games four temples.

Quotes

The Oliver Twins (creators of Dizzy) - ”Wow! It’s amazing to see you emulate our style of games 25 years after we created them. It’s clear that playing Dizzy as a child has made a big impression on you. So good luck with your Kickstarter, I hope you are able to make the full adventure you’ve always wanted to – but not too close to Dizzy please :) Make it your own.”

Markus Perrson / Notch (creator of Minecraft) - "It does look cool! It's obvious which inspirations you have, but you seem to make it your own thing, in a great way"

Thanks for your support!

story:
[Update 4/08/2014] We have added a perk in the Picture and pdf section. Look below.

Hi ! My name is Delphes. 

I am a visual artist, and i graduated in Sculpture from The Fine Arts school of Paris. I have been acquainted with the Lovecraft mythos since I have met my life-partner, 12 years ago. For a Long time now, i have helped him to create props for his role-playing games. Now I would like to use my classical training to create a very special prop for Horror on the Orient Express.


Two other people have worked with me on this project :

Remy Gente is a 30 years old filmmaker and art director. He has created the Sedefkar Simulacrum project logo you can see above and worked with his group of film director (Bruno Cailloux and Bertrand Cazor) Black Hive to create the video presentation.

You can read his complete presentation on his website.

Rezvan Farsijani is a stylist and Iranian researcher living in Paris. She worked as a stylist for several luxuary brands. She has studied Persian miniature, and she will be in charge of the Sedefkar scroll.


If you have any question about this project, leave a comment, you can also join us on facebook or mail us at sedefkarsimulacrum@gmail.com.

About the Simulacrum

The Sedefkar Simulacrum is a prop, licensed by Chaosium, for the Call of Cthulhu Campaign : Horror on the Orient Express. It is intended for keepers and gamers, but I hope all Lovecraft enthusiasts and amateurs of weird artefacts will find it intriguing. It could indeed have a place in a cabinet of curiosities. 

The Simulacrum is different from others Mythos sculpture : it doesn't represent an Elder God or a alien creature, but a human form that must evoke both terror and strangeness. Since it is supposed to be the very first human-shaped sculpture ever created, maybe even before humanity was even born, it should stem from some ancient civilisations, without being specific to any of them. 

The sculpture of the Sedefkar Simulacrum will be cast in polyurethane, when assembled its size will be a respectable 37 centimeters long (1.2 foot), if it was smaller, it would not seem as threatening as it should. Once it will be cast in Greece, it will be hand-painted by myself - Delphes. Each sculpture will be unique. I have worked very hard to find how to paint the simulacrum in a way that matches the description given in the books : a changing color "according to strength of the light bathing it", I will use a traditional technique where I apply successive layers of fine pigments. It increases the colors effects in the patina, so the material looks like metal and copper and wood and ceramic.  With your investment you will offer yourself an unique artefact, made in a traditional process.

It will be composed of six parts (head, legs, arms and torso) that can be assembled by a clever magnetic system (our caster team in Athens found a great way to do it, and it works) so when assembled it will look like a reduced model of the real thing.

Did you ever had the chance to play with a real sculpture which had a central part in your game ? With your support and assistance, it will be the first time ever a sculpture is commercialized for a role playing campaign.

So Far

I have already work long and hard to produce several sculptures until I found one satisfying enough to present it, one which, despite its manageable reduced size would look like a perfect replica of a far greater sculpture. Then based on one of them, the caster's team in Athens has created several prototype with different assemblage systems, until they found a magnetic one. I am currently always working on another version of the sculpture to see what I can improve.


Here, you can watch how the magnetic assemblage works on a prototype made in polyurethane (without finish and painting - the final magnet won't be silver shiny) : 


The Pledges

Here are the details on the various pledges proposed :

  • Pdf
The pdf of the seven pictures of the Simulacrum, a postcard from the Louvres (see below under Pictures), and an excerpt from the Scroll of the Head, six pictures will figure a part of the Simulacrum with a background figuring the city where it was found, and one picture will allow your players to contemplate the whole simulacrum in its horrifying glory. It will be designed by Remy Gente. 



  • Poster
This poster will be 70x100 cm, it will be designed as a movie poster with the title "Horror on the Orient Express". Your players will know they are about to have a cinematic experience when they will see this prop designed by Remy Gente. 


  • Pictures

All the pictures from the pdf will be professionally printed and cut for you to emulate 1920's postcards, all presented in a special envelope. You will have a picture of each part of the Simulacrum, and a picture of the whole simulacrum. It won't be like having a real sculpture for your players. But for those who can't afford the sculpture, it will be a good alternative to the original prop.

In complement to the sculpture, it will be helpful to your player (easy to manipulate or place on a map).

[Update - Spoiler] You will also receive a postcard the player characters can buy if they visit the Louvres during the Paris adventure. The postcard design will be based on real 1920s postcards from the Louvres, and it will represent the XVIIIth century portrait of a certain nobleman with connections to the simulacrum history…



  • Sculpture

The sculpture of the Sedefkar Simulacrum will be composed of six parts (head, torso, legs and arms), all cast in polyurethane and hand painted. The different parts can be assembled with a magnetic device. 


  • Box

The sedfkar simulacrum will be presented in a box specially made in strong cardboard and decorated with labels.





  • Scroll of the Head

The scroll of the Head will be more than 20cm wide and 1m long, and it will depict half of the Scroll (with 11 pictures and 25 illuminated Arabic words). It will be printed in both sides, in color, on a special paper (human skin is unavailable). The background will try to emulate the color and feel of different tanned piece of human skins stitched together.


  • Supplementary Head

The Sedefkar Simulacrum is supposed to remind you of your own features when you look at it. Some of you will be able to purchase supplementary heads, with faces that look like your character or anyone you deem fit, even yourself. If you do such an order, I will contact you to ask for pictures of the face you want on your order.



  • Life-size Sulpture

If your really love this project and weird scuplture, you can purchase the Sedefkar Simulacrum on a 1:1 scale. It will be 150cm (5 ft tall) when assembled : six pieces, with lugs and corresponding slots for the piece to fit together. It will be cast in polyurethane in Greece and painted by hand. I intend to follow the description of the book concerning the texture of each members « examined closely, perhaps through a magnifying glass or other optical aid, small repeating forms of the segment can be seen to make up a surface design on each segment, as though etched. Thus the head is shaped of tiny heads, the right arm of tiny repeated right arms and so on. » I will use tiny casts to print the small forms on the surface. You can choose the face you want (I will need pictures). I will personally come to deliver it at your home, wherever you are on the planet when it will be finished.


Stretch Goals

Our first objective is to reach €35 000. This sum will be used to finance the polyurethan casting of the sculptures and the edition of the posters, boxes, pictures and scrolls. If we go beyond this first step, we will be able to improve some of the offers.


  • Bigger Poster - € 40.000
If we reach that Goal, all ordered posters will have a size of 100x140 cm instead of 70x100 cm. Now will just have to find a wall big enough to put it on.

Status : In Progress


  • Macro Pictures - € 50.000
We will add 6 macro pictures of the simulacrum showing what each part looks like through a magnifying glass (you know what I mean if you have read the campaign). This will be added to the pdf. And if your pledge contains the pictures, you will have a printed version.

Status : In Progress


  • Calligraphy - € 65.000
If we reach this stretch goal, we will hire a calligraph for the text written on scroll of the head. If not, we will have to do with a special font that look good. It may be close enough, but a real calligraphy made by a specialist will be a lot nicer.

Status : In Progress


  • Better box - € 75.000

If we reach this stretch goal, the box will be decorated on five faces instead of one.

Status : In Progress


  • A Wooden Dowel  - € 85.000
If we reach this stretch goal, a wooden dowel at the end of the scroll of the Head will be added. This will help it to be unrolled and rolled up. Of course, we will choose one that look ancient and true to the project.

Status : In Progress


  • Second head - € 100.000

If we reach this stretch goal, every sculpture ordered (except life-size) will have a second head added to unsettle your players and friends even more. This will allow you to change its head when people are not looking… I will propose several faces I think fit and every pledger will be able to vote for its favorite. A picture of the chosen head will be added to the pdf and the pictures set.

Status : In Progress


  • The whole Scroll of the Head - € 120.000
If we reach this stretch goal, the scroll of the head will be complete with 22 pictures and 49 illuminated Arabic words. It should be more than 2 meters long!

Status : In Progress


  • Sample Passage - € 140.000

If we reach this stretch goal, we are proposing you to print the sample passage (in English) of the Scroll of the Head printed in the same way (but of course way shorter) as the scroll itself. It will be added to every pledge with the scroll of the Head in it.

Status : In Progress


  • A Wooden Box - € 160.000
If we reach this stretch goal, the simulacrum will be send to you in a wooden box, with pattern and motifs burned on five faces. 

Status : In Progress


  • Leather - € 180.000

If we reach this stretch goal, the scroll of the head will be enclosed in a leather sheet and strap. It will be added to every pledge with the scroll of the head in it.

Status : In Progress


  • A Third Head - € 200.000

If we reach this stretch goal, every sculpture ordered (except life-size) will have a third head added, so the simulacrum will really seems like it can change when you don't look at it.  I will propose several faces I think fit and every pledger will be able to vote for the two favorites. A picture of the third head will be added to the pdf and the pictures set.

Status : In Progress
