story: Jag är inte Henrik Bing, utan bara en anonym som fått uppleva hans storhet. Jag vet att han ALDRIG skulle be om ekonomiskt stöd själv, utan istället gett pengar till sina TT-kamrater före sina egna behov. Men världen kräver att Henrik™️ behöver en dator för minst 10000, en ynklig summa, så slå er ihop nu och sätt ner foten mot all ondska i världen. Börja här.
story_txt: Jag är inte Henrik Bing, utan bara en anonym som fått uppleva hans storhet. Jag vet att han ALDRIG skulle be om ekonomiskt stöd själv, utan istället gett pengar till sina TT-kamrater före sina egna behov. Men världen kräver att Henrik™️ behöver en dator för minst 10000, en ynklig summa, så slå er ihop nu och sätt ner foten mot all ondska i världen. Börja här.

story:
We are gamers, and seasoned industry professionals who have dedicated our careers to making great video games. We know first hand what it takes to get the major bugs out of games before they are released, and that player’s should never need to download and install system updates and game patches.

Network-dependent game consoles rob us of time we want to spend playing, and sometimes the ability to play games we own just because they aren’t compatible with the latest updates or they can’t connect to a distant or decommissioned server.

Together, we can create a great new video game system built on the old ideas that games shouldn’t waste our time start playing quickly, never need patches or system updates, and be playable for as many years as we like.

      Together, we can bring RETRO VGS to life.



Meet RETRO VGS


RETRO VGS is the first new video game system to play new games from cartridges in nearly twenty years.

RETRO VGS games start quickly and are thoroughly tested before they are released, so you never need to download and apply software patches. Unlike downloadable games, cartridge games are stored on their own media and can be collected, traded, and resold.

Through its cartridge slot and standard USB interface for controllers and other devices, RETRO VGS functionality can be extended without ever needing a system update.


Take Gaming Back to its Roots

    • Never patch a game. Games are tested thoroughly before release, just like they used to be.

    • Never update your system or risk turning it in to a brick. Your console stays factory fresh.

    • No network connection or game server(s) required. Never fear of your favorite game will get pulled and shut down!

    • No hidden costs from downloadable or streaming content.


RETRO VGS is All About Games! 

As we have learned over the years, a console is only as good as the games that can be played on it.  So we have spent a considerable amount of time outlining launch games we feel will be universally enjoyed by retro gamers and have negotiated with these developers to make their games available for launch on RETRO VGS. 


The Adventures of Tiny Knight

Everyone will receive the pack-in game,  The Adventures of Tiny Knight from CollectorVision Games as part of their RETRO VGS system purchase here.  If you loved games like Super Mario, Wonder Boy and Mega Man you will be in for a real treat taking the role of Sir Basset, the Tiny Knight as he sets out to save the Princess from the clutches of the evil dragon.  It will also feature a campaign only "Knighted" silver cartridge shell. 



More Games Available at Launch

The games below are confirmed launch titles for RETRO VGS, available to backers in exclusive colors as described below.  

To add any of these games to your reward bundle:

  1. Click a Perk Level
  2. When you see the Perk description, click "Custom" under "Additional Gift"
  3. Add the dollar amount for any extra games or controllers you want to add to your bundle
  4. We will contact you at the conclusion of the campaign and confirm your additional selections

GunLord 

by NG:DEV.TEAM

Translucent Green Cartridge, Add $60 to pledge

Knight's Chance 

by NeoBitz

Purple Cartridge, Add $50 to pledge

Adventures in the Tower of Flight 

by Pixel Barrage Entertainment, Inc.

Sky Blue Cartridge, Add $30 to pledge

RETRO VGS exclusive version Tower of Flight BONUSES:

  • 2 new areas (24 to 30 additional level maps)
  • 1 new boss at the conclusion of the 2 areas
  • 1 new relic after the new boss
  • New themed enemies for the new areas

Sydney Hunter and the Caverns of Death 

by CollectorVision Games



The RETRO VGS Console

If you look closely you might notice something familiar about the appearance of RETRO VGS. In a move that saved our team considerable start-up capital we purchased and took ownership of the original mold tooling Atari used to create the Atari Jaguar in the early 1990's.  This tooling is still in exceptional condition and able to create high quality, polycarbonate parts to this very day.  We are repurposing this tooling to create the RETRO VGS console and cartridge shells, with slight modifications.

 

The RETRO VGS controller is designed to have the best of both worlds. From modern day controllers come responsive dual-analog sticks and shoulder buttons combined with the all familiar and loved classically-inspired D-pad and correctly oriented buttons. Developers will have a multitude of game and player control options to tap into. RETRO VGS will utilize its own USB controllers but gamers will also have the option to plug in their other favorite USB controllers and devices, even a keyboard!

RETRO VGS USB controllers are available individually or may be added to your console perk for $25 each.


9-Pin Classic Controller Interface

In addition to offering USB controller options, RETRO VGS allows you to play new games using a wide variety of classic 9-pin controllers including joysticks, paddles, spinners, trackballs, and more.


Exclusive Campaign Colors

To celebrate the launch of RETRO VGS here on Indiegogo we are offering exclusive console colors only for our Indiegogo campaign backers.  These will never be produced in these color combinations ever again and will add considerable value to these consoles purchased here on Indiegogo.

** If you back at one of these exclusive color levels you will be asked at the conclusion of the campaign to confirm your desired color **



Specifications

Internal Hardware

* CPU: “Quadrunner” 4-core 1.6 GHz 32-bit ARM Cortex-A9 (16,000 DMIPS) processor plus embedded high-performance graphics processing unit (GPU) with:

* 3-D (shader, tiler, parallel vertex and pixel processing, and more, supporting OpenGL ES 1.1 and 2.0, OpenVG 1.1, etc.),

* 2-D (blitter with high-performance stretch and shrink plus one-pass blending, scaling, and rotation, anti-aliased line drawing, etc.), and 

* Image enhancement (scaling, rotation, mirroring, etc.)

RAM: 1 GiB (2^30 bytes) 32-bit DDR3-800

* Field-programmable gate array (FPGA)

* Fast, flexible, durable cartridge interface

* Convection cooled: no noisy fan to wear out

Data Storage

* User data is stored externally only

  + No private user data is stored in console

  + Console always returns to factory state when unplugged

  + When plugged in, only time and date are saved, if the the user has set the clock

* Game-related data (such as high score lists, saved games, etc.) may be stored on each cartridge (depends on game)

* System-related data (such as preferred initials for high-score lists, preferred     controller configurations, etc.) may be stored on an optional USB thumb drive

Interfaces

* Universal Serial Bus (USB)

  + 4 standard type A ports

    - Connects game controllers, storage devices (e.g. thumb drive), hubs, etc.

    - 2 on front (side-by-side) and 2 on rear (stacked)—functionally equivalent

  + Standard type B USB connector “Host” port on rear

    - Connect 2 or more consoles for multiple-screen party play

    - Connect to host PC to develop software

* Game controllers—supports 2 types:

  + USB (see above) up to 4 controllers directly, or more via optional hub(s)

  + 2 front D sub-miniature 9-pin

    - Flexible pin-out circuit allows connection of any classic controller with a mating connector

    - Makes building custom controllers easy

* Audio/video output

  + Simultaneous output of the same image to digital output and 1 analog output

  + Signals

    - Digital High-Definition Multimedia Interface (HDMI)

    - Analog audio output: stereo or mono at line level via RCA connector(s)

    - Analog intermediate frequency (IF) video output (1 at a time)

    - Composite video, blanking, and sync (CVBS) via RCA or expansion port

   - S-Video available via optional Sega 32X cable or expansion port

    - RGB available via optional Sega 32X cable or expansion port

    - Component available via optional Sega 32X cable or expansion port

    - Analog radio frequency (RF) audio/video output available via optional Sony RFU adapters

  + Connectors

    - HDMI

    - 3 RCA for CVBS video and stereo or mono

    - 2.5mm phone jack power output for optional Sony RFU

    - 9-pin miniature circular DIN for optional Sega 32X cable

    - Expansion port for cables or adapters

  + Formats

    - Analog: NTSC or PAL (user-selectable)

    - Digital: up to 1080p/60

    - Aspect ratio: select 4:3, 16:9, etc.

* Expansion connector

  + Common 110-pin 2.0mm “hard metric” backplane connector (type A 22)

  + Center alignment system enables “blind mate” and prevents bending pins

  + Dust cover

Media Player

* Plays media files (MP3, etc.) from external storage devices

System Menu

Used to:

* Pause the game

* Select and configure controllers

* Select video output format

  + Analog NTSC or PAL (for CVBS or S-Video)

  + Analog RGB or component

  + Select and coordinate aspect ratio (letterbox or pillarbox on digital or analog outputs)

  * Set the time and date (optional)

  * Set and edit user preferences (if an optional USB thumb drive is connected)

Power

* External power adapter with cable/plug supplied for destination nation

Regulatory Certifications

* International (CE, CSA, FCC, UL, etc.)


Our Goal
Our primary goal is to deliver the most fun to the most people for as many years as we can.

Bringing a big state-of-the-art product like this to market is an expensive process, and we have already personally invested all the time and money we can. Now we need your contribution to build a fun, long-lasting video game system—and one that you’ll be among the first to play!


Our Progress to Date

After we determined what we want RETRO VGS to do, we did our homework.  We now know what we want to build, how much it will cost, and how long it will take.

Our plan and progress to date:

2013

  • Created initial concept
  • Researched market

2014 Q4 - 2015 Q1

  • Acquired mechanical design, rights, and tooling

2015 Q1 - 2015 Q3 : Phase 1

  • Collected and defined requirements
  • Created overall architecture
  • Researched and established component supply chains
  • Created initial circuit designs, initial PCB assembly designs, budget,       development and business plans
  • Recruited developers and defined initial launch titles and pack-in game

Above: Actual output of our printed circuit board design, created using Altium Designer and SolidWorks


2015 Q3 - 2016 Q1 : Phase 2

  •  Secure funding
  •  Complete design of circuits and PCB to build and test alpha prototype systems
  •  Regulatory compliance pre-scan
  •  Start development of system software and games
  •  Schedule delivery and order components and materials for manufacturing
  •  Journal and demonstrate progress to backers with weekly updates


2016 Q1 - 2016 Q3 : Phase 3

  • Revise design of circuits and PCB to build and test beta prototype systems
  • Regulatory compliance testing and certification
  • Complete development of system software
  • Continue developing games
  • Journal and demonstrate progress to backers with weekly updates

2016 Q3 - 2016 Q4 : Phase 4

  • Manufacture and deliver product
  • Continue developing games
  • Journal and demonstrate progress to backers with weekly updates

Stretch Goals

At our minimum goal of $1,950,000, RETRO VGS comes to life and will play a wide variety of fun, high-quality games.  After that, the more success our campaign receives, the more we put into RETRO VGS.


Unprecedented Flexibility

At $3,100,000—about 60% more than our minimum goal—we increase the size of our FPGA, making RETRO VGS the first video game system capable of recreating classic systems through reshaping its own hardware!

At $3,800,000—less than twice our minimum goal—we increase the size of our FPGA again, nearly doubling its size from the previous goal.


What is an FPGA?

A field-programmable gate array (FPGA) is a large integrated circuit with an array of many logic gates that can be connected together to perform parallel and sequential functions by programming bits in random-access memory (RAM). An FPGA is similar in structure to common “standard cell” digital application-specific integrated circuits (ASICs) which are programmed when they are created through a pattern in what are essentially bits in masked read-only memory (ROM).


More Gates = More Variety + More Fun

Using a larger FPGA allows game developers to extend the ability of RETRO VGS in the same way that on-cartridge enhancement chips (ASICs) extended the ability of the Super Nintendo, but on a much larger scale and at much lower cost to game makers and buyers.

The larger FPGA will give RETRO VGS enough gates to duplicate the circuits of entire classic video game and computer systems.


Use of Funds

At our minimum goal amount, more than two-thirds of funds raised will be used to manufacture contributors’ rewards.

As stretch goals are reached, the proportion of funds used to manufacture contributors’ rewards grows larger.

The remaining portion (the small gray piece) will be used to complete developing our design into a highly-polished, marketable consumer product.  This pays for everything from building and testing prototypes through the international regulatory certification process, including:

  • Stipends (including benefits, payroll tax, etc.)—only about half of normal wages, but enough to afford to do this full time (8-12% of minimum goal)
  • Creating prototype circuit assemblies—from where we are today through regulatory certification, including pre-release systems for developers of launch titles (5% of min. goal)
  • Outsourcing software development (5% of min. goal)
  • Testing and certifying regulatory compliance (4% of min. goal)
  • Renting space and equipment for a small office and lab (4% of min. goal)
  • Advertising (2% of min. goal)
  • All other operating expenses (1% of min. goal)

Our Team




Mike Kennedy, Co-Founder, President– Mike is an avid “retro” gamer and collector, entrepreneur and creator and publisher of RETRO Video Game Magazine. Mike’s 25+ year career in designing and installing automated material handling and lean manufacturing systems will be applied to the manufacturing and production of the RETRO VGS in the USA.  

Mike graduated from the University of Nebraska with a degree in marketing.

Steve Woita, Co-Founder, VP Developer Relations – Steve  is a game industry icon and pioneer who has worked and developed games for some of the industry's most notable companies including Atari, Apple, Sega, Nintendo, Electronic Arts, Activision, Tengen, Big Fish Games and The 3DO Company.  Steve is also an adviser to the Video Game History Museum.

John Carlsen, Co-Founder, VP Operations and Platform Development– As a principal hardware engineer, John created a Sony PlayStation for emerging foreign markets and co-founded Iguana Entertainment, where he created powerful low-cost software-development interfaces for SNES, Saturn, PlayStation, and Jaguar.

John contributed to the development of system software for PlayStation 3, the first computer with AMD 64-bit processors, most flash-based MP3 players (including iPod Shuffle), Altera programmable logic semiconductors, Media Vision's high-quality PC sound cards, and the first TV input device for personal computers. John has also worked for Atari, Atari’s former president and co-founder Nolan Bushnell, and Activision, and has taught college courses in game development.

John has degrees in computer science and management from St. Edward's University in Austin, and five degrees from De Anza College in Cupertino—where Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak studied.


The RETRO VGS Story

It was about 2 years ago when I had an idea for a new game system to run off "modern day" cartridges.  I had discussions with colleagues about this idea and eventually was hooked up with game industry alum, Steve Woita.  Steve has a long career in gaming beginning with his games developed for Atari 2600, which included TAZ and Atari's first and only game with voice, QUADRUN.  After Atari, Steve continued his career developing games for both Sega and Nintendo NES.  His titles there include:  Kid Chameleon, Sonic Spinball and Sonic 2.  And for Tengen on NES, Super Sprint and unrealesed Police Academy.   You can read more about Steve's work here.   Steve and I have been working on this concept ever since.

It wasn't until E3 2014 when I knew the time was drawing near for a venture like this. I was walking the E3 floor and noticed that Sony and Microsoft had invited various indie developers into their pricey booth space to show off their creations.  And most of these games were all retro style, influenced games.  I saw the mainstream industry now taking notice of these developers and these style games.  Retro gaming is now become a genre and an art form!  I thought it was a shame, however, these games were going to be relegated only to digital downloads.  These games should have the chance to survive and live long into the future, not be tossed aside like so many games these days once the "newness" has worn off.   Some games deserve to be preserved and there is no modern day console that will do this.  And, in fact, as new generations of consoles have been introduced they are separating gamers even further from their games.

It was about this same time I had learned the Atari Jaguar molds were put up for auction on eBay.  I discovered they hadn't sold and were still around and located at a dental instrument manufacturer who had originally bought them from Atari in a late 90's liquidation.  I quickly called them up, confirmed they still had them and drove up to Northern California to see them in person.  This trip was the beginning of this venture becoming reality and is the reason this campaign is running.  To make a long story short, I ended up purchasing the Atari Jaguar tooling from Imagin Systems and have since relocated them where we will be manufacturing RETRO VGS, here in Southern California.  Once we had the tooling delivered to their new home (a local injection molding company) we set up and tested the parts and were amazed to discover they still produce top quality polycarbonate parts.  So far so good!

Since we had a significant part of this venture decided, the look of the console and the tooling to make it, we then focused on the hardware.  Now this process doesn't happen fast and we've gone through a few different design iterations.  At one point, Steve began considering using an FPGA to give RETRO VGS some interesting application and it is an idea we have stuck with ever since and will continue to stick with pending the outcome of this campaign and its achieved funding.  It was in March of 2015 we discovered a diamond in the rough, John Carlsen.  And as luck would have it, he was available to work on this with us and also somewhat local to Southern California.  John is a gaming hardware guru having worked intimately on both the software and hardware side of the console business for his entire career. For Sony, John developed a small Playstation for emerging foreign markets.  Earlier, John was a co-founder of Iguana Entertainment and worked his magic there to create a low-cost development systems for the Super NES and other cartridge gaming consoles.  John also worked for Altera, one of the top FPGA makers.  Yes, this all comes full circle and the stars aligned.

Steve Woita, Mike Kennedy & John Carlsen

As of today, we've literally done everything we can do up to this point before preparing for the costly prototyping phase. We've confirmed the appearance of the RETRO VGS console and cartridges and have purchased the tooling to create and produce mass quantities of these parts. We are working with a third party controller manufacturer to supply us with branded USB controllers and we have working prototypes in hand that are testing out great.  We have designed the system architecture and circuit design and have established solid relationships with the largest (and local) electronics distributors and suppliers in the area.  We have spec'ed out all electronics and parts and are proud to say we are using only the best parts available in RETRO VGS. Finally, we have established a relationship with one of the largest PCBA contract manufacturers in the area. All the pieces are in place to create a working prototype soon after it appears our funding goal will be met.

Thankfully, we have had significant outreach from over 150 developers all interested in bringing games onto RETRO VGS.  Most saying they never thought a chance to have their games on cartridges would never happen.  We also have inroads to the mainstream gaming developers and publishers and believe that if we can prove there is still a solid market for "new" cartridge based games, then they will be happy to bring their big name, legacy games onto the system.  We now need all of you to show them there is a market and that you want to see some of their franchises brought back to life on RETRO VGS.

Help us bring cartridges back!  Cartridges are a medium that brings gaming back and gaming culture back to its roots and it can all happen on RETRO VGS.  We ask for your support and are confident we can deliver to you all in 2016, a brand new, high-quality and state-of-the-art cartridge based video game system that will be fun to play for years to come.

- Mike Kennedy


Our Sites

Official Website
Facebook
Twitter


Interviews


The RetroGamingRoundup podcast invited all three of us on their show for an indepth 90 minute interview.   To learn more about RETRO VGS and our team CLICK HERE.
story_txt:
We are gamers, and seasoned industry professionals who have    dedicated our careers to making great video games. We know first    hand what it takes to get the major bugs out of games before they    are released, and that player’s should never need to download and    install system updates and game patches.    Network-dependent game consoles rob us of time we want to spend    playing, and sometimes the ability to play games we own just because    they aren’t compatible with the latest updates or they can’t connect    to a distant or decommissioned server.    Together, we can create a great new video game system built on the    old ideas that games shouldn’t waste our time start playing quickly,    never need patches or system updates, and be playable for as many    years as we like.

      Together, we can bring RETRO VGS to life.








Meet RETRO VGS
    RETRO VGS is the first new video game system to play new games from    cartridges in nearly twenty years.    RETRO VGS games start quickly and are thoroughly tested before they    are released, so you never need to download and apply software    patches. Unlike downloadable games, cartridge games are stored on    their own media and can be collected, traded, and resold.    Through its cartridge slot and standard USB interface for    controllers and other devices, RETRO VGS functionality can be    extended without ever needing a system update.


Take Gaming Back to its Roots

Never patch a game. Games are tested thoroughly before release, just like they used to be.
Never update your system or risk turning it in to a brick. Your console stays factory fresh.
No network connection or game server(s) required. Never fear of your favorite game will get pulled and shut down!
No hidden costs from downloadable or streaming content.




RETRO VGS is All About Games! 
As we have learned over the years, a console is only as good as the games that can be played on it.  So we have spent a considerable amount of time outlining launch games we feel will be universally enjoyed by retro gamers and have negotiated with these developers to make their games available for launch on RETRO VGS. 

The Adventures of Tiny Knight

Everyone will receive the pack-in game,  The Adventures of Tiny Knight from CollectorVision Games as part of their RETRO VGS system purchase here.  If you loved games like Super Mario, Wonder Boy and Mega Man you will be in for a real treat taking the role of Sir Basset, the Tiny Knight as he sets out to save the Princess from the clutches of the evil dragon.  It will also feature a campaign only "Knighted" silver cartridge shell. 



More Games Available at Launch

The games below are confirmed launch titles for RETRO VGS, available to backers in exclusive colors as described below.  

To add any of these games to your reward bundle:



Click a Perk Level
When you see the Perk description, click "Custom" under "Additional Gift"
Add the dollar amount for any extra games or controllers you want to add to your bundle
We will contact you at the conclusion of the campaign and confirm your additional selections




GunLord 
by NG:DEV.TEAM
Translucent Green Cartridge, Add $60 to pledge

Knight's Chance 
by NeoBitz

Purple Cartridge, Add $50 to pledge

Adventures in the Tower of Flight 
by Pixel Barrage Entertainment, Inc.

Sky Blue Cartridge, Add $30 to pledge
RETRO VGS exclusive version Tower of Flight BONUSES:

2 new areas (24 to 30 additional level maps)
1 new boss at the conclusion of the 2 areas
1 new relic after the new boss
New themed enemies for the new areas

Sydney Hunter and the Caverns of Death 
by CollectorVision Games
Green cartridge, Add $40 to pledge

Read Only Memories 
from Midboss, LLC
Translucent Purple cartridge, Add $50 to pledge
Songbringer 
from Wizard Fu Games
Gold cartridge, Add $40 to pledge

More Games Coming Soon
Watch this section as we continue to add new games.

Shantae and the Pirate's Curse
by Wayforward




Double Dragon Trilogy 
by DotEMU

Pier Solar
by Watermelon Games

Last Hope Pink Bullets
by NG:DEV.TEAM

Jeffrey Wittenhagen's Black Box Challenge
by Jeffrey Wittenhagen









The RETRO VGS Console
If you look closely you might notice something familiar about the appearance of RETRO VGS. In a move that saved our team considerable start-up capital we purchased and took ownership of the original mold tooling Atari used to create the Atari Jaguar in the early 1990's.  This tooling is still in exceptional condition and able to create high quality, polycarbonate parts to this very day.  We are repurposing this tooling to create the RETRO VGS console and cartridge shells, with slight modifications.
 



What's Included

Included with each RETRO VGS game console:

Pack-in game cartridge: The Adventures of Tiny Knight in an exclusive campaign only "Knighted" silver cartridge shell
1 RETRO VGS USB game controller
Digital A/V cable (HDMI)
Analog A/V cable (RCA triple)
Power adapter (with input and plug for destination nation, unless otherwise requested)



Free Digital Magazine Subscription




All backers will also receive a free 1-Year Digital Subscription ($18 Value - contact us to upgrade your subscription to PRINT) to RETRO Video Game Magazine. Just like back in the day, you will get a magazine that complements the console. It will feature previews of upcoming RETRO VGS games including developer liner notes and interviews and game concept art. It's all part of bringing back the culture of gaming! Check out previews of back issues on the ShopReadRETRO Website!




RETRO VGS Controller Flexibility
RETRO VGS allows you to play new games using USB controllers, classic controllers, or both.

The RETRO VGS USB ControllerThe RETRO VGS controller is designed to have the best of both worlds. From modern day controllers come responsive dual-analog sticks and shoulder buttons combined with the all familiar and loved classically-inspired D-pad and correctly oriented buttons. Developers will have a multitude of game and player control options to tap into. RETRO VGS will utilize its own USB controllers but gamers will also have the option to plug in their other favorite USB controllers and devices, even a keyboard!

Here is an actual working controller prototype playing through a demo level of Adventures of Tiny Knight.
                             RETRO VGS USB controllers are available individually or may be added to your console perk for $25 each.

9-Pin Classic Controller Interface
In addition to offering USB controller options, RETRO VGS allows you to play new games using a wide variety of classic 9-pin controllers including joysticks, paddles, spinners, trackballs, and more.



Exclusive Campaign Colors


To celebrate the launch of RETRO VGS here on Indiegogo we are offering exclusive console colors only for our Indiegogo campaign backers.  These will never be produced in these color combinations ever again and will add considerable value to these consoles purchased here on Indiegogo.
** If you back at one of these exclusive color levels you will be asked at the conclusion of the campaign to confirm your desired color **

Legend Series


Jewel Series-Translucent with Matching Controllers

Treasure Series - Most Limited



Specifications

Internal Hardware
* CPU: “Quadrunner” 4-core 1.6 GHz 32-bit ARM Cortex-A9 (16,000 DMIPS) processor plus embedded high-performance graphics processing unit (GPU) with:
* 3-D (shader, tiler, parallel vertex and pixel processing, and more, supporting OpenGL ES 1.1 and 2.0, OpenVG 1.1, etc.),
* 2-D (blitter with high-performance stretch and shrink plus one-pass blending, scaling, and rotation, anti-aliased line drawing, etc.), and 
* Image enhancement (scaling, rotation, mirroring, etc.)RAM: 1 GiB (2^30 bytes) 32-bit DDR3-800
* Field-programmable gate array (FPGA)
* Fast, flexible, durable cartridge interface
* Convection cooled: no noisy fan to wear out


Data Storage
* User data is stored externally only
  + No private user data is stored in console
  + Console always returns to factory state when unplugged
  + When plugged in, only time and date are saved, if the the user has set the clock
* Game-related data (such as high score lists, saved games, etc.) may be stored on each cartridge (depends on game)
* System-related data (such as preferred initials for high-score lists, preferred     controller configurations, etc.) may be stored on an optional USB thumb drive
Interfaces
* Universal Serial Bus (USB)
  + 4 standard type A ports
    - Connects game controllers, storage devices (e.g. thumb drive), hubs, etc.
    - 2 on front (side-by-side) and 2 on rear (stacked)—functionally equivalent
  + Standard type B USB connector “Host” port on rear
    - Connect 2 or more consoles for multiple-screen party play
    - Connect to host PC to develop software
* Game controllers—supports 2 types:
  + USB (see above) up to 4 controllers directly, or more via optional hub(s)
  + 2 front D sub-miniature 9-pin
    - Flexible pin-out circuit allows connection of any classic controller with a mating connector
    - Makes building custom controllers easy
* Audio/video output
  + Simultaneous output of the same image to digital output and 1 analog output
  + Signals
    - Digital High-Definition Multimedia Interface (HDMI)
    - Analog audio output: stereo or mono at line level via RCA connector(s)
    - Analog intermediate frequency (IF) video output (1 at a time)
    - Composite video, blanking, and sync (CVBS) via RCA or expansion port
   - S-Video available via optional Sega 32X cable or expansion port
    - RGB available via optional Sega 32X cable or expansion port
    - Component available via optional Sega 32X cable or expansion port
    - Analog radio frequency (RF) audio/video output available via optional Sony RFU adapters
  + Connectors
    - HDMI
    - 3 RCA for CVBS video and stereo or mono
    - 2.5mm phone jack power output for optional Sony RFU
    - 9-pin miniature circular DIN for optional Sega 32X cable
    - Expansion port for cables or adapters
  + Formats
    - Analog: NTSC or PAL (user-selectable)
    - Digital: up to 1080p/60
    - Aspect ratio: select 4:3, 16:9, etc.
* Expansion connector
  + Common 110-pin 2.0mm “hard metric” backplane connector (type A 22)
  + Center alignment system enables “blind mate” and prevents bending pins
  + Dust cover
Media Player
* Plays media files (MP3, etc.) from external storage devices
System Menu
Used to:
* Pause the game
* Select and configure controllers
* Select video output format
  + Analog NTSC or PAL (for CVBS or S-Video)
  + Analog RGB or component
  + Select and coordinate aspect ratio (letterbox or pillarbox on digital or analog outputs)
  * Set the time and date (optional)
  * Set and edit user preferences (if an optional USB thumb drive is connected)
Power
* External power adapter with cable/plug supplied for destination nation
Regulatory Certifications
* International (CE, CSA, FCC, UL, etc.)

Our Goal


Our primary goal is to deliver the most fun to the most people for as many years as we can.


Bringing a big state-of-the-art product like this to market is an expensive process, and we have already personally invested all the time and money we can. Now we need your contribution to build a fun, long-lasting video game system—and one that you’ll be among the first to play!

Our Progress to Date

After we determined what we want RETRO VGS to do, we did our homework.  We now know what we want to build, how much it will cost, and how long it will take.

Our plan and progress to date:

Created initial concept


Researched market

Acquired mechanical design, rights, and tooling

Collected and defined requirements


Created overall architecture

Researched and established component supply chains
Created initial circuit designs, initial PCB assembly designs,      budget,       development and business plans
Recruited developers and defined initial launch titles and pack-in game
 


Above: Actual output of our printed circuit board design, created using Altium Designer and SolidWorks

All the pieces are in place to create a working prototype soon after it appears our funding goal will be met.
Thankfully, we have had significant outreach from over 150 developers all interested in bringing games onto RETRO VGS.  Most saying they never thought a chance to have their games on cartridges would never happen.  We also have inroads to the mainstream gaming developers and publishers and believe that if we can prove there is still a solid market for "new" cartridge based games, then they will be happy to bring their big name, legacy games onto the system.  We now need all of you to show them there is a market and that you want to see some of their franchises brought back to life on RETRO VGS.
Help us bring cartridges back!  Cartridges are a medium that brings gaming back and gaming culture back to its roots and it can all happen on RETRO VGS.  We ask for your support and are confident we can deliver to you all in 2016, a brand new, high-quality and state-of-the-art cartridge based video game system that will be fun to play for years to come.
- Mike Kennedy

Our Sites
Official Website
Facebook
Twitter

Interviews


The RetroGamingRoundup podcast invited all three of us on their show for an indepth 90 minute interview.   To learn more about RETRO VGS and our team CLICK HERE.

story:
WargameWords, The Board

My name is Antonio García-AIcaide Rupérez, I love Wargames and the fantasy world and I had a dream a year ago.

I wanted to create a new fantasy world where the main characters were Gods and mortals. And from that new world create a 28 mm miniatures game.That´s how Wargame and The Board world were born.

I´m a Fan of the hobby who wants to create something for the hobby.

I´d like to begin this adventure with the first campaign on The Board: The Conflict of Frondglaucous. A war between ugris and dwarfs. Find brief introduction below, and more information at Wargamewords website.

Triple Treat

My goal is to create a world where you can engage in small skirmishes or massive battles, it´s your choice.


WargameWords, El Tablero

Me llamo Antonio García-Alcaide Rupérez, me encanta la fantasía y los wargames y hace un año tuve un sueño. Quise crear un nuevo mundo de fantasía donde los protagonistas fuesen dioses y mortales. Y de ese mundo, crear un juego de miniaturas de 28mm. Así nació Wargamewords y el mundo de El Tablero. Soy un aficionado al hobby que quiere crear algo para el hobby.

Me gustaría comenzar esta aventura con la primera campaña en El Tablero: El Conflicto de Frondaglauca. Una guerra entre Ugris y Enanos. Aquí tenéis una pequeña introducción, más en la web WargameWords:

La Triple Dádiva

Mi objetivo es crear un mundo donde librar pequeñas escaramuzas o batallas a gran escala.

What do I need? What do you get?

All contributions will be allocated to the creation process, game rules, illustrations, background, 3D designs, printing and the manufacture of miniatures.

In principle miniatures will be delivered in multicomponent plastic sprues. There are two 3d ugris designs  and two 3d dwarves designs (you can see in pictures) and you can build ten different poses of ugris and ten of dwarves. We hope we will be able to make heroes, kings and gods of resin or metal in the future. You will be asked what your preference is around this, as you are the one enjoying it.

To be clear I want to begin this project with you, and your contributions will be used to implement The Board. If you contribute in the creation of The Board, you will be able to choose between miniatures of Dwarves, Ugris or a mix of both at the most cost-effective model. The vast majority of project profits will go towards the following project campaign. We don't want to stop, do we?


¿Qué necesito y qué obtienes?

El dinero que aportes irá destinado a todo el proceso de creación del juego, reglas, ilustraciones, impuestos, web, trasfondo, diseños 3D, impresión y producción de las miniaturas. 

En un principio las miniaturas serán de plástico en matrices multicomponente, Son dos diseños 3D de Ugris y dos de Enanos (los que se ven en las imágenes) que, al ser en matrices, puedes montar con ellos diez poses diferentes de cada raza.  En un futuro deseamos poder realizar héroes, reyes y dioses en resina o metal. Para ello se os preguntará a vosotros que preferís, pues sois los que lo vais a disfrutar. 

Has de saber que quiero que empecemos este proyecto juntos, y tu dinero irá destinado a poner en marcha El Tablero. Si contribuyes en la creación de El Tablero, podrás elegir entre miniaturas de Enanos, Ugris o una mezcla de ambas a un precio lo más ajustado posible . Has de saber que la mayor parte de las ganancias se destinarán a crear la siguiente campaña. No queremos parar, ¿verdad?



 Perks



You can choose between this eight perks, all made in plastic multi-component sprues to build so many different models:  

No shipping cost included

4 Dwarves + 4 Ugris = 12USD

10 Dwarves + 10 Ugris or 20 Dwarves or 20 Ugris = 27USD

20 Dwarves + 20 Ugris or 40 Dwarves or 40 Ugris = 48USD

40 Dwarves + 40 Ugris = 92USD

With all perks I send you a reglament in pdf format with The Board first edition.

STETCH GOALS



Recompensas

Puedes elegir inicialmente entre estas ocho recompensas, todas en matrices multicomponentes de plástico con las que montar muchos modelos diferentes:

Gastos de envío no incluidos

4 Enanos + 4 Ugris = 12USD

10 Enanos + 10 Ugris or 20 Enanos or 20 Ugris = 27USD

20 Enanos + 20 Ugris or 40 Enanos or 40 Ugris = 48USD

40 Enanos + 40 Ugris = 92USD

Con todas las recompensas se enviará un reglamento en pdf para poder empezar a jugar con la primera edición de El Tablero.

Si conseguimos superar la cifra necesaria, desbloquearemos los siguientes extras: RECOMPENSAS DESBLOQUEABLES

Shipping cost

Ask me if your country doesn't appear:

This prices are available to plastic miniatures only

Spain: 

8miniatures(4USD) 20miniatures(4.5USD)40-80miniatures(6USD)

Europe Union:

8miniatures(5.5USD) 20miniatures(6.5USD)40-80miniatures(12USD)

America and Australia:

8miniatures(6USD) 20miniatures(7.5USD)40-80miniatures(17USD)


Gastos de envío

Si tu país no aparece en la lista, pregúntame:

Precios válidos para envíos de miniaturas de plástico

España: 

8miniaturas(4USD) 20miniaturas(4.5USD)40-80miniaturas(6USD)

Unión Europea:

8miniaturas(5.5USD) 20miniaturas(6.5USD)40-80miniaturas(12USD)

América y Australia:

8miniaturas(6USD) 20miniaturas(7.5USD)40-80miniaturas(17USD)


Share your thoughts! Your opinion is much appreciated

I can be contacted any time day or night and I will endeavour to respond within 24 hours. You will be part of a project, so do ask any questions that cross your mind, anytime. I appreciate any suggestions made. In fact please do so, this adventure will improve with the everyone´s ideas.

I intend to create an enjoyable experience for everyone, so please do share any ideas to improve it, leaving fear or shame aside. All your questions and suggestions are welcome.


¡Háblame! Tu opinión es lo más importante 

Puedes escribir en cualquier momento del día o la noche, serás respondido en menos de 24 horas. Vas a colaborar en un proyecto así que pregunta lo que quieras y cuando quieras. También estoy abierto a sugerencias de cualquier tipo, de hecho os animo a ello, esta aventura mejora con las ideas de todos. 

Pretendemos que sea un juego para disfrutar, di en que lo mejorarías sin miedo ni vergüenza. Todas tus preguntas y sugerencias son bienvenidas.


Never give up

Whatever happens, we´ll never give up. We fall so that we learn how to pick ourselves up.


Nunca rendirse 

Pasa lo que pase, no nos rendiremos, En esta vida nos caemos para aprender a levantarnos. 


WargameWords needs you

If you don´t have the funds to support us but you´d like to make any contribution, please feel free to contact me. We´ll find a way you can be helpful based on your skills.

theboard@wargamewords.com

    WargameWords te necesita 

    Si no dispones de dinero para apoyar la campaña... escríbeme, encontraremos una forma en la que puedas ayudar y que se ajuste a tus aptitudes. 

    eltablero@wargamewords.com

story:
Vision is a unique social game hub for indie gamers. It allows developers to deploy their indie game on a platform where normal people who love indie games can download it for free. With Vision we aim to bring a fantastic indie gaming experience back to the desktop, and properly allow PC gamers to use a controller for games. If they want to, of course, we have support for keyboard input as well, Vision is all about choice and running your games how you want to.

But what’s the catch? The catch is that there isn’t a catch. It’s free of charge to download the core software, and all content from the store will be free.

We will ship no bloatware with Vision, and it will be snappy. We’ve limited our use of animations, so that the when you press a button - you get what you want. Fast.

It’s beautiful - the home screen is simply amazing. Don’t like it? Download a theme from the Vision store and change it up so it’s perfect for you. Don’t like any of the store ones? Make your own and upload it for free! That’s the thing about Vision - it’s not closed. We want you to make it your own. You can tweak and customise almost every aspect of the system so it’s just the way you like it. Because at the end of the day, it’s not just our Vision - it’s yours.

What can I run it on, I hear you ask? I guess it’d be simpler to ask what you can’t run it on. The prototype runs on the 3 main operating system’s - Linux, Windows and Mac OS X. However, we have plans for a modified version of Gentoo, which will run Vision on top of it. Which means Vision practically is the operating system. It’ll load up almost instantly, and run blazingly fast on almost any hardware. Perfect if you’ve got an old PC lying around unused, and want to turn it into your own gaming console. We will also allow you to create a bootable USB drive, so you can take Vision with you wherever you go. We also are planning to compile this to run on ARM devices, which means you would see a version of Vision for very low end hardware such as the Raspberry Pi. Hook it up to your television, plug in a controller, and voila, you can enjoy brilliant indie games on a flat screen television!

Android support could also be possible, but this really does depend on how the kickstarter goes.

But what features does Vision have?

Panes. The home screen of Vision contains something we call panes - they are large icons, which launch you into apps. They’re beautiful. There are 4 of them on each page. Vision comes with the most important apps pinned - Apps, Games, System and Friends. When you go into Apps or Games, you will have the ability to pin either of these as a pane on your home screen, creating multiple pages of panes. So you can get to the things that matter to you most - quickly.

Vision Store. This is where you’ll find all the indie apps and games that can run on Vision. Each week we’ll pick the top featured apps and put them up front. We’ll also have a most downloaded apps section, where you can check out. When an app is sent to us, we’ll verify that it’s not a virus, contains no bloatware or malware, and do brief quality control before it’s allowed onto the store. The store will also contain themes, so you can theme Vision to your hearts content.

Vision Central. This is a place where you can access all your notifications, and it shows off the time and date as well. We also will have widget support here, so you can see the things most important to you at a quick glance - be it the weather, or latest sports results, etc.

Vision Voice. Our own voice control system. You’ll be able to tell it to do things such as launch apps, message your friends, etc.

Notifications. Any app can send out a notification, if you allow it too on the first boot, meaning that you can always keep up to date.

Social Services Integration. Vision will connect with your social networks, and then from that it will be able to give you notifications and a feed on all updates.

Automatic updater . On boot, Vision checks that it is running the latest version, and if it isn’t, it’ll automatically update - you’ll always be on the latest version of Vision.


It’ll come with the default apps you’d expect from an application such as this - a music and videos player, and things such as a web browser.

If you’re a developer interested in Vision, then you’ll be happy to know that there is an SDK on the way, built around LWJGL and Slick2D. We really didn’t change much of the Slick2D API, so you can start developing your Vision Games and Applications as Slick2D StateBasedGames, until we get back to you on the position of the API. But trust us, you’ll only have to change a couple words to make them a Vision game/application. And then you can add some brilliant Vision features such as achievements and notifications, with only a couple more lines.

If you have any question’s about Vision - do not hesitate to email
support@the45industries.com

And make sure to follow us on Twitter!
@visiongameshub OR https://twitter.com/visiongameshub

Thank you, and we hope you support our project!

story:
I know, I know, we said kickstarter in the video.

 

Time Rift started as my end-of-year school project. As I started to work on it, I realized that I would need more people to get it done in time. I recruited my best friends, Michael, Eric, and Mo. We started to make the game, and realized that we needed globs of money. a lot more than we had. It was then that Michael suggested Kickstarter and when that didn't work, he suggested indiegogo! Now here we are, a official company, with a real game! I hope you decide to fund us, and thank you in advance!

About the game

   Time Rift is a Cross between a Role Playing Game (RPG), like Skyrim, and a rougelike game, like Faster Than Light. In the game, you are a Time Traveling Hero aided by a wizard, protecting time from a evil force! The Timelines that you travel to are randomly selected from a huge pool of them, and the loot works on the same concept. We have Timelines ranging from when King Arthur and his knights were going around questing, to the far future, where there is no difference between man and machine!

Risks and challenges

The obstacles we have found are mainly that we are all underage, so our parents have to run this stuff. There is also the fact that this is our first game, so you may think we won't make a good one. However, we will respond to community feedback, and have many people to help us make Time Rift a game for the ages!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, feel free to promote (not spam) us. It's greatly appreciated.
 

Note:

Only adults have access to financial-related things, and have veto power over everything

story: Closed campaign
story_txt: Closed campaign

story:
Whip Master is a nostalgic love letter to the 80's and 90's that takes inspiration from some of the best classics of the 8-bit era while offering a new and fresh series of adventures and challenges in becoming the Whip Master.

The game will feature five different distinctive and unforgettable worlds, each with its own unique themes, enemies, and bosses. Each world will include at least seven challenging levels as well as secret bonus areas (35 unique levels total plus bonus areas and special levels). You can also perfect your skills features like a speed run mode and multiple challenging achievements for you to earn along the way.

We also hope to include a level editor (but only with your help - check stretch goals below!) to allow you to create and your own levels and share them with the world.

But there will be much more included in your experience. Throughout the game you will also be able to unlock multiple features to make it feel as if it was straight out of the past such as several enhanced visual filters such as CRT, tube, composite, scan lines, etc. to make your playing experience even more unique and memorable. The game will also include a brand new 8-bit soundtrack (included as a possible reward - check out the rewards below).

Visual Filters:

These are just a few examples of the filters that will be included in the game, but there will be more to come. Be sure to stay connected to this campaign for more updates.

Level Editor:

We would love to include a level editor so that you can create personalized new challenges for Whipseey. We would like to set up a server for at least the first year after release to allow players to share their levels online like Super Mario Maker. This would add countless hours of fun and adventure, but we need your support to make it happen.

 

The Game's Story

In the game you play as Drew, a regular 10-year-old kid who gets transformed into  the Whip Master. Drew is thrown into a mysterious world as part of a curse after reading a rare comic book he finds in his new home.  
Armed with your newfound whip, your only option is to explore and fight through this fantastical and vivid world full of cunning enemies, treacherous obstacles,  and challenging bosses. You will learn new and empowering skills along the way to complete your adventure, prove yourself as the Whip Master, and with any luck, be able to return home. 

 

 

We only get to keep the money if the project gets successfully funded. If we do not get fully funded, you get your money back. Our campaign goal is asking for only what is strictly necessary to bring this game to life and deliver it to you.

 

  • $ 7,000 -  ensures a Windows release of the game
  • $ 10,000 - Linux + Mac port
  • $ 20,000 - level editor
  • ​$ 40,000 - we will explore the possibility of porting the game to other platforms

 

$ 1 

Every dollar helps! You will receive a personalized thank you email from us.

$ 5 

 When the campaign is finished, you will receive a pack of mobile and desktop wallpapers
+ everything from the previous tier.

$ 10

You will receive a DRM-Free copy of the game
+ a steam key when the game is released
​+ everything from the previous tiers.

$ 15

You will receive a digital manual when the game is released
​+ everything from the previous tiers.

$ 20

You will receive the complete Whip Master digital soundtrack 
​+ everything from the previous tiers.

$ 30

You will receive  a special thanks in the game credits
​+ everything from the previous tiers.

$ 50

You will get to be a beta tester and play the game before anyone else
+ your name in the game credits  as "play tester and backer"
​+ everything from the previous tiers.

$ 100

You will receive the game's source code
​+ everything from the previous tiers.
  (only 100 available)

$ 200

You will get to design one bonus level in a special "Whip Master and Friends Party" area of the game
​+ everything from the previous tiers.
(only 25 available)

$ 500

You will receive a exclusive digital development diary documenting the process of creating of the game, concept art, and developer's notes
+  the Whip Master engine for GameMaker
​+ everything from the previous tiers.

$ 1000

As a special thank you for loving the project so much, you will be featured at the start of the game as "executive producer"  
+  you'll have the right to receive any future  sequels of Whip Master
​+ everything from the previous tiers.
(only 5 available)

You probably want to know how we'll spend the money.

  • Indiegogo fees (5% + 3% credit card fees)
  • Software licenses (5%)
  • Coding (22%)
  • Art (20%)
  • Design (25%)
  • Sound and Music Design (20%)

As a reminder, our campaign goal amount is only what is necessary to bring this game to life.

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out Whip Master. if you have any questions about the campaign or the game, I will be more than happy to answer them. Please share the campaign and spread the word. We are excited to share this game with you but please consider support us to make it happen!

In appreciation,

  Daniel Ramirez
and
Benji Inniger
story_txt:
Whip Master is a nostalgic love letter to the 80's and 90's that takes inspiration from some of the best classics of the 8-bit era while offering a new and fresh series of adventures and challenges in becoming the Whip Master.The game will feature five different distinctive and unforgettable worlds, each with its own unique themes, enemies, and bosses. Each world will include at least seven challenging levels as well as secret bonus areas (35 unique levels total plus bonus areas and special levels). You can also perfect your skills features like a speed run mode and multiple challenging achievements for you to earn along the way.We also hope to include a level editor (but only with your help - check stretch goals below!) to allow you to create and your own levels and share them with the world.But there will be much more included in your experience. Throughout the game you will also be able to unlock multiple features to make it feel as if it was straight out of the past such as several enhanced visual filters such as CRT, tube, composite, scan lines, etc. to make your playing experience even more unique and memorable. story:
WELCOME HUMAN...


Tiny Life Game is first and third person exploration, simulation, racing, diving, adventure game taking place in the human body environment in microscale.

This game will let player take on a epic journey of discovery, to explore yours most important thing in the world: YOU. 


Unique setting: Game is set in unique environment of human microbiology and is visually simulating physiology. Environments vary from tight tunnels, complex tissue structures up to large fluid open spaces. Each environment has not only different visual feeling but also physical characteristics which will also has effect on players manevourability of controlled character.

Educative aspect: Game is combination of fresh, fun gameplay and educational approach to interactively teach along the way basics of human biology and health(self)care to increase prevention and self awareness. As player progress in game he will visit new areas and learn more about different systems of human biology. Amount of information is composed so is understandable for everybody, especially kids. 

Platforms. Game is developed for PC with support of upcoming Virtual Reality Hardware. Ports on other platforms later possible.



TEAM


Who? We are working in video game industry for over a decade. We worked primarily or as outsource for many titles from table type games, shooting galleries, flying arcade/simulations, fantasy RPG ...

We developed games for Nintendo 3DS, Playstation 3, Playstation 4, Microsoft XBOX 360, Nintendo Wii, Nintendo DS, PC and cash-operated machines. 

This project is collaborative work of:

http://innerdrivegames.com/ studio

http://www.games-farm.com/ studio

Technology. Company works with latest technology available on the market, including 3D displays, Sony Playstation Move, Microsoft Kinect, Nintendo 3DS, VR Oculus rift and others.


ABOUT THE GAME


Game is set in strange and beautiful world of human biology.Our bodies are extremely complex structures with incredible balance of so many factors. From brain to nails, everything has its purpose.

Explore colorful rich environments and get challenged.

Game has two main modes:

1. Exploration sandbox mode

2. Arcade adventure mode


1. EXPLORATION SANDBOX MODE


In this experimental mode player is able freely to explore different environments of human biology. Game is driven by wonder and exploration.

Player is controlling different ship like objects(white cells/nanobots) navigating through variety of environments and is able to interact with some parts of the environment to see actions and reactions.

This is more explore focused, less challenging game mode.

Support VR technologies to enhance experience.

More sandbox style gameplay. Visuals are more realistic and mature. 

2. ARCADE ADVENTURE MODE


Is focusing on challenging game play with quick thinking and planning as key to success.

Game progress by player finishing challenges, unlocking new environments, unlocking new abilities. Player is constantly challenged by different types of danger.

Arcade mode contains 3 separate mini games:

2.1 Micro racer

2.2 Roll them up

2.3 Central defense

2.1 Micro racer

This mini game is letting player control white blood cell/nanobot. Player is able to fly/dive with small ship like object through various environments. Diving in everything from tight tunnels to wide open fluid spaces. Collect nutrients, avoid collisions and destroy intruders along the way. Relatively fast paced racing/diving/flying arcade. 

2.2 Roll them up

This mini game is based on classic twin stick shooting concept. Fight in various environments, flat or rounded “terrain” and stop invading intruders using various abilities. 

2.3 Central defense

In this mini game player taking control of rather stationary “turret” and defend structures against invading intruders using different abilities (projectiles,pull/push tool, slow motion...) .


INSPIRATION


Once Upon a Time... Life - animated Tv series

We would like to bring theme of human biology in similar fashion as this 80’s Tv animated series did. We dont want scare people with overwhelming approach but in funny ways introduce bases of human biology in similar way as mentioned series did.


Real world observations

There is lot of real world inspiration in our art and design. Rich visuals and dynamic environments is one of the main focus points. We choose Unreal 4 engine to use mainly for his real time rendering capabilities.


Other Games

As inspiration for mini games gameplay we also look in lot of similar games which are around and mixing lot of features with different concepts to suit it in our environment. Just to mention a few games for inspiration: Crash Bandicoot, Wipeout, Super Stardust, Waves,....


FAQ


On which platforms will be Tiny life game released?
Initially on PC. Later on we would like to port on PS4, XBOX One, iOS...

If you have any questions please feel free to ask in comments section.. 



WELCOME ON THIS EPIC JOURNEY...


IF YOU LIKE OUR PROJECT YOU CAN ALSO HELP US BY SHARING, LIKING ON SOCIAL MEDIA...THANK YOU..LIVE LONG AND PROSPER

story:
Everworld Island is a coop Sandbox Multiplayer game, that can be played both, Online or over LAN with up to 4 Players. The most unique features in this game are the Campaign and Level editor,which allows you to create, share and play levels, campaigns or stories with your friends or with people from all over the world without any programming knowledge. There will also be a variety of classes, like the Mage,Knight,Mechanic,Diver. Each Class has their own abilities, the Diver for example, will be able to swim, and dive for treasures or hidden secrets.

There will also be a wide range of items that can be found and collected in the levels, like Potions, Treasure Maps, rare items that can be placed in your home for others to see.

The Day/Night cycle within the game will allow more variety in your levels. For example some encounters are only triggered during a specific daytime, like ghosts, and some secrets rooms are only active at night, while plant like enemies are only active during the day.


Why do we need the money?

There are quite a few features already in the game, but some are missing completely, just to name a few: coop, player housing. We would also like to add much more content to the game, enemies, bosses, more tilesets, sound, music, items, theme sets.

Developing Everworld Island costs alot of money and will be spent on sound, music, programming, graphics and we appreciate every support that we can get.

If you have any suggestions,feedback,ideas on how to improve Everworld Island, please head over to our official forums, since you guys will be shaping the game alongside us.

The multiplayer part is integrated though the cooperative features like the switch systems which can be only activated together are missing completely!


Follow us on facebook

Everworld Island Website & Board


Please vote up on Greenlight


Existing features: 

  • Online multiplayer mode over the internet or local via Lan with up to 4 players!
  • Simple but powerful level editor to create single levels or campaigns
  • Day/Night cycle
  • A global map (not fully done, yet)
  • Gamepad support
  • Classes: Standard Class, Mage
  • Inventory System & different items which you can find in the Levels
  • Enemies: Bad-Worms
  • Vertical and horizontal moving platforms
  • Main quest goal: Find all jigsaw pieces!
  • Randomly placed chests
  • Level Theme Set: Forest

Planned features:

  • Campaign Editor
  • More goals for your own levels
  • More classes: knight, mechanics
  • More level-themes: winter, steampunk (see the stretch goals)
  • More level objects (trees, hills, coins...)
  • More items
  • Player Housing




From the collected money we have to pay 19% betterment tax. 7% goes out for the Sound and Music. The remain goes out for the rent and other costs.




Items and Coins:

The player starts with no coins or items. These must be collected in levels to buy new objects for his home or for new level objects for the level editor. After the creation of levels the player can share them with other people online. These can be played by other players again, so they can get new items and coins.

Global Map & Levels:

The game is splitted into two parts. The first one is the global map which is static. On the global map the players can also find the shop. The second part are the user-created levels which is the dynamic part of the game. In these levels the players can find and collect different items and coins which they can trade for new objects in the shop on the global map.

Housing:

After buying a piece of ground which the players can buy at the shop, they're able to use a portal to get to this plot of land. On this plot they can build their own house using the collected or bought blocks and items. At the house the players can plant seeds to grow different plants and flowers. These plants can be used to brew different potions in a bowl like a heal potion. The players are also able to place furnitures and other inside the house.

Multiplayer:

The focus of Everworld Island is the cooperative multiplayer mode. This means that the player must use a water pump while another player must lead the water jet against a target for example. Likewise there are tons of possibillities to create different switch - riddles which can only be solved by more than one player.

The different classes which can be choosen inside the level at different spots are important to finish a level. This means that one player must choose the diver as a class to dive into a lake to activate a switch, another one must choose the mechanic to repair an elevator for example.

By these dynamic levels created by players there will be endless possibillites how to solve a level.

Leveleditor:

Everworld Island includes a very easy to use leveleditor where everyone can create their own levels. If you have a good concept for a story then create a campaign which means that you can string more than one level together. The campgain or also a single level can be shared with friends and other people. Of course you can also play them with your friends! New objects like plants, elevators, new enemies, etc. can be bought at the Shop with coins.

Day/Night Cycle:

The game also contains a day and night cycle. The levels adapt to the current cycle and behave differently. This means that there are ghosts which spook while it's night or secret "ghost ways" which only appear at night and lead to special places for example. While daytime there are special enemies which would sleep at night or npcs which only appear while it's daytime.

Pets:

If you have collected enough coins and finished enough levels then you're able to buy a pet which can follow you through the levels and even help you! E.g. a dog can sniff treasures under the earth and even dig them out. Other pets like the Fairy will function like a light source at night, but they're also able to fight against ghosts. Pets must be fed daily or they get moody and won't follow you inside a level.



The Magician: The Magician can use different Spells to defeat his foes, and in some cases magic is the only way to destroy enemies.

The Diver: The Diver is a true treasure hunter, with his swimming and diving abilities he is able to find sunken treasures or hidden secrets underwater.

The Mechanic: Something is broken? He can fix it. The Mechanic is capable of repairing elevators  or every other kind of complex mechanisms.

The Knight: This guy belongs to the front of your Party, with his Swords and Hammers he can destroy armored enemies or break blocks that are meant to be broken.


The Gamer, Pet and Editor Pack are exclusively available during our Indiegogo-campaign, they won't be available once the campaign is over.




Screenshots:

Animated ingame-scene


Ship scene

Full-Sized Screenshot


Day / Night


Artwork

Full-Sized Artwork


FAQ:

Which platforms are supported?

Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8

Is there a singleplayer mode?

Yes!

Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8


Is there a singleplayer mode?
Yes!

story:
Vídeo en español :

 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_UrZ0CX5LzA


                                 Build a Kingdom. Fight the Darkness. Claim your Throne.

                                                                      -.-.-

                            Construye un Reino. Derrota la Oscuridad. Reclama el Trono.

Rocky Crown is a boardgame for 2-4 players in which dwarven clans build and fight over a newly established dwarven city. They must also explore the tunnels below the grand halls, hoping to find riches and treasures that will place them on the throne.

The game takes up to eleven turns or until the dwellers of the underground overrun the city. The winner, should the dwarves survive, is the clan holding the most prestige points.

Every turn players must bid to take up different positions which are entrusted with the diverse aspects of the daily life of the city. The clans must lead expeditions into the dark, assume responsability over the great works taking place and supervise the defence of the city both above and below ground. In doing so, they'll gain prestige that'll take them closer to their goal of becoming king of the new city

Aside from the race to the Throne, the clans must also take care of their economy and relative strength. Mining riches, recruiting inmigrants, acquiring useful items and settling the tunnels are all actions that must be taken in order to have a chance of achieving the final victory.

Meanwhile, in the tunnels, the creatures of the dark spawn and multiply in ever greater quantities. Keeping them in check and prohibiting them even the smallest victory on dwarven held ground is vital to the survival of the new kingdom.


Rocky Crown es un juego de mesa para entre dos y cuatro jugadores en el cual varios clanes enanos construyen y luchan por el control de una recién fundada ciudad enana. Deben también explorar los túneles bajo los grandes salones, con la esperanza de encontrar riquezas y tesoros que les catapulten al trono.

El juego dura hasta once turnos o hasta que los habitantes del subterráneo desborden la ciudad. El ganador, suponiendo que los enanos sobrevivan, es el clan con mayor cantidad de puntos de prestigio.

Cada turno los jugadores deben pujar por ocupar los diferentes cargos que se ocupan de los diversos aspectos de la vida diaria de la ciudad. Los clanes deben liderar expediciones a la oscuridad, asumir responsabilidad sobre las grandes obras que tienen lugar y supervisar la defensa de la ciudad bajo y sobre tierra. Al hacer esto, ganarán prestigio que les acercará a su objetivo de convertirse en reyes de la nueva ciudad.

Aparte de la carrera al trono, los clanes deben también preocuparse de su economía y poder. Minar riquezas, reclutar inmigrantes, adquirir objetos útiles y colonizar los túneles son todas acciones que deben ser tomadas para poder tener una oportunidad de alcanzar la victoria final.

Mientras tanto, en los túneles, las criaturas de la oscuridad surgen y se multiplican en cantidades cada vez mayores. Mantenerlas bajo control y denegarles la más pequeña victoria en terreno enano es vital para la supervivencia del nuevo reino.



The game includes:

- Box

- Board game

- A puzzle of cardboard pieces with the built up city

- Rulebook in English and Spanish

- 90 Dwarven and Monster tokens (upgradeable to plastic figures in the Stretch goals)

- 80 Wooden Resource cubes

- 4 Role tokens

- 5 Score counters

- 2 Large Mine cardboard pieces

- 100 Small Mine cardboard pieces

- 50 Cards

El juego incluye:

- Caja

- Tablero

- Un puzzle de cartón con la ciudad construida

- Manual en inglés y español

- 90 fichas de enanos y monstruos (sustituidas por miniaturas de plástico si alcanzamos el objetivo de financiación indicado abajo)

- 80 cubos de recursos de madera

- 4 marcadores de puesto

- 5 contadores de puntuación

- 2 piezas grandes de Minas en cartón

- 100 piezas pequeñas de Minas en cartón

- 50 Cartas

We've been working on Rocky Crown for close to a year and we believe it has reached maturity. There are some art assets still uncompleted and the game is still undergoing local playtesting to ensure an entertaining and balanced experience for players, but aside from that the game is now done. 

We believe it is a good, fun, original game and it deserves to see the light of day, but we need your help to see it done. We could release it on our own but we consider that crowdfunding has many advantages.

It gives us global visibility, which ensures we're not going to end up sitting on a lot of boxes. It allows us to include more things in the box knowing that there are lower risks involved. And, there is a special reason for this project, highlighted below down in the stretch goal list.

Rocky Crown is a game about dwarves and monsters, so it could benefit inmensely from adding miniatures to it. While we could face the risks involved in taking the game to press ourselves, there is a minimum run required for manufacturers to be interested in adding miniatures. That amount is not realistical for a project like ours, as we lack proper channels for selling such large amounts.

So... what is my money for?

The money from the pledges will be used to pay for the manufacturing cost, to pay for the high costs of shipping, and to pay the artist for his time and tears. 

Aside from that, some money will go to Indiegogo.com and Paypal, part of it to pay VAT, taxes and other costs and should any money remain, it'd be used to advance further in the stretch goal ladder. Profit comes from selling the remaining boxes.


Hemos estado trabajando en Rocky Crown cerca de un año y consideramos que ha alcanzado la madurez. Todavía hay algunas ilustraciones por completar y el juego aún está en su fase final de testeo para asegurar una experiencia entretenida y equilibrada para los jugadores, pero por lo demás el juego está completo.

Creemos que es un buen juego, entretenido y original y que merece ver la luz del día, pero necesitamos tu ayuda para poder hacerlo. Podríamos llegar a publicarlo por nuestra cuenta pero consideramos que el crowdfunding tiene muchas ventajas. 

Nos da una mayor visibilidad global, que garantiza que no terminaremos sentados encima de un montón de cajas sin vender. Nos permite incluir más elementos en la caja, sabiendo que el proyecto entraña un menor peligro. Y hay un motivo especial para este proyecto, indicado en las profundidades de la lista de objetivos desbloqueables.

Rocky Crown es un juego que trata sobre enanos y monstruos, así que se beneficiaría inmensamente de añadirle miniaturas. Aunque podríamos asumir el riesgo derivado de enviar el juego a fabrica, existe una producción mínima requerida por los fabricantes para añadir miniaturas. Esa cantidad no es realista para un proyecto como el nuestro, ya que no disponemos de los canales adecuados para vender una cantidad tan grande. 

Así que... para que necesitáis mi dinero?

El dinero de los colaboradores ira destinado a pagar el coste de manufacturación, a pagar los altísimos costes de envío, y a pagarle al ilustrador su tiempo y lágrimas. 

Aparte de ello, parte del dinero irá a Indiegogo.com y a Paypal, parte de él a pagar IVA, impuestos y otros costes y, caso de que sobrara dinero, lo emplearíamos en avanzar en la escala de recompensas. El beneficio para el autor proviene de la venta del resto de cajas al público.


The game will be manufactured with Panda Game Manufacturing, in China. They have an excellent track record and more than a hundred published games. We've already contacted them and budgets and timetables have already been put at our disposal.

The game files will be sent to factory in early Feb. 2014 and games should arrive around July 2014. We cannot make asurances on slight delays but it'll definitely arrive on the Summer.

Reaching the plastic miniatures goal on our stretch goal chart may be an additional source of delay but with the current timetables it should not represent a problem, as we're already set some time between the end of the crowdfunding and the manufacturing.

El juego será manufacturado con Panda Game Manufacturing, en China. Tienen un excelente historial y más de cien juegos publicados. Ya hemos contactado con ellos y nos han enviado presupuestos y estimaciones de calendario.

Los archivos del juego serán enviados a principios de Febrero de 2014 y los juegos deberían llegar en torno a Julio de 2014. No podemos hacer promesas respecto a posibles pequeños retrasos pero sin duda llegará en verano.

Si alcanzáramos el objetivo mínimo para poder producir miniaturas de plástico, podría ocurrir un pequeño retraso adicional pero con las estimaciones actuales no debería suponer un problema, ya que ya hemos dejado algo de tiempo entre el final de la microfinanciación y la manufacturación.

If you are a retailer or distributor and are interested in Rocky Crown please send an e-mail to javiergsebastian@gmail.com.

Si eres un distribuidor y estás interesado en Rocky Crown por favor envía un correo a javiergsebastian@gmail.com

story:
Introduction

I am in the process of making my first M.A.M.E. Arcade cabinet, complete with a four player control panel. This is the first project I have started, and find myself in need of assistance from fellow enthusiasts. I'm seeking donations to help fund the purchase of parts needed to complete this cabinet, and every contribution will help realize this goal.


Control Panel


Features:

  1. 4 Players
  2. Trackball
  3. Spinner
  4. 7 button layout per player
  5. Player Start and Coin Buttons
  6. USB Keyboard Emulators.



Money Required

I need $650 dollars to get the following
  1. Keyboard Emulators ($138)
  2. Trackball and Spinner ($171)
  3. Pushbuttons and Joysticks ($191)
  4. Artwork for the control panel ($150)

Stretch Goals

$1000 - I can purchase side artwork and a marquee for my M.A.M.E. cabinet 
$1500 - I can get a new 26" arcade monitor
$2000 - I can get a brand new computer to run my M.A.M.E. setup

Perks

Arcade Contributor

$1 USD

Your help is greatly appreciated, every dollar I receive goes towards my final project. In return you will be forever remembered. I will put your name in my M.A.M.E. software.


Arcade Supporter

$5 USD

Thank You,Your contribution helps so much. In return I will put your name in my software and mail you a hand written thank you card.


Arcade Dreamer

$25 USD

Your contribution is a great help to my dream. In return I will give you the previous perks plus send you a T-shirt


Arcade Enthusiast

$50 USD

Since you are so kind to help me, I will send you everything listed previously, plus a arcade mouse pad. Your choice between these two:

#1 #2


Arcade Aficionado

$200 USD

Thank You!!! Your incredible. In return I will put your name in my software and give you a hand written thank you card, a t-shirt, and a mouse pad plus make you your own one player control panel, with USB support for your PC. There will be four different color choices. See below.

Option 1: Green Joystick and Buttons

Option 2: Red Joystick and Buttons

Option 3: Blue Joystick and Buttons

Option 4: Yellow Joystick and Buttons

Arcade Connoisseur

$400 USD

Wow!! Your Amazing!!! In return I will put your name in my software and give you a hand written thank you card, a t-shirt, and a mouse pad plus make you your own two player control panel, with USB support for your PC.



Thank You

Thanks to everyone that contributes to my project. It is greatly appreciated.
If you can not contribute but would like to help out, tell your friends and help spread the word.
Thanks again
Michael Melssen
