story:
We are very excited and we know the potential of this game and the hardest job is to communicate our passion and vision. During the test we had more than 95% positive feedback which is absolutely uniuque in world of board games.

We know is a very funny game: it shows people that human brain is short or ‘short-circuit’.

"Can we play one more?"

That was the most frequently asked question from testers, and that is why our project here.

When we started to play we smile a lot about ourselves and we hoped people would do the same, and it  happened. Now we would like to share with the world this kind of gaming experience.

You can cowdfund this project while buying a new skills developing and entertaining board game (or two) at a reasonable price.

It is fun and easy-to-play board game , appropriate for all ages, which aims to become a modern classic. The 2-player version is a real duel, while the 4 player one is a great family contest! Ther will be 4 gaming methods for 2-3-4 persons, (4 player version will be a strech goal) You can vary them to provide entertainment for a quick-paced game as well as a longer family fun session. The game will also be suitable for championships. 

The main target is to find pairs and place tiles from hand to reach 2048.

Is is a simple game, but carries a lot of opportunities to improove strategic thinking. So game by game you will find, this game is not as simple as it looks...

Family-friendly game, Appropriate for all ages, 8 min – 15 min length, 2-3-4 players, Language independent, Developing memory, focus and intuition skills

1 x instructions manual

1 x game board

96 x tiles (4 player version is 128 x tiles - strech goal)



Once it is up and running, we will launch a version for the blind, enabling them to play with each other and their sighted fellows. In order to reduce the cost of the braille version we have to produce 5000pcs. We need your help to reach this quantity.

We are Gergő Darabont and Miklós Kovács who decided to develope a project together through Indiegogo.

We come from different cultural and educational backgrounds, Gergő is working on design …. Miklós gives trainings about drawing and painting, but we share a passion for making and stimulating social interaction and education.

This is our first task in Vivify Entertainment.

HUNGARY: free

EUROPE: 10$

US AND CANADA: 10$

Shipping for other countries upon request.

These are the measures we have taken to ensure that we are capable of delivering our product if our indiegogo campaign gets successfully funded:

  1. We have essentially finished our game design files. While the Indiegogo campaign is live we will work on designing additional tile back sides for the mass production and some more refinings to the final tweaks to our game design.
  2. Almost everything is prepared; we have to work on the braille version and some marketing issues.
  3. As this is our first Indiegogo experience, we want to ensure we deliver everything in time.
  4. If we exceed our funding goal more than 5x, we will then look elsewhere to produce the game in a larger batch. 
  5. We will do our best to stick to our schedule and we promise to maintain transparency and keep you informed at all times.

Thank you for your trust in us!

Let's bring 2048 THE BOARD GAME to the Table Top world!

story:
FOLLOW US!

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Game.Beekeeper
  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/BeeNorshanks


Beekeeper is a family friendly game that is quick, compact, and enjoyable by anyone 5 years old and up!

Our plans for Beekeeper

With the release of Beekeeper, Norshanks Games is looking to start up a business where we can bring games to you and also to help raise funds and awareness to smaller, often overlooked organizations such as helping the state of the world's honeybee population. With every Beekeeper  perk, half of the profit of each board game ($4 CAD) will be sent to the National Beekeeping Association of your Country!  It will help educate the public, research into preventing and hopefully someday eliminating Colony Collapse Disorder, and many more exciting ventures!

Beekeeper isn't just a board game it's a way to bring ideas to life while also giving back to the world.


What is in Beekeeper?

·  1 draw-string cloth bag

·  1 Bag-Tag

·  37 Hexagonal Playing Pieces (1 is the Queen keep an eye out for her)

·  1 Set of Instructions

Set-up!

  1. Find a nice flat and level surface (12” X 12” at the very least)

  2. Untie the drawstrings and dump the playing pieces on the surface

  3. Find the Queen (she has an image on both sides of the piece to make it easier to find) and place her in the middle of the playing surface

Grab the rest of the playing pieces and arrange them around the Queen with the “Beekeeper” Logo facing up.  You can arrange the game however you want, personally I like making all the sides of the Queen have an equal amount of playing pieces.

Playing the Game:

Imagine a world with a huge Bee-Shortage, with one chance for hope! An advanced colony of Bees has been discovered and you and every other Beekeeper is out to claim these super-bees to recolonize the world. First one to grab the Queen ends the game, but the Beekeeper with the most points wins! So let’s see what you are all up against!

All the players (in a clockwise order) starting with the youngest player gets to choose one piece from the hive that has at least 2 open sides!  They then flip the piece and will find the following:


Finding Bees is the best thing!  Add up these points at the end of the game, and whoever has the highest amount wins!  In the game there are lots of Larva, Worker, and Drone Bees but only one Queen!  The Queen is tricky too, she will only leave the hive for at least 6 Honey Tokens, and once she is taken the game is over!
Speaking of honey tokens...

Finding honey tokens are a good thing, you need at least 6 of these to convince the queen to leave the hive and end the game!

But beware, you are not the only one who wants these bees!

If you find one of these guys you have to miss one or more turns!
(Don’t be fooled by the Honey Badger he is not as cuddly as you might think!)

Help Us Make This Game A Reality

We put this project on Indiegogo because we felt it would be the best way to bring our ideas for great board games into your hands, which will allow all of us as a community to make improvements and help great causes.
So if saving the world one bee at a time is something you're into, please back this project and help us build this game!

Risks and Challenges 

Beekeeper is a relatively straightforward product to make, that said, misprints can happen and will have to be revised and replaced. If a factory error does occur it could delay the shipment of the game by a couple of weeks.

One big question that you might be wondering about, "Why are only certain countries listed in this campaign?" Well we want to make sure we have a National Beekeeping Association that has agreed to partner with our game, so far we have only gotten 3 confirmed partnerships and awaiting a 4th.

Here is a list of our current National Beekeeping Association Partners for this game so far;

United States of America: American Beekeeping Federation (http://www.abfnet.org/) "Friends of the Bee"

United Kingdom: British Beekeepers Association (http://www.bbka.org.uk/) "Friends of the Honey Bee"

Canada: Canadian Honey Council (http://www.honeycouncil.ca) "Save our Bees"

Currently waiting for Australia's reply to a partnership.

If you know of any other National Beekeeping Associations who would like to partner with us get them to send us an email @ NorshanksGames@Hotmail.com or comment on this crowdfunding campaign with their website and we will try our best to contact them.

FOLLOW US!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Game.Beekeeper
Twitter: https://twitter.com/BeeNorshanks

Beekeeper is a family friendly game that is quick, compact, and enjoyable by anyone 5 years old and up!

story:
Project Goals

At VolksPC (http://www.volkspc.org) we want to build a low cost low power Linux PC.

Linux desktops have been shipping for a while but we still cannot buy a low cost Linux PC that comes with software pre-installed. Our initial plan was to use an ARM CPU and run a Debian desktop such as LXDE/XFCE. We soon realized that Debian ARM does not support YouTube playback and because of a lack of drivers, HD video playback was just not possible. Android, on the other hand, does this very well and also has many applications not available on Debian, So we went back to the drawing board and came up with a solution that allows both Android and Debian  applications to run simultaneously at native speeds.

VolksPC Hardware

The VolksPC hardware has the following specs:

  • Dual core Rockchip RK3066 Cortex-A9 CPU running at 1.4Ghz.
  • 1 GB DDR3
  • 8 GB NAND Flash (Android)
  • Optional 8 GB Class 10 MicroSD (Debian Wheezy)
  • 10/100 Ethernet port.
  • USB 2.0 x 2
  • 1 USB OTG
  • AV/Headphone Jack
  • HDMI v1.3 digital HD interface
  • IEEE 802.11 b/g/n
  • Bluetooth
  • SD /MMC/MS card reader

HDMI cable and 5V, 2A power supply are included in the package. The HDMI interface supports 720P native resolution. Below is an image of  VolksPC hardware showing all the ports.


VolksPC Software

For VolksPC we have created a Unified Distribution that runs Android Jelly Bean 4.2.2 and Debian Wheezy applications simultaneously. This video clip shows how both Debian LXDE and Android Jelly Bean work on VolksPC.


The Linux desktop on start-up will get the time zone, locale, and keyboard configuration from Android.

The Debian  file system  can reside in internal Flash as a single linuxfs.img  or in external MicroSD. In either case it is upgradebale. Android can be upgraded using the OTG port and RKBatchTools running on  a Windows PC.

Our unified software is  stable and runs well on a RK3066 based set-top box provided by a large Shenzhen manufacturer. Our latest release is based on XFCE desktop.  This short video clip shows our final hardware and software.


Review of Unified Distribution

We only have a few boxes of our final hardware so we don't have enough units to give for testing. We have also ported and tested our software on MK808 mini-PC. Mr Jean-Luc Aufranc from cnx-software was kind enough to review the MK808 running our unified Android and Debian distribution.

Here is a video clip of his review.


Some of the things that he liked:

  • Performance is good- fast booting, fast switching and fast loading of LibreOffice and Chromium.
  • He tested several Android apps such ES File Explorer, Google Play, YouTube and they all worked well.
  • Antutu 4.x benchmark gave a score of 10521 points. This confirmed that Debian did not in any way slow down Android.

Some software issues that he found:

  • He could not login to SAMBA share with ES File Explorer. This will be fixed.
  • Some Debian directories and files are not visible from Android. This will be fixed.

Some stability issues that seems particular to MK808 hardware:

  • Random WIfi disconnects. This is particular to MK808 as can be seen if you Google "MK808 WIfI problems".
  • Random disconnect of USB keybord. We could not duplicate this on our hardware.

The MK808 is a low cost mini-PC with limited ports requiring users to connect to an external hub to provide additional ports. Also the power supply provided with MK808 is not designed to source current required for the additional USB devices causing some instability.

Our final hardware has comprehensive set of ports, Wifi antennae and much better heat dissipation. We have not seen any stability issues in our testing.

MicroXwin Technology

At VolksPC LLC we created the fastest X-Windows implementation called MicroXwin. Here is a clip (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zttcdPtJN8A) of MicroXwin running on a Raspberry Pi and on a Cubieboard2 (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T18FhSTQ08k).

Linux desktop distributions don't have any interest in providing Android compatibility. There are community projects such as Linux on Android which allow Linux desktop graphics to be displayed on Android through VNC viewer. The problem with this approach is that Linux graphics applications must run through several software layers making it very slow.

With MicroXwin graphics technology we can run  both Android and Debian applications at native speeds.

Technical FAQ

What are the benefits of integrating Android with Debian ?

Users can install a lot of applications both  from Android market place and from Debian repositories.

What Debian applications are pre-installed on VolksPC ?

We have a base set off applications such as Chrome Browser, LibreOffice suite, Evince PDF viewer, Mplayer Video Playback, Transmission  bit-torrent client and Pidgin chat client.

Why doesn’t Debian run KDE or Gnome desktop ?

Both KDE and Gnome are big desktops in terms of memory usage. Our  latest unified distribution  is based on XFCE desktop environment.

 Is this technology same as Linux On Android ?

Linux on Android uses VNC viewer Android application  to display Linux desktop graphics. In our implementation Linux desktop graphics is handled by  MicroXwin which make our solution very fast.

Who  is the default user on Debian ?

Our distribution is set up to auto login into user  called desktop. There is no password prompt.

How is time zone and locale configured for Debian ?

When Debian starts up it reads this configuration form Android settings. So if user changes Android settings it will take effect on the next boot.

Is GPU supported on the unified distribution ?

Android supports GPU and OpenGL ES applications. Debian on the other hand  doesn’t have support for GPU  at this time. We will add GPU support for Debian when there are  more OpenGL ES games available.

Wouldn’t Debian applications run slower without GPU support ?

GPU accelerates 3D rendering but for most 2D rendering CPU works better than GPU as there is significant overhead in setting up the GPU hardware. Also MicroXwin is much  faster than standard X. GPU can accelerate Linux Games but there are not many OpenGL ES games available on Debian.

Why support this project

Linux desktop distributions such as Debian have had limited market success because there are not many commercial applications written for it. Also  x86 computers  with Debain/Ubuntu pre-installed are more expensive than a Windows PC.

With VolksPC we can create a Linux PC that is low cost and has access to a  large base of both commercial and open source applications. We think that this VolksPC unit is perfect for students of science and technology who can learn programming with the tools available on Debian and also have access to games on the Android market place.

With our expertise in Linux graphics (MicroXwin ) we are uniquely qualified to create such a device.

What will the money be used for

Our manufacturer needs a minimum order quantity of 1000 units to ship boxes with our software installed on the internal Flash memory. With your pledges we will be able to do so.

If we surpass our goals, we will invest the funds for even better integration between Android and Linux.

Project Timeline

This is our rough estimates on the various milestones for this project.

  • August 1- Indiegogo Campaign  Begins.  We already have few samples from our manufacturer.  We are finalizing software and continuing with more  testing.
  • September 1- Close of Campaign. At this point we should have final software release ready for manufacturing. Our manufacturing partner will be informed about the expected volume and required deposit will be sent. Manufacturer needs 30 days to get box ready.
  • October 1- November 15 Pledge Fulfillment. We will receive VolksPC from our Shenzhen manufacturer and will start shipping to our backers.

Risks & Challenges

We are primarily a software company and our software has been extensively tested on the several RK3066 based set-top boxes. If there are software issues after deployment users can upgrade both Android and XFCE distribution.

Manufacturing is always a risk and challenge. To mitigate this risk we have based our design on a mature Rockchip RK3066 SOC and a set-top box that is already being manufactured and shipped in high volumes. We are not making any changes to their hardware. The only change we are making is to replace their Android distribution with ours.

Shipping

US shipping is included in the perk. Add an additional $30 for world wide shipping.

Customs Fees & Duties:  You will most likely have to pay duties upon delivery of your perk outside the USA.  These vary by country and we cannot quote them ahead of time.  In the EU expect to pay the VAT and any national sales tax.  In Canada GST will likely be charged.  Please check your local laws.  .

About VolksPC LLC

We are a software company with developers based in Silicon Valley and Bangalore. We created a high performance X-WIndows software called MicroXwin that is 2X faster than standard X.

With VolksPC we want to combine our software expertise with commodity Android hardware to create a unique system that is user-friendly, hackable, fast and can run both Android and Debian applications simultaneously.

story:
Our miniatures are 28mm heroic scale .High quality resin miniatures .

                                                          Size Compare

                                                  Our High Quality Miniatures 

                                                        Who we are 

      Dark Hammer Miniatures is a professional and passionate team on miniatures.

     Wehave excellent artists from 2D concept, 3D modeling to handcraft sculpture

      and Talented writer.We are devoted to developing an exciting WarGame.


                                                 How we make a miniature                      


                                           Something about our products

All these miniatures will be brand new and made in high quality resin.Resin is an expensive, hand-cast material that can retain an extremely high level of detail from 

our original sculptures

    

                                                              Shipping 

             All the shipments will be delivered by registered air mail so that we can track 

            the package. For the shipping rate, please check each perk. The package will 

            also be marked as a gift.

                                                          

                                       what if i want multiple Reward levels ?

         Every perk has a description of what will you receive as a reward for choosing it.

       You can select as many as you like - just increase your contribution as appropriate. 

       For example, if you're at theCore Set reward ($65) and want a second one, just 

       pledge a total of $130you can tell us in the Comments section.


                                    How do I add Add-ons to my perk?

      For any addons above the perk that comes with your reward level, simply choose 

     your reward level and then increase the pledge amount by the value of the extra(s) 

     you'd like. For example, a $13 reward + a Sour reaper$15 

     would mean a total pledge of $28. You can tell us in the Comments section.


                             How do we know what you choose for your add-ons?

            Please tell us your add-ons in the Comments section.


                                What if I have any other questions?

          Please don’t hesitated to leave massage in the Comments section or 

          send email to us or stop by our facebook.

          Our email address: support@darkhammerminiature.com










.

 How we make a miniature                                                                 Something about our productsAll these miniatures will be brand new and made in high quality resin.Resin is an expensive, hand-cast material that can retain an extremely high level of detail from our original sculptures                                                                  Shipping              All the shipments will be delivered by registered air mail so that we can track             the package. For the shipping rate, please check each perk. The package will             also be marked as a gift.                                                                                                 what if i want multiple Reward levels ?         Every perk has a description of what will you receive as a reward for choosing it.       You can select as many as you like - just increase your contribution as appropriate.        For example, if you're at theCore Set reward ($65) and want a second one, just        pledge a total of $130you can tell us in the Comments section.                                    How do I add Add-ons to my perk?      For any addons above the perk that comes with your reward level, simply choose      your reward level and then increase the pledge amount by the value of the extra(s)      you'd like. For example, a $13 reward + a Sour reaper$15      would mean a total pledge of $28. You can tell us in the Comments section.                             How do we know what you choose for your add-ons?            Please tell us your add-ons in the Comments section.                                What if I have any other questions?          Please don’t hesitated to leave massage in the Comments section or           send email to us or stop by our facebook.          Our email address: support@darkhammerminiature.com.

story:
Introduction:

Hello, My name is Jan Groenhoej.

The Ecliptic Game is an ambitious project presenting a new educational and competitive gaming platform for Gamers in general, friends and families and people with interest in personal development and astrology. For Astrologers the Board will even be useful for Students and Client sessions.

Astrology is a very useful tool for understanding our individual personalities and conditions of life as well as people around us.

Through my studies of psychotherapy and corporate psychology I recognize how people fit into their Astrological archetypes.

To present these facts in a new and interesting way I have developed the Astrological Board Game – named Ecliptic.

The idea of presenting Astrology as a Board Game is a wish to share Astrology in a different way as a game full of action and fun with friends and families. My hope is that it will raise the incitement to discus personal subjects like feelings, passions, motivations, desires, ambitions and values.

From the excitement expressed by playing with friends and family – and some Astrologers, when playing my game, the idea of making the Ecliptic game available to the public came to life.

My challenge has been making the game plan accessible for everyone requiring no astrological knowledge and yet still to be true to the Astrological literature.

The Ecliptic design and game plan is now ready for production in English, German and Danish.  

To make The Ecliptic Game a reality I’m looking for your support through this crowdfunding platform to start a production and in return I wish to support you with great and useful perks.

Goals and Incentives:

The goal is to achieve a funding of € 40.000, - to start a production to meet our Backers perks and setting up a smart Web-store making Ecliptic game available for future sale through your unique personal links, rewarding your support and interest financially.

Support of € 20 or € 40 triggers a voucher and a unique personal links to our backers, with rewards of respectively 5 or 10 % commission each month of every sale directed from your personal link activated from your Facebook, Webpage, Web shop etc. Redeeming your voucher by paying the difference to receive the Ecliptic Game will adjust your commission link rate accordingly.

Support with € 80 will give you the Ecliptic Game (choose language) incl. European Shipment and a unique personal link of 15 % commission each month of every sale directed from your personal link activated from your Facebook, Webpage, Web shop etc. - See Ecliptic Game Box specification. 

All supporters will receive an invitation to the premiere reception in Copenhagen, when the Board Game is officially launched. 

If our goal is not fully funded - the funding will be returned according to the policy of Indiegogo.

Game Box specification:

The Game Box includes a rule booklet with two sets of roles, that very one can play involving all the Astrological terms and symbols. The Game Board of Ecliptic is a representation of the Radix call equal house system – designed with play regions and sky positions.

The game is ideal for 2 – 6 participants, even though there are 12 positions.

Game role 1: Capture the planets.

Game role 2: First to visit the planets.

The guide gives you 10 historical starting positions of the planets around the Earth and a free link to create any birth charts.

  • Magnetic Card Game Board - pictured below. 
  • The Solar system 10 planets
  • 12 Zodiac game pieces and 12 Zodiac player cards and scoring templates
  • 12 Ascendant game pieces and 12 Ascendant descriptions
  • 120 planet sky position cards with 480 conclusions
  • 24 battlecards combining 5040 outcome
  • 4 Zodiac dice

Visions: 

When successfully funded the Eclipticgame.com will open as a Web-store for the use of our Supporters unique personal links registered - believing that loyal ambassadors will be the backbone for success.

The current Ecliptic Game includes two sets of competitive rules with a exciting gaming dynamic and learning abilities. 

The Ecliptic Board is also prepared for upcoming rules of Lovers & Partners called Synastry or even rules of Transits and Progression and more - which will be offered in separate Boxes at the Web-store. 

We have other unique Ecliptic products in the pipeline to be revealed in the future.

Help the project:

We will be grateful for any contribution and support from Backers and Supporters, please share this project with your network.

story:
Random Studios is a newly formed indie games development studio currently comprised of four talented individuals dedicated to creating new and addictive Intellectual Properties for gamers to play on a wide range of platforms.
The team behind Random Studios has Bachelor Degrees majoring in Design, Animation, and Programming. And also have previous experiences in developing small games for a range of platforms.

 

We believe that in order to achieve our goal of developing AAA titles for our fans to enjoy, we first need to start small, and mobile games will be our ticket to success.

We need your help to turn our concepts into reality, and to further expand Random Studios in order to take on bigger challenges which will not only benefit us, but our fans as well, in the form of new and exciting games.

Your contributions will allow us to purchase testing devices to further improve our first project, Randy (see below) by optimizing its performance across all devices we are targeting, so all players can experience Randy.
The money will also allow us to hire artists to create amazing music tracks and sound effects, purchase additional software, and many other development costs which will allow us to implement so much more into the game.

 

Randy will be Random Studios first title and will hit the Apple App Store later this year!
Randy is a platform puzzler in which players will guide the main character (Randy) through a series of puzzles designed to make you think on the spot by reacting to obstacles set out to capture you for scrap metal.

The game will revolve around Randy losing his navigation unit which will allow him to only move forward, and it is up to you, the player, to guide Randy through the levels with our simple gameplay mechanics.

The core mechanic of the game is the tiles which you roll over. When you touch the screen, the tile you are currently on will rotate Randy left, so to avoid robots or obstacles ahead. The main goal of every level is to get Randy to the end of the map without coming into contact with other robots and obstacles.

Not only will the gameplay be fun and addictive, players will be able to continue to play levels over again to collect items which can be used to purchase customisations and other fun stuff from the in game store to modify Randy and enable additional features as well!

We are also looking into ways in which we can connect our players to their social networks if they choose to do so. This will enable them to easily communicate their achievements and scores with their friends!

Testing is a huge part of our development process to make sure that our ideas and mechanics are enjoyable. The core mechanics and features have been tested by taking a prototype build of the game to Exhibitions to gather vital feedback so we could alter features in the game in accordance with the input we received. We believe that testing our game and reworking ideas with our audience will allow us to produce a product which will appeal to a wider audience.

Your contributions will enable us to make Randy the best it can possibly be, and to help us support the game well after its release date through updates, as well as bringing it to other platforms such as PC and Mac.

 

We want to take the time to explain to our contributors exactly what will happen with their money to give them some peace of mind.

As explained above, most of our funding will be going into development costs for Randy, while the rest will be going straight back to our backers in the form of awesome rewards!

Before getting to the rewards, we want to share with you how your contributions will be spent on developing Randy.
You might be asking yourself, “Why do other game developers request so much more and you guys are only asking for $12k?.”
Well, since we are a small Indie team, our overheads are miniscule compared to companies who have had years to increase their team sizes into the hundreds. We are working hard to deliver an amazing game which will look and play as a high quality game created by those developers, and are putting all funds received into the game to make that happen. Due to the small nature of the team, some costs are already accounted for, but we still require a bit more to help us achieve our goals.

The breakdown of our development costs are:
Devices for testing - $3,000
Business Expenses - $2,000
Additional Hardware - $2,000
Rewards for you! - $5,000+

If we reach our goal, we will be able to implement many more features which we will not be able to otherwise; these features will allow us to create a game for the Apple App Store which will seriously compete with other top selling games. If we go beyond our goal, we will continue to improve and bring new features to Randy through updates, as well as be able to work on new IP’s straight after the games release!

Speaking of surpassing our initial goal, here is what we have planned if we are able to do the impossible and hit all of the below figures!

 

Now here’s the fun part which most of you have been patiently waiting for!

When developing a game for the Apple App Store, developers find it hard to gift their apps to people who support them through crowd funding sources such as this. Reason being is we only have so many redeem codes to give away which are meant for reviewers to download our app and review it for us.
So after going through multiple and absurd ideas to give this game to our backers for free, we figured that the most simplest way to solve this problem was to deduct $1 (99cents is how much the final release will cost) from each of the rewards! Too easy!

Now to the fun part!

 

$4 – SPARE CHANGE PACK

This reward is for those who just want to chip in some spare change and help see us through to the final release of Randy, all contributions help us out more than you can imagine! We will email you a set of wallpapers for both your Computer and iDevices specially made by our talented artists at Random Studios!

 

$14 – CHARACTER CARD PACK

We wanted to create something special for a reasonable price. You will receive the Wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, as well as 4 special character cards which will include a code on each to gain early access to some of the customizations in the game!

*NOTE - Please add $5 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$29 – DIGITAL ART PACK

Not only will you receive the above wallpapers for your Computer and iDevices, and the Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy. You will also receive a PDF version of the Art of Randy which documents our development of the game and has some pretty neat concept images!

*NOTE - Please add $5 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$39 – iPhone 4, 4S CONTRIBUTERS PACK

For our contributors with an iPhone 4 or 4S, turn your iPhone into a work of art with our awesome iPhone 4, 4S Case!
This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, and the PDF version of the Art of Randy

*NOTE - Please add $15 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$39 – iPhone 5 CONTRIBUTORS PACK

For our contributors with an iPhone 5, turn your iPhone into a work of art with our awesome iPhone 5 Case!
This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, and the PDF version of the Art of Randy

*NOTE - Please add $15 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$49 – NAME IN THE GAME!

An amazing opportunity to have your name listed in the Special Thanks of the game credits! Imagine being able to show off to your friends that your name is in one of the biggest game on the Apple App Store!
This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, and the PDF version of the Art of Randy

*NOTE - Please add $5 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$49 – POSTER PACK

Receive an A1 Poster to put up on your wall, or wherever you place your posters.
This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, and the PDF version of the Art of Randy

*NOTE - Please add $15 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$59 – iPad CONTRIBUTORS

For our contributors with an iPad 2nd, 3rd or 4th gen, turn your iPad into a work of art with our awesome iPad Smart Case!
This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, and the PDF version of the Art of Randy

*NOTE - Please add $15 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$59 – iPad Mini CONTRIBUTORS

For our contributors with an iPad Mini, turn your iPad Mini into a work of art with our awesome iPad Mini Case!
This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, and the PDF version of the Art of Randy

*NOTE - Please add $15 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$59 – PHYSICAL, ART OF RANDY

Perfect for those who love to see how games turn from concept sketches to the final product!
Receive a physical 7x7” (18x18cm) copy of the Standard Soft Cover Edition, Art of Randy. Packed full of concept images and developer notes!
This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, and the PDF version of the Art of Randy

*NOTE - Please add $15 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$89 – PHYSICAL, LIMITED ART OF RANDY

Perfect for those who love to see how games turn from concept sketches to the final product!
Receive a physical 7x7” (18x18cm) copy of the Limited Hard Cover, Art of Randy. Packed full of concept images and developer notes and will also be signed by the Random Studios team!
This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, and the PDF version of the Art of Randy

*NOTE - Please add $15 for shipping outside of Australia*

 

$599 – ROBOT PRAISE EASTER EGG!

Here at Random Studios we love Easter Eggs in games and look forward to placing a few of our own in Randy. For these backers, send us a photo of your face and we will create a special Easter Egg for you, and become part of the game! Not to mention all the bragging rights you’ll have over your friends.

This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, the PDF version of the Art of Randy, Poster, Physical Limited Art of Randy, and your choice of either, an iPhone 4/4S Case, iPhone 5 Case, iPad Smart Case, or iPad mini Case.

 

When developing games there are always risks of things going wrong, and our number one risk would be if we had to push back the release date.
We have many safety nets in place to prevent problems during our development, but as we are a small Indie Team attempting to create a game with so many features there is a chance of delay. But rest assured we are all working very hard to have the game ready for release on the Apple App Store by the end of this year.
If some lower priority features do not make the initial release, we will definitely include it as an update later in the Apps lifetime.
If however we require an extra month to finalise the game, we would be very appreciative for your patience while we work hard to get our game to you to play.

 

Once we release Randy for the Apple App Store, we will begin optimising the game to be played on PC and Mac so we can reach even more people!
We will also be working hard on updates to bring to our players so there will always be fresh content for you to enjoy.

If Randy enables us to continue on a new project you can be sure to see more games from us in the near future!

 

There are plenty of ways you can help us out! The best and easiest way is to head over to our Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and YouTube pages and hit those Likes/Follow/Subscribe buttons to keep up to date with all the latest news. Also get your friends to join in; we want everyone to enjoy our games!

Finally, everyone at Random Studios would like to thank you for taking the time to look at our Indiegogo campaign and all of your support so far!

Here at Random Studios we love Easter Eggs in games and look forward to placing a few of our own in Randy. For these backers, send us a photo of your face and we will create a special Easter Egg for you, and become part of the game! Not to mention all the bragging rights you’ll have over your friends.
This pack also consists of the wallpapers for Computer and iDevices, Character Cards with early access codes to customize Randy, the PDF version of the Art of Randy, Poster, Physical Limited Art of Randy, and your choice of either, an iPhone 4/4S Case, iPhone 5 Case, iPad Smart Case, or iPad mini Case.
 

When developing games there are always risks of things going wrong, and our number one risk would be if we had to push back the release date.We have many safety nets in place to prevent problems during our development, but as we are a small Indie Team attempting to create a game with so many features there is a chance of delay. But rest assured we are all working very hard to have the game ready for release on the Apple App Store by the end of this year.If some lower priority features do not make the initial release, we will definitely include it as an update later in the Apps lifetime.If however we require an extra month to finalise the game, we would be very appreciative for your patience while we work hard to get our game to you to play.
 

Once we release Randy for the Apple App Store, we will begin optimising the game to be played on PC and Mac so we can reach even more people!We will also be working hard on updates to bring to our players so there will always be fresh content for you to enjoy.
If Randy enables us to continue on a new project you can be sure to see more games from us in the near future!
 

There are plenty of ways you can help us out! The best and easiest way is to head over to our Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and YouTube pages and hit those Likes/Follow/Subscribe buttons to keep up to date with all the latest news. Also get your friends to join in; we want everyone to enjoy our games!
Finally, everyone at Random Studios would like to thank you for taking the time to look at our Indiegogo campaign and all of your support so far!

story:
Just as we were getting to know the 8x8km island map of Erangel and its desert-themed counterpart Miramar, we now have even more new PUBG maps to get excited about.

From the recently released jungle map of Sanhok, a 4x4km jungle map designed for constant fighting, to a new snow PUBG map called Vikendi, there’s always at least one more killing field in which to get your next chicken dinner. To help keep you updated on all of the PUBG new maps, we have assembled this roundup of everything we know about all the upcoming battlegrounds.

One of PUBG’s best features is its range of colossal maps – they are big enough to cater to different playstyles and feature an unmatched variety of combat scenarios for would-be military tacticians to overcome. However, the newest PUBG new map is very different. This ice cold 6x6km map tracks footsteps and vehicle tracks as you battle it out in the shadow of a huge mountain. But, what’s next? Here’s everything we know about all the new PUBG maps.

PUBG SNOW MAP RELEASE DATE

Winter has come to PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds with the main launch at a very suitable time: the PUBG snow map release date is December 19, 2018. That means you can get stuck in and turn the white snow red to your heart’s content.

story:
What is GAME.minder?

If you are the type of gamer that loves to stay on top of the upcoming games you want to play, then GAME.minder is for you. Our stated goal is to track every single upcoming video game and when it will be available to play. We then let you know when that info changes, and when it's time to play. You can track games at GAMEminder.com, from your iPhone, your Android phone and even on OUYA!

Try it at GAMEminder.com!

Are you a 'casual hardcore gamer'?

John Siracusa gave a great description of who uses GAME.minder and why on his podcast, Hypercritical:

The Casual Hardcore Gamer

Audio courtesy 5by5.tv

Where are we now?

GAME.minder currently has more than 28,000 registered gamers using more than 430,000 RE.minders to track more than 1700 different games (wowzers). The only problem here? We still haven't found a good way to make enough money to keep the service self-sustaining.

We've tried:

  • Selling add ons like advanced filters (to make it easier to find the game you are looking for)
  • Showing ads
  • Selling games via Amazon.com and the AppStore for an afilliate cut

And while each of these has provided a bit of money, none of them is setting the world on fire.

 

What do we need from you?

In April, we let our community know that if nothing changed, we would be forced to shut the service down. We got a ton of great feedback with lots of good ideas and after weighing them all, we've settled on transitioning GAME.minder into a subscription service.

We need $25,000 to build a subscription infrastructure for GAME.minder.

With your help, this will make GAME.minder self-sustaining and allow us to grow the service with even more features in the future.

 

So what will this new GAME.minder look like?

Mostly, it will look like what you're used to now. After this transition, it is our goal to have GAME.minder remain free, for your first 5 RE.minders. If you are never planning to track more than 5 games, GAME.minder will remain free.

However, if you want to track more than 5 upcoming games, you will need to pay for a yearly subscription. We're currently thinking somewhere in the $10-15 range for one year. With this paid subscription, you will be able to set an unlimited number of RE.minders.

Why do you need so much money?

It's important to know what you're paying for. GAME.minder is a large system, with a lot of moving parts. In order to build out this subscription system, we need to do the following:

  • Build support for the concept of subscriptions into the backend system
  • Build support for subscription payments into GAMEminder.com
  • Build support for subscriptions into the iOS app
  • Build support for subscriptions into the Android app
  • Build support for subscriptions into the new OUYA app

In addition, we need to launch all of these things at the same time to make sure all these moving peices don't get out of sync.

The $25,000 breaks down like so:

  •   $1750 - fees right off the top (4% for IndieGogo + 3% processing)
  • ~$8000 - server and website development
  • ~$5500 - iOS Client development and AppStore subscription implementation
  • ~$4500 - Android client development
  • ~$1000 - Google Play subscription implementation
  • ~$1000 - Amazon Appstore subscription implementation
  • ~$1000 - OUYA payment implementation
  •   $2250 - overhead and fulfillment (includes tshirts/shipping and misc development for the links page/badges/etc)

 

Let me get this straight...

"You are asking us to give you money, so you can build a way to take people's money?"

Essentially, this is exactly right. GAME.minder began life as an iOS only app and it has been growing into the service it is today by eating more money than it brings in for about 2 years now. We think the functionality of GAME.minder is solid, and we know our existing users like it, a lot.

The most common piece of feedback we've received over the last few weeks has been "I would definitely pay something to keep GAME.minder alive".

However, it is important that we are not just asking for money to keep the service alive. Another few months of life wouldn't mean anything if we didn't use that time to put in place something that could provide for the future of GAME.minder. As we have already tried most of the "traditional" ways to support a free service, it makes the most sense to build GAME.minder into a paid service.

Boring numbers!

GAME.minder currently costs about $300/month to keep running. This is without any ongoing development and doesn't count support costs associated with keeping the system up to date (which can be significant) or paying a salary for anyone here at Handelabra. So the absolute minimum amount of money we could keep GAME.minder alive on is about $3600 a year.

The system currently only brings in about $80-100 per month or just about $1000 per year leaving us with a deficit of $2600. 

If just 1 out of 10 of our current registered users buys a subscription at $15/year, that would give us $42,000 a year of subscription revenue. This would allow us to not only keep GAME.minder running, but also keep all the data in the system up to date, as well as fund some ongoing development and features.

If half our users buy a subscription, we're looking at $210,000/year which would put us in a really good position to continue building out new features.

And just in case you are curious, the average GAME.minder user is tracking at least 14 games. This means there's a lot of potential subscribers already using the system.

 

It's up to you now

We believe this is the best path forward for GAME.minder. If you like GAME.minder and would like to see it stick around, now is the time to act. Thank you and as we say over here in the GAME.minder world -

Don't Forget To Play!

story:
>> Download the DEMO! <<

In Verbis Virtus is a first person video game that mixes action and puzzle elements in a fantasy setting.

You play as a wizard who can cast spells pronouncing magic formulas. The innovation of this game resides in the control system: the player must use a microphone to perform spells by actually saying the magic words. In fact the title could be translated from Latin as "Power is in Words".

In Verbis Virtus begins with you entering a dark dungeon that hides many dangers. Unarmed, you can only overcome the obstacles learning the secrets of the arcane arts through ancient texts you discover along the path. These writings teach magic formulas which, if pronounced correctly, enable you to perform several spells. Using these powers in a creative way you can solve puzzles, overcome traps and kill the enemies which try to hinder you.


Main Features

  • Invoke the ancient magic with your own voice
  • Use your spells to solve tricky puzzles
  • Deal with wicked monsters using your arcane powers
  • Uncover the story of a mysterious main character
  • Explore the depths of the dangerous Temple


Our team is called Indomitus Games. We are a group of young Italian artists and programmers who have joined forces to develop an innovative gaming product: In Verbis Virtus.

It all began from a university project at the Politecnico di Milano. At the beginning, our group was composed just by few programmers. However, the concept of In Verbis Virtus immediately attracted a lot of interest, so the team quickly grew with graphics and audio specialists that could take care of the artistic aspects of the game. The team now includes:



Here at Indomitus Games we love making games, but creating something like In Verbis Virtus is not that simple. Until today we have put a lot of time and energy and money into this project and we are very proud of what we have achieved so far. We have already published a very early alpha stage playable demo. Since then, we have created much more content of which we showed only a tiny part, and we gathered a quite large community. Yes, we are talking about you, our fans. You are our most valuable asset and now we need your help to complete this ambitious project and bring the world of In Verbis Virtus on your computers.

What is the money for?

Fair question. Basically we need the money for the same things as any other company does: rent, bills, software licenses, personnel, etc... You’re probably wondering whether we need all these money to finish In Verbis Virtus. Believe it or not, it’s not a large sum at all for a video game, and the only reason it’s even cheap is because our staff have voluntereed in the past two years and are willing to work for the bare minimum to try and increase the odds of meeting our goal.

Here is a cost breakdown:

  • $30,000: operating costs (bills, rent, water, pizza) for 8 people for 5 months
  • $5,500: external contractors
  • $4,000: software licenses
  • $2,500: UDK royalties for the crowfunding campaign
  • $2,500: Voice recording and localization
  • $4,500: IndieGoGo and payment processing fees
  • $16,000: Manufacturing and shipping physical rewards

Are you asking to cover all the expenses?

No, not at all. The goal amount we are asking for is about 50% of what the production of In Verbis Virtus actually costs. Until now everyone at Indomitus Games worked for the glory but we can't continue without your support. To complete In Verbis Virtus we need to be able to concentrate only on this project for some months. We will also need to hire qualified professionals to do the work that no one in the team can do (translations, dubbing, etc...). Furthermore commercial licenses of some software are very expensive.

Through crowdfunding you will be able to help us dealing with the difficulties of indie game development. Anyway, you won't do this for nothing in return: we prepared tons of really nice rewards for you!

Moreover, as we approach our goal, we can dedicate our time to In Verbis Virtus with more confidence. This means that the sooner we receive your help, the sooner we can deliver the new demo and work toward the final version. So if you intend to contribute, please do so at your earliest possible convenience!


Our main goal is to make In Verbis Virtus a great game but why not making it even greater? And what could make a game better than creating it as the players would like it to be?

We listened to the requests of our fans for additional features and we chose stretch goals accordingly. Every dollar we gather with this campaign will be used to enhance In Verbis Virtus, but some features will be added after the game release to avoid delaying it. We know you can't wait playing In Verbis Virtus!

Oculus Rift is a virtual reality headset designed to make 3D gaming even more immersive. Since it was first announced our fans asked us to support this amazing technology and we would really like to do so! In Verbis Virtus would become a very innovative experience with Oculus Rift.

Today smartphones and tablets are widespread, especially among tech enthusiasts such as our supporters, so we decided to use them to enhance the gaming experience. We would like to develop an app that lets you use mobile devices as your spellbook and journal. Further features will be discussed later.

Leap Motion is an innovative device that enables you to control your computer moving your hands and fingers. Wouldn't it be awesome to cast spells with magic gestures in addition (or alternatively) to magic words?

And then there is something that really a lot of people asked: multiplayer. Nowadays a large number of games allow to play over LAN or on the Internet to take fun to another level. We hope that In Verbis Virtus will be no less than these games, but a multiplayer mode needs infrastructures, additional maps and more. That's why we need further help to reach this objective.

"A Fantasy Game Where Your Actual Voice is Your Only Friend"
Kotaku.com

"If you want to cast a spell, you're going to have to actually say the words"
IndieGames.com

"Cool, I can use the force"
RequiemsVoid - Youtube

"I was surprised as anyone when I said "Let There Be Light" and a glow lit up the surrounding area"
Rockpapershotgun.com

"Indomitus Games has launched a crowd-funding campaign on Indiegogo to support In Verbis Virtus in its final development phases"
GamersHell.com





Perk add-ons and first Archmage award!

For those who want to customize their rewards beyond the normal perks we offer the possibility to select one or more of the following add-ons:

An extra digital download copy of In Verbis Virtus: +14$ (requires Wizard perk or higher)
Winged Glory ultra-detailed model: + 40$  (requires Invoker perk or higher)
In Verbis Virtus silver ring: +100$ (requires Invoker perk or higher)
In Verbis Virtus silve pendant: +200$ (requires Invoker perk or higher)

To get your add-on simply select the base perk of your choice and increase the donation according to the add-ons that you would like to get. Then contact us to let us know what are the add-ons you selected.

You already contributed? Don’t worry, you can increase your donation as explained in the FAQs.

That’s not all of course! The first backer to select the Archmage perk will get an extra copy of In Verbis Virtus and an extra T-shirt too! (As for all the other rewards you will get this only if the campaign is successful).

Who wants to live forever?

We are pleased to announce that we decided to run a Referral Contest!

Your face carved in stone, eternally gazing at the dark mazes of In Verbis Virtus.
To gain this you only need to be the best promoter of our Indiegogo campaign, in this way you will get the Immortal perk that, along with all the other rewards (game, soundtrack, poster, booklet, t-shirt, statuette, beta participation, ring and pendant), will allow you to be immortalized as a 3D sculpture, expressly designed by our artists and that will be used in the game.

How to participate?

1) Log in to Indiegogo
2) Go to the In Verbis Virtus project page
3) Share it the way that you like the most (you can do this more than once with different methods)

That’s it!

At this point anyone who will contribute after getting to our project page through your link will increase your score in the Referrals ranking.

At the end of the campaign, if our goal is reached, the first place wins the Immortal perk (in addition to any perk he may have get through contributions)!
 
What else can we say? Share and may the best supporter win!


Will I get my copy of In Verbis Virtus through Steam?

Yes you will! But we will most likely publish the game through other stores too, in this case you will be able to choose the one you prefer.

Can I already play In Verbis Virtus?

Yes! You can download the demo here. It was published more than a year ago and it was mostly a "proof of concept", it doesn't show what the final game will be.

On which platforms will In Verbis Virtus be available?

At the moment only a PC and a MAC versions are planned but we do not exclude future conversions on other platforms.

It seems that In Verbis Virtus does not work correctly on my PC, what should I do?

Before all be sure that your PC meets the hardware and software requirements, in case it does send a mail to info@indomitusgames.com describing your problem with as many details as possible and attaching the "My Documents\My Games\In Verbis Virtus\Vreco.log" and "My Documents\My Games\In Verbis Virtus\UDKGame\Logs\Launch.log" files.

Which languages will be available in the game?

You will be able to choose which language to use for spells. We will certainly include a fictional language and English, plus languages created by backers (see Perks and Rewards). The rest of the game will certainly be in English and almost certainly in Italian. Anyway we hope to be able to support more languages.

How can I help In Verbis Virtus developers?

Besides donating to this campaign you can follow us on Facebook, Twitter or Google+ and tell us your opinion about the news that we publish, this will help us to make the game better.

Will you publish another demo?

Yes, in the next months we will publish another demo with new spells and puzzles, and you'll finally be able to use magic to fight terrible monsters. In the new demo also the voice recognition will be improved and you will have the chance to cast your spells using a custom fantasy language.

Which technologies have been used to develop In Verbis Virtus?

In Verbis Virtus is built with Unreal Engine, on which many renowned games such as Mass Effect and Bioshock are based. The speech recognition software is built upon the open source libraries.

Do I need an expensive microphone?

No, any cheap microphone can do it.

What if I have troubles with the speech recognition?

The game will include an option to 'train' the recognizer to your voice. However, most people will be perfectly fine with the default recognition profile, without any need for training.

Won't it just end up being a brainless screaming game?

Not at all. Puzzles force to experiment with the spells to figure out a solution, while combats require to use multiple spells in the right way to deal with monsters effectively.

How do I upgrade my perk?

If you have already made your contribution and would like to adjust your perk, please contact us. If your preferred perk requires a higher contribution, donate the difference and write to us telling us what is the perk you would like to get. If you have already made your contribution and simply wish to increase your contribution or select an additional perk, you can do this in a separate contribution.

Do I get two copies of In Verbis Virtus with the Sorcerer or any higher perk?

No, you don't. The only difference between Wizard and Sorcerer perk is that Wizard has a lower price and a limited quantity. The same applies to the Spell Singer and Spell Chanter perks. If you want one or more additional copies for your friends you can use the add-on as explained at the of the Perks and Rewards Section.

We know you can't wait playing In Verbis Virtus!

Today smartphones and tablets are widespread, especially among tech enthusiasts such as our supporters, so we decided to use them to enhance the gaming experience. We would like to develop an app that lets you use mobile devices as your spellbook and journal. Further features will be discussed later.
Leap Motion is an innovative device that enables you to control your computer moving your hands and fingers. Wouldn't it be awesome to cast spells with magic gestures in addition (or alternatively) to magic words?
And then there is something that really a lot of people asked: multiplayer. Nowadays a large number of games allow to play over LAN or on the Internet to take fun to another level. We hope that In Verbis Virtus will be no less than these games, but a multiplayer mode needs infrastructures, additional maps and more. That's why we need further help to reach this objective.
"A Fantasy Game Where Your Actual Voice is Your Only Friend"Kotaku.com"If you want to cast a spell, you're going to have to actually say the words"IndieGames.com"Cool, I can use the force"RequiemsVoid - Youtube"I was surprised as anyone when I said "Let There Be Light" and a glow lit up the surrounding area"Rockpapershotgun.com"Indomitus Games has launched a crowd-funding campaign on Indiegogo to support In Verbis Virtus in its final development phases"GamersHell.com

















Perk add-ons and first Archmage award!
For those who want to customize their rewards beyond the normal perks we offer the possibility to select one or more of the following add-ons:

An extra digital download copy of In Verbis Virtus: +14$ (requires Wizard perk or higher)Winged Glory ultra-detailed model: + 40$  (requires Invoker perk or higher)In Verbis Virtus silver ring: +100$ (requires Invoker perk or higher)In Verbis Virtus silve pendant: +200$ (requires Invoker perk or higher)To get your add-on simply select the base perk of your choice and increase the donation according to the add-ons that you would like to get. Then contact us to let us know what are the add-ons you selected.You already contributed? Don’t worry, you can increase your donation as explained in the FAQs.That’s not all of course! The first backer to select the Archmage perk will get an extra copy of In Verbis Virtus and an extra T-shirt too! (As for all the other rewards you will get this only if the campaign is successful).Who wants to live forever?
We are pleased to announce that we decided to run a Referral Contest!Your face carved in stone, eternally gazing at the dark mazes of In Verbis Virtus.To gain this you only need to be the best promoter of our Indiegogo campaign, in this way you will get the Immortal perk that, along with all the other rewards (game, soundtrack, poster, booklet, t-shirt, statuette, beta participation, ring and pendant), will allow you to be immortalized as a 3D sculpture, expressly designed by our artists and that will be used in the game.

How to participate?1) Log in to Indiegogo2) Go to the In Verbis Virtus project page3) Share it the way that you like the most (you can do this more than once with different methods)
That’s it!At this point anyone who will contribute after getting to our project page through your link will increase your score in the Referrals ranking.
At the end of the campaign, if our goal is reached, the first place wins the Immortal perk (in addition to any perk he may have get through contributions)! What else can we say? Share and may the best supporter win!
Will I get my copy of In Verbis Virtus through Steam?
Yes you will! But we will most likely publish the game through other stores too, in this case you will be able to choose the one you prefer.
Can I already play In Verbis Virtus?
Yes! You can download the demo here. It was published more than a year ago and it was mostly a "proof of concept", it doesn't show what the final game will be.
On which platforms will In Verbis Virtus be available?At the moment only a PC and a MAC versions are planned but we do not exclude future conversions on other platforms.It seems that In Verbis Virtus does not work correctly on my PC, what should I do?Before all be sure that your PC meets the hardware and software requirements, in case it does send a mail to info@indomitusgames.com describing your problem with as many details as possible and attaching the "My Documents\My Games\In Verbis Virtus\Vreco.log" and "My Documents\My Games\In Verbis Virtus\UDKGame\Logs\Launch.log" files.Which languages will be available in the game?You will be able to choose which language to use for spells. We will certainly include a fictional language and English, plus languages created by backers (see Perks and Rewards). The rest of the game will certainly be in English and almost certainly in Italian. Anyway we hope to be able to support more languages.How can I help In Verbis Virtus developers?Besides donating to this campaign you can follow us on Facebook, Twitter or Google+ and tell us your opinion about the news that we publish, this will help us to make the game better.Will you publish another demo?Yes, in the next months we will publish another demo with new spells and puzzles, and you'll finally be able to use magic to fight terrible monsters. In the new demo also the voice recognition will be improved and you will have the chance to cast your spells using a custom fantasy language.Which technologies have been used to develop In Verbis Virtus?In Verbis Virtus is built with Unreal Engine, on which many renowned games such as Mass Effect and Bioshock are based. The speech recognition software is built upon the open source libraries.
Do I need an expensive microphone?No, any cheap microphone can do it.What if I have troubles with the speech recognition?The game will include an option to 'train' the recognizer to your voice. However, most people will be perfectly fine with the default recognition profile, without any need for training.Won't it just end up being a brainless screaming game?Not at all. Puzzles force to experiment with the spells to figure out a solution, while combats require to use multiple spells in the right way to deal with monsters effectively.
How do I upgrade my perk?
If you have already made your contribution and would like to adjust your perk, please contact us. If your preferred perk requires a higher contribution, donate the difference and write to us telling us what is the perk you would like to get. If you have already made your contribution and simply wish to increase your contribution or select an additional perk, you can do this in a separate contribution.
Do I get two copies of In Verbis Virtus with the Sorcerer or any higher perk?
No, you don't. The only difference between Wizard and Sorcerer perk is that Wizard has a lower price and a limited quantity. The same applies to the Spell Singer and Spell Chanter perks. If you want one or more additional copies for your friends you can use the add-on as explained at the of the Perks and Rewards Section.

story:
Short Summary

Collectible LEGO Minifigures are a huge success and I am amazed by their detail design. Some of you may already know my Unofficial LEGO Minifigure Catalog or the associated App.

Today I want to ask for your support for a new project: The Unofficial LEGO Minifigure Quartet card game. Quartets are games similar to Super Trumps or Go Fish. I believe that this LEGO Minifigure Quartet game will be great fun to play and to collect. Each deck will consist of 32 cards, grouped into eight sets of four cards. Each set will have a theme such as:

  • Suit Guys
  • Robots
  • Musicians

What We Need & What You Get

Printing card games can only be done with traditional printing methods. The smallest feasible run will be 500 decks. I need your support to help me with the initial investment.

In return I offer supporters a copy of the card game prior to its initial release and also personalized versions.

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be great if you could spread the word about this campaign. Post it on Facebook, email your friends or send a message to your favorite LEGO mailing list.

story:
SHRINKed shall be available on third trimester of 2020 for Windows, Mac and Linux (and may be available on consoles and tablets, according to the stretch goals). 

You'll jump back and forth between two game situations:

  •  "In session": in the office, you play "the shrink" (strategic/narrative gameplay).
  •  "Inception": in the patient's head, you play "Shrinky" (action/exploration gameplay). 

 

You start "in session", as a therapist in his office. In front of you, there's Paul, the patient you take care of. You need to find out why his days are so damn hard. You have no weapons, no super powers, but your ears, brain, and mouth. 

  1. The dialogue. Your main goal is to know more about Paul, about his story and his current issues. Then you may be able to link them together. Listen carefully to your patient, until you have an opportunity to interact.
  2.  The interaction box. During a session, you'll have to choose how to react. Each choice generates its own effect on the dialogue, your empathy level, and Paul's homeostasis.
  3.  Empathy level. It shows how well you understand your patient. The more empathy you have, the more you'll positively impact Paul's homeostasis. Keeping silent often increases empathy, whereas too many interpretations in a row may decrease it.
  4.  Paul's homeostasis. It represents how your patient feels, and is influenced by your interaction choices and empathy level. It's also about strategy and ressource management! However, if Paul feels bad, it doesn't mean that you're wrong. It may even have interesting consequences. Trust your instincts! 

 

  • Provoke: use when you want Paul to interpret something by himself. You have the answer, but you think it won't have any value coming from you. So you give him a clue by questioning or underlining something he just said.
  • Reassure: use when you think there's no need to go down that line or when you think Paul needs a bit of compassion to keep moving on.
  • Interpret: use when you find something valuable you don't want to let go, but you don't think Paul will be able to interpret it by himself. 
  • Keep silent: use when you have nothing interesting to say and feel like Paul is getting to something. Empathy is built on your ability to listen. So know when to keep silent.

Every choice creates a unique path in the dialogue. If you regret a choice you made, you won't be able to go back. Deal with it! 

 

A few examples of how your reactions can influence Paul's homeostasis (though, nothing is 100% predictable): 

  • "Reassure" may increase Paul's wellness.
  • "Keep silent" too much could increase his anguish. 
  • "Interpret" at the right time will boost his trust, whereas many interpretations in a row increase Paul's passivity. 
  • "Provoke" unnecessarily generates hostility, but produces reflexivity when used at the right time.

When you complete one of the Homeostasis gauge, a breach opens. 

 

You can fill any feeling gauge to open a breach, but the one you choose will influence where Shrinky will land on inception mode. Positive feelings are on the left, negative ones are on the right.

If you choose to go in, you'll raid Paul's psyche. Homeostasis gauge levels will be translated as scores for Shrinky, determining his life points, time spent in Paul's psyche, and the enemies' level.

 

Ok, you just opened a breach and chose to go in. You're taken to another dimension of the game: inception mode. You are now in Paul's head, and play Shrinky, the representation he has of you. 

You are in an exploratory mission. You have to collect some information that could not be delivered by Paul in session. These psychic data can be unconscious, or protected by some strong defense devices (like bosses or enigmas): Paul can't talk about them yet, so you have to access them this way. That will make him free to talk about that specific topic afterwards. 

You will come across people, memories, weird objects, frozen emotions, phobias, fantasies, etc. All possible mental items populating people's psyches. Each area matches one of Paul's specific mental trait. When visiting them again, you may notice that they change, according to what you found out in session.

 

The playable ground is very wide. It contains different areas separated by enigmas, keys, secret passages, and bosses. Your investigation "in session" may unlock some of these accesses, while your exploration in "inception" mode may influence Paul's reactions during the sessions. 

So what's the goal?

Your goal, as a shrink, is to end the therapy and let Paul stand on his own two feet. To understand Paul's story, you will have to investigate, both in sessions and during inceptions. Each part of the game will feed the other one. 

But you'll do it your way. 

 

Music is an essential part of the project. As a therapist but as a patient too, I've always associated a feeling to a specific piece of music. The introspective process is linked, in part, to the ability to interpret and transform something that we start by just feeling: it's about creativity. Well, this is precisely what I try to do with the OST of the game: transforming, my way, an object that initially touched me. 

Check out the first tracks I'm working on:

                                                                                   

 

I'm Pierre Oudet, a 31 years old shrink from Paris. I've been practicing as a therapist for 8 years (private office, hospital, schools), but as a patient too! I've been on both sides of the chair. I'm a musician (guitar and DAW) and a synth wave and classical music lover. On a side note, I love video games since I'm a child. All of them!

For all these reasons, I decided one year ago to listen to this sweet and powerful voice telling me to take the plunge. I learned code, digital drawing and game design until it became a thing. 

Why do I need to raise funds?

Reality principle, as Freud would say. I decided to stop working as a shrink to focus on this project. The collected money will allow me to keep working on it a 100%. If this campaign works well, I will also be able to surround myself with the right people for game development, and add some of the following features.

  • Characters museum is a place where you'll be able to know more about each character you've met in the game.
  • "Interactive psycho wiki" is a didactic tool that will contain some theoretical considerations related to what you discover during your adventure. Each collected item will unlock one psychology concept. 
  • "The supervision": a bonus game mode where you'll play the shrink's shrink!
  • "The couple therapy": a bonus game mode featuring two patients: Paul and his wife! Try to save their couple...or not!
