story:
Meet Athena - The World's Most Immersive Gun Controller

Athena immerses you in the game with its realistic features. You'll aim and pull the trigger to shoot, not just flick a mouse. You'll use the magazine and slide to reload your gun, not just press 'R'. It's wireless too -- as you'd expect any good gun to be.

 

Lighthouse Tracking for Seamless Integration Into Your SteamVR Games

Athena integrates SteamVR, or Lighthouse, tracking. Think of Athena like a Vive controller – with more features. Your games will recognize Athena as a controller and you'll be able to jump right in to the action.

 

Lose Yourself in the Game

Athena is a fully tracked SteamVR compatible controller. This means it will work with your HTC Vive headset, as well as any other headset that runs on the SteamVR platform.

The controller you see being played with in our video and many of our images is our developer kit, The Persuader. We developed The Persuader to perfect our hardware and to put our controller in the hands of game developers as soon as possible, but Athena is a gamer-ready controller with a new look and some exciting new features.

  Athena provides the exact same inputs as the Persuader, with a revamped and more powerful recoil. But the major game-changing (literally) feature is that Athena has integrated SteamVR tracking, which provides a hassle-free user experience (no more mounting your Vive controller!) and seamless integration into SteamVR games.

 

Built With Gamers in Mind

Athena is the result of over two years of hardware prototyping and working with game developers and gamers around the world. We at Ilium VR have taken everything we’ve learned from our previous controllers and put it into what we think is the most immersive gun controller for virtual reality.


 

 

Easy Integrations Into Games

Because Athena provides more inputs than a standard Vive controller, taking advantage of the full features may require the developer of the game to make slight modifications to utilize this added functionality – such as utilizing the magazine and slide for realistic reloading or using the additional buttons for addition inputs within the game.

Our partnered studios, Vertigo Games and Invrse Studios, are bringing you fully featured support for Athena to Arizona Sunshine and The Nest. In addition to these partners, we will maintain a list on our website of all games which take advantage of the full features of Athena.

If you are a developer interested in adding our features to your game, please contact us! We'll hook you up with everything you need. It's easy, we promise!

 

Bundled Games

We want you to get the best experience possible, right away, so we're partnering with two excellent games! At the base tier you will be able to select one of these games which will be included with your controller. If you're really crazy about both and can't decide -- don't worry! There's also a perk that includes both games.

Arizona Sunshine

Step in the midst of a zombie apocalypse as if you were really there, freely move around and explore a post-apocalyptic world, and handle motion-controlled weapons with real-life movements - putting the undead back to rest is more thrilling and satisfying than ever before.

Arizona Sunshine is developed by Vertigo Games.

The Nest

The Nest is a thrilling first-person shooter made custom for motion-controlled VR. Duck, dodge and use cover to avoid incoming projectiles, and gain mastery over the adjustable-zoom sniper scope to dominate your enemies.

The Nest is developed by Invrse Studios.

How its Made

Athena is made from quality materials -- Strong ABS plastic, with a metal recoil system. The weight will be lighter than a real rifle, no more than five pounds, but with a balanced feel to play for hours without wearing your arms out too much. Athena is compatible with the Vive and any other Lighthouse/SteamVR tracking products -- Ilium VR is part of the SteamVR licensing program to officially bring this technology to our platform. The controller is completely wireless -- charges in about 45 minutes and will last for 10-15 hours of active gameplay.

Where Are My Funds Going?

Good question! Short answer: Manufacturing costs.

Over the last two years, we've gone through many iterations of this product  -- doing all development and assembly in-house. With our developer program units, this worked great -- providing us the flexibility of going back and forth with developers to hone our design.

But if we are going to produce Athena at scale, we can’t do it alone. We're hardware and software developers -- not large scale manufacturers. To get us over the hurdle of mass production, we’ve enlisted the help of manufacturers to produce Athena at quantity. This allows us to focus our efforts doing what we’re really good at— making your VR experience so real you forget you’re in a game.

This is where you come in! We chose crowdfunding because since our inception, Ilium VR has been fueled by the VR community. It’s always been about working with one another to create the most immersive peripherals possible. That’s why we’re turning to you.

In order to get production rolling, we need a large number of orders upfront to offset the costs involved for all parties (you included!). Having enough of you come together to show us you want this enables us to manufacture Athena at scale and deliver them to you as quickly as possible at the highest quality.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Other than your financial support, you can help bring Athena to life by sharing this campaign with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, by email, carrier pigeon, signal flare, cult meeting, or however else you communicate with your social circle! You can also help us by liking our pages on social media to help get the product in front of as many people as possible to keep the momentum going!

 

We've Been Doing This for a While -- and We Love It!

 

Ilium VR was founded in 2014 by Sebastian Sarbora, Jazmine Olinger, and Robert Rouhani. At the time we were three university students attending Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. We made the very first version of this controller at a hackathon hosted at Rutgers University. From there we realized that people wanted immersive controllers for VR and so we set out to make that vision a reality!

Founders



Sebastian Sarbora - CEO
Sebastian has spent years developing a variety of hardware products, from robotics to home automation. These days he spends most of his free time tinkering with interesting VR projects and Model Rockets.

 


Jazmine Olinger - COO
Jazmine is a recovered World of Warcraft addict with years of experience in software development and computational mathematics. She spends her work time wearing many hats at Ilium VR and her free time playing Overwatch and mindlessly refreshing the front page of Reddit.

 

 

Robert Rouhani - CTO
Robert works with game developers to build the best experiences possible with our controllers. He focuses on the software used to quickly and easily integrate our controllers with existing VR experiences. He's been interested in VR ever since he backed Oculus on Kickstarter.


 

We Could Not Have Done It Without You!

We want to extend our deepest thanks to the VR community, to all the gamer and game developers who have worked with us to perfect our product, to YCombinator whose guidance and enthusiasm helped us launch our first private beta product during the Fellowship program, to the entrepreneurial community of Upstate New York whose energy and drive to support fellow entrepreneurs helped and inspired us, to the city of Troy which has been our steady home base, to every talented person who has joined our team, and to our friends who gave us their support and best efforts at every step of the way!

Most importantly, a huge thanks is in order to you. We could not have done this without you and we appreciate your support and your feedback. If you have any questions about our company or the product or any of the perks of the campaign, please ask us! 

Frequently Asked Questions

What equipment do I need to use Athena?

Athena will require an HTC Vive headset and a computer capable of running the Vive!

What games can I play?

​We provide two demo experiences for Athena for free -- a rooftop defense game and a desert zombie shooter. We are also bundling with Arizona Sunshine and The Nest in this campaign so you will receive a copy of one, or both, of those games, depending on which perk you choose. Beyond that, because the of the SteamVR integration you will be able to use Athena with any shooter game that works on the HTC Vive. However for fully featured support to accomodate the additional inputs Athena provides compared to the standard Vive controller, the developers of the games will have to make minor changes.

I chose the Arizona Sunshine/The Nest perk. When will I have access to the game?

You will receive your copy of Arizona Sunshine/The Nest very shortly after the campaign is successfully funded. No later than February 1st, 2017!

Why is it called Athena?

Athena is the Greek goddess of wisdom, craft, and war. Who better to lead you into battle with your virtual enemies?

Will you support the Oculus/PSVR/OSVR/some other VR platform?

Currently Athena will only support the HTC Vive or any other headset that is made on the SteamVR platform. However we are pursuing options for Oculus, PSVR and others and fully intend to support these platforms in the future.

Is it ambidextrous? ​

Yes Athena is fully ambidextrous! All of the founders of Ilium VR are left handed so we feel very deeply for all our left handed friends living in a right handed world. No more!

Can I play with my friends? ​

Assuming you and your friends have a multiplayer game and have two or more Athena controllers, of course! One of our partnered games, The Nest, has a multiplayer mode! We've tried it, it's awesome.
story_txt:
Meet Athena - The World's Most Immersive Gun Controller
Athena immerses you in the game with its realistic features. You'll aim and pull the trigger to shoot, not just flick a mouse. You'll use the magazine and slide to reload your gun, not just press 'R'. It's wireless too -- as you'd expect any good gun to be. Lighthouse Tracking for Seamless Integration Into Your SteamVR GamesAthena integrates SteamVR, or Lighthouse, tracking. Think of Athena like a Vive controller – with more features. Your games will recognize Athena as a controller and you'll be able to jump right in to the action. Lose Yourself in the GameAthena is a fully tracked SteamVR compatible controller. This means it will work with your HTC Vive headset, as well as any other headset that runs on the SteamVR platform.The controller you see being played with in our video and many of our images is our developer kit, The Persuader. We developed The Persuader to perfect our hardware and to put our controller in the hands of game developers as soon as possible, but Athena is a gamer-ready controller with a new look and some exciting new features.  Athena provides the exact same inputs as the Persuader, with a revamped and more powerful recoil. But the major game-changing (literally) feature is that Athena has integrated SteamVR tracking, which provides a hassle-free user experience (no more mounting your Vive controller!) and seamless integration into SteamVR games. Built With Gamers in MindAthena is the result of over two years of hardware prototyping and working with game developers and gamers around the world. We at Ilium VR have taken everything we’ve learned from our previous controllers and put it into what we think is the most immersive gun controller for virtual reality.  Easy Integrations Into GamesBecause Athena provides more inputs than a standard Vive controller, taking advantage of the full features may require the developer of the game to make slight modifications to utilize this added functionality – such as utilizing the magazine and slide for realistic reloading or using the additional buttons for addition inputs within the game.Our partnered studios, Vertigo Games and Invrse Studios, are bringing you fully featured support for Athena to Arizona Sunshine and The Nest. In addition to these partners, we will maintain a list on our website of all games which take advantage of the full features of Athena.If you are a developer interested in adding our features to your game, please contact us! We'll hook you up with everything you need. It's easy, we promise! Bundled GamesWe want you to get the best experience possible, right away, so we're partnering with two excellent games! At the base tier you will be able to select one of these games which will be included with your controller. If you're really crazy about both and can't decide -- don't worry! There's also a perk that includes both games.Arizona SunshineStep in the midst of a zombie apocalypse as if you were really there, freely move around and explore a post-apocalyptic world, and handle motion-controlled weapons with real-life movements - putting the undead back to rest is more thrilling and satisfying than ever before.Arizona Sunshine is developed by Vertigo Games.The NestThe Nest is a thrilling first-person shooter made custom for motion-controlled VR. Duck, dodge and use cover to avoid incoming projectiles, and gain mastery over the adjustable-zoom sniper scope to dominate your enemies.The Nest is developed by Invrse Studios.How its MadeAthena is made from quality materials -- Strong ABS plastic, with a metal recoil system. The weight will be lighter than a real rifle, no more than five pounds, but with a balanced feel to play for hours without wearing your arms out too much. Athena is compatible with the Vive and any other Lighthouse/SteamVR tracking products -- Ilium VR is part of the SteamVR licensing program to officially bring this technology to our platform. The controller is completely wireless -- charges in about 45 minutes and will last for 10-15 hours of active gameplay.Where Are My Funds Going?Good question! Short answer: Manufacturing costs.Over the last two years, we've gone through many iterations of this product  -- doing all development and assembly in-house. With our developer program units, this worked great -- providing us the flexibility of going back and forth with developers to hone our design.But if we are going to produce Athena at scale, we can’t do it alone. We're hardware and software developers -- not large scale manufacturers. To get us over the hurdle of mass production, we’ve enlisted the help of manufacturers to produce Athena at quantity. This allows us to focus our efforts doing what we’re really good at— making your VR experience so real you forget you’re in a game.This is where you come in! We chose crowdfunding because since our inception, Ilium VR has been fueled by the VR community. It’s always been about working with one another to create the most immersive peripherals possible. That’s why we’re turning to you.In order to get production rolling, we need a large number of orders upfront to offset the costs involved for all parties (you included!). Having enough of you come together to show us you want this enables us to manufacture Athena at scale and deliver them to you as quickly as possible at the highest quality. Other Ways You Can HelpOther than your financial support, you can help bring Athena to life by sharing this campaign with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, by email, carrier pigeon, signal flare, cult meeting, or however else you communicate with your social circle! You can also help us by liking our pages on social media to help get the product in front of as many people as possible to keep the momentum going! We've Been Doing This for a While -- and We Love It! Ilium VR was founded in 2014 by Sebastian Sarbora, Jazmine Olinger, and Robert Rouhani. At the time we were three university students attending Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. We made the very first version of this controller at a hackathon hosted at Rutgers University. From there we realized that people wanted immersive controllers for VR and so we set out to make that vision a reality!FoundersSebastian Sarbora - CEO Sebastian has spent years developing a variety of hardware products, from robotics to home automation. These days he spends most of his free time tinkering with interesting VR projects and Model Rockets. Jazmine Olinger - COO Jazmine is a recovered World of Warcraft addict with years of experience in software development and computational mathematics. She spends her work time wearing many hats at Ilium VR and her free time playing Overwatch and mindlessly refreshing the front page of Reddit.  Robert Rouhani - CTO Robert works with game developers to build the best experiences possible with our controllers. He focuses on the software used to quickly and easily integrate our controllers with existing VR experiences. He's been interested in VR ever since he backed Oculus on Kickstarter. We Could Not Have Done It Without You!We want to extend our deepest thanks to the VR community, to all the gamer and game developers who have worked with us to perfect our product, to YCombinator whose guidance and enthusiasm helped us launch our first private beta product during the Fellowship program, to the entrepreneurial community of Upstate New York whose energy and drive to support fellow entrepreneurs helped and inspired us, to the city of Troy which has been our steady home base, to every talented person who has joined our team, and to our friends who gave us their support and best efforts at every step of the way!Most importantly, a huge thanks is in order to you. We could not have done this without you and we appreciate your support and your feedback. If you have any questions about our company or the product or any of the perks of the campaign, please ask us! Frequently Asked QuestionsWhat equipment do I need to use Athena?Athena will require an HTC Vive headset and a computer capable of running the Vive!What games can I play?​We provide two demo experiences for Athena for free -- a rooftop defense game and a desert zombie shooter. We are also bundling with Arizona Sunshine and The Nest in this campaign so you will receive a copy of one, or both, of those games, depending on which perk you choose. Beyond that, because the of the SteamVR integration you will be able to use Athena with any shooter game that works on the HTC Vive. However for fully featured support to accomodate the additional inputs Athena provides compared to the standard Vive controller, the developers of the games will have to make minor changes.I chose the Arizona Sunshine/The Nest perk. When will I have access to the game?You will receive your copy of Arizona Sunshine/The Nest very shortly after the campaign is successfully funded. No later than February 1st, 2017!Why is it called Athena? Athena is the Greek goddess of wisdom, craft, and war. Who better to lead you into battle with your virtual enemies?Will you support the Oculus/PSVR/OSVR/some other VR platform?Currently Athena will only support the HTC Vive or any other headset that is made on the SteamVR platform. However we are pursuing options for Oculus, PSVR and others and fully intend to support these platforms in the future.Is it ambidextrous? ​Yes Athena is fully ambidextrous! All of the founders of Ilium VR are left handed so we feel very deeply for all our left handed friends living in a right handed world. No more!Can I play with my friends? ​Assuming you and your friends have a multiplayer game and have two or more Athena controllers, of course! One of our partnered games, The Nest, has a multiplayer mode! We've tried it, it's awesome.

story:
We design cards for use in Pen & Paper Roleplaying games.

Our aim is to improve immersion, simplify bookkeeping and spark creativity for players of various systems and universes. The idea is using customized cards to manage characters‘ assets. Each set will include 120 full colored cards intended to cover the needs of adventurers of all kinds.

The shipped cards will not have text on them. this is our imagination of your beautiful handwriting. You could also print stickers we provide (see below).

The cards help to visualize your characters without leaving "low-tech" Pen & Paper territory. For example, if your character stumbles and something falls out of his backpack and down a cliff, the Game Master can have you draw a card at random and discard it. No long discussion but fast, clearly visible results.

We are convinced using cards to handle a party's "assets" speeds up the game, gives your a clear overview of what you have (or in the case of the game master, what your players have), gain or lose in a certain situation. Using physical cards helps visualizing not just your stuff, but what happens with it.

There are no names or descriptions on our cards. It is up to you to add those. What we did is designing a category system which is represented on cards by dividing them into four colors as well as ~25 colored illustrations. For example, there is a category for sword-like weapons, but no defined longsword card. 

If we succeed with our Indiegogo campaign, we will produce sets of 120 Medieval / Fantasy-themed cards. Dungeons & Dragons or your Own Universe, World of Darkness or Unknown Armies, Numenera to Game of Thrones, the cards will suit your needs. If we reach certain stretch goals, Modern Day / Horror as well as Future / Cyberpunk sets might be added as well.


The cards feature graphics but no text - to allow for endless flexibility. The white space can be used to note the specific name of the item (or entity) so both players and game masters can adapt and always have the card ready for a given situation.

Generalized, yet characteristic and unique illustrations and coloring help keep track of what your characters use and carry around. All cards are layouted to allow for adding stickers (see the Knight perk and above) or plain writing - for example to note condition, origin, customization and amounts.

We have put a lot of time into researching what kind of categories and illustrations are required. We decided to have four main categories (colors red - combat, blue - clothing and containers, green - consumables and yellow - general) and 25 subcategories (illustrations). 

You can find a lot more pictures and information on our website www.itemcards.com!

Why do we need crowdfunding? While the idea for our project has been developed for our own roleplaying group, we soon realized the cards would be so much more awesome if they were printed professionally - doing that with highest quality is expensive, though - offset printing requires at least hundreds of copies of the set (more than 100 000 cards total!) to make sense.

Thus we had the idea to make the cards available for everyone and to use Indiegogo to gather the funds. We need Your help to make Tabula Rasa available for everyone! But of course we want you thank you for your support, so we developed a set of rewards (ones you can actually use!) you get for backing us. Of course, this includes the cards themselves.

We have also set a few Stretch Goals in case we exceed or funding and if You are backing us and we exceed even those numbers, we will add more:


  • 8 000 € - Card sleeves! Every package will include transparent sleeves to make your cards even more resistant to mead, pizza and other gaming table hazards
  • 10 000 € - 10 000 € - Modern day / horror cards!

The projects initiators, Anton Katzer and Wiebke Scholz are based in Berlin, Germany, and first of all, passionate gamers. We have a background in game design and art as well as in print and web publishing.

We would also like to thank all the members of our roleplaying groups who helped us with ideas, criticism, motivation and playtesting as well as spreading the word and creating our pitch video. Without you this would not have been possible!

All perks include free shipping worldwide! One set of cards is usually enough for a small group of players, so for a group of more than 4, we recommend getting at least 2 sets (238 item cards) - this of course depends on your group. Some people want to go into detail more than others.

The following perks include a tracking number for your package. If you need one for the perks above you can get one for 2 € extra. Just mention it when you pledge.

If you back our project of not, we are glad you spared some time reading up on this project. We would be even more grateful if you helped spreading the word, ask your friends to back us or simply like and link our website, facebook or this page.

  • itemcards.com
  • facebook.com/tabularasacards

Please note the following details:

Get in Contact with Online Support Staff or Tournament Moderator(s) via mail in case of any issues of Match Timing and Score reporting. 

Check-IN is an essential part of participation and is compulsory for every participant.

No Rescheduling is Allowed in this Tournament.

Report the score with valid screenshots to claim your win.

Wait for your first match to show up. Regularly Check Brackets for Time Slots.

story:
UPDATE 15/04/2012

4 more days. We realize that there's a lot of chance that we won't reach our $2000 goal. Comparing to most campaign on indiegogo, this is a "do or die" campaign. That means we won't get anything if we don't reach our goal.

We'll re-evaluate our option for the development on iOS (iphone / ipad) and Windows phone. We can already assure you that they'll be less content on the free version comparing to what we offer on Android.

For those who already contribute and will contribute in the next 4 days, for whatever donation you will give us, we'll give you the full version of our game on Android, iOS and Windows phone to thank you for supporting this project.

Finally,  Gravity Bound has reach 2000 downloads yesterday! Thank everyone for supporting us in this great adventure we started 4 months ago! We would like to thank everyone who helped us in our campaign. We really appreciate.

Who we are

Our story began as three young Montreal video game addicts who had a common dream: to create a renowned video game and software company.  And so… Maitop was born!

Together, in these hard economic times, we wanted to share our passion for gaming by giving it back to the world. Created from this passion was a project named Gravity Bounds. Our goal was to create a great quality video game with the smallest budget possible; mostly using our personal time. In this adventure of ours, we all worked together for more than 1000 hours while keeping our daily jobs to pay development costs and our personal bills.

From all of this hard work came the fruit of our labor, Gravity Bounds. Our first game built and released on the Android platform on December 16, 2011. Our first goal has successfully been completed, but we’ve now hit an economic wall and that’s the reason we are asking for help from the community.

Why we need your help

We are doing this campaign so we can continue to share our passion with more people.  Our goal is to raise enough money allowing us to purchase hardware that will enable us to develop ports to the iOS and Windows Mobile platforms. We’ll use the extra money to develop a new achievements and skins system. It’ll enable you to change the look of every balls, objects and tiles in the game. Achievements will give you some milestones to achieve in order to unlock these skins.

We also want to keep gravity bounds lite with a lot of contents. To give you an idea, Gravity Bounds "lite" on Android has 100 levels out of 120 (the last 20 are in the full version). We would like to be able to offer the same to iPhone and Windows phone user.

What you'll get

We want to express our gratitude for all of your pledge and give something back.  We shall be sending all sorts of goodies out like T-Shirts, coffee mugs, or ‘thank you!’ letters and promotional spots in our free version of the game.

We as gamers are proud to be giving back to our fellow gaming community. We want to provide more challenging games like this in the future for free. If you feel passionate about video games, but just like us your budget is tight, give us some love on Facebook or follow us on Twitter.  Spreading the word contribute as much as if you donated money!

 

About Gravity Bounds

Full version : Gravity Bounds - Full
Free version : Gravity Bounds - Lite

Gravity Bounds is a brain mind retro puzzle game. The goal is to get all of the balls on the screen together to clear them. The catch is, when you move the game stage in a direction, every object goes in that direction.  Advancing leads to many new obstacles that hinder your progression to ultimate victory! If you would like a preview of what Gravity Bounds has in store, take a look at our new promotional video we made at the top of this page.

The game already as been quote as the game of the week in LaPresse of December 31th 2011. We also got a review from François Charron at SalutBonjour on Frebuary 14, 2012.. Finaly, Alex Bisaillon was on Denis Talbot tv show (M.Net) on March 22, 2012.

Note: the last 2 links have been translated with google translate since they were in french :)

Version française ici : http://maitop.ca/?page_id=237
Version française des perks ici : http://maitop.ca/?page_id=244

story:
Hi, my name is Edgar, I am founder of an independent game development studio ZIPSTED.

We started in 2012 and since then we've developed three small mobile games for iOS: SOPOR, Fridge Break, and Tapobang. They still live on App Store, and I made them free while Indiegogo campaign is continuing. Look to them, if you'd like.

In 2016 I decided to create something bigger. At that date I've read a sci-fi novel Prisoners of Power by Arkady and Boris Strugatsky and found the book amazing. A month later I've wrote first few lines of INZIPID code and modeled the first version of the main character. I was pretty familiar with Unity engine, so development has begun fine.

The only obstacle I've met was a time. I'm working on INZIPID almost every day after my full-time job for about a year, and currently developed gameplay lasts a little more than an hour. Meanwhile, I have a plot, which approximately corresponds to 6-8 hours of gameplay. So, we've got a simple proportion here. If I leave things as is, I need 6-8 years to complete INZIPID and release it. The only way out is to work on the game 60 hours per week instead of 10 hours.

In other words, I'm pretty sure I cannot do this without your help.

INZIPID is inspired by sci-fi novel Prisoners of Power, and placed in the world of machines. It is a 2.5D platformer in an atmosphere of desolation and lifelessness.

  • Cinematic plot makes player feel and worry with the main character
  • Tragic and perceptible conflict between two races of robots
  • Dilapidating civilization of artificial intelligence
  • About 150 puzzles and interactive locations
  • About 30 unique characters

Inspiration from Prisoners of Power

Shortly about the novel plot (excerpted from Wikipedia). The hero of the story is a space explorer from Earth. He accidentally discovers a planet inhabited by a humanoid race. The man finds himself in the capital of a totalitarian state, perpetually at war with its neighbors. The population is governed by an anonymous oligarchy with police and military omnipresent. Eventually, it is revealed that to maintain the loyalty of the population, the oligarchy employ mind control broadcasts. The broadcast towers pepper the landscape of the country. Constant broadcasts suppress the ability to evaluate information critically. In addition, twice a day, intense broadcasts relieve mental stress caused by the disconnect between the propaganda and the observed reality by inducing an outburst of blinding enthusiasm.

A minority of the population are not susceptible to the broadcasts. In these people, the intense daily broadcasts induce horrible headache and seizures. The people that are not susceptible to the broadcasts are branded degenerates or degens by the state. They are actively persecuted. When captured they are either executed or sent to prison.

INZIPID Plot

The main character is a human-looking robot. He wakes up somewhere and do not figure out where he is and what is happening. He starts to explore the world and finds friendly blue-eyed robots, who help him on his way. Later he meets more characters, which do not treat well to the main character. For example, yellow-eyed robots. Yellow-eyed robots are in conflict with blue-eyed robots for some reason. Discovering the game world player finds out that all local robots are sensitive to broadcasting, but if yellow-eyed robot becomes raging and aggressive, than blue-eyed robot feels pain and loses ability to resist. Only the main character does feel nothing from broadcasting.

But who did develop broadcasting and why? Can be those cute little robots angry and evil? Are there more robot races? Why is the main character not affected by the broadcasting? Gameplay answers to these and much more questions.

There are a lot of locations in INZIPID: military zone, office building, factory producing towers, canalisation, police station, ghetto with gameplay on roofs, entire island with its own architecture, stadium, train station, and so on. But let me show you the atmosphere.

 

All INZIPID characters are machines. They may look like humans, animals, plants, or insects, but don't let them deceive you -- they are still just robots. I can't say that there are a lot of characters in the game, but there are as many characters as needed to tell the whole story. Entities should not be multiplied beyond necessity. Very few INZIPID robots appear in the game more than twice. Since INZIPID denies the existence of terms "good" and "evil", there are no simply good or bad guys in the game. If you find somebody in the game helping you, that doesn't mean he doesn't do horrible thing in the future. Every character has its motivation to do or do not things during gameplay.
Each character is created by hand in Blender3D with huge author's love. Some of them are animated in Blender, others become alive in Unity engine directly.

 

Links:

  • ZIPSTED Twitter: https://twitter.com/zipsted
  • Tweet about Indiegogo campaign: https://twitter.com/zipsted/status/925755935343210496
  • INZIPID Trailer on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wWdtzpusdxA

 

I know you do not trust game developers here on Indiegogo. I can not blame you for that, there are a number of examples when successfully funded campaign did not end up with game release. I will never be able to assure you, that I'm not the one of them, but I can show you few facts about me, which I can prove or they are obvious by themselves.

  1. All my game projects always come to release. I'm developing video games since 2012, and my games are not as successful as I've ever expected, but if I start the project it will be done for sure. Here's the link to the first documented mention of my game SOPOR, and this link proves that SOPOR had been released and still alive. Told about Fridge Break and released it. Tapobang mention and its release.
  2. I do not need a million, or even a half of a million. All I need is a year of game development without distracting factors and side-projects. Actually, I understand those guys, who successfully funded their games, have looked at their bank account, and lost their enthusiasm to continue development. $500,000 can blind anyone. In my case, I need $77,000, which I will spend on salary compensation for me as a programmer, salary for third-party artist/designer (it will help to model all the stuff in an annual term), platform and banking fees, taxes, and relatively cheap things like modern PS4 (I already have PC, Mac, and Xbox), UI localization, and marketing/PR.
  3. Everyone knows that Kickstarter campaigns for video games are more efficient. Statistically. But there is at least one problem with Kickstarter for video games -- the platform accepts only a few countries to start a campaign. I'm from Russia, which is not in Kickstarter list, and I'm not going to use dirty semi-legal schemes to set up INZIPID campaign from third country. So, I show my project here, to you, and I trust in your sense of beauty.
  4. Fixed goal. I need a year of development, and "float campaign" will not help me to reach that goal. Nobody will happy to receive a half (or fifth part) of the game in release. So, all or nothing.

You definitely can help us and it's simple! Just spread the info and tell everyone about INZIPID and our Indiegogo campaign! At very top of this page you can find Indiegogo share buttons, so don't hesitate to use them!

Retweet our tweet or just follow me on Twitter. Post on Facebook, share INZIPID Trailer anywhere, leave a message about INZIPID and Indiegogo campaign on your favorite forum. Tell your friends about what happening here. Any word helps.
story_txt:
Hi, my name is Edgar, I am founder of an independent game development studio ZIPSTED.
We started in 2012 and since then we've developed three small mobile games for iOS: SOPOR, Fridge Break, and Tapobang. They still live on App Store, and I made them free while Indiegogo campaign is continuing. Look to them, if you'd like.
In 2016 I decided to create something bigger. At that date I've read a sci-fi novel Prisoners of Power by Arkady and Boris Strugatsky and found the book amazing. A month later I've wrote first few lines of INZIPID code and modeled the first version of the main character. I was pretty familiar with Unity engine, so development has begun fine.
The only obstacle I've met was a time. I'm working on INZIPID almost every day after my full-time job for about a year, and currently developed gameplay lasts a little more than an hour. Meanwhile, I have a plot, which approximately corresponds to 6-8 hours of gameplay. So, we've got a simple proportion here. If I leave things as is, I need 6-8 years to complete INZIPID and release it. The only way out is to work on the game 60 hours per week instead of 10 hours.
In other words, I'm pretty sure I cannot do this without your help.

INZIPID is inspired by sci-fi novel Prisoners of Power, and placed in the world of machines. It is a 2.5D platformer in an atmosphere of desolation and lifelessness.

Cinematic plot makes player feel and worry with the main character
Tragic and perceptible conflict between two races of robots
Dilapidating civilization of artificial intelligence
About 150 puzzles and interactive locations
About 30 unique characters



Inspiration from Prisoners of Power
Shortly about the novel plot (excerpted from Wikipedia). The hero of the story is a space explorer from Earth. He accidentally discovers a planet inhabited by a humanoid race. The man finds himself in the capital of a totalitarian state, perpetually at war with its neighbors. The population is governed by an anonymous oligarchy with police and military omnipresent. Eventually, it is revealed that to maintain the loyalty of the population, the oligarchy employ mind control broadcasts. The broadcast towers pepper the landscape of the country. Constant broadcasts suppress the ability to evaluate information critically. In addition, twice a day, intense broadcasts relieve mental stress caused by the disconnect between the propaganda and the observed reality by inducing an outburst of blinding enthusiasm.
A minority of the population are not susceptible to the broadcasts. In these people, the intense daily broadcasts induce horrible headache and seizures. The people that are not susceptible to the broadcasts are branded degenerates or degens by the state. They are actively persecuted. When captured they are either executed or sent to prison.
INZIPID Plot
The main character is a human-looking robot. He wakes up somewhere and do not figure out where he is and what is happening. He starts to explore the world and finds friendly blue-eyed robots, who help him on his way. Later he meets more characters, which do not treat well to the main character. For example, yellow-eyed robots. Yellow-eyed robots are in conflict with blue-eyed robots for some reason. Discovering the game world player finds out that all local robots are sensitive to broadcasting, but if yellow-eyed robot becomes raging and aggressive, than blue-eyed robot feels pain and loses ability to resist. Only the main character does feel nothing from broadcasting.

But who did develop broadcasting and why? Can be those cute little robots angry and evil? Are there more robot races? Why is the main character not affected by the broadcasting? Gameplay answers to these and much more questions.

There are a lot of locations in INZIPID: military zone, office building, factory producing towers, canalisation, police station, ghetto with gameplay on roofs, entire island with its own architecture, stadium, train station, and so on. But let me show you the atmosphere.




 


All INZIPID characters are machines. They may look like humans, animals, plants, or insects, but don't let them deceive you -- they are still just robots. I can't say that there are a lot of characters in the game, but there are as many characters as needed to tell the whole story. Entities should not be multiplied beyond necessity. Very few INZIPID robots appear in the game more than twice. Since INZIPID denies the existence of terms "good" and "evil", there are no simply good or bad guys in the game. If you find somebody in the game helping you, that doesn't mean he doesn't do horrible thing in the future. Every character has its motivation to do or do not things during gameplay.Each character is created by hand in Blender3D with huge author's love. Some of them are animated in Blender, others become alive in Unity engine directly.
 








Links:

ZIPSTED Twitter: https://twitter.com/zipsted


Tweet about Indiegogo campaign: https://twitter.com/zipsted/status/925755935343210496

INZIPID Trailer on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wWdtzpusdxA






 



I know you do not trust game developers here on Indiegogo. I can not blame you for that, there are a number of examples when successfully funded campaign did not end up with game release. I will never be able to assure you, that I'm not the one of them, but I can show you few facts about me, which I can prove or they are obvious by themselves.


All my game projects always come to release. I'm developing video games since 2012, and my games are not as successful as I've ever expected, but if I start the project it will be done for sure. Here's the link to the first documented mention of my game SOPOR, and this link proves that SOPOR had been released and still alive. Told about Fridge Break and released it. Tapobang mention and its release.

I do not need a million, or even a half of a million. All I need is a year of game development without distracting factors and side-projects. Actually, I understand those guys, who successfully funded their games, have looked at their bank account, and lost their enthusiasm to continue development. $500,000 can blind anyone. In my case, I need $77,000, which I will spend on salary compensation for me as a programmer, salary for third-party artist/designer (it will help to model all the stuff in an annual term), platform and banking fees, taxes, and relatively cheap things like modern PS4 (I already have PC, Mac, and Xbox), UI localization, and marketing/PR.
Everyone knows that Kickstarter campaigns for video games are more efficient. Statistically. But there is at least one problem with Kickstarter for video games -- the platform accepts only a few countries to start a campaign. I'm from Russia, which is not in Kickstarter list, and I'm not going to use dirty semi-legal schemes to set up INZIPID campaign from third country. So, I show my project here, to you, and I trust in your sense of beauty.

Fixed goal. I need a year of development, and "float campaign" will not help me to reach that goal. Nobody will happy to receive a half (or fifth part) of the game in release. So, all or nothing.



You definitely can help us and it's simple! Just spread the info and tell everyone about INZIPID and our Indiegogo campaign! At very top of this page you can find Indiegogo share buttons, so don't hesitate to use them!
Retweet our tweet or just follow me on Twitter. Post on Facebook, share INZIPID Trailer anywhere, leave a message about INZIPID and Indiegogo campaign on your favorite forum. Tell your friends about what happening here. Any word helps.

story:
For start we want to introduce ourselves so you’ll get to know us better. I can’t say that we are professionals, but we definitely know what makes a great game.

  Currently there are only 4 of us, which is not big, but we hope, we will find people who can help our game grow. It was our dream as players to make a game, and now is the time, when we got together and with right materials and ideas we started to work on this project. We always had very good ideas on how a game should work, that’s why we thought that creating one would help us accomplish our dream and it would fill the needs of a passionate gamer.

  We are also just players, the idea of creating a game came from watching and playing other games, we wanted to create something different a special thing that would make the player feel like he was in the game, like he was living the life of the main character's story. It’s not possible to just simply make a game, there has to be time, passion, creativity, ideas, people, and of course you our fan base you are the ones, who will help us to make a good, interesting and fun to play game.

  I hope that you’ll know even more about us as we’ll progress with our game and, that you’ll give us usefull ideas and help to us to create a succesfull game. To keep it short so it is not boring, we can assure as a fellow gamers/players that we will do our best to create something that you’ll enjoy. As most of players we thought about creating a game, but those ideas are always just words so we decided to take matters in our own hands. We are senior students in high school, with brilliant ideas and interest in game development industry.

  So to give you an idea about who we are, I will tell you something about each member of our project.

- Let’s start with Lukas lead creator and director of the game, he got the whole project together so he was the initiative to create our game. He is the most creative member of the group, so thanks to him you’ll have a great story with lot of twist and mysteries. He started using his fantasy in an effort to write a novel, where he also used his ability to create  breathtaking scenes and deeper sense. He wanted to transform his thoughts into virtual reality.

- My name is Peter I’m game lead programmer and I also like writing a lot. I don’t like talking about myself much but let me give you at least some information. When I heard the idea, that Lukas created I was very interested and wanted to include my ideas and opinions on the game. Now something more personal about me, as you can see I like writing as I already told you and I enjoy learning about new cultures and languages, my current passion is Asia don’t worry it won’t affect the game :). I'm working on the gameplay side of the game, so if you find a bug you can blame me for that.

- And the newest member of our team Zuzana and the only lady. She is a head story editor the person who you’ll love because of the amazing story, that she edited and created. Her ambitions are to became a book writer. We became very depended on her because of her ideas on the story line, you’ll see for yourself. As she is the only lady in our team, we can rely on her with things, that we are not good at or lazy about. Zuzana was also interested, like me with the Lukas idea and wanted to become a part of it.

Unfortunetly we can’t introduce the fourth member at the time being. 

There are some informations, what we want to tell you. First of all, we are using some default stuff from cryengine in our presentation. Why? In this campaign, game features and our systems are more important for us. We wanted to show you, what is unique in our game. So, that's the reason, why we didn't spend much time with models. But in this time, behind the campaign, we are working on it. So, you will see it in our future updates. 

If you don´t understand us in the video, you have our sorry. We are from Slovakia, so, it's little more problematic for us. Please, turn on captions in the video, if you have problem with understanding us.

Let me give a you brief explanation about what our game features. So I’m going to talk about some of them. You now know that, we wanted to create a realistic world with a lot of opportunities, choices and options for a player. We want you to enjoy it as much as you can, that’s why it’s important to feel like you are part of the game itself.

Let’s see first of all:

NPC system : Creating just some NPC’s that you’ll talk to, that doesn’t work for us. We made them little bit more dynamic. They can help you questing, adventuring around SEVENA, fighting off your enemies. Choose whoever you want, who looks more to your liking. Make them drive you around if you are lazy to drive.

Combat : The most important part of a RPG shooter is combat, so we are giving you a good combat system that you can work with. Combat in our game can drastically change depending on the weather, youre visibility, precision, shot trajectory. If I was you I would pay closer attention to the current weather

  • - Editing your weapon, choosing attachemants that you like from our special illegal store. Or buy the whole weapon from friendly fire shops.
  • - Casino system : If you feel lucky and have money to spend, try our casinos it can be a risk, but you can get some valuable prices too.
  • - Night clubs for those party animals, dance machines out there who like to have some fun.
  • - Inventory system  we feel like most of the games have unlimited space, you have tons and tons of weapons and things. Because we like things more realistic, you’ll have enough space but you have complete some requirements for example smaller gun needs a holster, for shotgun longer jacket. And you can place your weapons and ammo in the truck of your car for more space.
  • - Dynamic events, dynamic weather :
  • Like in real world anything can happen in just a second. You can be in a bar and event will pop something like a bar fight. When you have good enough car street racers can recognize you and ask you to join them in a race. There will be lot more I’m just giving you an example.
  • Dynamic weather – we like to have night time, day time , all four seasons , one day will be sunny, one rainy it will change randomly so don’t forget to take your umbrellas. There is 24 minutes cycle of night & day system.
  • - Owning an estate, car - if you want to get more money get a building that you can profit from, you can also sell the whole thing if you need some quick cash. The same goes for cars you can edit, buy, sell, steal all cars that are in the game.
  • - You’re family owns a lot of properties and territories, but the same goes for other mafia family. When you own an territory it’s yours you are getting some benefits, earning more money, and giving yourself a place to fight for. It’s your land so you have to defend it against your enemy, in the game you will have lot of massive fights over your territories giving you the experience of real mafia fight. Get some of your buddies and capture the enemy territory.
  • - Interaction with civilians is important too. Your behaviour plays a big role, you can be a hero to people if you are helping them with their daily lives or a bully. Depending on at they can help you but they can also give information to your enemy it all depends on your actions.
  • - CO-OP system : You are always bored in world just by yourself, we created good CO-OP system. Instead of NPCs you can invite one of your friends, use the options of an open world activities that SEVENA island offers.
  • - Easter eggs, Achievements will also have a role in our game, if like to explore complete all achievements you won’t be disappointed we prepared a good amout of things that you can do and you’ll get rewards for your spent time.
  • - HP : Don’t expect to take more that one bullet, everything has a value you have to be carefull with your body. If you are in an action and you don’t have time you can use adrenalin that will help you fight even with pain but only for a period of time. Later you have to visit a doctor if it’s a bigger wound or a bullet shot, he will fix you in no time. My advice to you try not getting shot.
  • Police - our policemans are very realistic, like in real life. They will punish you for speed limits, when you go on red-light, traffic accidents and most of other realistic elements.

And there is our RPG site of our game. You’ll have a choice between 3 different play styles:

  • 1. Combat,                                 2.Sneaking,                            3.Leadership
  • Combat : for your typical front line guy that just kills with no mercy.
  • Sneaking : if you prefer a sneakier way of dealing with things this is the right class for you. Play as sniper patiently waiting for it’s prey to be hunted down. Sneak behind your enemies, find their weak spots, kill them quicker, faster and efficiently.
  • Leadership :You are not a type of person who deals with everything on his own, with your leadership abilities this will give you an easier time. You’ll be someone who everyone admires and would do anything for them. Lead you family to success and progress, capture areas that you don’t own yet.
  • We built one of the most revolutionary system in the game development  - 
  • Friendly Controller, is a thing, which can make your Friendly(buddy) more inteligent. For example: in action, you can give him multiple commands to do what you need and what is best in the current situation for you. You can really enjoy your position of a true Leader. Friendly Controller is fixed on Leadership Skill from the biggest part.

In action 1 we used "Drive" and in action 2 we used "Move". That allows you to make a simple, but usefull way on how to clear your enemy territory with the help of your buddy. You can see this function in the campaing video. All of these actions, can be activated just by pressing a hotkey.

    Our world is very specific. We wanted to build something new and special. Sevena Islands are inspired by places like Miami, Florida, Hawai, so it´s a tropical paradise. Everything that is on Sevena Islands, can not be seen enywhere else only in our game. We wanted to make something what you can't see in other places on  Earth, so that's why we created this land. Game will instantly put you into a new world, new culture full of interesting history (which are figures like easter eggs). You can see more on "Game Features" in "Dynamic Events" and you can see how much is our world living.

    In the presentation, you can see only 1% of our map, and even that 1% is quite large. So, that means, that our map will be very, very, very big. Our map resolution will be something about 10-thousand km2 and that's pretty huge. In the picture you can see, that 1% of our map (in the red circle) and other parts that we are working on.



    Story is something, what is very important for us. We want to include feelings into the story writing, so with this, we can control player´s emotion. Our fantasy in this way is very big, maybe unlimited, however, when you are playing a game, we are aiming on your emotions, because only with that, you can fully enjoy the whole game. Our story line is full of plots, so thats the reason, why our story is so great. While playing, you will be revealing lot of new facts about Sevena Islands, intrigues in Tate's family and everything else. You will play in present day, nothing like a specific date, but you will see it in our game, what kind of century it is.

    Main character of our story is a young man, Francis Tate, who is called to the mafia wars because of the loyalty to his family. He just felt the need to protect every last thing, which his family owns, after his father died. Our story is not about revenge. It's on you, how you'll take it. One of very important characters in our game, is Francis´s step-brother, Clarence, who is adopted. He will mix the cards through the whole story line. There are more important characters, but in this time, we don't want to tell you(spoil) every detail of our very dramatic story line.

    This is one of main characters. She is a member of corporation "EFD", I can't tell you more details about this thing in our story(maybe in another update ;) ), but it´s very interesting part of the game.

    Strength and options of Cryengine were one of the most decisive factors, when choosing an engine, that we wanted to work with. The software itself "Sanbox" is most usefull for us. Options and flexibility of Cryengine were on the first place in our selection.


    Our aim is to create a special game, that will build its name in the game industry. We want to continue on our path. Project SEVENA is not our only project.  We have lot of ideas, which we wanted to bring to life. Project SEVENA is not an ordinary gaming project, we want to bring our hearts to this project and with this we are aiming to the clouds of AAA titles.


    When creating our dream, we thought about things like, how we are going to pay for our project. We tried to find investors who would support our idea but we didn't succeed, because most people are not interested in things which are not fully developt. That why we took things in our own hands and started working hard on our thoughts, ideas and dreams. Except getting our finances, we realized that the best thing for our project will be to get financial support from you, the player comunity, and also we need feedback from our potentional players - that's the reason why we are here.


    Your support is very important for our success. You can give us feedback, and you can help us to grow our project.

    With your support, we can make our game better. We want to make our characters with 3D Scan. For animations we want to use MOCAP and other things, that we need for our job

    We wanted too make our studio bigger, so, we could be a real game development studio with more people and with it's name on the market.

prefer a sneakier way of dealing with things this is the right class for you.
Play as sniper patiently waiting for it’s prey to be hunted down. Sneak behind
your enemies, find their weak spots, kill them quicker, faster and efficiently.


Leadership :You are not a type of person who
deals with everything on his own, with your leadership abilities this will give
you an easier time. You’ll be someone who everyone admires and would do
anything for them. Lead you family to success and progress, capture areas that
you don’t own yet.
We built one of the most revolutionary system in the game development  - 

Friendly Controller, is a thing, which can make your Friendly(buddy) more inteligent. For example: in action, you can give him multiple commands to do what you need and what is best in the current situation for you. You can really enjoy your position of a true Leader. Friendly Controller is fixed on Leadership Skill from the  biggest part.




In
 action 1 we used "Drive" and in action 2 we used "Move". That allows 
you to make a simple, but usefull way on how to clear your enemy 
territory with the help of your buddy. You can see this function in the 
campaing video. All of these actions, can be activated just by pressing a
 hotkey.





Our world is very specific. We wanted to build something new and special. Sevena Islands are inspired by places like Miami, Florida, Hawai, so it´s a tropical paradise. Everything that is on Sevena Islands, can not be seen enywhere else only in our game. We wanted to make something what you can't see in other places on  Earth, so that's why we created this land. Game will instantly put you into a new world, new culture full of interesting history (which are figures like easter eggs). You can see more on "Game Features" in "Dynamic Events" and you can see how much is our world living.
In the presentation, you can see only 1% of our map, and even that 1% is quite large. So, that means, that our map will be very, very, very big. Our map resolution will be something about 10-thousand km2 and that's pretty huge. In the picture you can see, that 1% of our map (in the red circle) and other parts that we are working on.





Story is something, what is very important for us. We want to include feelings into the story writing, so with this, we can control player´s emotion. Our fantasy in this way is very big, maybe unlimited, however, when you are playing a game, we are aiming on your emotions, because only with that, you can fully enjoy the whole game. Our story line is full of plots, so thats the reason, why our story is so great. While playing, you will be revealing lot of new facts about Sevena Islands, intrigues in Tate's family and everything else. You will play in present day, nothing like a specific date, but you will see it in our game, what kind of century it is. 
Main character of our story is a young man, Francis Tate, who is called to the mafia wars because of the loyalty to his family. He just felt the need to protect every last thing, which his family owns, after his father died. Our story is not about revenge. It's on you, how you'll take it. One of very important characters in our game, is Francis´s step-brother, Clarence, who is adopted. He will mix the cards through the whole story line. There are more important characters, but in this time, we don't want to tell you(spoil) every detail of our very dramatic story line. 


This is one of main characters. She is a member of corporation "EFD", I can't tell you more details about this thing in our story(maybe in another update ;) ), but it´s very interesting part of the game.
Strength
 and options of Cryengine were one of the most decisive factors, when 
choosing an engine, that we wanted to work with. The software itself 
"Sanbox" is most usefull for us. Options and flexibility of Cryengine 
were on the first place in our selection.
Our aim is to create a special game, that will build its name in the game industry. We want to continue on our path. Project SEVENA is not our only project.  We have lot of ideas, which we wanted to bring to life. Project SEVENA is not an ordinary gaming project, we want to bring our hearts to this project and with this we are aiming to the clouds of AAA titles.






When creating our dream, we thought about things like, how we are going to pay for our project. We tried to find investors who would support our idea but we didn't succeed, because most people are not interested in things which are not fully developt. That why we took things in our own hands and started working hard on our thoughts, ideas and dreams. Except getting our finances, we realized that the best thing for our project will be to get financial support from you, the player comunity, and also we need feedback from our potentional players - that's the reason why we are here.




Your support is very important for our success. You can give us feedback, and you can help us to grow our project. 
With your support, we can make our game better. We want to make our characters with 3D Scan. For animations we want to use MOCAP and other things, that we need for our job
We wanted too make our studio bigger, so, we could be a real game development studio with more people and with it's name on the market.

story:
Please scroll down for the English summary!

Die Tatsache

In Bonn fehlt was! Und auch in der Umgebung! Ein Ort für Fantasy-Freunde und Spiele-Fans – eine Anlaufstelle für alte Hasen und frische Neugierige, an der man auch noch in passendem Ambiente bewirtet wird.

Die Vision

Wir wollen das ändern und im schönen Bonn ein Spiele-Café und Fantasy-Pub eröffnen, als besonderen Treffpunkt mit Atmosphäre und Gemütlichkeit. Dort werden alle möglichen Sorten von Spielen vertreten sein: Gesellschaftsspiele, Rollenspiele, Platz für Table Tops, Spiele-Turniere und auch Demo-Runden. Dazu stellen wir uns ein ausgiebiges Veranstaltungsprogramm vor mit Themenpartys zu aktuellen und klassischen Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Genres, hin und wieder auch was Historisches und Literarisches, Lesungen, Workshops, Bierproben, Konzerte etc.

Ihr könnt dann auch gerne selber etwas anbieten!

Damit zudem die Geschmackssinne etwas zu tun bekommen, bieten wir ein spannendes Getränke-Angebot: Biere aus dem Ausland oder weiter entfernten, deutschen Regionen. Kennt Ihr z.B. Lambic oder Trappistenbier? Dubbel- oder Tripelbier? Wisst ihr, was für tolle Sachen im Fränkischen gebraut werden? Außerdem gibt es verschiedene Metsorten, historische Gewürzweine, seltene Limonaden usw. Dazu haben wir kleine Speisen, von Muffins bis Pommes und Burger. Die idealen Snacks zum Spielen.

Selbstredend können wir uns ebenfalls gut vorstellen, mit verschiedenen Einrichtungen im Bereich der gemeinnützigen Tätigkeit zusammenzuarbeiten. Wir sind immer offen für Gespräche.

Wer sind wir?

Astrid. Arbeitet mit bei Crimson Darkness, der Hörnchen-Manufaktur und turnt mit denen seit acht Jahren über die Cons, Messen, Märkte und Festivals. Sie ist an und für sich Archäologin, Mediävistin und passionierter Fantasy-Fan. Im Voyager wird sie zur Herrin der Küche und der Lagerauffüllung. Ihr kennt wahrscheinlich schon ihre Kekse – sie kann auch noch mehr!

Kay. Ist auch schon seit Jahren bei Crimson Darkness. Er kann Diplom-Bibliothekar und hat viel im kaufmännischen gearbeitet. Seine Liebe gilt alter Fantasy und Science Fiction, egal ob Buch oder Film. Ihm wird die Theke zu Untertan sein.

Beide Chefs zusammen werden sich um sämtliche Organisation und Öffentlichkeitsarbeit kümmern. Auch wenn wir nicht immer einwandfrei rechts und links unterscheiden können, wissen wir dennoch, was die rechte und die linke Hand des Anderen tut!

Unser Team wird außerdem unterstützt durch das Meister-Hörnchen Atma Sinnan selber. Sie wird uns in allen praktischen Design- und Ausstattungsfragen behilflich sein. Hörnchens Bruder Max wird uns vor Ort gekonnt durch die Untiefen der Buchhaltung führen, und Kay sein Bruder Maik erhält die handwerkliche Supervision auf dem Voyager-Boot.

Wer darf zu uns kommen?

Das ist mal eine Frage! Na, Ihr alle!!! Jung und alt, dick und dünn, Männlein, Weiblein, Ork und Elf, Pirat und Klingone... Menschen? Ja, die dürfen auch rein! Wir öffnen die Pforten für jede Art von Noob und Nerd! Wissen, was ein Würfel ist, kann auch nicht schaden. Nur wer ein Casino sucht, ist bei uns leider falsch. Ihr dürft so viel spielen, wie Ihr wollt.. Ihr müsst aber nicht!

Was wir schon haben

Wir haben mit ein wenig professioneller Hilfe einen langen (sehr langen) Businessplan geschrieben. Wir haben uns das künftige Veranstaltungsprogramm ausgedacht und geplant, jede Menge Dekorationsideen und sowohl Speise- als auch Getränkeauswahl für Euch fertig entwickelt.

Von uns gestartete Umfragen haben viel positives Feedback und weitere Anregungen ergeben, die wir zu einem gar nicht mal so kleinen Teil bereits eingeplant oder umgesetzt haben.

Und tatsächlich: Wir hätten sogar schon einen Laden in Aussicht, der genau unseren räumlichen Erfordernissen und Vorstellungen entspräche! Eigentlich könnten wir uns den schnappen und loslegen… aber…

Was wir noch brauchen

Da wir schon so fleißig waren, brauchen wir nur noch das, was im Grunde alle brauchen: Geld.

Es gibt reichlich Dinge, die finanzieren werden möchten: Die Location will ein bisschen renoviert und umdekoriert werden. Bei Küche und Theke müssen wir noch mal bei. Dazu fehlen noch einige Möbel, viele Spiele (denn alle haben wir auch nicht selber), Ambiente-Kram, genug Getränke, Essen u.ä. Dann können wir gründen und endlich starten.

Warum Ihr uns unterstützen solltet

Voyager macht Euch ein Angebot, dass Ihr nicht ablehnen könnt. Unterstützt die Famiiilie! Bei uns gibt’s auch garantiert keine Betonfüße!

Nein, im Ernst: wenn Ihr einen ganzjährigen Community-Treffpunkt wollt zum Schnacken, Spielen, Feiern, Austauschen oder einfach einen Pub mit coolem Angebot und einmaligem Ambiente, dann helft uns bei der Entstehung!

Das passiert mit Eurem Geld

Eure Spende fließt direkt in eine der Anschaffungen oder Renovierungsmaßnahmen. Ihr bekommt dafür einen der sog. Perks, also eine Gegenleistung von uns – sei es einen Gutschein, ein Tshirt, eine Heldenplakette auf der Einrichtung oder auch Euer persönlicher Feiertag. Das gilt allerdings nur, wenn wir den Betrag, den wir brauchen, mit Eurer Hilfe zusammenkriegen. Wenn nicht, bekommt jeder Spender automatisch von Indiegogo sein Geld zurückgebucht, das Voyager sinkt auf den Grund des Meeres und wir weinen uns jede Nacht in den Schlaf.

Falls wir überfunded werden, schadet das auch nicht. Perks sind genug da. Es wird dann nur noch schneller, noch ambientiger in unserer Location. Und wir können noch schneller noch mehr tolle Spiele auf einmal beschaffen.

Wir wissen, dass die Startsumme hoch ist. Doch wir wissen auch, dass ihr Eure Unterstützung nicht bereuen werdet. Go Voyager!!

Und so geht’s

Eine Anmeldung bei Indiegogo ist gar nicht erforderlich. Ihr sucht Euch einfach den schönsten Perk auf unserer Seite hier aus und klickt drauf. Dann müsst Ihr nur Eure email-Adresse angeben, damit Ihr die Bestätigung zugeschickt bekommt und werdet dann gleich zur PayPal- oder Kreditkartenzahlung weitergeleitet (Vorsicht, PayPal ist ein wenig aufdringlich.. auf dem Button steht "weiter zu PayPal", aber zur Kreditkartenzahlung kommt man auch da lang). Zahlung abschicken und fertig :-)

(Bei der Anmeldung zu Indiegogo müsste man allerdings auch nur Name und email-Adresse eintragen mit Passwort, ist also nicht viel aufwendiger.)

Wie kann man sonst noch helfen?

Gehet hin und verbreitet die Kunde vom künftigen Ort der Heiterkeit! Erzählt über uns, empfehlt uns weiter, rührt ein bisschen die Werbetrommel. Je mehr Menschen von unserem Projekt erfahren, desto mehr Unterstützer können wir gewinnen. Es ist auch nicht wichtig, ob diese Leute in unserer Region wohnen. Jeder von Euch kennt wen, der wiederum wen kennt…

Anstelle des Fundings bieten wir zusätzlich die Möglichkeit, bei uns zu investieren. Das geht natürlich auch! Wir zahlen vernünftigere Zinsen als die Banken derzeit! Wer sich hierfür interessiert, sollte uns natürlich sofort ansprechen.

English Summary - Voyager in a nutshell

We're about to open a Fantasy Pub/ (Board)Game Café in Bonn, Germany and we're going to name it "Voyager" (subtitle: travel to distant worlds and ages). That's because we want to include every fantasy and sci-fi genre as well as historical and literary topics, e.g. in our theme parties, our celebrated holidays (Star Wars-Day, Pi(e)-Day, Talk like a Pirate-Day, etc.), workshops and of course in our beverages and food. In addition to the usual stuff we plan to offer uncommon beer.. uncommon at least for this part of Germany.. that would be for instance beer from Belgium, Scotland, Southern Germany and beer with weird creatures on the bottles. Various flavours of mead and spiced wine are on the menu, as well as rare lemonades and a lovely English tea time.

Our pub will be open for every noob and nerd, and they are very welcome to choose from our large and ever growing collection of games (board~, card~, role play~, etc.). We'll also provide space for miniature wargaming.

The atmosphere at the Voyager is meant to be cosy and a combination of a medieval tavern and your second living room. We plan to furnish the rooms with sofas, wooden benches, seats and tables. In every corner you will find another geeky reference.

Why are we crowdfunding? Well, we lack the money to furnish and repaint the location which is about half of the amount we need to get going (there is a list of the things we need among the updates.. in German though).

We would be very happy if you donated a couple of Euros so we can make the world an even better geeky place! The perks vary from a personal postcard from us, free drinks and food, T-shirts, an entry on Voyager's official hero charter, a fantasy cooking class, or your personal annual holiday which we will name after you (or your IC-name) and celebrate at the pub. Apart from the donations you can also become an investor. We pay better interests than the bank with certainty. If you wish to invest feel free to contact us and ask for more details from our business plan!

Go Voyager!! :-)
