story:
This is my project that I've been working on for almost 4 years and now I need your help to finish it because I can't do it alone.

<--- DOWNLOAD the PREVIEW VERSION on Itch.io --->


----------- The games has been GREENLIT -------------

To thank you all for your amazing support we're adding +1 digital copy of the game to every pledge that grants you a copy. Eg. 10€ = 2 digital copies of the game.

Thank you!




Lead the Courier and finish the delivery, but be wary of the cursed and long forgotten crypts. You will have to learn how to use the magic torch to your advantage - to solve puzzles, dodge, or lure enemies into traps and explore dark places without loosing your flame. Do you have tremendous courage to finish the delivery?


PUBLIC MENTIONS & AWARDS



FEATURES
  • Ambiental  and carefully hand-crafted maps full of puzzles & secrets
  • Magic torch - light your path, scare off the enemies, solve puzzles...
  • Deadly traps & rich treasures
  • Simple yet appealing story with a twist
  • Beautiful pixelated graphics
  • Music and visuals for perfect ominous ambient
  • World map with secret maps to unlock
  • Perfection system
  • Achievements
  • Full controller support

           




STORY

Enter the story of a young and mischievous fella' on his first work day at the Pony Delivery Service. This is the Courier.
His first errand is simple, take a letter to the guardian of the crypts. But like in every story, something must go wrong. The Courier is determined to finish his delivery despite all the dangers lurking down in the crypts but it may be a much longer journey than he ever imagined.

Lead the Courier through the ominous crypts full of mysteries and forgotten secrets. Regardless of the dangers you'll face you have to make sure the letter is delivered. Don't be afraid though, for you won't be going alone...


Your best friend is a magic torch which will guard you from the forsaken souls and illuminate the darkest pathsbefore you. Be aware though for the torch needs to feed otherwise its flame will vanish and you may get lost forever.


TORCH MECHANICS

The main aspect of the game is a magic torch that you wield. Environment will react to it's flames in different ways so it will be common for you to toggle the flame on and off throughout the game. Some enemies will leave you alone while others will try to extinguish the torch. It's up to you to learn all about them and use that knowledge to your advantage. Some enemies you can lure into traps, or sneak past them. And will you let the Dark Moths drink your light or let them attack you? There are also riddles in the dark that only magic flame reveals. Enemies and puzzles should not be your main worry though. You must keep your torch filled with magic flame at all times or fall prey to the dark spirits. Use your torch wisely and look after its flame.


EXPLORATION & BACKSTORY

As you progress through the game, you'll find more about the sect of cultists that was operating down the crypts. Or does it still? It's up to you to explore the dark places and learn their forgotten secrets. Read the books and parchments left behind as you delve deeper and deeper down the crypts.

Reading the scripts is not required to complete the maps, but you may miss secret areas and puzzle hints. Maps will be filled witch secret rooms and corridors for you to explore but first you need to find them. How? You can find tips in the writings lying around or you may go deeper into the darkness and watch for hidden switches and other clues.





AMBIENT

We are working really hard to create the best ambient that we can. We want players to enjoy just being there in the game and feel the crypts around them. Lights, sounds, music and events are repeatedly pieced together until everything feels perfect. 


ENVIRONMENTS

The world is seperated into three episodes. Each episode will take the Courier deeper down the crypts and unlock new gameplay elements, enemies and puzzles. Each episode will also feature a unique theme with one extra sub-theme. The fact that the game is happening down the crypts shouldn't confuse you, the underground hides much more than some graves and dusty scrolls.


REPLAY VALUE

Each level will have secrets and relics just begging to be found, but most of the time that won't be an easy job. This offers an extra challenge and you may soon find yourself searching for perfection points in each map. Some maps will also have alternative endings, unlocking secret maps for you to enjoy. Your efforts put in exploration will be rewarded.

Secret places also offer rich treasures which can be used for...

UPGRADES & MAP UNLOCKS
Somewhere in the game you'll be able to use your money to buy some small upgrades from ghosts like increased number of hearts or slower flame consumption. You can also use gold coins at the friendly spirits found around the secret places which will unlock extra maps.

There is this Ferryman on the Swamp of Sprits, for example, which will take you to the other side (unlocking the map) but the ride won't be for free.  

Unlocking extra maps won't be mandatory to finish the game though. For true explorers and perfectionists there's a lot to do in the game so make sure you grab all the shinnies you can find on your way.


We put a lot of thought into how the Courier of the Crypts should sound. Like visuals the sound has changed over the years of development. Originally we had music playing throughout the game but we realized that it didn`t work as we hoped it would. We scratched that idea and started working on a new concept. We came up with the idea of not having music at all but rather have some short musical segments or stingers that let the player know on what is happening sound wise. Therefore you will hear a distinct music piece when boss battle starts or when you find a particular secret. 
The whole game will be driven by soundscapes as we feel it is the best representation of what the crypts would sound. These soundscapes will be dynamic, meaning they will change according to what the player torch status is. For instance, when you are running low on torch light the soundscape will change to become creepier. The player will definitely know that something is going on – that something is not right. 

On the other hand there will be a Courier of the Crypts soundtrack which will feature complete scores of the short pieces that you will hear in game plus there will be some bonus theme songs included in the final rendition of the game.

MUSIC EXAMPLES




         


First concept and idea for the game was born in April 2011, on the Ludum Dare #20 competition (see the entry here). The theme was "You won't be going alone, take this!". In 48 hours I created this quick and rough prototype of a Courier weilding this magic torch that scares the spiders off. After the competition I left the idea alone until October that year. It was an October challenge - make/finish something and earn at least 1$. I created a whole new visual style of the game and added more of the gameplay like throwing flame urns, switches, gold and more. At that point I knew I can do much more from this and my journey began. Through many prototypes and different visual styles I've reached the final form which I'm working on in the last year.

PROJECT'S EVOLUTION




         


You will get a DRM-free digital version of the game as well as Steam / GOG key. The game has been greenlit so the keys will be supplied when available.

The same rules apply for extra copy perk.


You'll get an access to the private forums which will be created after the campaign. I'll be posting private testing builds there for preview, testing and discussion. 


The soundtrack which will feature complete scores basedon short pieces you will hear in the game.In addition, there will be bonus theme songs included in the final rendition of the game. Look under the music section for the examples

Digital format only

Courier of the Crypts poster to hang on the wall in your room. It will be signed by myself on the back with a thank you note. 

Add Courier of the Crypts to your games collection shelf and get a full CD box with a game and printed manual. 
(You still get the digital copy of the game)

Almost 4 years of the development is a lot, especially when it comes to one person behind the game. After the game release I want to gather all the notes and memories to write a full book about the development. It will include good and bad personal moments that I faced during that time - from times that I almost quit to smiles when I saw first article published about the game. Book will also contain scrap notes (early game designs, level designs, skecthes...) as well as images from different development stages. Every printed book will be signed with thank you note added.

(PDF or softcover printed format)

Graveyard of supporters will be a standalone map with graves and statues of pledgers who selected limited graveyard special reward. You'll be able to chose one of the premade tombstones / statues and put your name or nickname on it.

To make it even more interesting, this map will feature a secret to be found for every player. Your grave may get some visitors after all ;)

This is a quick preview of different options, but there will be much more to chose from.


You'll create a bonus map with our guidence for all the players to play. You'll have free hands to create whatever you want with the assets already in the game. Of course, there will be some rules like what can you write in the parchments (no inappropriate content) and how much gold you can place around for the sake of game's balance.
------------------------------------------------------
If you pick a tier with a physical reward please add 5€ for shipping fees.

         

Through all these years I was working on the game in all the spare time I could find , next to the full time work and studies. I've brough the project really far and it seems there are a lot of people who would like to see this game out and released. To finish the game as I wanted it to be I need your help.

Money requested will give me a year to finish the game as I want it to be, working on it full time. I've done lots of graphics and implemented large amount of features but I still need more content including maps. Crafting each map carefully takes a lot time as well as drawing new graphics and implementing new features.  

Initial funding target is the minimal amount I can live and work with.

HOW WILL THE MONEY BE USED

  • Food & Coffee - even though I'm working from home, I still need to pay for food and coffee that will keep me going.
  • Company expenses - If the campaign succeeds I'll have to register as a so-called independent entrepreneur to satisfy the taxation and bureaucratic requirements. This adds extra monthly expenses.
  • Sound & Music - Even though I'm working on everything by myself I still can't produce any sounds or music.  Great music and sounds for the game with ambient like this one does not come for free. 
  • Stretch goals - money that will pass the initial target will go towards the stretch goals. This means paying for extra help (freelancers) where needed.

WHAT HAPPENS IF I DON'T REACH THE GOAL

I'll most likely need a new job or at least start heavy freelancing. That will slow down the development enormously or even stop it for a while.


    Risks & Challenges

    As we all know, there are things in life that come to us unexpectedly but for what's in my power, I'll do my very best to follow the plan and release the game in late 2015 (November?). Game development is full of challenges and sometimes a task takes much longer than you planned. In worst case scenario, the release date will be postponed by a few months.

    Should problems arise, I have people ready to aid me on my quest.

    Other than that, I will work hard and finish the game no matter what. I was doing that for 3 years next to the full time job and studies and I will surely make it in full-time mode. The game is my passion and my soul afterall.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    I know some of you simply can't contribute. I understand this game is not for everyone and that you may not feel like putting your money into it. You may even just dislike the pixelated style of the game and that's perfectly fine as well.

    If you like what I'm doing or if you want to help me with my dreams, regardless how much interest you have in the game, then please help me the following ways. 

    • Use Indiegogo share tools to spread the word
    • Tell your friends about this game
    • The game has been greenlit, spread the word
    • Are you a youtuber or a streamer? Play the preview version of the game.
    • Tweet, show, share, draw, yell, all of this will help.

    Thank you all for your time and support. There is no Courier without you!
story_txt:
This is my project that I've been working on for almost 4 years and now I need your help to finish it because I can't do it alone.




<--- DOWNLOAD the PREVIEW VERSION on Itch.io --->

----------- The games has been GREENLIT -------------
To thank you all for your amazing support we're adding +1 digital copy of the game to every pledge that grants you a copy. Eg. 10€ = 2 digital copies of the game.
Thank you!



Lead the Courier and finish the delivery, but be wary of the cursed and long forgotten crypts. You will have to learn how to use the magic torch to your advantage - to solve puzzles, dodge, or lure enemies into traps and explore dark places without loosing your flame. Do you have tremendous courage to finish the delivery?

PUBLIC MENTIONS & AWARDS








FEATURES


Ambiental  and carefully hand-crafted maps full of puzzles & secrets
Magic torch - light your path, scare off the enemies, solve puzzles...

Deadly traps & rich treasures
Simple yet appealing story with a twist
Beautiful pixelated graphics
Music and visuals for perfect ominous ambient
World map with secret maps to unlock
Perfection system
Achievements
Full controller support






           



STORYEnter the story of a young and mischievous fella' on his first work day at the Pony Delivery Service. This is the Courier.
His first errand is simple, take a letter to the guardian of the crypts. But like in every story, something must go wrong. The Courier is determined to finish his delivery despite all the dangers lurking down in the crypts but it may be a much longer journey than he ever imagined.

Lead the Courier through the ominous crypts full of mysteries and forgotten secrets. Regardless of the dangers you'll face you have to make sure the letter is delivered. Don't be afraid though, for you won't be going alone...


Your best friend is a magic torch which will guard you from the forsaken souls and illuminate the darkest pathsbefore you. Be aware though for the torch needs to feed otherwise its flame will vanish and you may get lost forever.



TORCH MECHANICS



The main aspect of the game is a magic torch that you wield. Environment will react to it's flames in different ways so it will be common for you to toggle the flame on and off throughout the game. Some enemies will leave you alone while others will try to extinguish the torch. It's up to you to learn all about them and use that knowledge to your advantage. Some enemies you can lure into traps, or sneak past them. And will you let the Dark Moths drink your light or let them attack you? There are also riddles in the dark that only magic flame reveals. Enemies and puzzles should not be your main worry though. You must keep your torch filled with magic flame at all times or fall prey to the dark spirits. Use your torch wisely and look after its flame.



EXPLORATION & BACKSTORY


As you progress through the game, you'll find more about the sect of cultists that was operating down the crypts. Or does it still? It's up to you to explore the dark places and learn their forgotten secrets. Read the books and parchments left behind as you delve deeper and deeper down the crypts.
Reading the scripts is not required to complete the maps, but you may miss secret areas and puzzle hints. Maps will be filled witch secret rooms and corridors for you to explore but first you need to find them. How? You can find tips in the writings lying around or you may go deeper into the darkness and watch for hidden switches and other clues.


AMBIENTWe are working really hard to create the best ambient that we can. We want players to enjoy just being there in the game and feel the crypts around them. Lights, sounds, music and events are repeatedly pieced together until everything feels perfect. 



ENVIRONMENTSThe world is seperated into three episodes. Each episode will take the Courier deeper down the crypts and unlock new gameplay elements, enemies and puzzles. Each episode will also feature a unique theme with one extra sub-theme. The fact that the game is happening down the crypts shouldn't confuse you, the underground hides much more than some graves and dusty scrolls.



REPLAY VALUE

Each level will have secrets and relics just begging to be found, but most of the time that won't be an easy job. This offers an extra challenge and you may soon find yourself searching for perfection points in each map. Some maps will also have alternative endings, unlocking secret maps for you to enjoy. Your efforts put in exploration will be rewarded.
Secret places also offer rich treasures which can be used for...

UPGRADES & MAP UNLOCKS
Somewhere in the game you'll be able to use your money to buy some small upgrades from ghosts like increased number of hearts or slower flame consumption. For true explorers and perfectionists there's a lot to do in the game so make sure you grab all the shinnies you can find on your way.

changed over the years of development. Originally we had music playing throughout the game but 

we realized that it didn`t work as we hoped it would. We scratched that idea and started working on 

a new concept. We came up with the idea of not having music at all but rather have some short 

musical segments or stingers that let the player know on what is happening sound wise. Therefore 

you will hear a distinct music piece when boss battle starts or when you find a particular secret. The whole game will be driven by soundscapes as we feel it is the best representation of what the 

crypts would sound. These soundscapes will be dynamic, meaning they will change according to what

story:
My Story

Well there's not too much to say here, I'm a normal person, who was and still is a massive fan of the Soul Eater anime, when It ended, I slowly began to realise it wasn't coming back, so I constantly was looking for something close to a game for it and began to realise there just wasn't going to be one. Recently I took it upon myself to make that happen, So I learned the skills, i just need the funding.

What I Need & What You Get


I plan for a few rewards to occur to contributors once the game is suitable for early release.
$10- A major thank you in an in game location and a title
$20- Special in game perks and below rewards
$50- Early access and below rewards
$100- Your own NPC, Exclusive in game items and a digital soundtrack +  below rewards.

The Impact

I understand that a lot of you are probably questioning the truthfulness of this campaign and I can fully understand that, I'm not sure anything I can say can fully persuade you but I hope you will not think of this as a scampaign. I possess the skills of animation and coding, but lack the money to buy good enough software to make a game of this scale, I have made a few minor games in the past but this is my biggest project to date, $500 Is the amount I asked for because it would probably be the bare minimum for something like this, any extra money raised will only go towards making a better game, i understand the promise of a stranger isn't much to go on, but it is what it, I plan to see this through to the bitter end.

Risks & Challenges

This task is not something I hope anyone would expect to be done in a night, It is going to take a long time, especially as a one man job, but going through the hard yards is something I have had to do a lot, I just want to make a game that even people who aren't fans of soul eater can enjoy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, I understand that there are a lot of people out there, like me, who just don't have the money to spend, no problems there, I'm always open to Ideas, if anyone has ANY suggestions contact me on Twitter @souleatergame or at souleatergameofficial@gmail.com (I'm going to add a YouTube video as soon as possible.)

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi, my name is Jess and I’m 13 years old. For the past 8 years I’ve lived on the beautiful island of Tasmania. I live a wonderful life, visiting amazing places, taking photographs and creating art. I want to go to Uluru in the very heart of the Australian outback and create a portfolio of photographs of my adventure. The centre of Australia is a long way from home, so I’m inviting you to come along on this adventure with me by helping me to get there and back again.

 

 

The trouble is Australia is a big place. The two week trip is more than 5000 km (3000 miles) long and that’s not including an eleven hour boat trip across Bass Strait to get to the mainland from Tasmania.  My Dad has promised to drive me there if I can raise enough money to cover the costs. We will be driving through the southern states of Victoria and South Australia and then north, all the way to the Northern Territory.

 

 

Along the way I want to do some amazing things, including:

  • Having a picnic on Moon Plain (where they shot scenes for the sci-fi films: Pitch Black, Red Planet and Mad Max: Beyond Thunderdome).
  • Visit the longest fence in the world: the dingo fence (5,614 kilometres or 3,488 miles).
  • Sleep in an underground home at the opal mining town of Coober Pedy and see a movie at its authentic drive-in theatre.
  • Swim in the desert oasis of Kings Canyon.
  • Ride a camel into the desert.
  • Visit the Henbury meteorite crater just south of Alice Springs.
  • Sleep in the desert under the stars.
  • See a sunset at Rainbow Valley.
  • Climb Uluru (that’s the enormous red rock in the centre of Australia).
  • And so much more….

Sounds cool, doesn’t it. I know you’d love to come along as well.

 

 

Your contributions will go towards fuel (that’s nearly $1000!!! gone already), the ferry trip across to the mainland and back with our van (that’s over $700), entrance fees to national parks, and accommodation (most of the time we will be sleeping in the back of our minivan, except in the underground house at Coober Pedy), and the printing and postage of your rewards.

 

 

In return you will not only help me go on the dream adventure of a lifetime, but you get to share in my adventure with fantastic perks. Yes, you heard me correctly, fantastic perks.

Together we can make this dream come true.

 

 

Here are a few more of my recent photos.

 

My model sailing ship.

 

A shot from an animation I want to do (my next project if this one works).

 

At Cradle Mountain.

 

Our cat.

 

If you love my adventure but can't make a donation (and even if you do), you can still help by sharing the dream with the world. Tweet, Google +, Facebook and everything else.

System requirements:

CPU:  AMD FX 4300/6100 or  similar from intel

RAM: 4 GB

OS: Windows 10 64 Bit, Windows 8.1 64 Bit, Windows 8 64 Bit, Windows 7 64 Bit Service Pack 1, Windows Vista 64 Bit Service Pack 2*

VIDEO CARD: NVIDIA 760/950 with  2GB memory / AMD r9 270x with 2GB memory (DX11,12)

Music created by Julie Maxwell's Piano Music.

story:
So why use a game to learn about economics?

I'm glad you asked, because we happen to think games and economics are a perfect match for each other. After all, why exactly is it that we find all that scheming, plotting, forging and breaking of allegiances so addictive in games? It's because that's what we - human beings - are so good at. We are above all, social animals, and games capture that perfectly. There's a good reason why economists as far back as 1713, trying to understand human strategic behaviour, called it 'game theory'.

 

What are the rules? Where can I find out exactly how Economicon works?

Have a look at the tabletop verion. You can download it from this link. The online version will be identical, but, well, online.

 

What are we doing to help schools and teachers use it too?

We're working with teachers and education specialists to develop a base of resources that will include suggested lesson plans and guidelines on how to fit Economicon into the syllabus for different subjects.

Once we've got it working in schools though, we think it also has much wider applications. Economicon deals with some fairly deep principles of gameplay, economics and social psychology, so anyone who likes games and is interested in how people and societies work should love it. And, because it will be online and completely free to access, it will be open to anybody.

Besides being an educational tool, it will also gather data from every game played. So it won't just be the students who are learning more about economics and society, it'll be the rest of us too!

 

Hmm. Gather data, you say. Who exactly will have access to all this data?

Everyone. The data we gather on what decisions people tend to make under which conditions and the patterns of social influence will be freely available online to anyone who wants it - universities, researchers, campaigners or governments. Economicon won't be linked to your online profile. You just enter a name and pick an avatar each time you play, so you (or anyone else) can't go and check up on how selfish your friends or anyone else is.

 

If I want to try out Economicon in my school/university right now, can I get involved?

Absolutely you can! We're running school trials of the tabletop version right now and developing our teacher resources. And were going to keep testing throughout the build process. If you are interested in getting involved with any part of this project, we'd love to hear from you! 

 

What next?

Of course, creating the game is not the end of the story. This is no ordinary computer game, after all. Making something awesomely fun to play is in some ways just the start of this project. Once we've made it, we need to get it out into the world, being played and gathering lots of useful data that will help us all to better understand the societies we live in. We'll be introducing it to schools, universities and businesses, but we also need you, our backers, to play the game and spread the word!

 

Thank you for taking the time to check us out, and to everyone who's already supported us!
story_txt:
So why use a game to learn about economics?
I'm glad you asked, because we happen to think games and economics are a perfect match for each other. After all, why exactly is it that we find all that scheming, plotting, forging and breaking of allegiances so addictive in games? It's because that's what we - human beings - are so good at. We are above all, social animals, and games capture that perfectly. There's a good reason why economists as far back as 1713, trying to understand human strategic behaviour, called it 'game theory'.
 
What are the rules? Where can I find out exactly how Economicon works?
Have a look at the tabletop verion. You can download it from this link. The online version will be identical, but, well, online.
 
What are we doing to help schools and teachers use it too? 
We're working with teachers and education specialists to develop a base of resources that will include suggested lesson plans and guidelines on how to fit Economicon into the syllabus for different subjects.
Once we've got it working in schools though, we think it also has much wider applications. Economicon deals with some fairly deep principles of gameplay, economics and social psychology, so anyone who likes games and is interested in how people and societies work should love it. You just enter a name and pick an avatar each time you play, so you (or anyone else) can't go and check up on how selfish your friends or anyone else is.

story:
Hi! My name is Daniele Messina, I'm from Italy. On the Internet I often go by the nickname Charlie Fleed. I'm a Computer Engineer with a passion for RPGs and strategic games. If you are reading this, you probably like them too. Well, then Hartacon Tactics is for you! 


Hartacon Tactics is a turn-based strategy RPG developed for PC where players challenge each other in online battles, also featuring a single-player campaign. Each player controls a party of fighters chosen from eight different classes and can face all enemies alone or team up in alliances. Battles take place in 2D isometric maps with 4-angles view and zoom.

The battle system is tactical, turn-based, and features traditional RPG aspects such as elements, altered states together with formations bonuses, damage depending on the direction of attack, heights, covers, and all the mechanics work in an almost 100% deterministic way, making battles a dispute of strategically planning minds.


Each class can equip two weapon categories and accesses two corresponding lines of skills which range from pure magic spells, to creation of barriers, modification of the maps, throwing allies and enemies, and much more. All classes are unique and strategically different.

By winning battles, parties gain Upgrade Points (UPs), used to recruit new characters and buy equipments, while individual characters gain Growth Points (GPs), used to learn new skills and increase stats.

Hartacon Tactics comes with a complete in-game map editor, where players will be able to build custom maps for their battles and share them with other players, and the creators of the most popular maps will be awarded with bonus points for their parties.

Hartacon Tactics is developed with XNA 4 and will be released for PC, and for XBOX 360 in the indie games section of XBOX Live.


After more than two years in the making and a huge personal effort, the technical side of Hartacon Tactics is now close to completion and the game needs you.

I am the game designer and programmer of Hartacon Tactics, I am fairly good at drawing comics-style stuff too, but for this project I want to bring you really wonderful visuals, and that is why I am working with skilled professionals in making game assets, who have helped me to create a lively and colorful fantasy world.

But you don't have to take my word for it, you can see it by yourself. Just download the demo from IndieDB, setup a party, build you own custom maps if you want, and start playing!


Are you back? Pretty good, uh? That is just a sample of what Hartacon Tactics will be with your support. This is where your contribution will go:

  • Hartacon Tactics already has one beautifuI outdoor tileset for its maps, but I plan to add more outdoor and indoor tilesets, all rich of great assets.
  • The GUI is pretty much ready but the game needs icons for every weapon, equipment, skill and whatnot.
  • As far as battle is concerned there cannot be good action without great character animations, visual effects and sounds.
  • The single-player campaign needs NPCs and locations art.
  • The multiplayer modes need a fast and reliable server, I will not charge the players for playing online.

As a reviewer once pointed out, this is a work of passion and love for the SRPG genre. I will get this game done, but your contribution is what will take Hartacon Tactics to another level, allowing me to present you with a true gaming art piece.


Pre-order, you will get a digital copy of the game! You didn't expect that...

8 digital postcards of full-resolution character artworks by the artist Douglas Draco.

A digital poster designed by the artist Douglas Draco.

A digital sketch-book full of concept art by artists Douglas Draco, Lane Brown, Max Heyder and many more.

Exclusive mousepad with Hartacon Tactics design.

A customized 8GB USB Drive with the logo of the game.

3-inches 3D printed model of the lionman character by artist Justin Bintz.

5-inches 3D printed model of the lionman character by artist Justin Bintz


Do you like Hartacon Tactics? Great! There is a chance that your friends will like it too! Visit the official Facebook Page, follow us on Twitter subscribe to the Youtube Channel, follow the project at IndieDB. Share, share and share! Use the Indiegogo share tools (they told me to say it)!

story:
Go Fight Fantastic! is a super vibrant 1-3 player Hack 'n Slash game where you and up to two friends play as the Tank, the Striker and the Healer, each with their own set of abilities. The game features both online and local multiplayer and will be released on Steam Early Access in 2022.


    Work together to fight off an alien invasion, find upgrades to get stronger and customize your characters' abilities along the way! 

      Early Horde Mode Contest at Sweden Game Conference 2019

       

      The game features a rich, colorful aesthetic with hand drawn environments and characters, a multi level story mode as well as a ton of challenges for those looking to really put their skills to the test. 

      Hand drawn art/animation: Mixing 3D with 2D frame-by-frame animations!

       

       

      Platforms & Closed Beta

      The game will release on PC/Steam Early Access in 2022, but we're hoping to bring the game to the Switch, Playstation and Xbox in 2023 (estimated). 

       

      As a backer for this projects, you'll get instant unlimited access to the Closed Beta through Steam, meaning you can start playing the latest beta right away!

       

      Open Beta Weekends!

      If you want a chance to try the game out before you buy, you can request access to the limited Open Beta using the 'Request Access'-button on our Steam Page. This will give you a chance to try out the game, but playtime will be limited to specific weekends only! 

       

       

      Story

      The game is about a gang of teen mercenaries and their spacedog-captain who stumble into an alien invasion and must fight against all odds to save the local bird-people from destruction! 

      The alien invaders start kidnapping people from the planet. Our heroes get caught in the middle and have no choice but to help the peaceful bird people inhabiting the planet, or they might just be out of work... 

       

      Gameplay

      Choose between three playable characters, where each of them have a unique set of abilities and specific role to play in the party. Combine your skills, work together as a team and fight your way forward, overcoming any and all obstacles!  

       

      In Story Mode, you unfold the story of what the alien invaders want and do your best to stop people from getting taken from their homes. You can explore for meteorite shards, upgrades you can use in any game mode to modify your character and their abilities. You’ll face enemies, bosses, challenges, events and maybe even a few puzzles! 

       

      The Horde Mode Arena lets your team work on communication skills, timing and go for the high score as an onslaught of enemies try to take you and your team down! The longer you play, the harder it will get.  

      Completing daily challenges and events will give you access to unlockable content, time limited upgrades and much more. The game also offers a wide variety of bonus challenges that grants access to rare and legendary meteorites (upgrades) for those skilled enough. 

       

      Upgrade Systems

      Exploring for and finding Meteorite Shards allow you to upgrade your characters and their attacks. Meteorites are persistent between games and level up as you play, allowing you to build your own collection of upgrades and customize the characters to your specific play style and needs.        
       

      Want to run faster, do more damage, electrocute enemies on critical hits or perhaps
      turn that defensive ability into an offensive one? Meteorite upgrades are the way to go!

       

      Characters

      The game features five main characters living on the ship: Super Nova, Dark Matter, Max Sparkles, Mercury and Captain Bowie. Three of which are playable characters with the rest to be added after launch.   

      Super Nova (the Tank) is a powerful close range character who really knows how to take a beating. She’s the first line of defense for the rest of the team and usually the first to engage enemies.   

      Dark Matter (the Striker) on the other hand is what’s referred to as a “glass canon”. He’s an incredibly mobile and powerful damage dealer who will easily lay waste to anything in seconds - but if he doesn’t keep moving, a few well placed hits is all it takes to knock him down.     

      The ever happy go lucky Max Sparkles (the Healer) is rarely seen without his guardian spirit, Aumakua, at his side. Together they do their best to make sure their friends are always safe and sound by using spirit magic.   

      The Bad Guys: General Poi and her pet monster Froggy!

       

      At the end of each level you’ll face off against powerful generals and their various pets in the form of intense boss fights. We've designed our enemies to force you to do more than just hack and slash your way forward. You'll need to read situations, learn enemy behaviors and timing - and know when to strike and when to run!

       

      Online & Local Multiplayer 

      The game features both local and online multiplayer but can also be played as a single player game where you can quick-switch between all three characters on the fly!

       

      Challenges  

      Adding unique in-game challenges to your gameplay changes the rules of the game, adding replay value as well as unlocking super rare meteorite upgrades. 

      Challenges can be anything from a shared health pool between the three characters to enemies resurrecting after 10 seconds forcing you to rush through the levels. We’ll add as many as we (and you, our community) can come up with!  

       

      Music & Sound Design 

      We’re fortunate to have our friends at Two Feathers working on music and sound design for the game! Two Feathers have previously worked on music and sound design for titles such as Angry Birds 2, Warhammer: Vermintide 2, Aragami, Apex Construct, Hammerwatch and many more. Given what they created for the trailer, we're super exicited to hear what they come up with next!

      Check out their website here: https://www.twofeathersstudio.com/ 

       

       

      Release Plans

      The game has been in development for just over 4 years and we’re pushing hard to have the game available on Steam Early Access in 2022. At that point we want the game to be mostly feature complete with the remaining work being focused on adding more levels, characters, upgrades and challenges - and improving features and gameplay further. 

       

      So how far along is the game?

      Everything you see in the trailer is actual gameplay footage from the latest build of the game, so the game is currently very much playable and has already been shown at expos in different stages for the last year or so. The Closed Beta is currently live for all backers and we’re currently gearing up for Open Beta-weekends, starting this February! 
       


      Much of the focus so far has been on making sure the game is fun, engaging and super tight which has meant a lot of hard work, gameplay testing, re-thinking and killing the right darlings to get things like combat mechanics, character abilities, interesting combos and animations super solid!  

      Our very first technical prototype that sparked the idea for Go Fight Fantastic!

       

      Why Early Access?

      As a small team, it’s important for us to get the game out to the public as soon as possible in order to get feedback on gameplay, level design and to solidify technical aspects of the game such as multiplayer matchmaking and difficulty curve presets. This will ensure we avoid common pitfalls such as producing a ton of levels and objectives without ever testing them in the wild.
       


      Our vision of the Early Access release is to deliver a game which is as close to feature complete as possible with as few bugs as possible and to add content such as levels, more playable characters, etc along the way. We'll embed a development/release timeline straight into the game making sure you know what’s coming and when!

       


       

      The Team  

      We are Lina (art) and Johan (code), a nerdy couple from Sweden who are super passionate about games, creativity and tech.

      The Team: Lina (Art/Animation), Johan (Tech/Code) & Bowie (Captainy stuff)


      Together we run a two person production company/studio which allow us to realize our wildest creative dreams. ​We have been fortunate enough to be able to work together for the last 9 years, recently with the addition of our puppy/morale booster Bowie (who’s in the game as Captain Bowie). 

       

       

      We need your help!
       

      Before we started working on this project, we both worked full time producing visual content for advertising agencies, retail stores and more. After ending up in perpetual crunch mode working 12-16 hour days, we decided to quit our day jobs and start focusing full time on our dreams and the things we’re most passionate about: game development!  

      We pooled all of our money and set out to follow our dreams - fully committed to optimizing our day to day costs and spend all of our savings on this massive undertaking. Going on just over 4 years now, we’ve been working and will continue to work without any income until the project is complete, which is why we need your help! 
                 

      Our Home Office where we make the game!

      With the resources we have left, crowd funding is a chance for us to keep funding the development of the project without having to go bankrupt in the process. With your help, we’ll be able to see the rest of the development through without having to worry about how to put food on the table. It would also go a long way towards funding more amazing sound design and music by Two Feathers.      

       

       

       Game Features

      • A vibrant, fun and exciting isometric Hack 'n Slash / Action Adventure.
      • 1-3 player (single/co-op) gameplay, with both local and online multiplayer.
      • Asymmetrical gameplay with completely unique characters & abilities!
      • Fast paced, challenging gameplay with focus on teamwork & communication.
      • An anime-inspired art style and beautiful hand drawn artwork!
      • A story mode with multiple levels, a ton of enemies, bosses and randomization!
      • An intense “Horde Mode” arena game mode with a world wide high score.
      • Upgrades allowing you to customize how your character plays.
      • Soul crushing challenges modifying the rules of the game.
      • Fully customizable difficulty settings (per stat tweakability).
      • Kick ass music by Two Feathers (just listen to that trailer!).
      • Keyboard/Mouse as well as full gamepad/controller support.
      • Easy to use emote-based in-game-communications.
      • Mid-range hardware requirements (won’t require a beast of a computer to run).
      • A feature rich Early Access Release on Steam in 2022.
      • More playable characters to be added during Early Access and after release.  

       

      Where can I find out more?  

      Check out our Steam Page and add the game to your wishlist to get a notification as we approach our release date. You can also join the official Discord Server to get the latest news, updates, beta access signup and participate in our fun contests!      

       

      Risks and challenges

      Based on all the horror stories of games being abandoned after a successful campaign, we think it's obvious that the biggest risk of any indie game project is not being completed. We’re doing everything in our power to make sure this doesn’t happen to Go Fight Fantastic!

      We’ve been living and breathing this game for the last 4+ years, investing all of our time and money into it – and we’ve had friends and family invest their hard earned money into the game. There’s simply no way we’re gonna stop now and disappoint ourselves and everyone who’s invested in the game. No matter what!

      As a small team our biggest challenge is working against the clock. We believe in having honest and transparent communication with our followers and backers, always letting you know what’s going on. Throughout the whole project, we’ve had a clear plan for the scope of the game. Every feature added has been discussed thoroughly in terms of both value to the game and development time/cost. We’ve killed darlings to maintain a realistic scope in order to make sure we can actually deliver on our vision, both from a financial and a technical standpoint.

      And lastly, regarding the Covid-19 situation: We take the situation extremely seriously, working from home and keeping interactions to an absolute minimum. That said, being dependent on external manufacturing of rewards/perks as well as for international shipping routes/logistics, there's always the risk of a slight delay when it comes to reward/perk fulfillment. To avoid delays to the best of our abilities, we'll make sure to start manufacturing of rewards/perks and prepare for shipping a few months ahead of time.

       

      Special Thanks!

      We want to give a huge thank you to our amazing friends and family who have supported us in so many ways since the start of this project. We simply couldn’t have done it without you. We love you guys!❤️

      We also want to thank Two Feathers (Elvira & Nicklas) for all their hard work on the music for the trailer! How great is that song, right?

      And special thanks to our amazing interns we’ve had over the years; Jesper, Emmi & Jessica. Thank you for all your hard work! You’re awesome!

      And finally a special shoutout and thanks to our friends at East Sweden Games in Linköping who have welcomed us with open arms to various expos/conventions/trade shows as well as inviting us to do a talk about the development of the game. If you’re a game developer, you should definitely look these guys up!

We’ll add as many as we (and you, our community) can come up with!   Music & Sound Design We’re fortunate to have our friends at Two Feathers working on music and sound design for the game! Two Feathers have previously worked on music and sound design for titles such as Angry Birds 2, Warhammer: Vermintide 2, Aragami, Apex Construct, Hammerwatch and many more. Given what they created for the trailer, we're super exicited to hear what they come up with next!Check out their website here: https://www.twofeathersstudio.com/   Release PlansThe game has been in development for just over 4 years and we’re pushing hard to have the game available on Steam Early Access in 2022. At that point we want the game to be mostly feature complete with the remaining work being focused on adding more levels, characters, upgrades and challenges - and improving features and gameplay further.  So how far along is the game?Everything you see in the trailer is actual gameplay footage from the latest build of the game, so the game is currently very much playable and has already been shown at expos in different stages for the last year or so. The Closed Beta is currently live for all backers and we’re currently gearing up for Open Beta-weekends, starting this February!  Much of the focus so far has been on making sure the game is fun, engaging and super tight which has meant a lot of hard work, gameplay testing, re-thinking and killing the right darlings to get things like combat mechanics, character abilities, interesting combos and animations super solid!  Our very first technical prototype that sparked the idea for Go Fight Fantastic! Why Early Access?As a small team, it’s important for us to get the game out to the public as soon as possible in order to get feedback on gameplay, level design and to solidify technical aspects of the game such as multiplayer matchmaking and difficulty curve presets. This will ensure we avoid common pitfalls such as producing a ton of levels and objectives without ever testing them in the wild. Our vision of the Early Access release is to deliver a game which is as close to feature complete as possible with as few bugs as possible and to add content such as levels, more playable characters, etc along the way. We'll embed a development/release timeline straight into the game making sure you know what’s coming and when!  The Team  We are Lina (art) and Johan (code), a nerdy couple from Sweden who are super passionate about games, creativity and tech. The Team: Lina (Art/Animation), Johan (Tech/Code) & Bowie (Captainy stuff)Together we run a two person production company/studio which allow us to realize our wildest creative dreams. ​We have been fortunate enough to be able to work together for the last 9 years, recently with the addition of our puppy/morale booster Bowie (who’s in the game as Captain Bowie).   We need your help! Before we started working on this project, we both worked full time producing visual content for advertising agencies, retail stores and more. After ending up in perpetual crunch mode working 12-16 hour days, we decided to quit our day jobs and start focusing full time on our dreams and the things we’re most passionate about: game development!  We pooled all of our money and set out to follow our dreams - fully committed to optimizing our day to day costs and spend all of our savings on this massive undertaking. Going on just over 4 years now, we’ve been working and will continue to work without any income until the project is complete, which is why we need your help!            Our Home Office where we make the game!With the resources we have left, crowd funding is a chance for us to keep funding the development of the project without having to go bankrupt in the process. With your help, we’ll be able to see the rest of the development through without having to worry about how to put food on the table. It would also go a long way towards funding more amazing sound design and music by Two Feathers.         Game Features
A vibrant, fun and exciting isometric Hack 'n Slash / Action Adventure.

1-3 player (single/co-op) gameplay, with both local and online multiplayer.

Asymmetrical gameplay with completely unique characters & abilities!

Fast paced, challenging gameplay with focus on teamwork & communication.

An anime-inspired art style and beautiful hand drawn artwork!

A story mode with multiple levels, a ton of enemies, bosses and randomization!
An intense “Horde Mode” arena game mode with a world wide high score.

Upgrades allowing you to customize how your character plays.

Soul crushing challenges modifying the rules of the game.
Fully customizable difficulty settings (per stat tweakability).
Kick ass music by Two Feathers (just listen to that trailer!).

Keyboard/Mouse as well as full gamepad/controller support.
Easy to use emote-based in-game-communications.

Mid-range hardware requirements (won’t require a beast of a computer to run).
A feature rich Early Access Release on Steam in 2022.


More playable characters to be added during Early Access and after release.  
 Where can I find out more?  Check out our Steam Page and add the game to your wishlist to get a notification as we approach our release date. You can also join the official Discord Server to get the latest news, updates, beta access signup and participate in our fun contests!       Risks and challengesBased on all the horror stories of games being abandoned after a successful campaign, we think it's obvious that the biggest risk of any indie game project is not being completed. We’re doing everything in our power to make sure this doesn’t happen to Go Fight Fantastic!We’ve been living and breathing this game for the last 4+ years, investing all of our time and money into it – and we’ve had friends and family invest their hard earned money into the game. There’s simply no way we’re gonna stop now and disappoint ourselves and everyone who’s invested in the game. No matter what! As a small team our biggest challenge is working against the clock. We believe in having honest and transparent communication with our followers and backers, always letting you know what’s going on. Throughout the whole project, we’ve had a clear plan for the scope of the game. Every feature added has been discussed thoroughly in terms of both value to the game and development time/cost. We’ve killed darlings to maintain a realistic scope in order to make sure we can actually deliver on our vision, both from a financial and a technical standpoint.And lastly, regarding the Covid-19 situation: We take the situation extremely seriously, working from home and keeping interactions to an absolute minimum. That said, being dependent on external manufacturing of rewards/perks as well as for international shipping routes/logistics, there's always the risk of a slight delay when it comes to reward/perk fulfillment. To avoid delays to the best of our abilities, we'll make sure to start manufacturing of rewards/perks and prepare for shipping a few months ahead of time. Special Thanks!We want to give a huge thank you to our amazing friends and family who have supported us in so many ways since the start of this project. We simply couldn’t have done it without you. We love you guys!❤️We also want to thank Two Feathers (Elvira & Nicklas) for all their hard work on the music for the trailer! How great is that song, right?And special thanks to our amazing interns we’ve had over the years; Jesper, Emmi & Jessica. Thank you for all your hard work! You’re awesome!And finally a special shoutout and thanks to our friends at East Sweden Games in Linköping who have welcomed us with open arms to various expos/conventions/trade shows as well as inviting us to do a talk about the development of the game. If you’re a game developer, you should definitely look these guys up!

story:
About Game

First off - Most likely everything you see in photos is going to be updated and much better - This is funding for a project to get better programs to animate, model and get some characters, animals and in overall get the game done to show to the world.

There are 2 reasons we are creating this game.

The first reason is that we loved playing Rust Legacy and we would like to give it a Legacy map or at least try to make it similar for a great nostalgic feeling and old Rust players will appreciate that.
Beside map, things like natural disasters, soldiers searching the map having a hidden fortress,
sicknesses, a huge amount of animals, beautiful graphics and much more
to make the game more exciting.

And finally, the second reason is that we haven't seen a studio that would
really listen to people and care about what they think and want.
So we are going to frequently post polls and info about updates.


We have a lot of stuff coming and every help would be appreciated. 
This is our first project and we are going to put in all our efforts to make it "perfect". 
Thank you for every help.

If you have any questions, offers, ideas - don't hesitate to e-mail us!
support@trytosurvivegame.com 

What We Need

 

As we haven't told you yet, we are just a 2-man team and that doesn't give us many chances to finish the game without spending money onto it. As we are also putting all of our time and efforts into the development and as we are really young, we don't have many chances to actually work and get it by ourselves (especially that amount).

But we can achieve it, together.

What You Get

Not only that you will help us a LOT (for what we would be really happy), You will also get a gift from us depending on how much you donate.

5$ - The Very First Player - Steam CD-KEY before release
30$ - Beta tester - Possibility to play before release
300$ - Special Donor - More info in the perk's tab

IMPORTANT
There is a possibility that skins are going to be added into the game (depending just on players choice) and if this will happen, every donator will get a unique skin according to perk he bought.
These skins will be acquirable only in the funding phase.

If we won't break the goal anyway, we are going to continue and get this game done no matter what.

The Impact You Make

We are doing all we can to make the game perfect, but this will be hardly be achieved without you. 
By donating any amount of money to us will get us faster and much better results - for example:
 

Optimization - So important for us and so for You, player.
Graphics - To have the best experience of the game by the visual side.
Gameplay - Making the game more exciting, giving us more opportunities and stuff to add.

Programs - Buying programs that would rapidly speed up our work.

Any donate (even the smallest amount) is really helpful, as this is our first project and we have nothing to take the funds from.

What are the Risks & Challenges?

AI

We want to make the game perfect because AI is going to have a huge impact on the game, so we have some struggles to overcome:

The first struggle will be with AI (Soldiers) that are going to search through the map in night time and defend radiations in the daytime.
Another one will be randomly hiding soldiers getting your position.
And the last one and least - animals to imitate them close to reality.
We will try to make the AI smart as we can.

 

Optimization

Our main goal is to optimize the game as much as possible so that You will be able to play it with the beautiful graphics we prepared.

Current specifications (haven't been working on optimizing yet):

AMD-FX 8370
NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 3GB
16GB RAM

Ultra - 50-60 FPS
Medium - 120 FPS
Low - 140 FPS

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We get that some of you don't have money to give, so you can help in other ways:

Share us with Indiegogo on social sites!

Like and follow our Facebook page

Anything with development (models, animating) - contact us: support@trytosurvivegame.com

Contact

Facebook (Eternity Games)
Website (in development)
E-mail: support@trytosurvivegame.com
Indiegogo: (Ask a Question)

story:
Deep Space - The Low Down

Story Introduction

The year is 2276; Humanity has reached beyond the confinements of Earth yearning towards the stars.

Headed by the Earth Government, colony development on suitable planets has begun the farthest of this is located on planet Orion IV. Planet side population had just exceeded 50,000 when contact was lost.

Standard protocols in place a task force of 6 was sent from Earth to investigate this strange cause. Enter you, the player, is this just another routine investigation or is something else happening?

Enter the nightmare.

The Team

Shay Walmsley - Project Manager, Programmer and the brains behind the project

Hello, The name is Shay my profile and the above would suggest. I am currently a student at Stratford High School and am a passionate gamer who has began to tread into game development. Deep Space is my brainchild  and will be the 3rd game I have developed. I am hopefull for this game to take off and to achieve this I have brought on some great people I know.

Brody Heal - Lead Programmer

Hey I'm Brody and I also am a student at Stratford High School for the past 4 years which is where me and Shay meet. Together we worked on a few projects some with the school and others we though of ourself and throughout it, I learnt alot of my now talent with computers and all things electronics. With our current project Deep Space I hope we can build the world class game we desire.

Jacob Foley - Content Designer/Director

Hello, I am Jacob. I'm currently a student at Stratford high school, I have joined in and helped with the development of deep space and am really looking forward to it being a success.

Andrew Mallows - Concept Developer/ Art Director

Jonty Marshall-Smith - Storyline Developer

Bonjour and hello, firstly I'd like to introduce myself. My name is Jonty and I studied at a range of school's, I'm quite into games just not much for developing them. This is why I have stepped back and I shall only test to help fine tune this game. I have given a hand at game development in the past such as; Having a design off against Shay..which undoubtedly he won. The game "Deep Space" in which is showcased will be a huge leap for all of us and we have high hopes for it. We just hope you're going to enjoy it as much as we do, happy adventuring (:

Alex Preston - General Manager

Our Vision

Our overall vision is to prove that the bit era graphics still have a place amongst First Person Shooters above all else.

Why We Need You

Unfortunitly to create the great game I envisioned we need money to cover costs such as engine licensing (The free version of Unity3D is missing features we need), some software such as Adobe Photoshop (It is easier to use familier software) aswell as  some hardware and the submission cost to the Xbox Live Arcade and Steam which we have chosen as our platforms.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribute at our Steam concept page http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=116517711&searchtext

 

Misc.

Feel free to contact us with anything  at our temporary
e-mail deep_space@outlook.com

story:
Short Summary

David Schwimmer's Haunted House is an ambitious indie title, which will offer players an experience never before seen in the gaming industry. A point and click adventure game, you play as a psychic die-hard David Schwimmer fan, who has been hired by David Schwimmer to vanquish the spirits that have taken up residence in his haunted house. As the story progresses though, you soon realise all is not as it seems, and it becomes a race against time to uncover the truth behind the spirits that occupy this house, and the secrets they and David Schwimmer hold.

I should also add I have absolutely no idea what I'm doing, but if enough people show interest in a David Schwimmer-based point and click game, I will definitely make this a reality. Like I haven't done any research into this at all, I'm not even sure if David Schwimmer would be cool with me doing this, but it seemed like too good an idea to pass up so I'm just throwing it out there and winging it.

The game will follow in the footsteps of classic point and click adventure games such as The Seventh Guest, featuring a more basic style in that vein, complete with pixelated images of David Schwimmer, and painfully screechy MIDI files of David Schwimmer quotes, much like you'd expect from an old Pokemon game when sending out your Pokemon, only this wouldn't be a Pokemon, it would be David Schwimmer.

In conclusion, a show of support will make the David Schwimmer's Haunted House game a reality, and at the end of the day, what more could anyone really want?

Risks & Challenges

I am totally winging this, I'm probably going to make David Schwimmer very upset. The challenge is finding out if there is a legitimate market for people who would play a David Schwimmer-based point-and-click adventure game modeled after games well over two decades old. The other challenge would be avoiding a hefty lawsuit from David Schwimmer's lawyers upon discovering there is a David Schwimmer Haunted House game.
Other Ways You Can Help

Don't give me money, just tell me you want this to happen and I'll try again with better planning, but actually planning something. Consider all prices a teaser of what could be on offer should a David Schwimmer game come to be.

story:
Help us to bring this project come to live.

Imposito is Open World Fantasy Action-RPG Game. You can create your character and go to adventure with many routes of personal story and numerous side quests. Player can freely explore the world and dungeons. Find the materials to crafting powerful items. Upgrade your character during your journey.


       Imposito is The land where magic and great technology live side-by-side.     Home to the countless conflicts among the five great races.

       Experience the world of ImpositO as a member of the human race and forge an alliance with the dwarfish Kon’Krae, the demonic Asura, the robotic Machina and the beastkin of Rakania to fight back against the forgotten vicious king. Form friendship as you trek across the continent to recruit friends and allies while bring an end to the bitter conflicts among the five great races.

Human

  Human has come a long way since the Shattering. Eons ago, human used to be the most prestigious of all races. They were the pioneer, the brave and the conqueror, united by a single emperor. Although they survived the Shattering, their empire did not. Over the centuries, they crumbled, facing rebellion and dangers from all sides. Human today is a shadow of their former self. 

Asura

    One of the most powerful combinations of spell and technology employed by the human of ancient Imperium is the summoning portal. This advancement allows them to call forth beings from the underworld that they label ‘demons’ for their fiery red skin and protruding horns.  Towards the end of the old empire, powerful mages have tried to enslave this magically powerful race, with little success. 

    The Asura’s homeland is small compared to those of other races and is at a very close proximity to the Shattered Continent, the epicenter of the Shattering. Because of this, the Asuran is at the frontline against the Corrupted horde from the lost continent of Lemuria. Despite their fearsome appearance, the Asuran shared a relatively amicable relationship with other races as they maintained a network of Rune Gate that world together.

Rakanian

   The grip of humanity reaches the north and the south, but it never managed to rule the west. The mist and the great jungle of this western continent and isles serve as a natural barrier that barred off human’s conquest over the course of centuries. For many years, the beastly people live in a reclusive society, away from that effect of the Shattering until the first ship arrived. By then, they encountered not only a powerful kingdom, but two great kingdoms of the Half-Beast that are in rivalry for dominance.


Machina

   At the first glance, Machina may seem like mindless machine with one single purpose in their mind, eradication of human. This isn’t entirely true however. Although their hatred for human is justified, they shared a relatively amicable relation with Kon’kraes, whom they owed an eternal gratitude of being saved and maintained by them after their revolt against human masters.

   Unlike the other races, these Machina are led by no sole ruler. Instead of a king or an emperor, they are under the single but unified directive of the Primarch (or PRIME-ARK), the collective consciousness of all Machina.

Kon’krae

Kon’krae has divided into many clans. The most prominent of them all are the Armistat and the Banking clan. The former engaged in arms trade with everyone far and wide while the latter conducted continent-wide banking enterprise. Together in a friendly rivalry, these two clans displayed Kon’krae’s prominence to other races.



- Many routes of story up to your choice and your action.
- Various weapons and skills.
- Player's Passive Ability for upgrade your character up to your style.
- Elemental and Abnomal Status.
- Crafting system. You can create powerful items with this system.
- Many kind of monsters to make you fun for defeating them.
- There are strong monsters spawn randomly for excite adventure.
- High friendly NPC can join your party.



3 set of T-shirt and than choose you color and size

Figure scale 1/8 ( Around 20-22 cm hight )


Hitbear Studio is the group of indie game developers. We are developer of
Action-RPG Starter Kit, Platformer Action-RPG, Top-Down Action RPG and Shooting RPG - Starter Kit  in Unity Asset Store.

This game will take 1-2 years to developed. Because this is the large scale project. We need the funds for extend our team to make this game better and faster.

Q: When this game will be released?
A: We planned to released this game in 2017

Q: Will this game have co-op multiplayer?.
A: It's depend on we can reach the stretch goal on Indiegogo or not.

Q: What's the platform of this game.
A: This game is for PC , Mac OS and Linux.

Q: Will this game support game controller.
A: Yes, This game will support game controller.

world together.

Rakanian
   The grip of
humanity reaches the north and the south, but it never managed to rule the
west. The mist and the great jungle of this western continent and isles serve
as a natural barrier that barred off human’s conquest over the course of
centuries. For many years, the beastly people live in a reclusive society, away
from that effect of the Shattering until the first ship arrived. By then, they
encountered not only a powerful kingdom, but two great kingdoms of the
Half-Beast that are in rivalry for dominance. 

Machina
   At the
first glance, Machina may seem like mindless machine with one single purpose in
their mind, eradication of human. This isn’t entirely true however. Although
their hatred for human is justified, they shared a relatively amicable relation
with Kon’kraes, whom they owed an eternal gratitude of being saved and
maintained by them after their revolt against human masters.
   Unlike the
other races, these Machina are led by no sole ruler. Instead of a king or an
emperor, they are under the single but unified directive of the Primarch (or
PRIME-ARK), the collective consciousness of all Machina.

Kon’krae
Kon’krae has divided into many clans. The most prominent of them all are the
Armistat and the Banking clan. The former engaged in arms trade with everyone
far and wide while the latter conducted continent-wide banking enterprise.
Together in a friendly rivalry, these two clans displayed Kon’krae’s prominence
to other races.

- Many routes of story up to your choice and your action. - Various weapons and skills. 
- Player's Passive Ability for upgrade your character up to your style. 
- Elemental and Abnomal Status. 
- Crafting system. You can create powerful items with this system. 
- Many kind of monsters to make you fun for defeating them. 
- There are strong monsters spawn randomly for excite adventure. 
- High friendly NPC can join your party. 3 set of T-shirt and than choose you color and sizeFigure scale 1/8 ( Around 20-22 cm hight )Hitbear Studio is the group of indie game developers. We are developer of
Action-RPG Starter Kit, Platformer Action-RPG, Top-Down Action RPG and Shooting RPG - Starter Kit  in Unity Asset Store. This game will take 1-2 years to developed. Because this is the large scale project. We need the funds for extend our team to make this game better and faster.
Q: When this game will be released?
A: We planned to released this game in 2017

Q: Will this game have co-op multiplayer?.
A: It's depend on we can reach the stretch goal on Indiegogo or not.Q: What's the platform of this game.A: This game is for PC , Mac OS and Linux.
Q: Will this game support game controller.A: Yes, This game will support game controller.

story:
Our Mission

Functional Play is a company dedicated to creating an evolved gaming system to provide a fitness experience to all users that is enjoyable, yet functional at the same time. CEO Alex Dilone has worked in the fitness industry for over fifteen years and has committed his life to research and practice of effective training methods for his clients. His ultimate goal is ensuring that everyone lives a fit and healthy lifestyle by being aware of the right information and becoming proactive in their approach to fitness. Functional Play was born from his love of gaming and desire to make fitness fun and accessible for generations to come. As gaming keeps changing before our eyes with new technologies like the smart television and google glasses, we are confident that our products would still serve a great purpose, even if in time the traditional console becomes obsolete.

The Team

Our team is excited to take fitness gaming to new heights and break barriers in home entertainment for adults. We are a skilled group of fitness experts and engineers who are excited to start working on the bright future of fitness gaming and active simulations. The products we create are carefully thought through to ensure that they are not only extremely useful, but as entertaining as possible for the public to stay engaged. 

  

Exercises

The kettlebell is a dynamic tool that allows the user to achieve rapid results in weight loss and muscle tone through strength training and cardio exercises. It is essential in helping to target the core of the body and the rest of the muscle groups, while allowing the body to perform smooth and explosive movements. Users interested in proper exercise form, better performance, and rapid results will find that the Functional Play Gaming Kettlebell is the perfect product. Additionally the kettlebell is safer to use than traditional dumbells and barbells.

Design

Our basic kettlebell model is just like a traditional kettlebell with a round weighted ball attached to a handle. It starts at three pounds and there are addtional weight pills which can be added. There is a two pound weight pill and a larger five pound weight pill. We are also working on a weight sleeve for our gaming kettlebell that will help increase the weight by five, ten and fifteen pounds. The buttons are strategically placed on the sides of the ball and inside the grips of the handle to provide the user fluid access in gaming situations. The two mini-analog buttons are added to the outside corner of the handle and on the belly of the kettlebell for comfortable controlling and targeting. 

Close-up view of the trigger handle of the kettlebell featuring the mini-analog and handle buttons.

A look at small weight pills being inserted into the bottom of the kettlebell.

Our design also gives the user smooth and dynamic control in many games and simulations including driving, shooter and swing action games.

Software/Gaming

The software for Functional Play's Kettlebell Coach provides a clean interface where the user can create a profile and customized workout program where they can track their progress.  Users can choose which fitness coach will guide them based on the workouts that they want to do and level of intensity. 

Kettlebell Coach users will be able to perform all kinds of cardio and strength training exercises. Additionally, Kettlebell Coach will allow the user to play swing-action games such as barrel tossing, bocce ball, horseshoe toss and many more.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are working to raise $275,000 for developing the software and working prototypes to make Functional Play a reality. We have organized a winning team and created basic prototype models. Details, from proper sensor placing to weight and durability have been carefully examined. However, we do need additional funds to create the software and hardware for the actual game. Those who contribute to the Functional Play campaign will help to provide all users from serious gamers, adults, and young adults with a unique experience that will be fun as well as productive. People who contribute to our campaign will receive great perks from merchandise, camp participation and Bay Area theme trips where the concept of Functional Play was realized. Look to the right for description of contribution perks.

The Budget Summary is as follows:

Functional Play Crew $70,000

Alex Dilone (Creator/CEO)

Raj Narayanan (Consulting Engineer)

Brian Leitner (Designer)

Jennifer Dilone (Marketing Manager)

Jator Pierre Gonzalez (Training Program Director)

Cheri Bell (Kettlebell Training Director)

Royce West (Sound Master)

Scott Marshall (Media Production) 

Felix Torres-Chaviano (Prototypes)

Benkei Moores (Art Director)

Software Development through Precelor $60,000 - $120,000

Facility Costs $20,000

Manufacturing $65,000

The Impact

Functional Play is very important to the world and not just the gaming industry.  Diabetes, heart disease, and other ailments are all on the rise. Obesity is at epidemic rates in America and fitness as a whole seems to be less of a priority for most people.  At the same time, more and more children, youth, and adults are turning to video games for recreation. We believe that by combining a unique fitness experience with gaming, we can help people enjoy their training routine to help make fitness a part of everyday life.

Choosing the Kettlebell as one of our centerpiece products is something we have taken great pride in. We want to assist the public towards the effective use of kettlebells, and unlock this dynamic training tool that builds muscle, helps balance your core strength, melts away fat, helps to train for explosive movement, and is a cardio tool like no other. The list goes on and on... From a young athlete who can't quite get the mechanics of a power clean, to a stay at home parent who wishes to take a challenging cardio class in the middle of the day, our gaming Kettlebell will introduce a safer and easier way to learn these complex exercises. Muscle memory will enable the body to remember these moves and apply them to specific sports skills and activities. 

The Functional Play Gaming Kettlebell will allow people to participate in fitness and sport simulations such as cricket, aerobics, wood chops and other fun exercises and workouts. The controls can also be used for other popular games like RPG's, first-person shooters, driving, and many more. Video games will not go away, but we at Functional Play do pledge to combine fitness and gaming to help spread awareness about being healthy while still having fun.

Other Ways You Can Help

We urge you to please contribute to Functional Play’s campaign. Help us realize our dream to make fitness fun for everyone. Our camps would make a great gift for that family member, friend or co-worker who needs a positive jump start and a new challenge. As one of our camp goers please help us to keep everyone safe by getting a doctor's aproval in writing to clear you for the moderate to challenging physical activity. Our camps will be open for people eighteen years or older and of different fitness levels, that is why it is extremly important to be cleared to participate. If you cannot contribute financially, please do help spread the word far and wide so that people who might be able to contribute will have a chance to hear about us and how Functional Play can help. We have experience with talking to game makers and understand the amount of work that goes in to this, but with the proper support you can help this rising company near the edge of the Silicon Valley make an impact around the world. Thank you so much and be sure to check out all of the content and tools on the Indiegogo site!
