story:
• Endless fun – all worlds are endless generated while playing

  • Two hand multitouch control – designed for Smartphone

  • Explore 3 beautiful and colorful worlds in unique style

  • Move completely free, full way up & down

  • Solve over 100 tricky missions on your way through the journey

  • Unlock and upgrade many unique items

  • Collect different achievements and trophies

  • Pure gaming - no internet connection required, no in-app-purchase, no Facebook log-in, no ads


RatRun is an endless-runner Smartphone game, developed fully with HTML5 canvas. We aim to release for iOS and Android (Windows and other platforms may be added later). You control a little rat called “Randy” and run through three beautiful worlds to solve over 100 missions. You can also collect a bunch of "over all" achievements with claiming increments or hunt for special medals and trophies in every world. Lovely graphics and gorgeous animations combined with a lot of features and possibilities will guarantee a lot of fun and amusing gameplay for days. The game will be available in at least 3 languages (English, German, French), more Languages will be added in the future.




The Storyline is very simple and easy to understand. The friends of our main character “Randy” got kidnapped by a bad snake and its allegiance. You help Randy rescue his friends by completing missions and unlock new worlds by fighting against evil bosses. Your journey starts at the forest and goes through sewerage to find its (short-term) end at the evil snake’s castle. While running through the worlds Randy collect cheese – the games currency – with which you can buy many new helpful items for your journey. There is a well balanced shop system with cool permanent items and upgrades as well as onetime items to help though single missions.



We decided to assemble a never seen graphical environment with lots of details and build up three unique worlds with creepy creatures and enemies within. The controls gives you the opportunity either to jump over objects and barricades or use the “full way up and down” control to avoid a collision.



RatRun has been in development for almost one year now and we are very proud to present it to you in these days! After hundreds of hours the work is almost done, and the game is in its final stages before we launch it in July 2014. So why do we need your support?

  • Soft- and Hardware are (unfortunately) very expensive

  • Sound effects and music

  • Costs for licensing and developing the game on the different platforms (additional cost for hosting in stores)

  • Market the game (domain, web space, advertising, etc.)

  • Some money for translating to other languages

  • Test devices for support & testing

  • Cool benefits for you

This is how the money will be used:

Beyond financial help we also need to share our project-idea with the whole world. We would really appreciate, if you could spread the word and share this project with all of your friends which are interested in our game and this campaign. We are very thankful for every kind of support you can afford.


Our goal is to aim at least at 3.500 € so we get back what we already invested to show you our work and this project. Anyway we can stretch this goal to provide you an idea what can happen.


NOTE: All tiers (5€ and above) include RatRun the game for Android or iOS and rewards from all previous/lower tiers.

  • 1 € - Thank you for support

  • 5 € - Wallpaper “Rat Run” / "Wall of Fame" register on fanpage (if desired)

  • 10 € - Awesome art book – (pdf version)

  • 20 € - Cool set of stickers – they stick everywhere

  • 40 € - Get the original Randy cup

  • 75 € - Randy art poster print

  • 120 € - Get an awesome T-shirt

  • 150 € - Get the art book as hardcover with all dev team signatures

  • 200 € Get part of special thanks selection in game credits – limited








Nico Leithoff Simon Widany
The graphics guy The man behind the code

Facebook-Fanpage

Rat-Run Website

story:
Hallo und Herzlich Willkommen bei AKIBA-Adventure of Lasergame

In unserer Geschichte machte sich im Jahre 1923 eine Expedition auf nach Afrika, um den Dschungel im Kongo zu erforschen. Die Leitung dieser Expedition hatte der berühmte deutsche Forscher Walter Sterner und beginnen sollte ihre Reise in Port Gentil, von wo sie von Einheimischen in die Tiefen des afrikanischen Dschungels geführt wurden.

Bereits kurz nach ihrem Start verlor man jeden Kontakt und nur durch Zufall entdeckte man Jahre später den Leiter der Expedition lebend in einem selbstgebauten Baumhaus. Doch bis heute sind die Umstände des Verschwindens und der Verbleib der anderen Expeditionsteilnehmer ungewiss. Nach dem Tod von Walter Sterner erbte sein Urenkel sein Tagebuch und machte sich mit dessen Hilfe auf, den Spuren der Expedition zu folgen und das Rätsel der verschollenen Expedition zu lösen und die Geheimnisse der Stadt der AKIBA zu erforschen.

Zu diesem Abenteuer wollen wir euch gerne mitnehmen, den Namen von diesem Urenkel könnt Ihr durch einen Perk bestimmen. Der Inhalt des Tagebuchs wird auf der Internetseite von Akiba Adventure of Lasergame wöchentlich preisgegeben. 

Unsere Idee

Ihr beginnt euer Abenteuer auf einem Expeditionsschiff dessen Name kann durch den Erwerb eines Perk gewählt werden. Auf dem Expeditionsschiff bekommt ihr dann eure Ausrüstung, welche von Lasergame Deutschland stammt. Sie besteht aus einem Markierer und einem Stirnband. Hier werdet ihr auch in 2 Gruppen aufgeteilt, einmal die Forscher und die Bewahrer. Dann geht es los zu den Startpunkten, diese befinden sich in gegenüberliegenden Ecken der Arena. Die Startpunkte sind wie Zelte gestaltet. Dass der Bewahrer im Stil von Beduinen und das der Forscher wie die englischen Entdeckerzelte Anfang des 19. Jahrhunderts. Und dann geht es los. Es gilt die meisten Punkte zu sammeln, dies wird durch markieren von Mitspielern des gegnerischen Teams mit dem Markierer ermöglicht.

                                           

In der Arena wollen wir kleine Gimmicks einbauen, welche ihr von bekannten Abenteuerfilmen kennt. Auch wollen wir Rätsel welche beim lösen Extrapunkte bedeuten einbauen. Diese Rätsel sind auch beim Abenteuer-Modus wichtig, denn nur wenn diese gelöst sind kommt Ihr eine Runde weiter.

Richtig gelesen es wird verschiedene Modi geben, den normalen und den Abenteuer-Modus, welcher Rätsel und eine eindrucksvolle Beleuchtung bietet.

Wer sind wir?

Wir sind Andrea und Patrick Leesemann und sind nun seit 9 Jahren ein gut eingespieltes Team und seit 2012 verheiratet. Andrea hat die kreativen und manchmal verrückten Ideen und Patrick kann sie dann im rechten Maß umsetzen, so gehen uns niemals die Ideen für neue Abenteuer und Weiterentwicklungen aus.
Zusammen haben wir das Konzept von Akiba-Adventure of Lasergame entwickelt und haben fast täglich neue Ideen, welche wir alsbald umsetzen wollen. Uns werdet ihr auch in der Arena antreffen, denn zusammen managen wir die Halle in Leverkusen-Opladen.

                                     


Was haben wir schon?

Wir haben eine Halle, in Leverkusen-Opladen, angemietet und dort sind wir bereits fleißig am renovieren, den größten Kostenposten haben wir durch einen privaten Investor ermöglichen können. Jedoch brauchen wir nun noch ein wenig Unterstützung bei den kleinen aber feinen Details und dazu brauchen wir euch.

Was wir noch kaufen wollen?

  1. Kunstpflanzen

  2. echte Pflanzen

  3. stimmungsvolle Lampen

  4. Farbe

  5. Schiffsdekoration

  6. Elektronik für Rätsel

  7. Soundanlage

Ihr könnt uns durch den Erwerb verschiedener Perks unterstützen, wie durch den Erwerb einer Plakette, welche dann auf unserem Ausrüstungs-Schiff am Mast angebracht wird. Eins von den T-Shirts auf dem das Logo von Akiba oder die verschiedenen Logos der Gegnerparteien abgebildet ist. Diese haben später auch noch eine besondere Bedeutung wenn Ihr damit gekleidet zu uns kommt. 

               

Symbol der Bewahrer                         Symbol der Forscher

Mit der Silber- oder Goldkarte habt Ihr ein Leben lang auf jedes Spiel Rabatt. Auch könnt Ihr die Helden unserer Geschichte benennen, das heißt den Urenkel und den Anführer der Bewahrer. Und zu guter Letzt könnt Ihr selber Teil der Geschichte werden. Ihr bestimmt euch als Person, welche Walter Sterner zur Seite steht oder auch ein neuer Feind ist. Oder ihr bestimmt, was Walter Sterner als nächstes passieren soll.

Unsere Aktion ist so kurz, da wir schon mitten drin sind und so schnell wie möglich eröffnen wollen. Darum bitten wir dich teil unsere Aktion mit deinen Freunden.

Wir freuen uns dich bei Akiba-Adventure of Lasergame zu sehen.

Andrea und Patrick

Namen von diesem Urenkel könnt Ihr durch einen Perk bestimmen. Der Inhalt des
Tagebuchs wird auf der Internetseite von Akiba Adventure of Lasergame wöchentlich
preisgegeben.  
Unsere Idee
Ihr beginnt euer Abenteuer auf einem Expeditionsschiff
dessen Name kann durch den Erwerb eines Perk gewählt werden. Auf dem Expeditionsschiff
bekommt ihr dann eure Ausrüstung, welche von Lasergame Deutschland stammt. Sie
besteht aus einem Markierer und einem Stirnband. Hier werdet ihr auch in 2
Gruppen aufgeteilt, einmal die Forscher und die Bewahrer. Dann geht es los zu
den Startpunkten, diese befinden sich in gegenüberliegenden Ecken der Arena.
Die Startpunkte sind wie Zelte gestaltet. Dass der Bewahrer im Stil von Beduinen
und das der Forscher wie die englischen Entdeckerzelte Anfang des 19.
Jahrhunderts. Und dann geht es los. Es gilt die meisten Punkte zu sammeln, dies
wird durch markieren von Mitspielern des gegnerischen Teams mit dem Markierer
ermöglicht.                                            
In der Arena wollen wir kleine Gimmicks einbauen, welche ihr
von bekannten Abenteuerfilmen kennt. Auch wollen wir Rätsel welche beim lösen
Extrapunkte bedeuten einbauen. Diese Rätsel sind auch beim Abenteuer-Modus
wichtig, denn nur wenn diese gelöst sind kommt Ihr eine Runde weiter. 
Richtig gelesen es wird verschiedene Modi geben, den normalen
und den Abenteuer-Modus, welcher Rätsel und eine eindrucksvolle Beleuchtung
bietet. 
Wer sind wir?
Wir sind Andrea und Patrick Leesemann und sind nun seit 9
Jahren ein gut eingespieltes Team und seit 2012 verheiratet. Andrea hat die
kreativen und manchmal verrückten Ideen und Patrick kann sie dann im rechten
Maß umsetzen, so gehen uns niemals die Ideen für neue Abenteuer und
Weiterentwicklungen aus. 
Zusammen haben wir das Konzept von Akiba-Adventure of Lasergame entwickelt und
haben fast täglich neue Ideen, welche wir alsbald umsetzen wollen. Uns werdet ihr auch in der Arena antreffen, denn zusammen managen wir die Halle in
Leverkusen-Opladen.                                      
Was haben wir schon?
Wir haben eine Halle, in Leverkusen-Opladen, angemietet und
dort sind wir bereits fleißig am renovieren, den größten Kostenposten haben wir
durch einen privaten Investor ermöglichen können. Jedoch brauchen wir nun noch
ein wenig Unterstützung bei den kleinen aber feinen Details und dazu brauchen
wir euch. 
Was wir noch kaufen wollen?



Kunstpflanzen




echte Pflanzen




stimmungsvolle Lampen




Farbe




Schiffsdekoration




Elektronik für Rätsel




Soundanlage




Ihr könnt uns durch den Erwerb verschiedener Perks
unterstützen, wie durch den Erwerb einer Plakette, welche dann auf unserem
Ausrüstungs-Schiff am Mast angebracht wird. Eins von den T-Shirts auf dem das
Logo von Akiba oder die verschiedenen Logos der Gegnerparteien abgebildet ist.
Diese haben später auch noch eine besondere Bedeutung wenn Ihr damit gekleidet
zu uns kommt.                 Symbol der Bewahrer                         Symbol der ForscherMit der Silber- oder Goldkarte habt Ihr ein Leben lang auf jedes
Spiel Rabatt. Auch könnt Ihr die Helden unserer Geschichte benennen, das heißt
den Urenkel und den Anführer der Bewahrer. Und zu guter Letzt könnt Ihr selber
Teil der Geschichte werden. Ihr bestimmt euch als Person, welche Walter Sterner
zur Seite steht oder auch ein neuer Feind ist. Oder ihr bestimmt, was Walter
Sterner als nächstes passieren soll. 
Unsere Aktion ist so kurz, da wir schon mitten drin sind und
so schnell wie möglich eröffnen wollen. Darum bitten wir dich teil unsere
Aktion mit deinen Freunden. 
Wir freuen uns dich bei Akiba-Adventure of Lasergame zu sehen.
Andrea und Patrick

story:
Update - May 23rd

Version 1.2 of Chromian Wars is out. It features a lot of game upgrades and new content, including a whole new Arcade game mode, new AR Technology for better performance, and so on. Check it out on the App Store today!

Update - May 9th

Listen to a podcast interview I gave for iGame Radio, in which I talk about our project and how you can help!

 

Our Story

Hello there, my name is Elie Charest and I've worked in the game business for about 16 years. Last year, I started my own indie game studio, Miralupa, along with two long-time friends. We invested our own money in the project and raised the equivalent from family and friends who believed in us.

A year later, we've successfully published our first iPhone/iPad game: Chromian Wars, a miniature tank battle game in Augmented Reality! However, we weren't quite able to take it where we wanted to. In particular, we didn't quite have the budget to include one of the key elements of the game: a multiplayer mode where iOS and Android users can customize their tanks and go against each other in augmented reality arenas!

Now, our baby is at a crossroads. Since launching the game we've been busy doing work-for-hire projects as we continue making small improvements and updates on evenings and week-ends (the Android version, in particular, should be out this Spring).

We really believe this game has a chance to be successful if we can make it what it was always  meant to be: the first game to allow mobile gamers on competing platforms to play together in a shared augmented reality space. Please help us make that dream a reality and prove that crowdfunding is a viable alternative to game financing by funding this project!

 

The Impact

As mentioned above, Chromian Wars has been a labor of love for Miralupa's three founders. A successfully crowdfunding campaign will have an enormous impact on the games's future, and by extension of the future of our studio as a independent game developer. Failure to meet our target, on the other hand, will likely push back the development of Chromian Wars' multiplayer mode by months, and may kill the project altogether. While the company will go on, generating enough revenue from work-for-hire to live and grow, part of the dream will have died along with this crucial part of our development strategy.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Basically, we've estimated the financial cost of completing the multiplayer mode and providing some basic tank customization (new weapons, armor, paint coat, etc.) at a little less than 15,000$. This is mostly salaries for programmers and 3D artists, middleware licence costs, as well as a little bit of marketing money to get the word out about the "new and improved" version of Chromian Wars.

Should we exceed our goal, any additional money will go into producing more downloadable content for players to customize their tanks with, improving the game in general, and putting more money into marketing to make sure the game receives the attention it deserves. We may also offer more perks if the campaign is a significant success!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can help us in addition to pledging money to the project: you can talk about it on social networks, spread the word about IndieGoGo in general (and our project in particular), download and try the free version of our game on iOS (iPhone 4/4S, iPod Touch 4th generaion, iPad 2/New iPad) while it is still available, give it a high rating on the App Store, show it to friends and convince them how cool it would be to play the game with them in real-time augmented reality, and so on.

We have poured our heart and soul into this project. Please help us take it to the next level to realize its full potential, and keep alive the dream of these indie game developers!

story:
This deck is a result of two my passions: love to cards and love to draw, create, and also of my fascination about wolves.


Wolves always fascinated me at all: how they look, their behaviours and instincts. When I got an idea to design my own deck of playing cards it was obvious for me, that it must be about wolves.




Deck includes:

52 playing cards, with custom court cards and colors.
2 identical jokers.
1 double backer.
1 gaff card.



Court Cards

I wanted to make them custom and also simple, so they are similar to standard court cards. The biggest difference is head. I wanted to make them look like real people: beautiful ladies, handsome mens. They were inspired by real people.

 Kings

Queens

Jacks

Red cards

All number cards are standard, but red color is slightly different. It is not so bright like in standard cards. It is close to raspberry. 


Ace of Spades



Jokers

There are two simple, identical jokers.


Gaff card

There's one gaff card, below is link to one of many possibilities which it gaves:
https://instagram.com/p/7hVTC6HD9g/?taken-by=krzysiekcwikla


Tuck box

Box will be on mat paper, with color of back design. There is prediction of 7 of clubs on a flap.


Printing and fulfillment

Cards will be printed by Expert Playing Card Company with their Master Finish.
Gambler's Warehouse will handle fulfillment and shipping worldwide. 

Risks & Challenges

It is fixed campaign, so if we don't get our goal you will get your money back. The goal may looks big, but it includes all costs of production, fullfilment and shipping. It means that the biggest risk is not to get our goal. When we will get enough money it is sure that you will get your deck! 



If you have any questions fell free to contact me by Indiegogo :)

story:
I'm an avid poker player. It's my second life. I live and breathe it when I'm not working my day job.

My life dream is to play in the Main Event one day and I'm hoping that this can be the year. I know what you're thinking, "if you're so good, then why don't you just win the money you need to get there." Well, the answer is that I'm simply horrible managing my money. I'm sure I've won that much 10x over but I just can't hold on to it.

Send me to the World Series and I'll chop half of the winnings with you (proportional to your donation.) Let's get rich together.

story:
Lost in an enchanted forest, our brave heroes encounter a hideous evil warlock! In a blink of an eye their powerful weapons are destroyed and treasures stolen as they are overpowered by the enchanter's foul magic!
But this cannot be!

It's time to get up and fight! It's time to get your loot back and taste sweet revenge! It's time to start the RAMPAGE!

Rampage Knights is a cooperative beat 'em up game mixed up with randomized dungeon crawling and exploration which you can play alone or with a friend online.

You play as a hero trapped by a spell in a magical forest. All paths lead to a nearby ruined castle, where the source of the black magic covering the land is dwelling.

The game is inspired by the catchy formula of Binding of Isaac mixed with classic melee combat from games like Golden Axe. Each run you start with a bare hero and your goal is to get as far as possible in a dungeon with randomized items, spells, traps and encounters. Along the way your character evolves and changes (visually and gameplay-wise) as you find better weapons, items, magic powers and fight harder and harder monsters. Eventually you reach the final boss at the bottom of the pit (or your death).

You can play the game alone or with a friend online. We decided to focus online multiplayer on two people for now, mainly for technical reasons. If we see enough interest in the project we will add a stretch goal for three or four people multiplayer.

The main features of the game are:

  • Melee combat inspired by games like Golden Axe.
  • Randomly generated environment.
  • Gameplay is split into short (up to 60 minutes) separate runs.
  • Your hero evolves with new abilities and visually changes along the way.
  • The game contains a lot of spells, weapons and other items with game changing properties.
  • There is a long term progression system where you can level up different classes of your hero and unlock new things in the game.

The Combat

The game is focused on melee fighting. You possess a small but effective palette of deadly moves to quickly dispatch large groups of enemies. You can dash through groups of enemies, lift bodies in the air and throw them at others, crush lying monsters with stomping, swing the bodies around or juggle with the enemies in the air. Main sources of inspiration for the fighting style were games like Golden Axe or Castle Crashers.


The Dungeon

Randomly generated environment provides many special encounters, which will define your adventure and shape your hero. You will die a lot, but every time you play you get wildly different set of weapons, spells, magical features and also curses and disadvantages that will give you different opportunities and challenges.


The Loot

The game has large variety of items, that do more than just raising your damage. Imagine a sword that drops a crushing treasure chest from the sky when you hit multiple enemies. A boots that freeze an enemy, if you kick him in the groin. These are a few examples.


The Magic

On your journey you will learn powerful spells a skills, that add another form of attack. Some are classic like fireballs, some have weird effects, like a device that spawns machines capable to immobilize enemies or crack chests open. Others can drag enemies around or enchant them.


The Hero

The items and encounters can change your hero completely. You may go through the adventure as a glass cannon berserk, a bloodthirsty vampire who can heal of defeated enemies, or an undead who cannot heal at all. You may learn to fly or lose your jumping ability completely. You can turn into a monster or superhero with crazy powers. All depends on what resources you find in the dark depths below and how you decide to use them.


The Campaign

The gameplay is split into relatively short (up to 60 minutes) easy to pick up runs. It's something like a campaign in Left 4 Dead or a mission in Killing Floor. The combat is very challenging and you will probably die a lot, but with every respawn you will explore a new maze, you will get better and more experienced and you will each farther in the depths of the labyrinth.


Rampage Knights is more than just a quick action and a bunch of disjointed raids on the castle. When you die, you may lose your weapons and items, but you keep your combat experience. And with every attempt your hero gets better and better as you progress deeper into the dungeons of the dark castle.

After death you are resurrected in a camp of travelers you met in the woods, and who are trapped in the enchanted forest just like you. These NPCs give you several interestiong options! Let's meet the guys!

You cannot descent into the labyrinth without proper equipment. Apart from your melee weapon your hero have a spell, a potion, a magic scroll and throwing weapons.

It's much like Left 4 Dead, where you had your weapons, medkit and pills. You can carry only one item of each kind, so you need to use your limited inventory wisely to survive various enemy types and traps.

In addition to inventory items, you will find armors, belts, boots and also special type of items that can be used to permanently change your hero's appearance and abilities. Bigger items like armors are visible on your character.

To give you the taste what's in the game, here are weapons we have created so far.

Some of the things we plan to add that might trigger your interest:

What can you expect, if the campaign is successful and the game picks up significant interest? Here are some things we have on a "nice-to-have" list, which may end up in stretch goals in case we get lucky:

  • Local co-op mode. Play with your friend on one machine.
  • Warrior with different body type: woman, dwarf, giant.
  • Co-op for 3 or 4 people.
  • More detailed customization of a hero.
  • More content - enemies, items, bosses, unique encounters etc.
  • More comfortable networking for non-Steam version.
  • More platforms (PS4?).

Here is more detailed info on perks.

* Note that Steam keys are applicable only if we succeed in our Greenlight campaign. Please vote for Rampage Knights on Greenlight to make sure that the Steam version becomes reality!

This is the basic perk. Once the game is released you get a download link for a full version and a Steam key*.


You get a beta access. We plan to start the beta in fall 2014 in order to tweak the balance of the game and gather suggestions from larger audience. If the game gets through Greenlight the beta will be also available on Steam. Once the game is released you get a download link for a full version and a Steam key*.


Rampage Knights is a multiplayer game. "Double trouble" perk get you the game and also an extra copy and an extra Steam key*, so you can give it to your friend and play together. You both will also get the access to the beta/Early Access*.


You get everything from "Double Trouble" perk. On top of that you get a Steam key for a side scrolling shooter Jets'n'Guns and a PDF handbook for Rampage Knight containing detailed info on all enemies, weapons, items, encounters and other stuff in the dungeon.


You get everything from "Swords and Jets" perk and a pack of five games from Rake in Grass. The pack contains: Archibald's Adventures, Crystal Cave, Larva Mortus, Northmark and Styrateg.


Maybe you feel generous, maybe you really like Rake in Grass and want this game to succeed. You can throw in an extra 10 bucks to help us. For that your name (and nick name optionally) will be listed in the game credits in section for the top backers. See preview of the credits. Of course you get everything from the "Big Package" perk.

This perk is limited to 100 people.


Do you want to be in the game? There is a lot of ancient paintings hanging on the walls of the castle you explore. And some of them may have your likeness! This perk will get your face on the paintings in the game. The paintings are also slightly animated, so you will laugh, lift eyebrows or change the face as the heroes approach your painting. Here is an example of the end result:

The "Night in the Gallery" perk will get you:

  • Your face in one of the animated paintings.
  • A special place in credits with your painting and name. See preview of the credits.
  • Everything from the "Big Package" perk.

This perk is limited to 20 people.


This is the top level perk for the most generous patrons. "Dungeon Master" gives you the right to directly influence Rampage Knights by adding 3 key elements to the gameplay:

  • A weapon. You may help us to design an appearance and magical properties of a sword, an axe or a mace in the game. Weapon magic in our game can considerably change the game, heroes or even the environment.
  • A potion. You have the power to mix your own rare potion in the game. Potions are one of four core items used by the heroes to survive in the dungeon. You may devise whatever concievable mix of positive, negative, random or funny effects. Your brew can make the heroes levite or give them tails, greatly increate their strength or turn their heads into potatoes. That's up to you!
  • An encounter. You can create one type of special room or object in the game. Heroes meet these randomly in the labyrinth and they pose various threats and challenges for them. An example of such thing is a treasure room, where you can try to lockpick a chest full of gold and items. Another example is an iron maiden - a huge sinister metal case containing unknown dangerous monster. Heroes may choose to break it, release the monster and collect the reward for the kill. Or they may leave it be and run.

The "Dungeon Master" perk also contains the following:

  • You will get a large animated portrait in the game.
  • You will be listed on top of the backers section in game credits with your portrait, name and your contribution in the game. See preview of the credits.
  • Everything from the "Big Package" perk.

We reserve right to veto anything offensive, too hard to realize or game breaking.

This perk is limited to 3 people.


Why Indiegogo campaign?

We are far into the development of this game, but this is the moment when we need some outside help. We pump a lot of time and effort into the game design, code and graphics every day. Now we could use that extra push that will allow us to finish things in best possible and polished way, to outsource stuff we cannot do ourselves (like music), to improve networking etc.

We also want to test the interest of the public, get valuable feedback and suggestions and start some buzz around the game to let the world know that Rampage Knights are here and getting ready.

What is the money for?

  • Music and sounds. We don't have musician in out team so need to outsource.
  • Networking integration with Steam. We are hiring an external guy who will be implementing seamless integration with Steam so you and your friend can join an online game without a hassle.
  • Port of the game to Linux and Mac with proper gamepad support.
  • More game content. The more interest we generate with the Indiegogo campaign the more and crazier stuff we will be able to add in the game.

What are the risks? What's the status of the project now?

The only weakness of our team is, how slow we are. Knowing this we deliberately pushed the start of this campaign in the late stage of the development with release date in sight. We ask for your help now to successfuly finish this with as much good stuff in the game as possible!

Most of the important things - the combat, the environment generation, basic networking, hero profiles, etc. - is in the game already or partially finished. You can test it in the demo. We just started to implement bosses. Our goal and the biggest time consumer in the next few months will be to fill the game up with more content, and polish and balance the gameplay.

When will the game be released?

If we succeed, we will most probably get the game out of the gates in the beginning of 2015 (maybe earlier but not later). In fall 2014 we plan to start beta testing with backers in order to tweak the balance of the game and gather suggestions from larger audience. If the game gets through Greenlight the beta will be also available on Steam and we may also consider starting an Early Access program on Steam.

Will the game run on Mac or Linux? Will you support gamepad XY?

The game will run on Windows, Mac and maybe Linux, if we get enough backing. The demo now supports only Xbox 360 controller on Windows but the final game will support more gamepads on all platforms via SDL library.

Can I play online with a friend on a different platform?

Yes. You will be able to run the game on Windows and play online with a friend on Linux or Mac.

Will I get Steam key?

Yes. Once the game gets on Steam all backers will receive keys to redeem the game on Steam. Of course only in case the game gets through Greenlight. (Please vote for us.)

Will the game supports 3 or 4 players online co-op?

For now we promise only 2 players online co-op mode because supporting more players is much harder for technical reasons and would also require extra gameplay tweaks. If the Indiegogo campaign is successful we may add a stretch goal for 3 or 4 players online mode. Also note that 3 or 4 players online will be supported only in Steam version of the game.

Will the game supports 2 players local co-op on the same machine?

Local co-op is not supported for now. We may add this feature later when the game will be approaching the release date.

What is the difference between Steam and non-Steam version?

Steam version:

  • Networking using Steam matchmaking so playing online is as simple as pressing a button.
  • Steam achievements and stuff.
  • If we support 3 or 4 players online in the future it will be implemented in the Steam version.
  • Automatic gamepad configuration from Steam big picture mode.

Non-Steam version:

  • Networking similar to how it works in the tech demo.
  • Only 2 players online mode.

I don't have money / I don't trust you enough to pay so early, but the game looks interesting.

That's okay. We are poor and paranoid too :D. You can still help a lot by spreading the word about the game and voting for us on Greenlight.

Your involvement is crucial as there are thousands of small indie games out there and we have zero budget for marketing. It's very hard for us to let the world know we even exist, so your help would be invaluable.

Getting on Steam is another big deal. It's not just about sales. This is a multiplayer game. Networking is a really hard thing to do and Steam services will help a lot. The Steam version of the game will be integrated with Steam matchmaking so starting an online game will become much more comfortable.

Help us and get involved. Even if you cannot contribute to the campaign directly you can still support us by telling everybody about the game!

RiG's website

We are small game developing team of 3 people, active since 2000, located in Czech Republic. We are full time game developers with over a decade of experience and lots of finished and released titles under our belt. We released games for PC, Mac, Linux, iPhone, iPad and PlayStation Portable. Our biggest success so far is side scrolling shooter Jets'n'Guns.

We are still faithful to "garage" game development. We don't have offices, keeping our cost very low. We work from our homes, doing fun stuff, creating games we want.

Here is selection of our previous games. You can click the images to visit their web pages to check the screenshots or download demos:

END

But this cannot be!

The game is inspired by the catchy formula of Binding of Isaac mixed with classic melee combat from games like Golden Axe. Each run you start with a bare hero and your goal is to get as far as possible in a dungeon with randomized items, spells, traps and encounters. Along the way your character evolves and changes (visually and gameplay-wise) as you find better weapons, items, magic powers and fight harder and harder monsters. Eventually you reach the final boss at the bottom of the pit (or your death).


You can play the game alone or with a friend online. We decided to focus online multiplayer on two people for now, mainly for technical reasons. If we see enough interest in the project we will add a stretch goal for three or four people multiplayer.





The main features of the game are:


 Melee combat inspired by games like Golden Axe.

 Randomly generated environment.

 Gameplay is split into short (up to 60 minutes) separate runs.

 Your hero evolves with new abilities and visually changes along the way.

 The game contains a lot of spells, weapons and other items with game changing properties.

 There is a long term progression system where you can level up different classes of your hero and unlock new things in the game.


The Combat


The game is focused on melee fighting. You possess a small but effective palette of deadly moves to quickly dispatch large groups of enemies. You can dash through groups of enemies, lift bodies in the air and throw them at others, crush lying monsters with stomping, swing the bodies around or juggle with the enemies in the air. Main sources of inspiration for the fighting style were games like Golden Axe or Castle Crashers.


The Dungeon


Randomly generated environment provides many special encounters, which will define your adventure and shape your hero. You will die a lot, but every time you play you get wildly different set of weapons, spells, magical features and also curses and disadvantages that will give you different opportunities and challenges.


The Loot


The game has large variety of items, that do more than just raising your damage. Imagine a sword that drops a crushing treasure chest from the sky when you hit multiple enemies. A boots that freeze an enemy, if you kick him in the groin. These are a few examples.


The Magic


On your journey you will learn powerful spells a skills, that add another form of attack. Some are classic like fireballs, some have weird effects, like a device that spawns machines capable to immobilize enemies or crack chests open. Others can drag enemies around or enchant them.


The Hero


The items and encounters can change your hero completely. You may go through the adventure as a glass cannon berserk, a bloodthirsty vampire who can heal of defeated enemies, or an undead who cannot heal at all. You may learn to fly or lose your jumping ability completely. You can turn into a monster or superhero with crazy powers. All depends on what resources you find in the dark depths below and how you decide to use them.


The Campaign


The gameplay is split into relatively short (up to 60 minutes) easy to pick up runs. It's something like a campaign in Left 4 Dead or a mission in Killing Floor. The combat is very challenging and you will probably die a lot, but with every respawn you will explore a new maze, you will get better and more experienced and you will each farther in the depths of the labyrinth.




Rampage Knights is more than just a quick action and a bunch of disjointed raids on the castle. When you die, you may lose your weapons and items, but you keep your combat experience. And with every attempt your hero gets better and better as you progress deeper into the dungeons of the dark castle.


After death you are resurrected in a camp of travelers you met in the woods, and who are trapped in the enchanted forest just like you. These NPCs give you several interestiong options! Let's meet the guys!





You cannot descent into the labyrinth without proper equipment. Apart from your melee weapon your hero have a spell, a potion, a magic scroll and throwing weapons.


It's much like Left 4 Dead, where you had your weapons, medkit and pills. You can carry only one item of each kind, so you need to use your limited inventory wisely to survive various enemy types and traps.



In addition to inventory items, you will find armors, belts, boots and also special type of items that can be used to permanently change your hero's appearance and abilities. Bigger items like armors are visible on your character.


To give you the taste what's in the game, here are weapons we have created so far.





Some of the things we plan to add that might trigger your interest:







What can you expect, if the campaign is successful and the game picks up significant interest? Here are some things we have on a "nice-to-have" list, which may end up in stretch goals in case we get lucky:



Local co-op mode. Play with your friend on one machine.

Warrior with different body type: woman, dwarf, giant.

Co-op for 3 or 4 people.

More detailed customization of a hero.

More content - enemies, items, bosses, unique encounters etc.

More comfortable networking for non-Steam version.

More platforms (PS4?).






Here is more detailed info on perks.


* Note that Steam keys are applicable only if we succeed in our Greenlight campaign. Please vote for Rampage Knights on Greenlight to make sure that the Steam version becomes reality!



This is the basic perk. Once the game is released you get a download link for a full version and a Steam key*.


You get a beta access. We plan to start the beta in fall 2014 in order to tweak the balance of the game and gather suggestions from larger audience. If the game gets through Greenlight the beta will be also available on Steam. Once the game is released you get a download link for a full version and a Steam key*.


Rampage Knights is a multiplayer game. "Double trouble" perk get you the game and also an extra copy and an extra Steam key*, so you can give it to your friend and play together. You both will also get the access to the beta/Early Access*.


You get everything from "Double Trouble" perk. On top of that you get a Steam key for a side scrolling shooter Jets'n'Guns and a PDF handbook for Rampage Knight containing detailed info on all enemies, weapons, items, encounters and other stuff in the dungeon.


You get everything from "Swords and Jets" perk and a pack of five games from Rake in Grass.
The pack contains:
Archibald's Adventures,
Crystal Cave,
Larva Mortus,
Northmark and
Styrateg.


Maybe you feel generous, maybe you really like Rake in Grass and want this game to succeed. You can throw in an extra 10 bucks to help us. For that your name (and nick name optionally) will be listed in the game credits in section for the top backers. See preview of the credits. Of course you get everything from the "Big Package" perk.


This perk is limited to 100 people.


Do you want to be in the game? There is a lot of ancient paintings hanging on the walls of the castle you explore. And some of them may have your likeness! This perk will get your face on the paintings in the game. The paintings are also slightly animated, so you will laugh, lift eyebrows or change the face as the heroes approach your painting. Here is an example of the end result:



The "Night in the Gallery" perk will get you:


Your face in one of the animated paintings.

A special place in credits with your painting and name. See preview of the credits.

Everything from the "Big Package" perk.


This perk is limited to 20 people.


This is the top level perk for the most generous patrons. "Dungeon Master" gives
you the right to directly influence Rampage Knights by adding 3 key elements to the gameplay:


 A weapon. You may help us to design an appearance and magical properties of a sword, an axe or a mace in the game. Weapon magic in our game can considerably change the game, heroes or even the environment.

 A potion. You have the power to mix your own rare potion in the game. Potions are one of four core items used by the heroes to survive in the dungeon. You may devise whatever concievable mix of positive, negative, random or funny effects. Your brew can make the heroes levite or give them tails, greatly increate their strength or turn their heads into potatoes. That's up to you!

 An encounter. You can create one type of special room or object in the game. Heroes meet these randomly in the labyrinth and they pose various threats and challenges for them. An example of such thing is a treasure room, where you can try to lockpick a chest full of gold and items.
Another example is an iron maiden - a huge sinister metal case containing unknown dangerous monster. Heroes may choose to break it, release the monster and collect the reward for the kill. Or they may leave it be and run.


The "Dungeon Master" perk also contains the following:


 You will get a large animated portrait in the game.

 You will be listed on top of the backers section in game credits with your portrait, name and your contribution in the game. See preview of the credits.

 Everything from the "Big Package" perk.


We reserve right to veto anything offensive, too hard to realize or game breaking.


This perk is limited to 3 people.



Why Indiegogo campaign?


We are far into the development of this game, but this is the moment when we need some outside help. We pump a lot of time and effort into the game design, code and graphics every day. Now we could use that extra push that will allow us to finish things in best possible and polished way, to outsource stuff we cannot do ourselves (like music), to improve networking etc.


We also want to test the interest of the public, get valuable feedback and suggestions and start some buzz around the game to let the world know that Rampage Knights are here and getting ready.


What is the money for?


 Music and sounds. We don't have musician in out team so need to outsource.

 Networking integration with Steam. We are hiring an external guy who will be implementing seamless
integration with Steam so you and your friend can join an online game without a hassle.

 Port of the game to Linux and Mac with proper gamepad support.

 More game content. The more interest we generate with the Indiegogo campaign
the more and crazier stuff we will be able to add in the game.


What are the risks? What's the status of the project now?


The only weakness of our team is, how slow we are. Knowing this we deliberately pushed the start of this campaign in the late stage of the development with release date in sight. We ask for your help now to successfuly finish this with as much good stuff in the game as possible!


Most of the important things - the combat, the environment generation, basic networking, hero profiles, etc. - is in the game already or partially finished. You can test it in the demo. We just started to implement bosses. Our goal and the biggest time consumer in the next few months will be to fill the game up with more content, and polish and balance the gameplay.


When will the game be released?


If we succeed, we will most probably get the game out of the gates in the beginning of 2015 (maybe earlier but not later). In fall 2014 we plan to start beta testing with backers in order to tweak the balance of the game and gather suggestions from larger audience. If the game gets through Greenlight the beta will be also available on Steam and we may also consider starting an Early Access program on Steam.


Will the game run on Mac or Linux? Will you support gamepad XY?


The game will run on Windows, Mac and maybe Linux, if we get enough backing. The demo now supports only Xbox 360 controller on Windows but the final game will support more gamepads on all platforms via SDL library.


Can I play online with a friend on a different platform?


Yes. You will be able to run the game on Windows and play online with a friend on Linux or Mac.


Will I get Steam key?


Yes. Once the game gets on Steam all backers will receive keys to redeem the game on Steam. Of course only in case the game gets through Greenlight. (Please vote for us.)


Will the game supports 3 or 4 players online co-op?


For now we promise only 2 players online co-op mode because supporting more players is much harder for technical reasons and would also require extra gameplay tweaks. If the Indiegogo campaign is successful we may add a stretch goal for 3 or 4 players online mode. Also note that 3 or 4 players online will be supported only in Steam version of the game.


Will the game supports 2 players local co-op on the same machine?


Local co-op is not supported for now. We may add this feature later when the game will be approaching the release date.


What is the difference between Steam and non-Steam version?


Steam version:


Networking using Steam matchmaking so playing online is as simple as pressing a button.

Steam achievements and stuff.

If we support 3 or 4 players online in the future it will be implemented in the Steam version.

Automatic gamepad configuration from Steam big picture mode.


Non-Steam version:


Networking similar to how it works in the 
tech demo.

Only 2 players online mode.


I don't have money / I don't trust you enough to pay so early, but the game looks interesting.


That's okay. We are poor and paranoid too :D. You can still help a lot by spreading the word about the game and voting for us on Greenlight.


Your involvement is crucial as there are thousands of small indie games out there and we have zero budget for marketing. It's very hard for us to let the world know we even exist, so your help would be invaluable.


Getting on Steam is another big deal. It's not just about sales. This is a multiplayer game. Networking is a really hard thing to do and Steam services will help a lot. The Steam version of the game will be integrated with Steam matchmaking so starting an online game will become much more comfortable.



Help us and get involved. Even if you cannot contribute to the campaign directly you can still support us by telling everybody about the game!





RiG's website


We are small game developing team of 3 people, active since 2000, located in Czech Republic. We are full time game developers with over a decade of experience and lots of finished and released titles under our belt. We released games for PC, Mac, Linux, iPhone, iPad and PlayStation Portable. Our biggest success so far is side scrolling shooter Jets'n'Guns.


We are still faithful to "garage" game development. We don't have offices, keeping our cost very low. We work from our homes, doing fun stuff, creating games we want.


Here is selection of our previous games. You can click the images to visit their web pages to check the screenshots or download demos:


END

story:
THE CAMPAIGN IS OVER and unfortunately we did not reach our goal despite the nice boost in the end. We wish to offer a very big thank you for everyone who participated by contributing or spreading the word.  You people showed us that Nyheim has great potential and we will now continue our hard work while trying to find other ways of financing the development.

THANKS!

Nyheim Team @ Happy Hobgoblin


 




CONTEST TIME!!!

Check out the referral contest on our Updates -page: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/nyheim-games/x/1077835#/updates




TRY OUT NYHEIM'S DEMO! 

Click one of the images below to play either the Android - or the Browser -version.

    

 


 

In February 2015, a rat in London is infected by a virus that causes excessive testosterone buildup and aggression. After one month, the virus spreads to a large part of the rat population. Pest control becomes aware of the changed behaviour and captures some of the rats. One person is bitten and becomes infected.
 

The disease mutates and becomes airborne with an incubation time of three weeks. It worsens, causing muscle ache, confusion and fatigue. Within a week, patient one dies from respiratory failure; within a few more weeks, many other fatalities are recorded in central Europe, the US East Coast and China.

News outlets catch on and the reports of an aggressive and lethal flu cause people to flock to hospitals, propagating the disease. The World Health Organisation issues a warning for people to stay indoors. The infection spreads across major cities, infecting people and rats. Rat populations become more aggressive, making containment difficult.



After 8 weeks WHO issues a global pandemic alarm and attempts to contain and quarantine the disease. Large swathes of population begin to show symptoms, slowing government down. People start to hoard supplies and lock themselves at home in order to avoid contact with others. Meanwhile, rat populations boom and take to the streets, invading supermarkets and homes in order to find food.

The death toll keeps rising. Governments cease to function. Infrastructure falls apart, and nuclear power plants start shutting down reactors and securing spent fuel rods. The infection hits remote areas. Looting becomes widespread.

The power grid fails when the power plants run out of manpower. The people who have survived the infection or who have had immunity to it begin to emerge to the new, post-pandemic world.

You are one of those people.

 


 

Nyheim is a single-player dice-rolling game in the same vein as Elder Sign Omens and Warhammer Quest. The core of the game are the survivor dice, representing the four attributes that the post-pandemic world will test: Wits, Awareness, Endurance and Speed. The attributes are used in everything, from fighting the rats to learning new abilities.

Get strategic with the Nyheim Map! Your Party will move on the map of Nyheim, from location to location. In a location the player can either search for supplies or progress on your objective, or rest and heal your injuries.
 


When rolling dice, you can use food to reroll your results, but beware: If your food runs out, you run the risk of starvation! To further help you succeed, items and skills will also give you rerolls, or allow you to turn your results to other results!
 

 

The changing seasons will force you to adapt: As time progresses, rats will get fewer but tougher and supplies found from scavenging will become worse…

Permadeath will keep you on your toes: Each game will have randomly generated locations and characters and each choice you make will be permanent!
 

 

Balance between the well-being of your search party and HQ: Each survivor, item or food that you don’t use will be taken to the HQ, where it can be used to add progress to your new society!


Objectives and crises pull you in different directions: Will you handle the looming disease that threatens your populations, or do you power through the next task towards relighting the city?

 

 


Here is a round-up of the main areas we’re currently working on. 

Story Mode:

While the standard game mode is already developed, we want to create something more narrative-driven. In the Story Mode you’ll be able to play as the first survivor of Nyheim and lead the efforts for the rebuilding of the city – and will span the first year post-pandemic.

You’ll be able to unlock larger regions as your population grows, and face larger challenges while the weather gets colder and winter starts setting in…

The campaign will feature custom objectives to drive the game forward.

Updated visuals:

We are aiming to replace the current 2D map of Nyheim with a 3D version! We’re aiming for a miniature landscape style, so you can be even more immersed in the city of Nyheim, along with a dynamic soundscape and animations to boot. Think a mix between Civilization V and Cities Skylines.

Plus we want to add more animations and effects for the cards, just for some pretty eye candy!
 


Alternative gameplay:

Supply Currency - Food, items and characters that you send to the HQ will be turned into “currency” that you can use to buy supplies, allowing for a better control over what you need! Upgrading your HQ with the currencies will unlock better quality supplies!

More crises - More variable crisis effects, like Threat spawning, and an alternative crisis system that exchanges the Crisis defeat for more and nastier crises




Crafting cards - Crafting cards that give powerful rewards, such as items, food or even direct injury healing after being used while resting.

 


HAPPY HOBGOBLIN

Happy Hobgoblin is a group of game development professionals who found each other in Oulu Game Lab-program. After working together for a year on the Nyheim mobile, the team bonds are tight and everyone is itching to get to develop the game to its maximum potential!
 

 

 

We believe in cool games. We believe that people would like to play niche games that aim high and try new and unconventional things. So we want to give you this chance to support a cool game, to show the world that yes, you can take a leap of faith.

The team is dedicated to bringing Nyheim to its full potential. While we’re also creating a mobile version of the game, we’re really excited about the extra depth we can add to the PC version and with your help we will be able to concentrate on making Nyheim the best it can be.

This involves adding resource for additional artists to further illustrate and polish the visuals of the game, along with more music and soundscapes. And more importantly, we can gather feedback and involve you in the development of the game. Because as important as our vision of Nyheim is, your feedback is as important, if not more so.


THE PERKS!

Here are our awesome perk rewards! 

EARLY CAT GETS THE RAT & I'D LIKE THE GAME PLEASE
  

DOUBLE THE FUN - ANDROID     
  +  

DOUBLE THE FUN - iOS
  +  

DELUXE EDITION
  +   /   +    +  

CREDIT EDITION
  +   /   +    +    +

CITIZEN EDITION
  +   /  +    +    ++  

RAT-CATCHER EDITION
  +   /  +    +    ++  

CARD-SHARK EDITION
  +   /  +    +    ++    +  

SURVIVOR EDITION
  +   /  +    +    ++    +  

SUPPLY EDITION
  +   /  +    +    ++    +   + 

CONNOISSEUR EDITION
  +   /  +    +    ++    +   +  
+  

TASK EDITION
  +   /  +    +    ++    +   +  
+  

CRISIS EDITION
  +   /  +    +    ++    +   + 
+  

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER
  +   /  +    +    ++    +   + 
+  



PERK CHART

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

After the Indiegogo service fees, all funds from this campaign will go directly to the development of the game, with the focus on paying for our top-notch programmers and new artists whose quality illustrations will further bring Nyheim to life!





Art: 43%   Unfortunately we are running low on artists and need to hire help from outside to make Nyheim look Awesome.

Salaries: 25%  No going around it, even game developers need food every now and then. :)

Partners: 10%  Indiegogo, Paypal, Square Enix Collective. Cool people who are helping us make our dream come true, just like You!

Rent: 15%  In addition to food, a roof and walls make developing games a bit easier.

Licenses: 2%  Tools of the trade

 

 

Nyheim is the first game project Happy Hobgoblin is working on, and for many of our intrepid developers it is their first trial by fire. But we do have two major advantages: Samuli’s experience in game development and the fact that Nyheim mobile is complete. The swordfighting card game that Samuli designed, Audatia, already won over the hearts of many swordsmanship hobbyists and raised a successful campaign here in Indiegogo. The mobile version of Nyheim has been in development for over year and a half, so the developers know the ins and outs of the project.

While every person at Happy Hobgoblin is eager to develop games, Nyheim is the company’s first project and not everyone has experience in game releases. Countless basement projects aside, only one game project has been released and has been a success in its own niche: Audatia, designed by our own Samuli. So the trials and tribulations of getting the game to the digital marketplaces may give our producer some more gray hairs. However, we do have Square Enix supporting our campaign! We have pitched Nyheim in the Square Enix Collective and gamers showed their support, opening this possibility.


 


THANK YOU FOR READING!

 

The entire team at Happy Hobgoblin thanks you for reading all of this! We are eagerly waiting for your feedback and comments, and also hope that with your support we can build not only Nyheim, but other games in the future!

Please, do not hesitate to ask questions or post comments!

And again, thank you for your support! We love you!

 

Pekka Södervall, Samuli Raninen, Jesse Passoja and the rest of the Happy Hobgoblin team!

 

FAQ:

Why are you making two versions of the game?

We originally envisioned Nyheim as a PC game, but once we started prototyping we thought it would make a great mobile and tablet game too. We’ve been working on both versions ever since.

How does the PC game differ from the mobile version?

The PC version of Nyheim will be a deeper and more polished experience, since the platform allows us to do more. The two are going to be very different experiences.

Are you planning on releasing Nyheim to other platforms?

For now Nyheim is going to be just for PC, Android and iOS, and we do not currently have any plans for consoles. But if demand is greater, we will explore the possibilities.

Who did all the art?

Nyheim began as a project in Oulu Game Lab, and many artists, including Jonna Koskelo, Kjersti Kravik, Katja Haapalainen, Joyce Waaijer and Kirsi Salonen.

Will there be a multiplayer version at some point?

Nyheim has been designed as a single-player experience, so no multiplayer.

What if I accidentally donated the contribution instead of selecting the perk I wanted?

Don't worry! We will send you the perk you deserve anyway.

PERK CHART

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?
After the Indiegogo service fees, all funds from this campaign will go directly to the development of the game, with the focus on paying for our top-notch programmers and new artists whose quality illustrations will further bring Nyheim to life!Art: 43%   Unfortunately we are running low on artists and need to hire help from outside to make Nyheim look Awesome.
Salaries: 25%  No going around it, even game developers need food every now and then. :)
Partners: 10%  Indiegogo, Paypal, Square Enix Collective. Cool people who are helping us make our dream come true, just like You!
Rent: 15%  In addition to food, a roof and walls make developing games a bit easier.
Licenses: 2%  Tools of the trade
 

 
Nyheim is the first game project Happy Hobgoblin is working on, and for many of our intrepid developers it is their first trial by fire. But we do have two major advantages: Samuli’s experience in game development and the fact that Nyheim mobile is complete. The swordfighting card game that Samuli designed, Audatia, already won over the hearts of many swordsmanship hobbyists and raised a successful campaign here in Indiegogo. The mobile version of Nyheim has been in development for over year and a half, so the developers know the ins and outs of the project.
While every person at Happy Hobgoblin is eager to develop games, Nyheim is the company’s first project and not everyone has experience in game releases. Countless basement projects aside, only one game project has been released and has been a success in its own niche: Audatia, designed by our own Samuli. So the trials and tribulations of getting the game to the digital marketplaces may give our producer some more gray hairs. However, we do have Square Enix supporting our campaign! We have pitched Nyheim in the Square Enix Collective and gamers showed their support, opening this possibility. 

THANK YOU FOR READING!
 
The entire team at Happy Hobgoblin thanks you for reading all of this! We are eagerly waiting for your feedback and comments, and also hope that with your support we can build not only Nyheim, but other games in the future!
Please, do not hesitate to ask questions or post comments!
And again, thank you for your support! We love you!
 
Pekka Södervall, Samuli Raninen, Jesse Passoja and the rest of the Happy Hobgoblin team!
 
FAQ:
Why are you making two versions of the game?
We originally envisioned Nyheim as a PC game, but once we started prototyping we thought it would make a great mobile and tablet game too. We’ve been working on both versions ever since.How does the PC game differ from the mobile version?
The PC version of Nyheim will be a deeper and more polished experience, since the platform allows us to do more. The two are going to be very different experiences.Are you planning on releasing Nyheim to other platforms?
For now Nyheim is going to be just for PC, Android and iOS, and we do not currently have any plans for consoles. But if demand is greater, we will explore the possibilities.Who did all the art?
Nyheim began as a project in Oulu Game Lab, and many artists, including Jonna Koskelo, Kjersti Kravik, Katja Haapalainen, Joyce Waaijer and Kirsi Salonen.Will there be a multiplayer version at some point?
Nyheim has been designed as a single-player experience, so no multiplayer.What if I accidentally donated the contribution instead of selecting the perk I wanted?
Don't worry! We will send you the perk you deserve anyway.

story:
This project didn't make it. Backers were refunded. I moved to smaller project, see https://www.patreon.com/pixelabcd

Play the demo! - Works well with Wine.

An ALPHA DEMO for WINDOWS is available for download here.​

Your feedback is very important, so if you encounter a bug during your playthrough of the demo, please let me know so it can be fixed.

Nightkeep is a project I’ve been working on for the past 2 years. My goal is to craft a fine metroidvania RPG set in a fairytale-like world.

While Nightkeep is influenced by Castlevania series (this shows the most in the design of Nyros’ Castle), it is also influenced by many games from the SNES and PlayStation eras, such as Breath of Fire, FInal Fantasy, Alundra and Dragon’s quest. Without these titles, I’d probably never get into game development in the first place. This games, however, isn’t just about a castle and some crazed king.

The gameplay is primarily based on quests, which are not divided into main or side quests. Every single one has its place in the game’s world.

You play as Arietta, one of the hunters, coming to the Nightkeep village, where she has a job to do and important decisions to make. Some of the events she won’t be able to alter, others however will directly impact the world around her.

By fulfilling different quests, you get “rank points”, which upgrade your abilities, open up new quests and cause various scenarios across the game world. Your rank, aside from being a way to upgrade your stats, is also a crucial element of the story.

All this game needs is chance.

The game features:

  • Original fantasy story with fairytale elements.
  • Original artwork and soundtrack
  • Many various quests and NPCs
  • Multiple endings
  • Classic RPG elements - EXPs, a leveling system, equipable items and power ups.
  • More than 70 different items
  • Slight rogue-like elements
  • Supported platforms: MS Windows

Long ago, the world was divided into 4 different kingdoms. A chain of events, however, caused one king to disappear, leaving the 3 kingdoms fighting over his lands.

All that is in the past now. Let’s jump 735 years into the future, where two huntresses are on their way to the Nightkeep village, sent by their guild. There’s work waiting for them there, alongside many difficult decisions, which could alter the fate of the entire kingdom. The story will gradually uncover the events that have occurred in the kingdom, the meaning of the Guild of Hunters and also incorporate the already mentioned “rank”.

The game world will have its own backstory and structure. The game is set in the eastern kingdom, where most of the story plays out, though it might occasionally refer to inaccessible places to explain bits of the story. Most of my previous stories began small, but I always managed to grow them into complex worlds with unique characters and its own history.

PixelABCD (Milan Svaty)

The supervillain. Responsible for anything from the story to the design. I’m behind the pixel art, animations, game design and code you may find in Nightkeep. I’ve been making games for fun since 2000 and Nightkeep is my first larger project, which I’d like to release for both the fans of its genre and broader audience. I founded a Czech and Slovak RPG Maker community. It bears the name RPG2 Heaven, which I also like to use as a signature on all my work. A giant fan of Castlevania and JRPG games.

Thomas. J. Peters

Among the sprawling reach of the San Fernando Valley in Los Angeles, California, professional composer Thomas J. Peters crafts lavish & powerful thematic musical settings for Nightkeep.

RHLPixels (Kat Chase)

When it comes to portraits, RHLPixels is a perfect choice. She’s been painting portraits from an early age and loves Breath of Fire, which has been of quite some influence for Nightkeep. With her help, every character will have its unique portrait.

Thomas Schmied 

Without Thomas, we couldn’t get to where we are now. He’s translated the Nightkeep demo and this campaign. Before that, he also localized the Greenlight campaign, which was greenlit. With his help, I’ll be able to create an English version of the final game.

Without the rest of the team, this game wouldn’t be possible!​

Why Indiegogo and not Kickstarter? The answer is simple - using Kickstarter requires the creator to be from one of the allowed countries, which isn't our case.

I’ve decided to learn pixel art, so I could make my own original game. Now, it’s been 2 years, since I began my work on Nightkeep. I make games purely for the joy of making games, I don’t make any money off of them. With your help, I’d love to work on this project full-time.

I’ve met many wonderful people willing to support the project, including a talented composer Thomas J. Peters, which has made 6 original tracks for the game. I’m financing the project myself and would like to properly reward everyone from the team.

I have, however, run into the point, where my income wouldn’t be enough to pay for more music tracks, which I wished to have in the demo. Because of that, the tracks for Rare monster fights, Noelle and Elleon’s theme and the village itself are not included.

I’d also like to replace some tracks heard in the demo, for I have different intentions with them. For example, I want to replace the current metal version of the boss theme with a new, more JRPG-oriented one (although the metal boss theme will find its use later on in the game). I’d also like to have a different track for every character, just like in many JRPGs.

 

Existing features:

Currently, about 60 monsters are finished (both art and coding), 6 bosses and about half of the game world, although some older maps need a revamp. All core systems, swords, weapons and the menu are finished. Custom key binding for keyboard and gamepad controls are supported. The storyline, however, is in its early stages and I’m slowly filling up the world with characters.

Planned features:  

Main and Side storylines and quests, more characters, maps, enemies, bosses and rare monsters. “Clear the way” battle sequences, a fishing minigame, some smaller puzzles and a marker for the in-game minimap. Hairdresser.

 

Pledge $10

  • You’ll get: A digital copy of the final game for MS Windows (Steam key or or DRM-Free)

Pledge $20 or 25

  • You’ll get: A digital copy of the final game for MS Windows (Steam key or or DRM-Free), a digital copy of the game’s soundtrack, an instruction manual describing anything from the menu, the statistics and the game mechanics, such as how monster spawning works, etc. Your name in the ending credits.

Pledge $35

  • You’ll get: 2 digital copies of the final game for MS Windows (2x Steam key or or DRM-Free), a digital copy of the game’s soundtrack, an instruction manual (see the $20 perk), a PDF book “The Chronicles of Nightkeep”, which will describe the world alongside many of its current or past residents in detail and a PNG map of the game. Access to the different alpha versions. Your name in the ending credits.

Pledge $50

  • You’ll get: 2 digital copies of the final game for MS Windows (2x Steam key or or DRM-Free), a digital copy of the game’s soundtrack, an instruction manual (see the $20 perk), a PDF book “The Chronicles of Nightkeep”, which will describe the world alongside many of its current or past residents in detail and a PNG map of the game. Access to the different alpha and beta versions. A special backers-only in-game item. Your name in the ending credits.

Pledge $75

  • You’ll get: 3 digital copies of the final game for MS Windows (3x Steam key or or DRM-Free), a digital copy of the game’s soundtrack, an instruction manual (see the $20 perk), a PDF book “The Chronicles of Nightkeep”, which will describe the world alongside many of its current or past residents in detail and a PNG map of the game. Access to the different alpha and beta versions. A special backers-only in-game item. A painting or statue (your choice) of you (I’ll use a photo as a reference, feel free to send a photo of your pets, etc) in Vandark Manor as a part of Balthazar’s art collection. Your name in the ending credits.

Pledge $150 or 300

  • You’ll get: 3 digital copies of the final game for MS Windows (3x Steam key or DRM-Free), a digital copy of the game’s soundtrack, an instruction manual (see the $20 perk), a PDF book “The Chronicles of Nightkeep”, which will describe the world alongside many of its current or past residents in detail and a PNG map of the game. Access to the different alpha and beta versions. A special backers-only in-game item.
  • $150 only Design a rare monster (note: it must blend into a medieval fantasy world). Your name will be displayed in a separate section of the ending credits (Lead Backers).
  • $300 only Design a quest (note: it must blend into a medieval fantasy world). Your name will be displayed in a separate section of the ending credits (Lead Backers). The quest can make use of new characters, which could stay in the world afterwards, if you wish!

Pledge $500

  • You’ll get: 3 digital copies of the final game for MS Windows (3x Steam key or DRM-Free), a digital copy of the game’s soundtrack, an instruction manual (see the $20 perk), a PDF book “The Chronicles of Nightkeep”, which will describe the world alongside many of its current or past residents in detail and a PNG map of the game (+ a copy showing the secrets). Access to the different alpha and beta versions. A special backers-only in-game item. Design a rare monster and a boss (note: both must blend into a medieval fantasy world). Your name will be displayed in a separate section of the ending credits (Lead Backers). I’ll use your photo as a reference when designing one of the Patrons - the guardians of the lands. One of the patrons, Odyele, can be seen in the beginning of the Indiegogo trailer.

*All items will be delivered once the game’s development is finished (excluding alpha/beta access). During the development, I’ll send you regular updates about the game’s development, through Indiegogo. I’ll get in touch with the Lead Backers after the end of this campaign.​

Why so much money for such a simple game? First, Indiegogo will get its cut from the funds raised and then the country I live in, as it is required by the law (tax, etc). A part of the money will go towards music production to ensure a great soundtrack for the game. It is an integral part of the world, providing it with great atmosphere, therefore I’m working with a professional composer to get the game to where I want it to be.

Next, a cut of the funds will go towards the game’s translation, and portraits for every character. I’m trying to give as much of my free time as possible, but the development is slow. That’s why I’m asking you to allow me to work on the game full-time.

The rest of the money will go towards the game’s production (art, code and story) and keeping me alive (electricity and snack). As I said, I’ll be working on the project full-time and keeping an active relationship with everyone interested in Nightkeep. That means: Regular updates, answering questions, etc.

If we manage to raise the funds we need, I can ensure an original soundtrack, additional art, faster development and a full English localization of the final game.

If you’re interested in my project, please consider backing it. Play the demo and let me know what you think. The demo is more of a public alpha, so expect some things, including parts of the story to change.

With your help, I can make sure Nightkeep will be a pleasant and memorable experience.

Budget Allocation (base budget is 10 000 USD). I will gladly answer questions regarding the game and its funding.

I’ve managed to eradicate the more serious bugs during the demo testing phase. Now, I’m concerned about how the game will run on different versions of the Windows OS and optimization. (I have a relatively fast processor i5 3,4GHz and don’t have access to a slower machine).

Sometimes, life can be a bit unpredictable. The same applies to game development, which I got to experience first-hand many times before. There may come times, when my schedule will get  interrupted by unpredictable events, but I can assure you I’ll do everything in my powers to keep the development going smoothly and send regular updates about it.

I’m not a professional programmer or artist. I’m developing games for fun, everything I’ve learned I’ve done so in my free time - and I’m still learning. I am still learning in the field of animation and always looking for ways to do them better.

Saranoske (@Saranoske on Twitter), an amazing animator liked the Nightkeep demo and offered to help me animate the main heroine, Arietta. If we manage to raise the funding goal,

If you give my game a chance, I’ll do everything I can to not disappoint you and bring you the game I envisioned. The expected release date is 2019.

Other Ways You Can Help

​

  • Please spread the word! You can use the Indiegogo share tools. Every bit of help is very important and appreciated!

​

All further funds will go to polishing the game even further!

  • $10000 - Goal ! https://twitter.com/Saranoske will join the project
  • $10 500 - Collectable in-game cards
  • $11 000 - A complete bestiary
  • $11 500 - More gemstones, tiers and abilities
  • $12 000 - An extra dungeon
  • $14 000 - More original music from Thomas J. Peters
  • $15 000 - Extra digital art for the game

  • http://rpg2heaven.com
  • https://twitter.com/PixelABCD
  • https://www.facebook.com/NightkeepGame/
  • https://www.youtube.com/user/Reabezion/

Special Thanks also belong to

Ross P - Help with Web code.                                                                                                      Louis Denizet - Provided me with a lot of useful feedback.                                                Michael Somkuti - Help with early / initial UI translation.
