Spread the word about the campaign, both online and offline. You can use the links at the top of the page, below the video to easily share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and Google Plus.
Play the demo and tell people what you think. Getting the word out is just as important as the contributions themselves, and I really appreciate all the help I can get.

story:
Below you will learn more about our web-app: the project, the plan, & the perks. 

As of today, you can go to Skoyz.com to watch instructional videos, but your support will allow players like you to:

  • log practice and share successes
  • create player profiles with all of your achievements, ribbons, and updates
  • upload videos to record progress on skills
  • join teams & participate in team challenges
  • access more instructional videos 



(For more images and videos about Skoyz, visit our Indiegogo gallery)



What is Skoyz? Skoyz is a web application that allows users to learn, log, and share new skill development with the goal of fostering a culture of curiosity and self-directed engagement. Initial content will include instructional videos for juggling and other skill toys, but this project will allow players to customize the app to any physical skill.

In the 21st century, we need to be willing to learn new tricks, daring enough to take the risk, and confident that we can master new skills. Why not start practicing that mindset with something fun?


What are skill toys? Skill toys are physical objects that are relatively simple in design, but can be tossed, spun, and balanced to accomplish amazing tricks. The most common skill toys are juggling, yo-yo, hooping, and kendama. Others include flower sticks, diabolo, and spinning plates. 

They have been used for hundreds and thousands of years to develop hand-eye coordination for hunting, to entertain the masses during tough economic times, and to impress travelling dignitaries. Although differences in culture, politics, and available resources may create friction between groups of people, a love of play and the desire to develop new skills creates connection and unites communities.

             

What does Skoyz mean? Skoyz is a name we came up with a few years ago (even before the idea for the app). It is a fun combination of the words “skill” and “toys.” Since skill toys are the tools we use in our workshops to engage individuals and build teams, we knew it would come in handy someday.

Once we had the idea for the app, we knew the name was a perfect fit because skill toys provided the inspiration for the app.

Why juggle or play with skill toys? We have been teaching these skills to teens and adults for over a decade and there is a wide range of benefits leading to whole person wellness.

  • Problem Solving: Skill toys give immediate feedback as to whether our efforts are working. If we pay attention to what is happening, make adjustments, and try again, we are practicing problem solving skills.
  • Resilience: Dropping is just part of the process of learning to juggle and play with skill toys. It may be a little messy at first, but picking the object up and trying again builds resilience.
  • Flow: When we are completely absorbed in an activity and working in our optimal zone of learning, we are in a state of flow which is essential to our overall well-being.
  • Physical Break: Most of us sit all day – in the car, at our desks, on our couch. We need more low intensity activities that we can do throughout the day to get up from our seats and move our bodies.
  • Mental Break: When we focus our attention on solving a problem at work or school, a mental break can provide the space for the connections and insights to occur. Research shows that the brain is actually very active when “doing nothing.”
  • Fun: We all need more opportunities to laugh and play.

Why would I need an app? In order to be successful in learning new skills, learners need a few things: good instruction, a way to track and reflect on progress, and opportunity to share successes with others and feel part of a team. Skoyz makes it easy to learn, log, and share from anywhere.

Where did you get this idea? Paul: I’m an avid skill toy player. I was constantly in search of new skill toys to learn. The more I discovered, the harder it became to keep track of the tricks I was working on and what tricks to work on next. Then one day as I was getting ready to go for a run, I clicked on an app to track my distance and time. That moment was the moment I realized I need something similar for my skill toy practice.

Dawn: Around the same time, I had been struggling with ways we could help the afterschool and library groups that we work with measure the impact of their programs beyond the few hours they spend with the kids each day or week. The idea for creating a team moderator that could communicate with team members, create team challenges, and share custom content took shape.

What has been done so far? We’ve begun developing Skoyz. Today you can browse content and begin learning. Your support of this project will allow us to add the ability for players to log practice and join teams.

What will the funds be used for? We are a juggler and a teacher with limited programming abilities. Over the last year, we made the plunge and began learning a lot about use cases, data bases, and design assets, and other tools that programmers live and breathe. Luckily, we have a team of amazing advisors.

We have invested our money in the development thus far, but need your help to build it out further. Based on estimates from software developers and designers, the amount needed to add the log, share, and team functionality is $30,000. We already have talented programmers that have done the first phase of development, and they are lined up to complete the project once we have the funding.

Why crowdfund? We are coming to you through Indiegogo because we want to start building a team of players today. We want Skoyz to be a community of individuals like you that are becoming even more awesome.

The Timeline:

  • Idea for App: Fall 2012
  • Research and Customer Discovery: December 2012 – June 2013
  • Programming and Design for 1st Iteration: June 2013 - present
  • 1st Iteration Release (browse and learn juggling videos): April 2014
  • Additional Content (additional skills to learn): Spring and Summer 2014
  • Release (learn, log, share & teams): September 2014

How can I help? Choose from one of the many options of Skoyz perks and help us spread the word.

  • Let people know about the project through email, social media, and good-old fashioned face to face conversation.
  • Put us in touch with press contacts or bloggers that you think might be interested in writing about Skoyz.
  • Ask your company to sponsor a team at a local library or afterschool program.
  • Post to groups or listservs that you belong to.
  • Create and post an endorsement video about this project, working with us, or the awesomeness of juggling.

We have a number of perks for you to choose from and just wanted to explain a few in more details.

Player Accounts: All player and player plus accounts will automatically get a limited edition Founding Player ribbon added to your profile for supporting our campaign.

  • Guest Account – available to everyone at no cost; allows the user to view instructional videos and learn on their own.
  • Player Account – available to $2 supporters; allows the user to learn, log practice, and share through social media; for players 13 years or older
  • Player Plus Account – available to $5 supporters; allows the user to learn, log, and share as well as join teams and customize content; for players 13 years or older
Teams: All teams are automatic lifetime subscriptions. They come with a moderator account that can create custom team content, issue challenges, and communicate with team members. Pick the team size based on the number on your team.

  • Family Team – moderator + 5 Player Plus invites
  • Club Team – moderator + 25 Player Plus invites
  • Division Team – moderator + 100 Player Plus invites
  • Minor League Team - moderator + 500 Player Plus invites
  • Major League Team - moderator + 1000 Player Plus invites

Create a team for your organization or sponsor a team for a local afterschool program, library, or camp in your area. If you would like to provide this experience for teens, but don’t have a group in mind, feel free to contact us for suggestions of organizations in your area. We have a list of organizations that have Skoyz on their wish list.

Performances, workshops, and other fun stuff: We have included an number of other services that help to bring the juggling and skill toy experience to your community.

  • Performance – Paul Miller’s 45 minute comedy juggling show; for more information visit FlowCircus.com
  • Team building workshops – Hands-on and interactive session for adult groups; for more information, visit SkoyzWellness.com
  • T-shirts & Euro stickers


Paul Miller: An entrepreneur and nationally touring performing artist, Paul brings creativity and enthusiasm to every project he tackles. His early career experiences in the hospitality industry and street performing where unhappy customers could just walk away taught him that connecting with your audience is at the core of customer service. He went on to create Flow Circus, a successful education company promoting active learning and play through the juggling arts. In 2013, Paul co-founded Skoyz Wellness to provide companies with a tool to increase productivity by making individuals, teams, and organizations stronger.

Dawn Daria: An award winning educator and author, Dawn loves to inspire individuals to step out of their comfort zone in order to discover something new about themselves, each other, and the world. Her natural ability to assess group dynamics and facilitate collaboration has been critical to her success as a teacher, educational consultant, and curriculum developer. She has taught a variety of skills to a wide-range of ages, but her favorite has to be working with teens. They are primed for risk-taking and self-discovery, but at the same time their fresh perspective on the world has much to teach adults. In 2013, Dawn co-founded Skoyz Wellness to utilize her knowledge of learning, motivation, leadership, and teamwork to engage individuals, strengthen teams, and enhance organizational culture.

Our thanks:

We want to thank you in advance for supporting our campaign, helping to spread the word, and providing more opportunities for teens and adults to play and learn.

story:
Welcome!
Bienvenidos!
 
We are the team Fanath, for those who don't know us a few years ago that is dedicated to sculpting and selling fantasy figures for Football, teams, figures, Markers ... A bit of everything and every day with more quality!
You can see other samples of previous work in fanath.com and all our news on Facebook
 
Somos el equipo de Fanath, para quienes no nos conozcan hace unos años que nos dedicamos a el esculpido y venta de figuras para Football fantasy, equipos, figuras, marcadores, fichas... De todo un poco y cada día con mas calidad!
Podeis ver otras muestras de trabajos anteriores en fanath.com y todas nuestras novedades en Facebook
 
 
 
In this project we will make the best team so far, a full team of 16 players, plus additional figures.
All figures of the team are one-piece metal (except the tree man and possibly some staff) to avoid problems with detached arms when you are playing.
 
En este proyecto vamos a sacar el mejor equipo hasta ahora, un equipo completo de 16 jugadores, mas figuras adicionales.
Todas las figuras del equipo son de una sola pieza en metal (excepto el hombre árbol y posiblemente algún staff), para evitar problemas con brazos despegados cuando se está jugando.
 
 
 
 
We have a local caster, to avoid delays in making the figures, and having produced other equipment is very rare to logistical problems shipments fall behind your figures. In addition, all domestic and international shipments are completely free! Orders will be delivered between 20 and 30 days after the end of the campaign
 
Tenemos un casteador local, para evitar retrasos en la fabricación de las figuras, y al haber producido otros equipos es muy raro que haya problemas de logística que atrasen los envíos de vuestras figuras. Además todos los envíos nacionales e internacionales serán totalmente gratuitos! Los pedidos se enviarán entre 20 y 30 dias después de finalizar la campaña.
 
 
 
 
Here you have some more detailed images of the team:
Aquí os dejo unas imágenes mas detalladas del equipo:
 
 
 
 
 
 

360 view, of the treeman!

vista 360 del treeman!

 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UXjiIwFcxLA
 
 

 

 

 

 
 
Remember to share the campaign to make us more and can more have unlocked rewards.
In all contributions can be added additional figures to our catalog on fanath.com and also the catalog of Hungry-troll.com
 
Recordar compartir la campaña para que seamos mas y poder tener mas recompensas desbloqueadas.
En todas las aportaciones se pueden añadir figuras adicionales de nuestro catalogo en fanath.com y también del catalogo de Hungry-troll.com
 
 
 
These are the lots that are available, small batches of two figures, or complete teams with possible gifts,  and remember that all shipments are free !!
The levels 7, 8 and 9 are the same figures, but if you're quick you can get a better price.
 
Estos son los lotes que se pueden adquirir,  pequeños lotes de dos figuras, o equipos completos con posibles regalos, y recordad que todos los envios son gratis!!
Los levels 7, 8 y 9 son las mismas figuras, pero si eres rápido puedes conseguirlo a mejor precio.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Depending on the money raised will be unlockables for free or at a low price of new figures and markers to complete the team. These gifts are only available to those who purchase minimum of one "level 7"
 
Dependiendo de el dinero que se recaude habrá desbloqueables gratis o a un bajo precio de nuevas figuras y marcadores para completar el equipo. Estos regalos solo están disponibles para los que adquieran mínimo un "level 7"
 
 
 

For all who choose a complete team, (Level 7 or more)
this figure free, Marilyn Cheerleader

Para todos los que elijan un equipo completo,
se llevarán esta figura gratis, la animadora Marilyn (Level 7 o mas)

story:
In this dark hour, my call to action. Our last stand. Will you join us?

Yes!  VS  No...

 

 

 

ANTUMBRA 2 STEAM GREENLIGHT

 

PLATFORMS: WindowsVista and higher, Linux & Mac.

LANGUAGE:
Default :English
Optional: Danish, French, German, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Portuguese
+more if enough money will be raised.

"(...)I look forward to Antumbra 2 if you choose to create it that is. I do hope that you choose to. Continue creating works like this and you'll go far. I think you may have found a good craft for yourself." ~Dragon

 

 

ANTUMBRA 1 ACHIEVED:

- TopTen on IndieDb, ranging from 10th to 1st spot out of over 26k games
- Frontpage on Newgrounds, Gamejolt and Kongregate
- 8th spot in monthly competition of April 2015
- Over 92 Let's Play Videos has been recorded so far
- Antumbra 1 has been played over 520k times across all platform
- Average score of 4,5/5
- Over 400 reviews on Newgrounds

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

 

  KONGREGATE

 

  NEWGROUNDS

 

  GAMEJOLT


 

 

 

 


Dear players and Steamers. Someone raised something to my attention.
To put it bluntly: that there is no gameplay in the video.
There actually is. Confused? Let me explain.

Imagine a painting. A beautiful painting. Now, please imagine you take a step, and then another... And you walk in. Into the painting. Literally. The middle part of the trailer - is the gameplay. But without animations and interface (sorry, I need to make them soon, but at the same time - I am so busy with the Greenlight and the IndieGoGo and they are not rolling as good as I hoped they will :( ).

The bottomline is - THAT is the game. Those are not fancy wallpapers or artworks. What you see here is what you will see - inside. As a player. Imagine if the whole world... Would be a painting. But a painting that is alive. Its not static. It lives, moves, breathe. And you are inside. In the world, on the other side of canvas. Aaand well - practically everything tries to kill you :D After all - this IS a horror game.


~DOWNLOAD LINK~
 

~DOWNLOAD LINK~
 

 

~DOWNLOAD LINK~
 


 

Imagine Alice in Wonderland and Silent Hill hooked up and had a baby. And then the baby got adopted by Lovecraft and raised on the board of Event Horizon during its virgin flight. Antumbra 2 is that child. 

 
Antumbra 2, as its prequel is a very surreal point-and-click horror adventure game. It has a powerful storyline, immersing audio, surreal graphics and atmosphere thick and sticky like tar. 
Its an adventure game like nothing else, taking inspiration from things like Silent Hill, Darkseed, Event Horizon, Lovecraft, H.R. Giger, Zdzislaw Beksinski, Hellraiser, David Firth animations, Alice in Wonderland, Planescape: Torment and many many others. 
The idea is to make Antumbra 2 to be for Antumbra 1 what Half Life 2 was for Half Life 1 - to take everything what was great in the prequel and expand it, polish it, add new extensions, and basically to make it bigger, better and more badass. 
Antumbra 2 is an attempt to bring back from the grave the Adventure/Point and Click genre which over the years degraded into Hidden Object Games with difficulty setting locked on kindergarten level.

PLATFORMS:
-Windows , Linux and Mac. (Desktops)
-Android & iOS (IF Stretched goals reached)
 

 

Antumbra takes place directly after the first part. After Eskalion awaking. Eskalion is weak and lost most of his powers. His realm, Sorma'Ksul is being ruled by his darken half, which makes the land twisted, corrupted and surreal. 

Player is forced to help Eskalion regain his power and rule. Which is more of a need rather then choice, because Player is trapped in the Sorma'Ksul and cannot go back to reality. Eskalion promised, that once he regains his powers he would the Player go back to his homedimension.
 

 

►NON-linear story
►Five Endings
►Random occurance and encounters, unique for each gameplay
►Huge, surreal and living game world
►Over 200 locations to explore and discover
►Mind bending puzzles, riddles and quests
►Hyper-immersive audio
►New elements of the game as you replay it
►Runic magic based Combat system
►Familiars/Companion who assist your playthought
►Medals and Achievements
►Inventory system
►Everything whats great in '90s adventure games with a modern touch and innovative mechanics
►Challanging difficulty setting so it takes you not hours but days and weeks to finish

 

Antumbra 1 was made by me and me only. Every sound effect, every voice over, every animation, every special effect, every piece of graphics, every music track, every line of code, every dialog, design and story - I made myself from scratch.

To be honest, I never intended Antumbra 1 to become so popular, as I've made it mostly for myself. At that time, I was in a terrible state of mind. Problems, both of mental and physical nature were piling up taking my breath away.

So I took all of them and turned them into an interactive game. And by doing so I partially set myself free. Then, the people came. And rained their awe and love on me and my creation. To this day, hundreds of people are requesting me to continue my story. To show them the whole thing.

Antumbra is my own personal purgatory. For over 30 years of my life I've experienced pains and misery like nothing else. Which was decades left me wounded and bleeding. And here, with Antumbra - those wounds are being healed and cured.

Antumbra is not a game. It's an experience. Oh journey through the darkest and at the same time - most beautiful realm there is - a tormented mortal man heart, soul and mind.
 

 

 

 

 

Most of the available perks are self-explanatory, but let me focus on a few that I think deserve a short description.

DRM-free Antumbra 1 Deluxe: this is a desktop version of the first Antumbra game with new locations, old one being re-designed , better code, better graphic design and new achievements.

DRM-free Antumbra 2 Deluxe: This version will be available for my IndieGoGo supporters only. The game will have more music, locations and some hidden secrets not available in a regular Antumbra 2 version. Backers exclusive. This version will never be officialy published.

Original Drone Locker Ambient Albums: I've released 3 dark ambient albums on bandcamp that I want to share with you guys.

Create your own character / location in-game: I will e-mail you and work on adding character, location or both (depends on your pledge) to Antumbra 2. However. please bare in mind that every character / location have to fit the Antumbra world.

Antumbra 2 In-Game Ad: I will add an ad of your choice at the very beginning of Antumbra 2. However, I will have to approve anything added to the game. But as long as you don't want to put a porn ad inside my game - it should be fine. Please get in touch with me before pledging!
 

NONE! :D Surprised? Well let me explain... But please, read it all. I know, we all hate walls of text, but this one's important. Forgive me, but this just cannot be explained in handful of words.

First of all, I am well known for my extreme honesty. For the past couple of days, I've been brainstorming what kind of stretch goals should be available for all my IndieGoGo supporters. Unfortunately, I couldn't come up with anything cool and flashy while still being just me - an indie developer. So here's what I've come up with.

Every penny counts. For the initial 3000 $ I will develop A2 the size of A1. And that's it. That's the spine, the backbone. But its a tiny percentage of what I would WISH to make. More locations, characters, riddles, stories, dialogs, inventory system, runic magic system, combat system, player familiar/companion, full voice-over, better graphics, animations, nonlinear elements that changes with each playthrough, many endings, random encounters, replayable content and much more. The list is big.

My friends, I find it very hard for me to take anything from the list and just glue it to an exact stretch goal. Like "6000 $ - voice over." Because the voice over will be there anyway; the size of it though depends on how successful my IGG campaign will be. I cannot say "$9000 - 100 locations", because this is just a silly number. Think The Elder Scrolls: Oblivion. Who gives a damn how big the gameworld is, if its damn dead, empty and repeatable...? It's all about polishing and putting more "meat on the bones". The more money I have the more features I can add.

Because I do everything myself (graphic design, animations, music, voice over, sfx, code) it's hard to put a price tag on it. Because I am doing the work of at least 6 people. So should give myself 6 independent salaries...? I don't think so.

That being said, I am ready to make something amazing - I "just" need your support!
 

Because it is being request. And in my whole life there was not a request i wanted to fulfil more then this one.
 

Because Love Is A Two-Way, Mutual Thing.

Although my game is dark and unforgiving, the story of this campaign is pretty simple; full of love and appreciation. Antumbra was my first proper game in the genre of horror adventure published for free on Newgrounds, GameJolt and Kongregate platforms.

After the initial release you, the community of the Internet, gave me an incredible, unimaginable amount of love and constructive feedback. I was truly humbled by your response.

It was so unexpectedly well-received that by popular demand it is time for a bigger, better & story-expanding sequel - Antumbra 2: Chant of Dust!

 

Antumbra 2: Chant of Ash is going to be a deep, personal experience for every player just like Antumbra 1 was. That being said, although I'm expecting to finish this game 6 months from the successfully funded campaign the release date might be slightly delayed. 

This game is also my first, proper game project. I've done many in the past, but this is the one that got people hooked. And I want to deliver the same level of emotions you felt in the original Antumbra.
 

 

 

My name is Radek. Also known as Drone Locker. I am a 31 years old father and husband, born in Orwellish year of 1984. I live in Poland.
 
I've received a (crappy) basic high school education. I've been a gravedigger, a nurse in hospital on Intensive Care, a security guard and a handicapped children caretaker.

During my life I've seen thing that cripples and breaks a man's heart. I am a self-learner. I taught myself everything I know.  Raging from English language, graphics, music, audio, to coding, design, animation and whatnot.

I am a weird-music composer, game designer, voice actor, graphics artist, a coder. Also quite a loony.

 

Antumbra 2: Chant of Ash is made by me and myself only and is my personal dreams-come-true type of story. Antumbra 1 was made as my personal cry for help. 
At the time I was working on the game I was dealing with a lot of personal stuff in my life and making this game was the best thing that's ever happened to me, 

Now, after hundreds of e-mails and questions on multiple websites asking me for Antumbra 2, I am ready! 

Antumbra 2: Chant of Ash is going to be everything Antumbra 1 was and much much more. It's about my life and my pain, but at the same time it's about yours too.

 

Some people can't contribute to the campaign directly, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

Please spread the word around and make some noise about my campaign. Thank you kindly!
 

 

Steam Greenlight

IndieDB

Facebook

Twitter

YouYube
story_txt:
In this dark hour, my call to action. Our last stand. Will you join us?
Yes!  VS  No...
    ANTUMBRA 2 STEAM GREENLIGHT PLATFORMS: WindowsVista and higher, Linux & Mac.
LANGUAGE:Default :EnglishOptional: Danish, French, German, Polish, Russian, Spanish, Portuguese+more if enough money will be raised."(...)I look forward to Antumbra 2 if you choose to create it that is. I do hope that you choose to. Continue creating works like this and you'll go far. I think you may have found a good craft for yourself." ~Dragon  ANTUMBRA 1 ACHIEVED:- TopTen on IndieDb, ranging from 10th to 1st spot out of over 26k games- Frontpage on Newgrounds, Gamejolt and Kongregate- 8th spot in monthly competition of April 2015- Over 92 Let's Play Videos has been recorded so far- Antumbra 1 has been played over 520k times across all platform- Average score of 4,5/5- Over 400 reviews on Newgrounds         
  KONGREGATE
 
  NEWGROUNDS
 
  GAMEJOLT
    Dear players and Steamers. Someone raised something to my attention.To put it bluntly: that there is no gameplay in the video.There actually is. Confused? Let me explain.Imagine a painting. A beautiful painting. Now, please imagine you take a step, and then another... And you walk in. Into the painting. Literally. The middle part of the trailer - is the gameplay. But without animations and interface (sorry, I need to make them soon, but at the same time - I am so busy with the Greenlight and the IndieGoGo and they are not rolling as good as I hoped they will :( ).The bottomline is - THAT is the game. Those are not fancy wallpapers or artworks. What you see here is what you will see - inside. As a player. Imagine if the whole world... Would be a painting. But a painting that is alive. Its not static. It lives, moves, breathe. And you are inside. In the world, on the other side of canvas. Aaand well - practically everything tries to kill you :D After all - this IS a horror game.
~DOWNLOAD LINK~ 

~DOWNLOAD LINK~ 
 
~DOWNLOAD LINK~  Imagine Alice in Wonderland and Silent Hill hooked up and had a baby. And then the baby got adopted by Lovecraft and raised on the board of Event Horizon during its virgin flight. Antumbra 2 is that child.  Antumbra 2, as its prequel is a very surreal point-and-click horror adventure game. It has a powerful storyline, immersing audio, surreal graphics and atmosphere thick and sticky like tar. 
Its an adventure game like nothing else, taking inspiration from things like Silent Hill, Darkseed, Event Horizon, Lovecraft, H.R. Giger, Zdzislaw Beksinski, Hellraiser, David Firth animations, Alice in Wonderland, Planescape: Torment and many many others. 
The idea is to make Antumbra 2 to be for Antumbra 1 what Half Life 2 was for Half Life 1 - to take everything what was great in the prequel and expand it, polish it, add new extensions, and basically to make it bigger, better and more badass. 
Antumbra 2 is an attempt to bring back from the grave the Adventure/Point and Click genre which over the years degraded into Hidden Object Games with difficulty setting locked on kindergarten level.

PLATFORMS:-Windows , Linux and Mac. (Desktops)-Android & iOS (IF Stretched goals reached)

story:
About

Flybros is a stone skipping type of game where you play as a mustache baldy; flying and skipping on clouds with his wings like a mustache. The goal: groom your mustache to unlock its hidden potential!

Download Flybros on you mobile phone. All backer have access to Beta version!! 

How to play?


Story

Flybros takes place in the early 1900s, and like many gentlemen in their era, the two brothers dream of being the first men to take flight. The brothers are blessed with talent, however talent alone is not satisfying enough. They want to be known as inventors. But since the brothers are unsuccessful at growing fine mustaches, they aren’t accepted by the inventor community, unrecognized as true gentlemen, and thus never taken seriously as inventors.

However, on one fateful day the brothers discovered a vessel of shampoo that fell from the sky, which read: “May all your dreams and wishes come true.” Little did they know that this odd looking bottle would alter their fate forever.



Enemies

Boss : Lv. 2

Cut Scene

The cut scenes were inspired by classic manga mixed with popular anime parodies. Enjoy ridiculously hard-boiled cut scenes as you fly! You’ll feel a power surge within you as you play. If that happens don’t be shy, and yell out your battle cries together – ORA! ORA! ORAAAA!!!!


Groom

In Flybros, we created a unique level up system. You do not gain experience from fighting or flying. Instead you level up by grooming your mustache. Some of the hair products you collect can be used to groom. Why? Because your mustache will evolve, of course!

So let us fly with GRACE and POWER!


Music

Our team realized the power of audio right away. We wanted the sound effects to make you laugh while simultaneously invoking your fight spirit. That is why we invested a lot of our funding into the audio experience. We are lucky enough to have Alyssa Menes as our sound designer.


Imagery below is not finalized art!




Why Indiegogo?

For months, we have been working tirelessly on Flybros, and we’ve come a long way since our initial dream. Now, we have arrived at a point where we cannot progress further without additional funding. We chose Indiegogo to not only crowdfund, but also create digital sharing opportunities to spread word about our game. Without you, the mustaches cannot take flight. Let’s us fly together to the place where men, women, and children can fly with mustaches!


Risks and Challenges

Flybros’ main mechanics are already established. The challenge stems from polishing the game and adding extra features, both of which we do not want to risk delaying. We will do our best and work our hardest to develop the most refined product for your maximum enjoyment, and because we are small, dedicated team, this process will take very little time.

Why Indiegogo?

For months, we have been working tirelessly on Flybros, and we’ve come a long way since our initial dream. Now, we have arrived at a point where we cannot progress further without additional funding. We chose Indiegogo to not only crowdfund, but also create digital sharing opportunities to spread word about our game. Without you, the mustaches cannot take flight. Let’s us fly together to the place where men, women, and children can fly with mustaches!






Risks and Challenges

Flybros’ main mechanics are already established. The challenge stems from polishing the game and adding extra features, both of which we do not want to risk delaying. We will do our best and work our hardest to develop the most refined product for your maximum enjoyment, and because we are small, dedicated team, this process will take very little time.

story:
I am Tina Ziemek, and I started Last of Five, LLC to create children’s play that is balanced, sincere, and promotes unity in a world where play is disproportionate, artificial, and promotes division. Our inaugural project, Miramonte Park, is a make-believe playground designed to bring out the best of both digital and real-world play for boys and girls ages 3-to-6. We intertwine digital learning games, which adults appreciate, free-play, which children love, and stories and real-world play in one single app. Our playground is imaginary, and our storybooks are physical and digital.  We found that many parents do not want to read eBooks with their child but want to participate in their child’s digital worlds.  Our stories are written to be enjoyed by adults and children, and our interactive digital books offer children a unique window into the world. We’ve created characters based off the five elements:  earth, air, fire, water, and space, and have animal characters that are equals in our world. Our goal is to celebrate our place in nature. We want to acknowledge the magic of all of the elements but also help children understand what we know about nature, and how it works. For example, we illustrate the lifecycle of a plant, how snow forms, and why fire is hot.

The main characters are based off of the five elements (from left to right): water, earth, space, fire, and air.  The story follows the space character named Violet.
The digital storybooks have learning games for when your children want to play on their own. These games allow children to practice a wide range of learning concepts including literacy skills, spatial skills, and empathy. Literacy develops self-image and provides a foundation for all other learning. Spatial ability lends itself to creativity and is correlated with success in various scientific and engineering disciplines. Empathy increases happiness, problem solving abilities, and courage. 

In our first story, Alfie (the cat-like animal), has magic seeds that he offers Violet so she can plant them and make a wish. In the digital storybook, your child grows the plant by picking the correct seed, and giving it dirt, water, and sun. The child will see his or her plant throughout the story and will use it at the end of the story. Parents may be happy to know the magic seeds are not the solution to solving Violet’s problem. Instead, persistence, ingenuity, and teamwork save the day. 

Video of Miramonte Park Prototype shown at 3.5x actual speed.  There is no audio.

Our goal is to give an object at the completion of each learning game and turn these objects into toys your child can use in the playground's sandbox. For example, in the growing plants' game, your child will get a shovel that can be used for digging in the sandbox. 

We will also provide ideas for real-world, hands-on activities that tie into the story and complement the digital games. These activities will emphasize free play and will turn household objects into playtime tools. Below is a paper-based activity we did at a local farmer's market where children designed their own flowers.  Parents loved seeing their child's creative process, the flower their child made, and how each flower was unique to their child.


In another activity, we built terrariums so children could watch real plants grow over time and recognize everything doesn’t happen as quickly as it does in Miramonte Park.  We encourage making the terrarium out of a large spaghetti sauce jar or similar object to emphasize the importance of reuse and recycling.

There is no shortage of apps available for children, but there is a shortage of high-quality learning apps.  You can think of playing like eating, and buying toys like buying food. Many apps are sugary and salty bite-sized snacks. We have found these apps are primarily used to keep kids busy here and there.

Miramonte Park is the organic alternative and complete solution because we give children a rainbow of colors, stories, activities, games, and opportunities for free play and learning.  We believe true, genuine play gives children the opportunity to learn on their own terms, grow their imagination, and be their true selves.

Our goal is to make screen time meaningful.  We aim to be the center of a wide range of learning, where your child can make discoveries, and feel that learning is fun. We understand that you need Miramonte Park to help in times when your child is sick, unable to play outside, when you’re traveling, and when your child is begging to play on the iPad.  

Our company, Last of Five, is focused on creating learning games, and  we believe narrative is the fundamental form of human learning. We have made stories the heart of our world, so that the narratives and characters can create a whimsical and fantastical space for your child to imagine, play, and learn. We want children to be fully engaged with our world. By beginning with the storybook, we are creating a strong narrative that doesn’t sacrifice story for gameplay.

The second reason we’re starting with story is more personal – as game designers, we think the most compelling games have narrative.  More broadly speaking, you can reduce the game design process to one of two basic approaches — you can start by creating a narrative — who the characters are, why they are doing what they are doing — or you can start by designing the game mechanics — the actions characters take such as jumping, flying, and things like that. By starting with narrative, we can be more creative with gameplay. And the more creative we can be as designers, the more creative our players will be when playing our games.

Montee is derived from the Spanish word "monte" for mountain.  As Joseph Campbell noted, you are the central mountain, I am the central mountain, we are all the central mountain, and that is the mythological way of being an individual. We are all Montees, and that is what will make the park magical.

Our stories redefine archetypes, challenge stereotypes, support individuality, and give children the freedom to imagine. We intentionally mix up our color palette and do things like make the fire character purple. We emphasize that our differences can help us better understand our world. And our story follows our Space character, Violet, as she figures out what is unique about herself and that Montees are more similar than different.


We will build this playground one feature at a time.  Join us on our path to learning through play!  

Your involvement will make this playground better for all children.  We want to hear from you via our community platform and incorporate your input and your feedback to design our world including using your characters, mythology, values, and aesthetics in our first story. Together we can create a collective wisdom where everyone's voice will be heard.  You will make our playground something bigger than we can do ourselves.


Monte is Spanish for mountain. We have seven landmarks on our summit to establishing Miramonte Park.

Future Summits:  We have lots of ideas for future development!  You help us decide what to build next! Like . . .
  • a Yellow Slide with ideas for real-world hands-on games and activities, 
  • fun, interactive storybook pages with animations to surprise and delight!
  • sandbox free play where objects collected from the story's games turn into toys!  For example, children can collect a shovel from the plant growing game to make sand sculptures in their sandbox. 
  • sticker and art books for creative play.
  • a teeter-totter for multi-player games, so two or more children can play together. Group activities are essential to developing empathy!
  • parents giving children sandbox toys for real-world behavior.
  • opportunities for parents to see their children's creative process.
  • different language translations such as Spanish and Mandarin.
  • Android and Fire OS versions of the app.

We're students and entrepreneurs and know how to get the most bang for our buck and keep overhead low. The majority of the funds will go toward educators to make learning goals, designers/producers/writer to create the digital book, and artists to make it look awesome!

Here is how the money will be spent:

$38,500:  artists, educators, designers, producers, and writer's salaries (seven people over five months)

$3,800:  administrative including lawyer, software, supplies, and equipment

$8,300:  making and shipping physical perks

$4,400:  indiegogo and paypal processing fees


Should we come in under budget, we will put the extra money to good use!  For example, we will create additional book pages, extra characters, or create hands-on real world activities that come from the story.

Note, this is a "fixed funding" campaign, meaning if we don't hit our goal, all pledges will be refunded.  We need the full amount in order to produce a complete book.

Last of Five will listen to your needs, feedback, and suggestions for our community playground.  We value You, and our independent contributors:  Tina Ziemek, Ph.D. (designer), J. Dianne Brederson, Ed.D. (curriculum), Natasha Wescoat (concept artist), Maria Solomou, Ph.D. (learning scientist), Sarah Ripley (engineer), Camille Pack (author), Jing Zeng (digital artist), Travis Turner (producer), Saumya Mukul (engineer), Jason Beck (street team), Lyn Christian (coach), J. Dean Brederson (early backer/advisor), and Peter Shirley, Ph.D. (early backer/advisor).

Read more about us in The Broomfield Enterprise and University of Utah's Lassonde Institute.

We have two main challenges right now. One, the financial support is a test and there is a possibility that we might have difficulties in supporting our staff to develop this game. Two, we need to convince the skeptics about the value of this game—however, we are on a good track so far, and are grateful to be receiving constructive feedback along with support from parents and educators. We understand there will be additional challenges, and we will be open and honest with you when they happen. Our team is experienced, grounded, and confident that together we can overcome the difficulties that lie ahead.  

Remember the importance of free play in the life of a child. Playing is learning.  Let children guide themselves and have self-directed adult-free play. Please pass along our message, and let's bring play back together!  Thank You for your support!

Your world seems very ambitious in scope and you have a lot going on (arts, games, learning, stories); how are you managing all these ideas?

We are focusing on one piece at a time!  We agree it’s an ambitious project, and we are making Miramonte Park because learning is playing, and playing is learning. We want to share our interests with children to inspire them to take on challenges.

Are you going to have boy characters?

We will create boy characters when the time is right. We would love to stay with the elemental theme of characters, and have boy characters be inspired by naturally occurring elements such as neon, helium, and titanium.

Your game seems feminine, is it a game for girls?

Our game is designed for all children.  Some aspects of our world will be feminine, others masculine, and the rest somewhere in-between.  We spent most of this past summer play-testing our game, and both boys and girls liked the game equally well. It was interesting to me, but frankly not surprising given my background building games and my access to learning and gaming research that neither the boys nor girls play-testing Miramonte Park really noticed the strong female presence in the game, and those that did notice did not seem to mind.

So, what turns out to be interesting, and potentially a challenge, is that adults — who buy these games for children — quickly and independently note character gender in Miramonte Park. This is not a game design issue per se in terms of enjoyability and playability, but this is something I have seen before — it is a marketing and presentation issue to parents, the economic buyer, rather than the kids.

We've thought about it deeply at Last of Five. It is puzzling that adults do not question whether the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles game is a world exclusively for boys because of its strong male presence!

Lastly, I think boys need strong female characters in games and books just as much as girls do, and taking different perspectives and gameplay strategies into account while designing yields better games. So we make games for everyone.

Why don’t you show any children in your videos/images?

We want Miramonte Park to speak for itself.  We want you to imagine being part of this world, and decide if you like it.  We are frustrated by a lot of the marketing that is directed toward children these days, and we do not want to be influenced by these tactics where children are used as propaganda to sell products.

What is your game design process?

By starting with the story, we are able to set ourselves up for success.  We will decide where the digital learning games and real-world activities will go as we write the story.  If we need to modify the story to accommodate a learning activity, we can.  After the story is set, we can dive deeper into creating the learning games and real-world activities.  We will create the real-world activities first to keep children engaged with our world as we develop the digital games.  This process will also give children the freedom to play and imagine and make up their own games before they play ours.  We will then create each digital game and publish them as we complete them. 

Why is it called Miramonte Park?

My most important “ah-ha” moment after I started designing Miramonte Park was its name. You see, Miramonte Park is named after a real place; it’s the park I grew up next to.  I knew if I named it that, it would remind me to stay true to my roots and keep the intrinsic motivation of why we’re doing this project alive.
story_txt:
I am Tina Ziemek, and I started Last of Five, LLC to create children’s play that is balanced, sincere, and promotes unity in a world where play is disproportionate, artificial, and promotes division. Our inaugural project, Miramonte Park, is a make-believe playground designed to bring out the best of both digital and real-world play for boys and girls ages 3-to-6. We intertwine digital learning games, which adults appreciate, free-play, which children love, and stories and real-world play in one single app. 


Our playground is imaginary, and our storybooks are physical and digital.  We found that many parents do not want to read eBooks with their child but want to participate in their child’s digital worlds.  Our stories are written to be enjoyed by adults and children, and our interactive digital books offer children a unique window into the world.




We’ve created characters based off the five elements:  earth, air, fire, water, and space, and have animal characters that are equals in our world.  Our goal is to celebrate our place in nature. We want to acknowledge the magic of all of the elements but also help children understand what we know about nature, and how it works. For example, we illustrate the lifecycle of a plant, how snow forms, and why fire is hot.

The main characters are based off of the five elements (from left to right): water, earth, space, fire, and air.  The story follows the space character named Violet.



The digital storybooks have learning games for when your children want to play on their own.  These games allow children to practice a wide range of learning concepts including literacy skills, spatial skills, and empathy.   Literacy develops self-image and provides a foundation for all other learning.  Spatial ability lends itself to creativity and is correlated with success in various scientific and engineering disciplines.  Empathy increases happiness, problem solving abilities, and courage. 


In our first story, Alfie (the cat-like animal), has magic seeds that he offers Violet so she can plant them and make a wish.  In the digital storybook, your child grows the plant by picking the correct seed, and giving it dirt, water, and sun.  The child will see his or her plant throughout the story and will use it at the end of the story.  Parents may be happy to know the magic seeds are not the solution to solving Violet’s problem.  Instead, persistence, ingenuity, and teamwork save the day. 

Video of Miramonte Park Prototype shown at 3.5x actual speed.  There is no audio.



Our goal is to give an object at the completion of each learning game and turn these objects into toys your child can use in the playground's sandbox. For example, in the growing plants' game, your child will get a shovel that can be used for digging in the sandbox. 

We will also provide ideas for real-world, hands-on activities that tie into the story and complement the digital games. These activities will emphasize free play and will turn household objects into playtime tools. Below is a paper-based activity we did at a local farmer's market where children designed their own flowers.  Parents loved seeing their child's creative process, the flower their child made, and how each flower was unique to their child.


In another activity, we built terrariums so children could
watch real plants grow over time and recognize everything doesn’t happen as
quickly as it does in Miramonte Park.  We encourage making the terrarium out of a large spaghetti sauce jar or similar
object to emphasize the importance of reuse and recycling.



There is no shortage of apps available for children, but there is a shortage of high-quality learning apps.  You can think of playing like eating, and
buying toys like buying food. Many apps are sugary and
salty bite-sized snacks. We have found these apps are primarily used to keep kids busy here and
there.

Miramonte Park is the organic alternative and complete solution because we give children a rainbow of colors,
stories, activities, games, and opportunities for free play and learning.  We believe true, genuine play gives children the opportunity to learn on their own terms, grow their imagination,
and be their true selves.

Our goal is to make screen time meaningful.  We aim to be the center of a wide range of learning, where your child can make discoveries, and feel that learning is fun. We understand that you need Miramonte Park to help in times
when your child is sick, unable to play outside, when you’re traveling, and
when your child is begging to play on the iPad.  




Our company, Last of Five, is focused on creating learning games, and  we believe
narrative is the fundamental form of human learning. We have made stories the heart of our world, so that the narratives and characters can create a whimsical and fantastical space for your child to imagine, play, and learn. We want children to be fully engaged with our world. By beginning with the storybook, we are creating a strong narrative that doesn’t sacrifice story for gameplay.


The second reason we’re starting with story is more personal
– as game designers, we think the most compelling games have narrative.  More broadly speaking, you can reduce the game design process to one of two basic approaches — you can start by creating a narrative — who the characters are, why they are doing what they are doing — or you can start by designing the game mechanics — the actions characters take such as jumping, flying, and things like that. By starting with narrative, we can be more creative with gameplay. And the more creative we can be as designers, the more creative our players will be when playing our games.


Montee is derived from the Spanish word "monte"
for mountain.  As Joseph Campbell noted, you are the central
mountain, I am the central mountain, we are all the central mountain, and
that is the mythological way of being an individual. We are
all Montees, and that is what will make the park magical.

Our stories redefine archetypes, challenge stereotypes, support individuality, and give children the freedom to imagine. We intentionally mix up our color palette and do things like make the fire character purple. We emphasize that our differences can help us better understand our world. And our story follows our Space character, Violet, as she figures out what is unique about herself and that Montees are more similar than different.

We will build this playground one feature at a time.  Join us on our path to learning through play!  
Your involvement
will make this playground better for all
children.  We want to hear from
you via our community platform and incorporate your input and your feedback to design our world including using your characters, mythology, values, and aesthetics in our first story. Together we can create a collective
wisdom where everyone's voice will be heard.  You will make our playground
something bigger than
we can do ourselves.





Monte is Spanish for mountain. We have seven landmarks on our summit to establishing Miramonte Park.
Future Summits:  We have lots of ideas for future development!  You help us decide what to build next! Like . . .


a Yellow Slide with ideas for real-world hands-on games and activities, 
fun, interactive
     storybook pages with animations to surprise and delight!

sandbox
     free play where objects collected from the story's games
turn into toys!  For example, children can collect a shovel
     from the plant growing game to make sand sculptures in their sandbox. 

sticker
     and art books for
     creative play.
a teeter-totter
     for multi-player games, so two or more children can play together. Group activities are essential to developing empathy!

parents giving children sandbox toys for real-world behavior.

opportunities
     for parents to see their
     children's creative process.
different
     language translations such as Spanish and Mandarin.

Android and
     Fire OS versions of the app.








We're students and entrepreneurs and know how to get the most bang for our buck and keep overhead low. The majority of the funds will go toward educators to make learning goals, designers/producers/writer to create the digital book, and artists to make it look awesome!


Here is how the money will be spent:
$38,500:  artists, educators, designers, producers, and writer's salaries (seven people over five months)
$3,800:  administrative including lawyer, software, supplies, and equipment
$8,300:  making and shipping physical perks
$4,400:  indiegogo and paypal processing fees

Should we come in under budget, we will put the extra money to good use!  For example, we will create additional book pages, extra characters, or create hands-on real world activities that come from the story.
Note, this is a "fixed funding" campaign, meaning if we don't hit our goal, all pledges will be refunded.  We need the full amount in order to produce a complete book.


Last of Five will listen to your needs, feedback, and suggestions for our community playground.  We value You, and our independent contributors:  Tina Ziemek, Ph.D. (designer), J. Dianne Brederson, Ed.D. (curriculum), Natasha Wescoat (concept artist), Maria Solomou, Ph.D. (learning scientist), Sarah Ripley (engineer), Camille Pack (author), Jing Zeng (digital artist), Travis Turner (producer), Saumya Mukul (engineer), Jason Beck (street team), Lyn Christian (coach), J. Dean Brederson (early backer/advisor), and Peter Shirley, Ph.D. (early backer/advisor).
Read more about us in The Broomfield Enterprise and University of Utah's Lassonde Institute.






We have two main challenges right now. One, the financial support is a test and there is a possibility that we might have difficulties in supporting our staff to develop this game. Two, we need to convince the skeptics about the value of this game—however, we are on a good track so far, and are grateful to be receiving constructive feedback along with support from parents and educators. We understand there will be additional challenges, and we will be open and honest with you when they happen. of enjoyability and playability, but this is something I have seen before — it

story:
WearPlay Wristband & Headset and a smartphone

 

Basically taking the video game and bringing it to your reality, you're able to become the video game character wherever you are, whenever you want!

 

 

 

 

 

The WearPlay proprietary software enables our game apps to utilize the camera view of your smartphone. Our software superimposes the computer-generated game images with the real life camera view and displays in a split screen format. When a user places the smartphone in a headset, the user's brain merges the two screens into a real life immersive gaming view. Our motion-sensing wristband controller is used as a game controller to interact with the game characters.

"Punching Panda" Demo
 

 

 

 

 

 

We are aiming to launch these games after we deliver the Indiegogo awards.

Consider these extra bonus games that we will try to provide our backers!

 

 

Our current default color offering for the central sensor piece is white. If we get enough support, we will definitely work to offer more colors options. We will keep you updated!

 

Let’s make it happen—together 

With IAR, the possibilities for both classic and innovative gameplay are endless. Our goal is to provide a platform in the near future that allows game developers to create IAR compatible games. Whether you love adventure games or are a hardcore fighting game fanatic, our vision is to give everyone the chance to enhance and enjoy their favorite games with an interactive gaming experience.

 

 

The WearPlay is developed by a team of industry veterans passionate about changing the way people experience video games forever. We’ve tackled projects of similar scope: we’ve designed and manufactured consumer hardware; and now we’re excited to build a product that can radically change the way people play their favorite video games.

We hope you can share our excitement about virtual reality, augmented reality, and the future of gaming. Join us in our vision to create a gaming experience like never before!

 

 

WearPlay seeks to push the limits of gaming tech into uncharted territory.

Naturally, developing a new and innovative technology is a monumental undertaking with a plethora of technical and operational hurdles to overcome. However, you may rest assured that WearX’s team consists of seasoned veterans with a wealth of experience developing and manufacturing consumer products of similar scope. The WearX team has successfully launched and delivered two Kickstarter campaigns, including the Titan 1 3D printer, raising over $687K. We are experienced and confident that we will deliver a great product again.

In addition, our team is intensely passionate about our vision and is giving 110% into making WearPlay nothing short of amazing. The WearPlay has been in development for approximately a full year and is being tirelessly fine-tuned and perfected by our group of experienced developers.

You can be certain that we will be fully transparent and provide constant updates on all major developments along the way. We value transparency and will be sure to keep you in the loop.

Regarding manufacturing and distribution, we are rigorously commuted to upholding the highest of standards. We pride ourselves in our ability to create and provide for you a durable and high quality product that lives up to our standards.

In the small chance that a slip-up does occur, we will do everything we can to ensure that you receive and are fully satisfied with your product.

 

 

Please email contact@wearxnow.com if you have any other questions!

story:
WHAT IS RC RACER?

 

What do you get when your racing game has… unique cars, superb drifts, fierce combats, hidden traps, blasts, explosions everywhere, jumps, up to eight cars (human and AI), collectibles, easter eggs, breathtaking settings...?

...RC Racer is what you get.

 

RC Racer is not only a typical PC racing-car-combat video game: it requires a bit of cunning and strategy. You drive RC cars against other players and AIs. Ours is an action-packed game where you are not only fighting to be the first, but also to survive.

Collect coins to buy better and faster cars. Find gadgets to trick your opponents. Compete in beautiful handcrafted levels. Master drifting and become the best RC Racer.

No point being the fastest if you can’t make it to the finish line.

 

ABOUT RAVENSTONE STUDIO

 

It all started at the end of August, 2020. We had been talking about this for ages, the same recurrent discussion: how come some AAA games are visually astounding but some seem lifeless at the same time, no matter the genre or their storyline? Most of the time, it all comes down to “what we would have changed to make it better” if it were up to us. 

We feel games are automatised, almost clockwork reproductions. If games were created as a coherent whole by people who know each other and share a vision, things would be very different. We want to make this a trend and exalt true artistic freedom. We want to take risks… to create worlds... we want our games to represent our selves. For us, risk is the foundation of art… and art is the foundation of fun.

That’s why we, Mauro Fuentes and Diego Gomez, decided to take action and found Ravenstone at the end of August, 2020. We are a brand new independent game development studio with members in Seattle (US), Granada (Spain) and Buenos Aires (Argentina): in other words, a multicultural and diverse group. Our aim is to be trend-setters instead of just sticking to the current mainstream video game industry. That is, to be a breath of fresh air for the gaming community.

We are excited to present our first official video game: RC Racer.

 

WHY HELP RAVENSTONE?

 

Paraphrasing agent Smith: It is purpose that created us. Purpose that connects us. Purpose that pulls us. That guides us. That drives us. It is purpose that defines us. Purpose that binds us. We are here because of you, Mr Player.

 

Like Smith, we have this strong sense of purpose. Our friendship brought us together and made us colleagues, but there is a much higher purpose: a professional one. The only game worth playing is a fully developed one. 

 

A video game is only a game if it’s playable.
 

If you decide to help Ravenstone take off, you will be enabling a small young team to consolidate and grow, not only in terms of business but also from the point of view of personal fulfilment. You will give us the chance to do what we love. 

 

Give us your support so that we can properly finish this video game. In the long term, your support will allow us to create more titles and offer the gaming community handcrafted original material. 

 

Give us your support so more artists, programmers and designers can come work with us. It’s a virtuous circle.

Why help us? In only 4 months we’ve achieved this. Imagine what we will achieve in more time and with your support.

 

CURRENT FEATURES

Cool features that are already working:

  • Video game infrastructure code basis. Most of the infrastructure for this phase is already coded. On this basis, we can easily expand the system in a modular way
  • Career mode in alpha stage
  • Versus mode in alpha stage
  • Your garage to select cars
  • A simple automatic save system
  • 4 stunning and unique low poly scenarios
  • 6 frantic one-of-a-kind racing cars
  • Fuzzy decision-making AI (not completely based on predefined paths)
  • Weapons to trick or harm opponents
  • Traps to sabotage other racers (careful: they can turn against you)
  • Collectible coins to buy more cars
  • Mind-blowing drift system.
  • Stats for each car

 

WHAT WE NEED THE FUNDS FOR

 

We need around $16,000 to complete the first phase of the development and give you a solid offline version of RC Racer with Career and VS (against P2) modes. We need to recoup part of our initial investment in order to reinvest in the game. To ensure stability within Ravenstone, we will pay competitive salaries to all our staff.

With the help of a UI artist, a concept artist, a 3D artist, a full-time programmer and a copywriter, we will improve the current game state. The full-time programmer will be helping us wrap up or enhance the features the game already has and set up the foundations for the online and other modes. We need time for artists to turn prototypes into final state assets and polish up the current tracks.

We’ll invest part of the funds to further promote the game on social networks. We’ll also hire a beta-tester in order to start testing as soon as possible.

By the end of this period, we’ll have a stable beta version of the game with the characteristics mentioned above and the following features:

  • Versus mode in beta stage
  • Career mode in beta stage
  • Test-drive level
  • Improved UI functionality
  • More cars
  • Secret paths in all tracks
  • Easter eggs

 

WHY CROWDFUNDING

We believe in this project and we are determined to finish it. With your help and support, we could make it happen.

There are many different ways you can give us a hand: you can talk about this project with your friends; share pictures and comments on social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter). The more you share, the more you help the campaign grow. Your friendship and support fuel what we do at Ravenstone. 

We’d love to get feedback from you: constructive criticism is more than welcome, but we appreciate compliments too! ;) 

Now, your funding is vital because financial resources would give us a real chance to devote ourselves to this project full time. The most important reason why we have chosen crowdfunding is that it will allow us to keep full creative independence. We don’t want to be swallowed up by the mainstream video game industry… We are our games.

 

WHY INDIEGOGO

Indiegogo is an international platform that has been around for over a decade and keeps helping thousands of creators, artists and designers carry out their projects successfully. We trust Indiegogo is the right tool to reach thousands of users all over the world. Its flexible goal policy suits our current needs because it allows us to explore our potential. What we need right now is a way of assessing our productivity in the near future since we are an emerging company. 

 

RC RACER PHOTOS

We are proud to show you some shots of the art of RC Racer:

 

 

Here’s a little teaser of our game:

 

 

PLANS FOR THE FUTURE

These are some of the features we’d like to have when the game is a stable release candidate:

  • Race against bosses
    • Defeat them to climb the RC Racer “ladder”
    • Defeat them and win their cars
  • Online mode
    • Friendly race against others
    • Ranked (be the best of the best)
  • At least 10 new tracks as unique and beautiful as the first ones
  • Sprint race mode
  • 10 more exclusive cars
  • Car customization
    • Colours, patterns and paint
    • Accessories that will improve aesthetics
    • Parts that will improve car stats
  • Ranked mode
    • Be the GOAT 
    • Collect points and buy upgrades for your cars
    • Play with your customized car and defeat others
  • Weapons
    • Guns. Lots of guns! A bundle of perks, traps and gadgets
  • Compatibility with other platforms
    • Nintendo Switch
    • Xbox

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

As RC Racer is a strategy-action-race game that requires lots of assets (each with their own system and model), we are treading on uncharted territory. Although we anticipate and monitor problems to keep within schedule, some unexpected issues might arise. When they do, we work twice as hard to solve them.

Early beta-testing is crucial to detect any setbacks and properly correct them; at the same time, we continue developing the game. The risk is to waste time in a loop of trial and error. We strive to offset this with close analysis and careful planning.

As we are planning to develop an online version for RC Racer, the biggest challenge would be to pave the way for it while ensuring the completion of the current modes.

We strongly believe in the methods and strategies we have used so far. We aim high and have worked at a steady pace for four months and we’ll keep it up.

We’ll keep our backers posted periodically.

 

LAST BUT NOT LEAST

 

We are very excited to present our game and we really hope you can back us up!

 

In return for your support, you will get the early access version of RC Racer and some amazing perks.

 

Get in touch! We would love to hear from you!
 

Thank you for your time reading and participating.

 

hello@ravenstone.studio

https://www.facebook.com/ravenstonestudio

https://www.instagram.com/ravenstonestudio/

https://www.ravenstone.studio

@RavenstoneStdio
 

Text written by Copywriter Anahí López Favilli anahilf@gmail.com
story_txt:
WHAT IS RC RACER? What do you get when your racing game has… unique cars, superb drifts, fierce combats, hidden traps, blasts, explosions everywhere, jumps, up to eight cars (human and AI), collectibles, easter eggs, breathtaking settings...?...RC Racer is what you get. RC Racer is not only a typical PC racing-car-combat video game: it requires a bit of cunning and strategy. You drive RC cars against other players and AIs. Ours is an action-packed game where you are not only fighting to be the first, but also to survive.Collect coins to buy better and faster cars. Find gadgets to trick your opponents. Compete in beautiful handcrafted levels. Master drifting and become the best RC Racer.No point being the fastest if you can’t make it to the finish line. ABOUT RAVENSTONE STUDIO It all started at the end of August, 2020. We had been talking about this for ages, the same recurrent discussion: how come some AAA games are visually astounding but some seem lifeless at the same time, no matter the genre or their storyline? Most of the time, it all comes down to “what we would have changed to make it better” if it were up to us. We feel games are automatised, almost clockwork reproductions. If games were created as a coherent whole by people who know each other and share a vision, things would be very different. We want to make this a trend and exalt true artistic freedom. We want to take risks… to create worlds... we want our games to represent our selves. For us, risk is the foundation of art… and art is the foundation of fun.That’s why we, Mauro Fuentes and Diego Gomez, decided to take action and found Ravenstone at the end of August, 2020. We are a brand new independent game development studio with members in Seattle (US), Granada (Spain) and Buenos Aires (Argentina): in other words, a multicultural and diverse group. Our aim is to be trend-setters instead of just sticking to the current mainstream video game industry. That is, to be a breath of fresh air for the gaming community.We are excited to present our first official video game: RC Racer. WHY HELP RAVENSTONE? Paraphrasing agent Smith: It is purpose that created us. Purpose that connects us. Purpose that pulls us. That guides us. That drives us. It is purpose that defines us. Purpose that binds us. We are here because of you, Mr Player. Like Smith, we have this strong sense of purpose. Our friendship brought us together and made us colleagues, but there is a much higher purpose: a professional one. The only game worth playing is a fully developed one.  A video game is only a game if it’s playable. If you decide to help Ravenstone take off, you will be enabling a small young team to consolidate and grow, not only in terms of business but also from the point of view of personal fulfilment. You will give us the chance to do what we love.  Give us your support so that we can properly finish this video game. In the long term, your support will allow us to create more titles and offer the gaming community handcrafted original material.  Give us your support so more artists, programmers and designers can come work with us. It’s a virtuous circle.Why help us? In only 4 months we’ve achieved this. Imagine what we will achieve in more time and with your support. CURRENT FEATURESCool features that are already working:
Video game infrastructure code basis. Most of the infrastructure for this phase is already coded. On this basis, we can easily expand the system in a modular way
Career mode in alpha stage
Versus mode in alpha stage
Your garage to select cars
A simple automatic save system
4 stunning and unique low poly scenarios
6 frantic one-of-a-kind racing cars
Fuzzy decision-making AI (not completely based on predefined paths)
Weapons to trick or harm opponents
Traps to sabotage other racers (careful: they can turn against you)
Collectible coins to buy more cars
Mind-blowing drift system.
Stats for each car
 WHAT WE NEED THE FUNDS FOR We need around $16,000 to complete the first phase of the development and give you a solid offline version of RC Racer with Career and VS (against P2) modes. We need to recoup part of our initial investment in order to reinvest in the game. To ensure stability within Ravenstone, we will pay competitive salaries to all our staff.With the help of a UI artist, a concept artist, a 3D artist, a full-time programmer and a copywriter, we will improve the current game state. The full-time programmer will be helping us wrap up or enhance the features the game already has and set up the foundations for the online and other modes. We need time for artists to turn prototypes into final state assets and polish up the current tracks.We’ll invest part of the funds to further promote the game on social networks. We’ll also hire a beta-tester in order to start testing as soon as possible.By the end of this period, we’ll have a stable beta version of the game with the characteristics mentioned above and the following features:
Versus mode in beta stage
Career mode in beta stage
Test-drive level
Improved UI functionality
More cars
Secret paths in all tracks
Easter eggs
 WHY CROWDFUNDINGWe believe in this project and we are determined to finish it. With your help and support, we could make it happen.There are many different ways you can give us a hand: you can talk about this project with your friends; share pictures and comments on social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter). The more you share, the more you help the campaign grow. Your friendship and support fuel what we do at Ravenstone. We’d love to get feedback from you: constructive criticism is more than welcome, but we appreciate compliments too! ;) Now, your funding is vital because financial resources would give us a real chance to devote ourselves to this project full time. The most important reason why we have chosen crowdfunding is that it will allow us to keep full creative independence. We don’t want to be swallowed up by the mainstream video game industry… We are our games. WHY INDIEGOGOIndiegogo is an international platform that has been around for over a decade and keeps helping thousands of creators, artists and designers carry out their projects successfully. We trust Indiegogo is the right tool to reach thousands of users all over the world. Its flexible goal policy suits our current needs because it allows us to explore our potential. What we need right now is a way of assessing our productivity in the near future since we are an emerging company.  RC RACER PHOTOSWe are proud to show you some shots of the art of RC Racer:  Here’s a little teaser of our game:

 
 PLANS FOR THE FUTUREThese are some of the features we’d like to have when the game is a stable release candidate:
Race against bosses
Defeat them to climb the RC Racer “ladder”
Defeat them and win their cars


Online mode
Friendly race against others
Ranked (be the best of the best)


At least 10 new tracks as unique and beautiful as the first ones
Sprint race mode
10 more exclusive cars
Car customization
Colours, patterns and paint
Accessories that will improve aesthetics
Parts that will improve car stats


Ranked mode
Be the GOAT 
Collect points and buy upgrades for your cars
Play with your customized car and defeat others


WeaponsGuns. Lots of guns! A bundle of perks, traps and gadgets

Compatibility with other platforms
Nintendo Switch
Xbox


 RISKS & CHALLENGESAs RC Racer is a strategy-action-race game that requires lots of assets (each with their own system and model), we are treading on uncharted territory. Although we anticipate and monitor problems to keep within schedule, some unexpected issues might arise. When they do, we work twice as hard to solve them.Early beta-testing is crucial to detect any setbacks and properly correct them; at the same time, we continue developing the game. The risk is to waste time in a loop of trial and error. We strive to offset this with close analysis and careful planning.As we are planning to develop an online version for RC Racer, the biggest challenge would be to pave the way for it while ensuring the completion of the current modes.We strongly believe in the methods and strategies we have used so far. We aim high and have worked at a steady pace for four months and we’ll keep it up.We’ll keep our backers posted periodically. LAST BUT NOT LEAST We are very excited to present our game and we really hope you can back us up! In return for your support, you will get the early access version of RC Racer and some amazing perks. Get in touch! We would love to hear from you! Thank you for your time reading and participating. hello@ravenstone.studiohttps://www.facebook.com/ravenstonestudiohttps://www.instagram.com/ravenstonestudio/https://www.ravenstone.studio@RavenstoneStdio Text written by Copywriter Anahí López Favilli anahilf@gmail.com
