story:
Para ver la versión en Español pulsa aquí.

Be The Best Knight is an ARPG / Sandbox game in 1st / 3rd person , set in a magical and medieval world (available in Spanish and English ) . Play the role of a weak young gentleman who tries to achieve to become the best of all time , for this, we will have our minions , our castle (store wealth , train minions ..) and the various adventures that will live in our travels.

The project began on July 26 last year, its main objectives to achieve was to create a game in which each item was unique , offering a real " sandbox" , without limiting the realism of the game , as in most of the latest games ( who have been published or are forthcoming)some details are highly polished but at the same time overlook basic things : who has not wanted to grab a tank in gta and destroy some buildings ? Or playing minecraft that water arrasase everything in its path ? .

Similarly, another objective is to create a game in which the player's skill premiase , power play half an hour ( or more ) and feel it really worth the time hechado while each player could create your own class as a function of their style of play ( skills are enhanced when used, not to level up ) . All of this focused on a multiplayer game ( Coop / Vs)

 The objective was achieved : With the help of Unity (Free) are designed the basic mechanics of the game , the vast majority based on procedural generation : Maps, structures , enemies, weapons , events , ia ... For the moment, only playable in Singleplayer or Coop(split-screen mode) , but in the future it will be battles against up to 32 players.



HISTORY In BTBK there is no history so to speak ,  only the historical context in which we find (expressed in the multiple books that we find in our trip) , we make history by playing : history ( and quests events) is developed according to our actions. This means that we are not obliged to do X quest to advance , we can pass of it, or even kill whoever gave it. Since the quest are avoidable, can kill any npc : enemy, neutral or ally without worrying about losing access to some quest later.

   PHYSICS: The "Strenght" happens to have a greater role , since all objects satisfy the physical laws , the actions that your character can carry with them depends largely on its " strength " in relation to its weight : lift it , move it , ... at the same time, the weight affects the damage it causes any object ( a function of its speed), this means that if a castle crumbles us within probably die. Even our character will have a weight ( a function of your body and your inventory) making that crossing (heavily loaded) flimsy bridges  is not always a good idea.

               

               

               


CRAFTING: Most of the processes that we will make on crafting  include minigames (in which our passive skills play a major role) in order to prevent it from becoming monotonous crafting and delivering better results in function as you finish the minigame. Besides all actions associated with crafting (fishing, cooking, fur, first aid, mining ...) also count with minigames and it will give exp to us even causing us to level up regardless of  we fight or not.


AUTOGENERATION: Everything is self-generated according to the level and history of the player (s)-in adventure mode, this means that we never find ourselves with 2 identical maps because on each map, will be generated new weapons , enemies, quests structures and events. Despite being still in early-alpha already has more than weapons and enemies different .


COMBAT: The combat is realistic, at all times we can see our hands and feet, which allows greater fight control. We can kick in order to push or destabilizing, throwing lunges, vertical cuts and side (with edged weapons), shooting (guns, wands and bows) or use our powerful (alone or combined) skills as a combo (over 500) . All at the purest style FPS.



Game modes 

To achieve become the best knight of all time we have 2 basic game modes: Adventure and Castillo. 

-Adventure: travel to a randomly generated map (4 km2), either alone or as a coop way up to 4 players (besides our minions). In these adventures we can overcome certain quests (generated and assigned before or during the adventure) and at the same time will have dynamic events. These events can occur even if the player is not present, which forces our knight to explore. Some we faced to enemies, on other we will search treasures, some have to protect someone and some evolve into a true epic, the difference to the quests, is that events are not indicated as such, making the player has to think if you do it compensates, and from which side (if you can) take part ... (each map has between 50-150 events). Also in this mode will have the help of our minions (max 6) whose we can recruiting / breeding in our castle, or capturing on the adventure. 

In this way we can also get the objects to  create / customize our castle or use the "crafting", explore or just destroy and infuriate everyone 


- Castle : start with a small field , but we will create a castle in the purest medieval (and mechanical) style, we can build it by hand, or ordering our minions (no limit minions in castle) that we constructed from Room Planes (made by us or purchased ) . Each room , depending on their size , lighting, objects / furniture inside will have a function, which we will unlock upgrades and other ... our castle

( smithy, throne room, room , torture room , stables, armory , herbalist ... ) . Additionally we will have a lot of traps to place our castle and adjoining land (being able to build structures around the castle), and you will wonder , so many traps ? So simple, occasionally we will be attacked by other gentlemen ( IA offline or online against friends) or simply we will be harassed by a bunch of bloodthirsty monsters . Also in the case of Castillo vs Castillo ( and variants) our minions will fight on our side


Progression and Skills 

To achieve become the best knight of all time ,we have to improve our skills and statistics as well as our minions / castle and have the best team / wealth. To achieve this we have several methods: get experience through various actions: killing enemies, solve quests, make certain minigames, crafting, exploration ... but unlike many other games, this only serves to level up and improving our statistics (not our skills): 

-Strength: Affects the damage / critical damage done with melee weapons (a bit on ranged weapons), our total strength, our (and recovery rate) endurance, armor, ability to lock and load (Force required to lift a given object). 

-Dexterity: Affects damage / critical damage done with ranged weapons in movement speed, attack and velocity of release a physical ability, the probability of evasion, also the chance of critical damage (physical). 

-Vitality: Influence of life (and recovery rate), the physical strength of our character and lessens the effects of disease. 

-Intellect: Affects mana (and  recovery rate),magic  damage /critical, and magic resistance.

-Concentration: Influences the chance of magic critical damage, casting speed magic skill, the cooldown of all abilities and all recovery rates (life, mana, stamina). 

-Perception: It influences the probability of missing a hit (because of evasion of the enemy) and critical chance (physical and magical). It also allows us to see traps / enemies and other hidden secrets. 

-Charisma: Influences the price improvement and allows us to develop more dialogue choices (leading to better results in quests and events). 

-Luck subtly influences everything that happens around you, such as the amount of treasures found, the doors are open, find keys or clues more easily ... 

 

Also is possible that some items / equipment requiring some level at least one of them(one attribute) to equip it.With each level will get 10 stat points to distribute freely, unlike other games in which the player is destined to be a particular class (with a predefined role). To prevent players have to choose which skills to use (and avoid roles), the system of gain skills is: The more you use a skill, the more powerful is, and also will allow you to use the next skill (or skills)of their skill tree. So you decide to raise skills and most importantly, allows you to upload a tree together 42 skills (6 basic) without depending on your level: teachers skilled archers experters in natura, necromancers healers, tanks murderers ...


The skills tree is as follows: We have six basic trees: Magic, Fighting, Strategist, Survival ,Craft and Mysticism .. Each one contain 6 branches (counting the basic 7) which influence each the other, the tree of skills is as follows: 

-Magic (Elemental): This is the most basic magic and on it are the purest spells as "Force Field" and "Shockwave". Contains: Fire, Ice, Light, Darkness, Nature and Tempo. 

-Fight: It teaches different techniques and physical skills that improve our fighting technique, contains: Melee, Ranged Weapons, Guns, Battle Arts, Combat Shield and unarmed. 

-Strategist: It teaches us to command our minions on the battlefield and make better buildings / war machines.contains: leadership, command abilities, war machines, battle cries, Conquistador and Architecture. 

-Survival: It teaches us to survive with few resources and kill silently. It consists of: Trapper, Hunter, Explorer, Murderer, Locksmiths, Thief. 

-Craft: We taught different trades: Blacksmith, Furrier, Tailor, Enchanting, Cook and Jeweler. 

-Mysticism: It teaches the hidden skills and power of the ancient gods. It consists of: Faith, Blood Magic, Voodoo, Alchemy, Summoning and Necromancy. 

They may seem too many skills (about 30 per tree), although it must be said that some of them will be passive, and others will be able to be combined (if allowed) on the different combos (hotkeys). Furthermore, since the only way to improve a skill (increase your level) or unlock it is using it, we won´t find  skills  that we don´t know how to use or that are useless. 


Enemies and NPCs 


In our travels and adventures we will find different NPCs. This can be enemies (the vast majority),neutral or allies. Normally neutral NPCs will not attack us as long as we do not attack them before, some are just "enemies" that,  due to its peaceful nature herbíbora or prefer not to fight, while others (humanoids) can be blacksmithers, sellesr or just someone with we can talk (and maybe get some quest). 

On the other hand we have our allies (both own and allied knights) to help us in any way possible. We will able to hire them, capture them or raise them (animals and insects), and once this is done, we can train them so that they are stronger or more functional but unlike in other games when fighting, we can only indicate orders basic (go to a site, patrolling, wait ...) while they (depending on your level and your level strategist) will be the ones to decide which function develop in the battlefield (healer, dps, tank ... ). This also will occur with our enemies, who if they attack in groups, will choose the most useful strategy against us instead of attacking directly. 

Note that while in the "Adventure" our maximum number of minions (NPC allies to our control) will only be 5, in the "Castle" the number is unlimited (focused on Castlevs Castle fight, but also oninvasions and usable in construction). 

All NPCs are self-generated, depending on which "family" they belong, their appearance as well as their skills and stats will be different. Currently there are 4 families completed "Humanoids", "Undead", "Beast", "Insects" and 3 upcoming ("Golems", "Abominations", "Ethereal"). Broadly speaking, the differences between them are:

-Humanoids: The vast majority have a human appearance, with little or no innate abilities, but with very balanced stats, noted for its strength and intellect. Its toughness (both physical and magical) is low but it compensates with the use of armor and other weapons 

-Undead: Humanoids that long ago passed from this life, resurrected by a necromancer with a new and unique objective: Kill!. Represent high magic resistance and altered states, but pose low physical resistance, which makes them perfect as sorcerers. They haveinnate abilities such as breathing and rebuild. 


-Beasts: agile and fast, most use their mouths to make their attacks. Sometimes they can be seen using them as mounts due to its high speed and power loading, plus her meat is delicious! 

-Insects: Small and weak, but numerous. Although they are the easiest to kill, often with only a few hits, due to their size are the most difficult to hit, but also have been seen giant insects, real killing machines. 


The generation process,selects the parts that make up our NPCs, as a function of these (the number and type), it will have more or less life, attack, speed, shock resistance ... as well as certain special skill (the sting of insects allows poison, spidery legs walk the walls, the claws to dig, dragonfly wings allow flight motionless ...). Similarly, in combat, we can curtail / cut the extremites of our enemy (if a human for example) to prevent attack us, or take the legs off an insect, thus reducing its speed.. All parts of an enemy are destructible, and depending on the destroyed part will do more or less damage, plus the skill that allows that part. For example, while a humanoid can not live without a head , an undead is unfazed. 

With each death (even assassinate an ally) get experience and a small drop (according to the type of enemy). Also if this was carrying a gun, this will be our , which means to kill a weak enemy, but it is very strong for his equipment, always compensated.


    Maps and Structures

Each map to explore is generated at play, including the terrain (holes, grooves, lakes, mountains, caves ...), vegetation (trees, shrubs and grass), natural resources (ores and minerals) enemies, structures, objects and events. 

Both structures and vegetation and are 100% destructible objects, plus all objects / building blocks meet the physical laws (allowing build towers, castles, bridges ..). Trees and shrubs, unless q is destroyed (for wood), bear fruit and reset after a while, so does the grass, which grows as time passes. 


 The structures in addition to self-generate (size, number of floors, number of rooms) also generate the content of these, making certain rooms performing functions within the structure (forging, treasure room, throne room, dungeon ...) .We can do the same things on our Castle, but if we want a specific room (bringing upgrades and improvements to our castle)  it MUST comply with different requirements (light, objects in the room, size of the room ... ). There are also other types of structures such as wells and altars (also destructible) whose function is strange and mysterious. 

 An important point to be destructible, is that the doors (among other things) happen to have a secondary role: if you have the key can open it, if you're strong enough uou can break or throw down, or if you have pumps you can destroy a piece of wall (being careful that it not colapse and kill you). 


On this moment the ground is the only part of the game that isn´t destructible or deformable, although it is one of the basic objectives, along with realistic physics of fluids (water is static moment).


Weapons and Equipment 

In our travels and adventures we will find different types of weapons and armor, each composed and autogenerated by different parts (for the moment only generated weapons). 

For his generation, depending on their type (12 now): guns, bows, swords, daggers, axes, wands, staffs ...  is selected the parts that make up the selected weapon, also the material of which each part will be done and if is magic (the vast majority),the statistics modifiers for each part. 



Depending on the part, and the innate values ​​of the material (or alloy), the physical statistics are generated for each part, which (along with modifiers) are combined to create the ultimate weapon. This allows for example to create a sword grip and handguard which is of iron, but whose blade is diamond (using the physical strength of the iron with the hardness (damage) and low weight of the diamond). Besides exists 2000+ different  statistics modifiers (mainly affects Knight) (800 common, 600 uncommon, 400 unique and 200legendary) make each truly unique weapon. Also depending on the type of weapon equiped, enables ones or others attacks (with different multipliers to damage). 

Just as weapons and armor use the statics of materials (resist, weight, damage ..), so does the malleability, and each party will have a level of malleability, and if the material does not meet ( along with a help of our skill) we will be impossible "crafting" the part with this material, forcing us to progress our skills, find another material, or use the same material but in a less demanding part. 

Also can be observed in the weapon itself as wear level is used, providing a more intuitive Gun Control current state(Perfect>>50% damaged>>90% damaged):



Materials


In our adventures we will find different materials ( 20 different ) , each with different statistics : physical resistance , repair strength , Weight , Damage , Affinity and malleability .

At the same time we can divide them into 2 groups , metallic and nonmetallic , the basic difference between them is that while the latter can not be combined , the metals yes( in a forge ) , forming alloys up to 4 , and depending their proportions will alter in one way or another their stats and appearance. The various statistics that represent a material are:

- Physical Resistance: The resistance of the material against another material. A material with lower strength (peak ) versus other major ( rock) , not be able to break it and reduct the level of reparation (even break )but if hit against a material with less resistance ,  it may break / damage .

- Repair Resistance : The resistance of the material to be repaired , which can be translated so that cost us repair the object , weapon, armor ... in money and time.

- Weight: Affects the strength to move an object , as well as the attack speed of weapons .

- Damage: The base damage that causes the material on hit 

- Affinity: tilt of the Magic on the material (or alloy). 

- Workability: The ease with which the material can be molded to create an object or weapon. 

In the case of alloys, the resulting values ​​do not always positive, but the vast majority of the ratios will result in negative values ​​in parts (very hard material with great harm, but very heavy and not very malleable or a massive damage, but physical endurance 1, which will cause breakage in a few hits). Depending on our knowledge (and some passive skills)we will learn to create better alloys with time. 

To obtain these materials have to mine multiple ores (metals), minerals (diamonds and precious stones), cut trees (wood), sand melting(glass), long as we have the necessary tools, and greater physical strength than material we're going to hit.



Quests and Events 

As we move on our journey to become the best knight,we must take out quests and events. The basic difference is that while the quests can be (mostly) performed along different maps and with a fixed bonus(exp and items) ; events only take place in the current map and are not intended to give a reward for his completion, but depending on how it develops, this will give way to new events, quests, clues ... or do not give anything (making our gentleman should consider to make it or pass). As in the rest of the game the quests and events are self-generated, allowing to divide them into several types: 

Quests: The quests that will take place ranging from the most basic: Rescuing a npc, farm enemies parts / kill, search treasure  to more complicated ..: Conquering a castle, fend off an invasion .. The vast majority of these will be assigned from our castle, by our minions and other emissaries, but we can also start quests from the fulfillment of events, get certain objects or complete the mission itself (in the map). Unlike other games, the missions do not disappear (unless to remove it from our search) even though we have made progress in the game, but the level of difficulty for the realization of these scale according to our knight, making that the most basic mission involves some challenge.


Events : Events are like " mini - quests " which are not required to perform and not always occur in the presence of the player: for example, a fight between 2 teams of enemies, maybe when we come,they already been killed and the event has finalized, but if we hurry , we can take part in the fight and tip the balance of the side you want, so at the end , with a little luck the winning team will become our ally and maybe even gift us something. On this types of events are found the "fight ", " guard ", " assault / conquest" , "defense" or more complex types: a house is on fire , you risk turning it off ... Within this type are also more events global ( affecting the entire map) : flood, eruption , invasion ...

There are other events , which can be called static , and will depend on the actions of our knight ( pick an object, initiate a mechanism to open a chest , complete a quest at any given time ) , having in most cases result in a direct confrontation with the enemy , an ambush, resolve a puzzle or a unique and unrepeatable event.



Funds are needed to further develop the game  and help launch this . For now, the game has been developed by my (programer) , which means that the models and other aspects ( graphics , sound) are not created the best possible way . The funds allow you to expand the team , hiring 3d modelers , sound producers , artists ... which results in higher quality and speed when developing .

It is also necessary to pay for the software , but by the time the game was developed with Unity (Free ) is required to continue to have the paid version ( $ 1,500 ) in addition to acquire other licenses ( if funds are enough) such as Cinema4D ($ 3000) or Substance Database ($ 900). Similarly afford the necessary hardware (servers ) with which will do the test for multiplayer and equipment  for development / debug.The recaudated founds

Below is a list of goals in function of the acquired funds and a brief explanation of each:


-Main Goal : Game Launch! and documentation to all contributors

-Pets & Ships: We can bring pets to accompany us everywhere and help us (not fight) in one way or another depending on their type (walk on water, plan, become invisible ...) in addition to help in the realization of the minigames. 

Creating ships and flying machines with which we can move and fight. Creation with parts and free-style.

-Hardcore Mode: Hunger, thirst, sleep, illness and permanent death (optionally) 

-Realistic Fluids: Most realistic fluids and their behavior: Moco, Gel, Oil, Plasma.

-Customization of Traps and RTS Mode : We may create traps completely customized (size, type of attack, modifiers, color ...) and manage the battlefield (in CASTLE mode) from aerial view in the purest strategy style. 

-Minion Mode: Play from the skin of one of your minions (insects, animals, golems, skeletons ...) both in Singleplayer mode (necessary high level skills) or in multiplayer (or Castle vs Castle or Minion Arena) mode. 

-Special Effects and Particles: allow the generation of weapons and equipment that combine visual particle effects with special effects and crazy: Swords that become flexible whips, sticks that dwarf people, arrows that produce love  ... 

- Object Generator: allow the generation of new objects starting from basic models of existing ones. This will translate into  will not exist 2 identical furniture or 2 identical dishes. Everything will be unique.

- Linux Portability: The game will be also compatible with Linux-based systems 

- Temperature Effects: The game will consider the temperature of objects, causing them to transfer or absorb heat as a function of position(between 2 or more), allowing realistic states of "Freezing", "Melting" and "Evaporation". Also if an object exceeds its maximum temperature will begin to burn (until it turns off and its temperature decreases or converts on ash) 

- Mac Portability and Translations: The game will be also compatible with Linux-based systems. Furthermore it will be translated into French, Italian, German and Russian (currently in English and Spanish).




- Crowns: It will be the currency used in game store and allow buy vanity items, boosters and skins. 

Alpha-Special Avatar: Play like a ****. Only enable for alpha buyers. 

-Your Picture in a Picture: Send us a photo, picture or logo, and enter it in the generator frame so everyone can admirarla.Formato 4:3 scale for a table as follows: 


-Your Picture in a Picture (BIG SIZE): Send us a photo, picture or logo, and enter it in the generator frame so everyone can admirarla.Formato 16:9 scale for a table as follows: 

-Assets/Scripts Pack: It will contain unused models (character, enemies, objects and furniture basic, ~ 30), ambient sounds (~ 10), Sprites for customization (60 +) , shaders and the following scripts (Unity):

 - Dungeon Generator: Generate homes and dungeons of varying size with a number of rooms, size and distribution(random or defined). Also difference each room and allows to place windows and doors. 

- Font Effects: Allows transforming an image file (previously structured as abc) in a dynamic font. 


- Seed Creator: Generate seeds and place them randomly, which uses only germinate if they meet previously reported series of conditions (soil type, terrain inclination, maximum size, portion of area supported ...) 

- Button Creator: Create buttons (visible and invisible)with form of any polygon (triangles, pentagons, trapezoids, irregular ...) and choose their rotation.


- Character Library: A collection of functions from which we can calculate the statistics of your character (more than 80). Functions of saved, loaded, creation and deletion within the library are also included.

                                                            --------

-LICENSE and API for Modders : Once the alpha is complete, all necessary documentation and API development will be delivered ( with a license for mods ) that will allow the creation , publication or sale of the mod (the game  will continue being necessary for play) . In addition, will be provide the tools necessary to make their evidence (access to game servers ) .

-Special Undead Avatar: Play like a skeleton. Only obtainable here .

-Your Name in the History : We will include your name and appearance (real or drawing) in the current story ( historical context ) and you alter-ego will play the role of your choice ( King , pirate, dragon ..). This will be reflected in the books , sculptures and dialogues that we find in our adventures.

-Design a Skill: send us your ideas on what you would like to have skill , appearance , way of realization and effects (no matter if you are crazy) , we'll do it for you and only you can use it.

-Design a Biome : send us your ideas on what new type of biome you would like to see . You will be the responsible for defining its appearance , the type of special events to be developed , the type of vegetation , enemies, structures ... We'll create and take it for everyone to enjoy .

- Special Mention in Credits : Your name will appear next to members of staff in the credits and you can also include a logo to show together.

- Unlimited Access to the Shop : Lets you make any purchase (maximum 3000 crowns per day ) in game-store for all your life for free.
story_txt: Para ver la versión en Español pulsa aquí.Be The Best Knight is an ARPG / Sandbox game in 1st / 3rd person , set in a magical and medieval world (available in Spanish and English ) . Play the role of a weak young gentleman who tries to achieve to become the best of all time , for this, we will have our minions , our castle (store wealth , train minions ..) and the various adventures that will live in our travels.The project began on July 26 last year, its main objectives to achieve was to create a game in which each item was unique , offering a real " sandbox" , without limiting the realism of the game , as in most of the latest games ( who have been published or are forthcoming)some details are highly polished but at the same time overlook basic things : who has not wanted to grab a tank in gta and destroy some buildings ? Or playing minecraft that water arrasase everything in its path ? .Similarly, another objective is to create a game in which the player's skill premiase , power play half an hour ( or more ) and feel it really worth the time hechado while each player could create your own class as a function of their style of play ( skills are enhanced when used, not to level up ) . All of this focused on a multiplayer game ( Coop / Vs) The objective was achieved : With the help of Unity (Free) are designed the basic mechanics of the game , the vast majority based on procedural generation : Maps, structures , enemies, weapons , events , ia ... For the moment, only playable in Singleplayer or Coop(split-screen mode) , but in the future it will be battles against up to 32 players.HISTORY In BTBK there is no history so to speak ,  only the historical context in which we find (expressed in the multiple books that we find in our trip) , we make history by playing : history ( and quests events) is developed according to our actions. This means that we are not obliged to do X quest to advance , we can pass of it, or even kill whoever gave it. Since the quest are avoidable, can kill any npc : enemy, neutral or ally without worrying about losing access to some quest later.   PHYSICS: The "Strenght" happens to have a greater role , since all objects satisfy the physical laws , the actions that your character can carry with them depends largely on its " strength " in relation to its weight : lift it , move it , ... at the same time, the weight affects the damage it causes any object ( a function of its speed), this means that if a castle crumbles us within probably die. Even our character will have a weight ( a function of your body and your inventory) making that crossing (heavily loaded) flimsy bridges  is not always a good idea.                                             CRAFTING: Most of the processes that we will make on crafting  include minigames (in which our passive skills play a major role) in order to prevent it from becoming monotonous crafting and delivering better results in function as you finish the minigame. Besides all actions associated with crafting (fishing, cooking, fur, first aid, mining ...) also count with minigames and it will give exp to us even causing us to level up regardless of  we fight or not.AUTOGENERATION: Everything is self-generated according to the level and history of the player (s)-in adventure mode, this means that we never find ourselves with 2 identical maps because on each map, will be generated new weapons , enemies, quests structures and events. Despite being still in early-alpha already has more than weapons and enemies different .COMBAT: The combat is realistic, at all times we can see our hands and feet, which allows greater fight control. We can kick in order to push or destabilizing, throwing lunges, vertical cuts and side (with edged weapons), shooting (guns, wands and bows) or use our powerful (alone or combined) skills as a combo (over 500) . All at the purest style FPS.Game modes To achieve become the best knight of all time we have 2 basic game modes: Adventure and Castillo. -Adventure: travel to a randomly generated map (4 km2), either alone or as a coop way up to 4 players (besides our minions). In these adventures we can overcome certain quests (generated and assigned before or during the adventure) and at the same time will have dynamic events. These events can occur even if the player is not present, which forces our knight to explore. Some we faced to enemies, on other we will search treasures, some have to protect someone and some evolve into a true epic, the difference to the quests, is that events are not indicated as such, making the player has to think if you do it compensates, and from which side (if you can) take part ... (each map has between 50-150 events). Also in this mode will have the help of our minions (max 6) whose we can recruiting / breeding in our castle, or capturing on the adventure. In this way we can also get the objects to  create / customize our castle or use the "crafting", explore or just destroy and infuriate everyone - Castle : start with a small field , but we will create a castle in the purest medieval (and mechanical) style, we can build it by hand, or ordering our minions (no limit minions in castle) that we constructed from Room Planes (made by us or purchased ) . Each room , depending on their size , lighting, objects / furniture inside will have a function, which we will unlock upgrades and other ... our castle( smithy, throne room, room , torture room , stables, armory , herbalist ... ) . Additionally we will have a lot of traps to place our castle and adjoining land (being able to build structures around the castle), and you will wonder , so many traps ? So simple, occasionally we will be attacked by other gentlemen ( IA offline or online against friends) or simply we will be harassed by a bunch of bloodthirsty monsters . Also in the case of Castillo vs Castillo ( and variants) our minions will fight on our sideProgression and Skills To achieve become the best knight of all time ,we have to improve our skills and statistics as well as our minions / castle and have the best team / wealth. To achieve this we have several methods: get experience through various actions: killing enemies, solve quests, make certain minigames, crafting, exploration ... but unlike many other games, this only serves to level up and improving our statistics (not our skills): -Strength: Affects the damage / critical damage done with melee weapons (a bit on ranged weapons), our total strength, our (and recovery rate) endurance, armor, ability to lock and load (Force required to lift a given object). -Dexterity: Affects damage / critical damage done with ranged weapons in movement speed, attack and velocity of release a physical ability, the probability of evasion, also the chance of critical damage (physical). -Vitality: Influence of life (and recovery rate), the physical strength of our character and lessens the effects of disease. -Intellect: Affects mana (and  recovery rate),magic  damage /critical, and magic resistance.-Concentration: Influences the chance of magic critical damage, casting speed magic skill, the cooldown of all abilities and all recovery rates (life, mana, stamina). -Perception: It influences the probability of missing a hit (because of evasion of the enemy) and critical chance (physical and magical). It also allows us to see traps / enemies and other hidden secrets. -Charisma: Influences the price improvement and allows us to develop more dialogue choices (leading to better results in quests and events). -Luck subtly influences everything that happens around you, such as the amount of treasures found, the doors are open, find keys or clues more easily ...  Also is possible that some items / equipment requiring some level at least one of them(one attribute) to equip it.With each level will get 10 stat points to distribute freely, unlike other games in which the player is destined to be a particular class (with a predefined role). To prevent players have to choose which skills to use (and avoid roles), the system of gain skills is: The more you use a skill, the more powerful is, and also will allow you to use the next skill (or skills)of their skill tree. So you decide to raise skills and most importantly, allows you to upload a tree together 42 skills (6 basic) without depending on your level: teachers skilled archers experters in natura, necromancers healers, tanks murderers ...The skills tree is as follows: We have six basic trees: Magic, Fighting, Strategist, Survival ,Craft and Mysticism .. Each one contain 6 branches (counting the basic 7) which influence each the other, the tree of skills is as follows: -Magic (Elemental): This is the most basic magic and on it are the purest spells as "Force Field" and "Shockwave". Contains: Fire, Ice, Light, Darkness, Nature and Tempo. -Fight: It teaches different techniques and physical skills that improve our fighting technique, contains: Melee, Ranged Weapons, Guns, Battle Arts, Combat Shield and unarmed. -Strategist: It teaches us to command our minions on the battlefield and make better buildings / war machines.contains: leadership, command abilities, war machines, battle cries, Conquistador and Architecture. -Survival: It teaches us to survive with few resources and kill silently. It consists of: Trapper, Hunter, Explorer, Murderer, Locksmiths, Thief. -Craft: We taught different trades: Blacksmith, Furrier, Tailor, Enchanting, Cook and Jeweler. -Mysticism: It teaches the hidden skills and power of the ancient gods. It consists of: Faith, Blood Magic, Voodoo, Alchemy, Summoning and Necromancy. They may seem too many skills (about 30 per tree), although it must be said that some of them will be passive, and others will be able to be combined (if allowed) on the different combos (hotkeys). Furthermore, since the only way to improve a skill (increase your level) or unlock it is using it, we won´t find  skills  that we don´t know how to use or that are useless. Enemies and NPCs In our travels and adventures we will find different NPCs. This allows for example to create a sword grip and handguard which is of iron, but whose blade is diamond (using the physical strength of the iron with the hardness (damage) and low weight of the diamond). Besides exists 2000+ different  statistics modifiers (mainly affects Knight) (800 common, 600 uncommon, 400 unique and 200legendary) make each truly unique weapon. Also depending on the type of weapon equiped, enables ones or others attacks (with different multipliers to damage). Just as weapons and armor use the statics of materials (resist, weight, damage ..), so does the malleability, and each party will have a level of malleability, and if the material does not meet ( along with a help of our skill) we will be impossible "crafting" the part with this material, forcing us to progress our skills, find another material, or use the same material but in a less demanding part. Also can be observed in the weapon itself as wear level is used, providing a more intuitive Gun Control current state(Perfect>>50% damaged>>90% damaged):MaterialsIn our adventures we will find different materials ( 20 different ) , each with different statistics : physical resistance , repair strength , Weight , Damage , Affinity and malleability .At the same time we can divide them into 2 groups , metallic and nonmetallic , the basic difference between them is that while the latter can not be combined , the metals yes( in a forge ) , forming alloys up to 4 , and depending their proportions will alter in one way or another their stats and appearance. The various statistics that represent a material are:- Physical Resistance: The resistance of the material against another material. A material with lower strength (peak ) versus other major ( rock) , not be able to break it and reduct the level of reparation (even break )but if hit against a material with less resistance ,  it may break / damage .- Repair Resistance : The resistance of the material to be repaired , which can be translated so that cost us repair the object , weapon, armor ... in money and time.- Weight: Affects the strength to move an object , as well as the attack speed of weapons .- Damage: The base damage that causes the material on hit - Affinity: tilt of the Magic on the material (or alloy). - Workability: The ease with which the material can be molded to create an object or weapon. In the case of alloys, the resulting values ​​do not always positive, but the vast majority of the ratios will result in negative values ​​in parts (very hard material with great harm, but very heavy and not very malleable or a massive damage, but physical endurance 1, which will cause breakage in a few hits). Depending on our knowledge (and some passive skills)we will learn to create better alloys with time. To obtain these materials have to mine multiple ores (metals), minerals (diamonds and precious stones), cut trees (wood), sand melting(glass), long as we have the necessary tools, and greater physical strength than material we're going to hit.Quests and Events As we move on our journey to become the best knight,we must take out quests and events. The basic difference is that while the quests can be (mostly) performed along different maps and with a fixed bonus(exp and items) ; events only take place in the current map and are not intended to give a reward for his completion, but depending on how it develops, this will give way to new events, quests, clues ... or do not give anything (making our gentleman should consider to make it or pass). As in the rest of the game the quests and events are self-generated, allowing to divide them into several types: Quests: The quests that will take place ranging from the most basic: Rescuing a npc, farm enemies parts / kill, search treasure  to more complicated ..: Conquering a castle, fend off an invasion .. The vast majority of these will be assigned from our castle, by our minions and other emissaries, but we can also start quests from the fulfillment of events, get certain objects or complete the mission itself (in the map). Unlike other games, the missions do not disappear (unless to remove it from our search) even though we have made progress in the game, but the level of difficulty for the realization of these scale according to our knight, making that the most basic mission involves some challenge.Events : Events are like " mini - quests " which are not required to perform and not always occur in the presence of the player: for example, a fight between 2 teams of enemies, maybe when we come,they already been killed and the event has finalized, but if we hurry , we can take part in the fight and tip the balance of the side you want, so at the end , with a little luck the winning team will become our ally and maybe even gift us something. On this types of events are found the "fight ", " guard ", " assault / conquest" , "defense" or more complex types: a house is on fire , you risk turning it off ... Within this type are also more events global ( affecting the entire map) : flood, eruption , invasion ...There are other events , which can be called static , and will depend on the actions of our knight ( pick an object, initiate a mechanism to open a chest , complete a quest at any given time ) , having in most cases result in a direct confrontation with the enemy , an ambush, resolve a puzzle or a unique and unrepeatable event.Funds are needed to further develop the game  and help launch this . For now, the game has been developed by my (programer) , which means that the models and other aspects ( graphics , sound) are not created the best possible way . The funds allow you to expand the team , hiring 3d modelers , sound producers , artists ... which results in higher quality and speed when developing .It is also necessary to pay for the software , but by the time the game was developed with Unity (Free ) is required to continue to have the paid version ( $ 1,500 ) in addition to acquire other licenses ( if funds are enough) such as Cinema4D ($ 3000) or Substance Database ($ 900). Similarly afford the necessary hardware (servers ) with which will do the test for multiplayer and equipment  for development / debug.The recaudated foundsBelow is a list of goals in function of the acquired funds and a brief explanation of each:-Main Goal : Game Launch! and documentation to all contributors-Pets & Ships: We can bring pets to accompany us everywhere and help us (not fight) in one way or another depending on their type (walk on water, plan, become invisible ...) in addition to help in the realization of the minigames. Creating ships and flying machines with which we can move and fight. Creation with parts and free-style.-Hardcore Mode: Hunger, thirst, sleep, illness and permanent death (optionally) -Realistic Fluids: Most realistic fluids and their behavior: Moco, Gel, Oil, Plasma.-Customization of Traps and RTS Mode : We may create traps completely customized (size, type of attack, modifiers, color ...) and manage the battlefield (in CASTLE mode) from aerial view in the purest strategy style. -Minion Mode: Play from the skin of one of your minions (insects, animals, golems, skeletons ...) both in Singleplayer mode (necessary high level skills) or in multiplayer (or Castle vs Castle or Minion Arena) mode. -Special Effects and Particles: allow the generation of weapons and equipment that combine visual particle effects with special effects and crazy: Swords that become flexible whips, sticks that dwarf people, arrows that produce love  ... - Object Generator: allow the generation of new objects starting from basic models of existing ones. This will translate into  will not exist 2 identical furniture or 2 identical dishes. Everything will be unique.- Linux Portability: The game will be also compatible with Linux-based systems - Temperature Effects: The game will consider the temperature of objects, causing them to transfer or absorb heat as a function of position(between 2 or more), allowing realistic states of "Freezing", "Melting" and "Evaporation". Also if an object exceeds its maximum temperature will begin to burn (until it turns off and its temperature decreases or converts on ash) - Mac Portability and Translations: The game will be also compatible with Linux-based systems. Furthermore it will be translated into French, Italian, German and Russian (currently in English and Spanish).- Crowns: It will be the currency used in game store and allow buy vanity items, boosters and skins. Alpha-Special Avatar: Play like a ****. Only enable for alpha buyers. -Your Picture in a Picture: Send us a photo, picture or logo, and enter it in the generator frame so everyone can admirarla.Formato 4:3 scale for a table as follows: -Your Picture in a Picture (BIG SIZE): Send us a photo, picture or logo, and enter it in the generator frame so everyone can admirarla.Formato 16:9 scale for a table as follows: -Assets/Scripts Pack: It will contain unused models (character, enemies, objects and furniture basic, ~ 30), ambient sounds (~ 10), Sprites for customization (60 +) , shaders and the following scripts (Unity): - Dungeon Generator: Generate homes and dungeons of varying size with a number of rooms, size and distribution(random or defined). Also difference each room and allows to place windows and doors. - Font Effects: Allows transforming an image file (previously structured as abc) in a dynamic font. - Seed Creator: Generate seeds and place them randomly, which uses only germinate if they meet previously reported series of conditions (soil type, terrain inclination, maximum size, portion of area supported ...) - Button Creator: Create buttons (visible and invisible)with form of any polygon (triangles, pentagons, trapezoids, irregular ...) and choose their rotation.- Character Library: A collection of functions from which we can calculate the statistics of your character (more than 80). Functions of saved, loaded, creation and deletion within the library are also included.                                                            ---------LICENSE and API for Modders : Once the alpha is complete, all necessary documentation and API development will be delivered ( with a license for mods ) that will allow the creation , publication or sale of the mod (the game  will continue being necessary for play) . In addition, will be provide the tools necessary to make their evidence (access to game servers ) .-Special Undead Avatar: Play like a skeleton. Only obtainable here .-Your Name in the History : We will include your name and appearance (real or drawing) in the current story ( historical context ) and you alter-ego will play the role of your choice ( King , pirate, dragon ..). This will be reflected in the books , sculptures and dialogues that we find in our adventures.-Design a Skill: send us your ideas on what you would like to have skill , appearance , way of realization and effects (no matter if you are crazy) , we'll do it for you and only you can use it.-Design a Biome : send us your ideas on what new type of biome you would like to see . You will be the responsible for defining its appearance , the type of special events to be developed , the type of vegetation , enemies, structures ... We'll create and take it for everyone to enjoy .- Special Mention in Credits : Your name will appear next to members of staff in the credits and you can also include a logo to show together.- Unlimited Access to the Shop : Lets you make any purchase (maximum 3000 crowns per day ) in game-store for all your life for free.

story:
Mini Tank Battles

Welcome to the campaign of Mini Tank Battles. Mini Tank Battles is a comic styled multiplayer oriented 3rd person shooter/ tower defense crossover. The current state of the game is an early alpha. Please watch the video to see some shots from the game.

The main gameplay is a fast paced 3rd person shooter with tower defense to support you in the battlefield. With 4 game modes and 4 classes to choose from. By leveling up, spending skillpoints and getting better gear you are able to overcome bigger challenges.

Please also support via Steam Greenlight: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=147823526

The alpha

You can play a snapshot of the latest alpha here: http://minitankbattles.com/play.php . Do note that this version is in alpha as well as a few steps behind what is posted in the updates.

The classes/characters

There are several classes you can play. At the moment there is one class available (the Tank). The others are still in production:

  • The Tank. An overall well adapted class for combat.
  • The Buggy. A nimble, fast moving, hard to hit class with rapid shooting weapons.
  • The Engineer. A tower oriented class with some quite unusual weapons.
  • The Artillery. A class specialized at destroying opponents from a long range.

Game Modes

There are currently 3 game modes in the alpha. The Coop mode, The Player versus Player mode and the Team versus Team mode. A 4th mode is in development: Assault mode.

  • Coop: In coop mode you and your team have to protect a certain structure against waves of enemies.
  • Player versus Player*: Here you will fight against other players.
  • Team versus Team*: Both teams have a structure to protect. By building towers and spawning waves you try to destroy the other team's structure.
  • Assault: You and your team have to invade a base to destroy the enemy's structure without having a base of your own.

The aim for the initial release is 5 to 10 levels per game mode. Modes with an * are multiplayer only. The others are both multi and singleplayer.

Leveling/ skillpoints / gear

In order to overcome bigger challenges you can level your character. By leveling you get more skillpoints that you can spend to get new and better abilities. Gear is also important. You can get better gear by drops or otherwise to become stronger.

There is also going to be decorative gear to personalize and spice up your vehicle.

Towers

There will be several towers reflecting the main weapons that are available in game as well as a few unique towers.

Production platforms

The game is initially released for PC, Mac and Linux. An android build is also in progress. However the android version will come after the PC, Mac and Linux versions. The iOS version will come after that (sorry for that) since I don't own a Mac or iOS device myself (which are required to create a build). Since I create the game in Unity3d, other platforms may become available, but are no part of the current plans.

Target date for the first release is 2013Q4 to 2014Q1. This date may vary for the purpose of getting the best possible experience during the release. Better good and late than bad and early.

The Campaign

The Developer

The developer behind this game is Guido de Jong (thats me). I am 26 years old and a Technical Medicine student from the Netherlands. I've been working as a programmer now for over 3 years and have done many years of programming before that as a hobby. In November last year I've started this project as a challenge for myself to see if I could make a fun game in 48 hours. I was so pleased with the result, that I've decided to continue on working on the game.

I am assisted by the sound engineer Tim Beek who provides both the music and the sound effects for the game.

The start of the campaign

There are 4 main reasons why I am starting the campaign:

The Prerequisite. Before starting the campaign, I wanted to make sure that a lot of code was completed. I also wanted to finish at least one model that would reflect the final style of the game. The the code I mentioned is for the main game mechanics. There is still a lot of programming to do, but those are mainly focused at the new content that will be added.

The licenses. Another aspect is that I am unable to bring out the game with the licenses I currently own (mostly student version). So in order to be even able to bring out Mini Tank Battles, I must own these full licenses of the creation software.

The company. It is a lot easier to have a company to bring out Mini Tank Battles. So part of the funds will be used to set up the company so I can actually bring out the game.

More funding equals better and more content. As an initial goal I will replace all the temporary models for their full featured versions. If the campaign brings up more money, I am able to provide more content for the game. Since I am a better programmer than a modeler or texture artist, I would be able to fund the costs for external creation of this content. This will most likely speed up the process of the creation of the game as well as better quality of the content.

The funding

I've chosen a fixed funding campaign. I'm simply unable to decently bring out the game without severely cutting on the game features if the fixed funding is not met.

So why does Mini Tank Battles need funding? Most of the points are clear from "The start of the campaign". So here is a short version:

Initial goals:

  • Financing the full licenses of the creation software/hardware.
  • Rent a server for at least one year to host the masterserver on to ensure stable multiplayer.
  • Start a small company to enable the release and further development of the game.

Secondary goals:

  • More content for the game.
    • More levels
    • More weapons
    • More enemies
  • Speed up the process of the game making as well
  • Experiment with other platforms for the release.

Once the Initial Goals are met, I will post more information about the secondary goals. I only want to make realistic goals.

 

Perks

Beta pass

If you like the idea, but don't have that much money, you could go for the beta pass perk. You will get closed beta access.

Contributor mentioning

Besides getting a beta pass, you will be mentioned in the end credits as contributor to the game.

OST + Wallpaper pack

Tim Beek is making a great soundtrack for the game. So if you get this perk, you will get the official digital soundtrack.

Mini Tank Battles - The Game

You get a windows, mac or linux version of the game as well as the perks above. This is pretty much equal to the deluxe version of the game.

MTB + Bull skull hood ornament

So it's great you have the deluxe version at home, but wouldn't is be even better that other players can see that you have contributed with an unique item? With this Bull skull hood ornament for ingame you can distinguish yourself from the other players. This item can only be aquired through the indiegogo campaign. A screenshot of the ornament will be posted here as soon as possible.

MTB + Gold plating

So now you have the deluxe version and your skull hood ornament. If you think the bull skull hood ornament isn't enough, why not adding gold plating to your vehicles? This plating is bound to be recognized from a distance. This is another item can only be aquired through the indiegogo campaign

MTB + Gear design

Well if you like the idea of shooting with your own designed weapons ingame or have a special piece of armor, then this is your perk to match your gold plating and bull skull hood ornament. Together with the developer you will be able to design a piece of gear for a class, turret or boss. You will be mentioned for that in the end credits. Limit of 15.

MTB + Level design

If you are quite the architect, and wan't all the perks with the gold plating and above, this might be the perk for you. Together with the developer you will be able to design a level for one of the four game modes. You will be mentioned for that in the end credits. Limit of 10.

MTB - Great funder

The same as "MTB + Gold plating and below" + you can choose between the "MTB + Level design" or "MTB + Weapon design" + You will be mentioned as "Main funder" in the opening credits.

You will also get a figurine of choice from a character ingame. Limit of 5

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute but really like the idea, no problem. Have you considered helping by:

  • Spread the project through your social media?
  • Spread the project on your local gaming community?
  • Tell friends and family about it?
  • Make video's and screenshots of the alpha and beta's that will come?

Questions/Suggestions/Idea's

If you have questions, suggestions or idea's, please don't hesitate to ask or tell them. I would like to keep an open mind to all input.

 Updates

As the campaign progresses, I will keep the campaign page updated with the latest developments.

story:
Boom! Greenlight update!

We are greenlit! It took just FIVE days for us to storm the Greenlight!



Who We Are & What We Do

VR-Gamers is a small artistic team of gamers of the 1990-s. We're tired of slow-paced modern games with tons of tutorials and linear and boring level-design.

We are making our games with experimental gameplay to see what else we can bring into the genre, and looks like we are not that bad at that at all! ;D

We are making the game about some science facility where scientists were working on the new technologies, but then bad things started to happen - involving military attacks and massive destructions. The protagonist has the power to outrun the world - his muscles and reflexes have been boosted, so he can move ten times faster than the world, allowing him to dodge the falling dangerous stuff or even to use the debris as the slooooowly moving platforms.

So we've created not one, but three playable prototypes of our game to show what we can do and what kind of game could you receive!

You can play the second and the third prototypes on the GameJolt and IndieDB. Also there's the web-version of prototype #2 available on our site.

Right now our team consists of 8 people in total:
  • Eugene Cone - the programmer with crazy gameplay ideas and knowledge of many aspects of the game development - he brought the idea of HASTE, coded the first prototype in 4 hours and then gathered us all;
  • Andrew Milovanov - the artist, that drew all the 2D-stuff and was watching over the art-style of the prototypes;
  • Vladimir Tugay - the musician... There could be semicolon, but there is one thing... That dude is the one of the most famous Russian musicians, also known as Darkman007 - the real life guitar hero, tracker magician and former demoscene programmer;
  • Vladislav Nedviga - the 3D-artist, that used toaster with the vacuum cleaner attached to his computer in order to increase it's computing power and to create most of the sketches, models and textures for our game;
  • Cyril Arkhipov - the architect, that dude knows everything about how to construct the buildings and how mow them down without a bulldozer;
  • Kirill Akimov - the foley artist and sound designer, he has the awesome recording gear and abilities to squeeze the beautiful sounds from the sound of  falling potatoes;
  • Cory Aileen - voice actress, youtube letsplayer, that dropped the most amount of the F-bombs possible using her beautifully strong voice - we just couldn't pass her by and not invite her in our team;
  • Tyler Box - voice actor, youtube letsplayer, the owner of the most impressive beard among the letsplayers and also of the decent voice.

We passionately love oldschool games and really miss them very much, so that's why we've grouped to make something new, but interesting and understandable without many explanations and tons of hints.

You might ask: "So, where's your team's Facebook page?!" - well, there is one, but on the russian li'l brother of Facebook, and it's written all over with our strange Cyrillic symbols :D
OK, there is one on the Facebook too, but due to lack of players' attention it's a bit deserted =)


What We Need & What You Get

When we sat down and calculated all the expenses that would allow us to pay for the advanced hardware, software, taxes and office for comfortable game development, we ended up with sum of 175 000 dollars - that was the perfect amount of money but there was an opinion that we won't be able to raise that much,..

So we sat down again, re-calculated everything and decided, that 95 000 dollars could be enough for creation of the game without renting an office, buying other less expensive and less useful stuff and without hiring a more experienced animator.

Perks... They're simple: the more money you put in the game - the more cool stuff you'll receive: if you're generous enough, you will get not only the game with soundtracks and T-Shirt, but also you'll be able to show off among your friends - because we will create a character based on YOU.


What will we do if we exceed needed amount of money? 

Well... We'll settle down for the DLC's and ports for the platforms other than Mac or PC. Our programmer will take a closer look at Oculus Rift (he had luck to touch and write a small game for DK1). We have very warm feelings about OUYA, but haven't time to work with it yet...

What will happen if we fail raising the funds? 

Oh... That will be the epic fail... Loss of 8 months of hard work and kilometers of wasted nerve strings... You'll have your money back and we will have to switch to the creation of something more simple, more casual, more stupid, more "nya-nya-nya", more idiotic... Mobile apps time-killers, maybe... That would be terrible... Don't wanna think about that, guys. =(


The Impact

Why our project is valuable... Well, we are passionate about bringing cool oldschool feelings about games back. There was the time when games could teach players how to play without showing any arrows, without any NPC's telling what to do. Those games acted like the player is smart enough to play without additional help. Those games were challenging, but brought insanely huge amount of awesome gaming experience through smart level-design, cool soundtrack and replayability.

So that's what our project is all about. Cool oldschool game with a good use of modern knowledge and technologies about time control and epic destructions.


Risks & Challenges

As we are healthy enough - there's very small risk of us abandoning the game due to the sickness :D

Our programmer knows how to write the code and how to make the stuff work, so there won't be big challenges in the programming and level design - it's just a matter of time (short time of course).


Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our game, but don't have the money or abilities to contribute, don't worry, you can help us by sharing the information about our campaign with your friends, parents, neighbors, pets, presidents (OMG, that might be too much :D)... 


Anyway, we are gamers and we love playing and making good games! Stay in touch and light the match! :D
story_txt:
Boom! Greenlight update!
We are greenlit! It took just FIVE days for us to storm the Greenlight!



Who We Are & What We Do


VR-Gamers is a small artistic team of gamers of the 1990-s. We're tired of slow-paced modern games with tons of tutorials and linear and boring level-design.

We are making our games with experimental gameplay to see what else we can bring into the genre, and looks like we are not that bad at that at all! ;D

We are making the game about some science facility where scientists were working on the new technologies, but then bad things started to happen - involving military attacks and massive destructions. The protagonist has the power to outrun the world - his muscles and reflexes have been boosted, so he can move ten times faster than the world, allowing him to dodge the falling dangerous stuff or even to use the debris as the slooooowly moving platforms.

So we've created not one, but three playable prototypes of our game to show what we can do and what kind of game could you receive!


You can play the second and the third prototypes on the GameJolt and IndieDB. Also there's the web-version of prototype #2 available on our site.




Right now our team consists of 8 people in total:


Eugene Cone - the programmer with crazy gameplay ideas and knowledge of many aspects of the game development - he brought the idea of HASTE, coded the first prototype in 4 hours and then gathered us all;

Andrew Milovanov - the artist, that drew all the 2D-stuff and was watching over the art-style of the prototypes;

Vladimir Tugay - the musician... There could be semicolon, but there is one thing... That dude is the one of the most famous Russian musicians, also known as Darkman007 - the real life guitar hero, tracker magician and former demoscene programmer;

Vladislav Nedviga - the 3D-artist, that used toaster with the vacuum cleaner attached to his computer in order to increase it's computing power and to create most of the sketches, models and textures for our game;

Cyril Arkhipov - the architect, that dude knows everything about how to construct the buildings and how mow them down without a bulldozer;

Kirill Akimov - the foley artist and sound designer, he has the awesome recording gear and abilities to squeeze the beautiful sounds from the sound of  falling potatoes;

Cory Aileen - voice actress, youtube letsplayer, that dropped the most amount of the F-bombs possible using her beautifully strong voice - we just couldn't pass her by and not invite her in our team;

Tyler Box - voice actor, youtube letsplayer, the owner of the most impressive beard among the letsplayers and also of the decent voice.


We passionately love oldschool games and really miss them very much, so that's why we've grouped to make something new, but interesting and understandable without many explanations and tons of hints.

You might ask: "So, where's your team's Facebook page?!" - well, there is one, but on the russian li'l brother of Facebook, and it's written all over with our strange Cyrillic symbols :D
OK, there is one on the Facebook too, but due to lack of players' attention it's a bit deserted =)






What We Need & What You Get

When we sat down and calculated all the expenses that would allow us to pay for the advanced hardware, software, taxes and office for comfortable game development, we ended up with sum of 175 000 dollars - that was the perfect amount of money but there was an opinion that we won't be able to raise that much,..
So we sat down again, re-calculated everything and decided, that 95 000 dollars could be enough for creation of the game without renting an office, buying other less expensive and less useful stuff and without hiring a more experienced animator.
Perks... They're simple: the more money you put in the game - the more cool stuff you'll receive: if you're generous enough, you will get not only the game with soundtracks and T-Shirt, but also you'll be able to show off among your friends - because we will create a character based on YOU.

What will we do if we exceed needed amount of money? 
Well... We'll settle down for the DLC's and ports for the platforms other than Mac or PC. Our programmer will take a closer look at Oculus Rift (he had luck to touch and write a small game for DK1). We have very warm feelings about OUYA, but haven't time to work with it yet...
What will happen if we fail raising the funds? 
Oh... That will be the epic fail... Loss of 8 months of hard work and kilometers of wasted nerve strings... You'll have your money back and we will have to switch to the creation of something more simple, more casual, more stupid, more "nya-nya-nya", more idiotic... Mobile apps time-killers, maybe... That would be terrible... Don't wanna think about that, guys. =(






The Impact

 Why our project is valuable... Well, we are passionate about bringing cool oldschool feelings about games back. There was the time when games could teach players how to play without showing any arrows, without any NPC's telling what to do. Those games acted like the player is smart enough to play without additional help. Those games were challenging, but brought insanely huge amount of awesome gaming experience through smart level-design, cool soundtrack and replayability.
So that's what our project is all about. Cool oldschool game with a good use of modern knowledge and technologies about time control and epic destructions.





Risks & Challenges
 As we are healthy enough - there's very small risk of us abandoning the game due to the sickness :D
Our programmer knows how to write the code and how to make the stuff work, so there won't be big challenges in the programming and level design - it's just a matter of time (short time of course).






Other Ways You Can Help
 If you like our game, but don't have the money or abilities to contribute, don't worry, you can help us by sharing the information about our campaign with your friends, parents, neighbors, pets, presidents (OMG, that might be too much :D)... 

Anyway, we are gamers and we love playing and making good games! Stay in touch and light the match! :D

story:
Hello everybody. I'm Thiago Assumption, I'm 26, and I'm graduating in Computer Science, working with development (as a programmer) almost 8 years and I'm here to ask for the help of you to complete a project I'm doing, a game called Dragon Soul.




Dragon Soul is a retro game platform, in 16-bit style, reminiscent of the Super Nintendo classics such as Mario, Metroid, and Megaman.

In the story, the protagonist is a shaman's apprentice who gets the power to transform parts of his body into pieces dragon.

The village of our hero is a very peaceful place and the legend says that is guarded by a mighty dragon of over a thousand years.
However one day, the village was attacked by an enemy who also has the skills of a shaman. The aim of the enemy was to get the power of the ancient dragon, however, he lacked the power was given to our hero, giving birth so our adventure.







Initially our hero only has the ability to turn your arm into a dragon arm (dragon claw).As he goes through phases and defeating the enemies he got the other dragons skills: Dragon Legs (dash), dragon wings (double jump, glide, shield), breathing dragon (fireball), among others.




There are many enemies in the world of our game, however the strongest are definitely the ninjas.

They are the main henchmen of the villain of our game.

There is a huge variety of ninjas, each represented by a different color and a power or weapon.



Shaman with the ability to turn on parts of the body parts of a bull.



Shaman with ability to transform parts of the body parts of an eagle.



Shaman very powerful. It is the main villain of the game. Your goal is to conquer the world collecting the essence of the strongest creatures thus making its much more powerful army.




At first the game will have 8 stages, each as a sub-boss and boss.
The number of stages may be increased to 12 if the goals are achieved here.



$5.00 - Thanks + Wallpaper

$15.00 - Digital copy game + previous items

$30.00 - Sound Track + previous items

$45.00 - Game Guide + previous items

$60.00 - Art Book + previous items

$75.00 - name in the credits + previous items

$500.00 - His face carved on one of the stages (limit 40) + previous items

$1000.00 - You choose the name of one of the 12 boss (limit 12) + previous items

$1500.00 - You choose the name of one of the four dragons (limit 4) + previous items

$2000.00 - you help create one of eight mini boss (limit of 8) + previous items



Much of the game engine already is ready, along with their main functions: movement of the character and enemies, crash, damage, drop items and others.

What did really remains to be completed in the project is the artistic part, creating more sprites and images. It will also be invested on the part of audio. Sounds and music of the game.



As I said above, the game is already very evolved. From my point of view, I see no problem that would prevent me from releasing the game.
 
The only risk calculation to be possible, it would be a short delay in the launch of the game. But I do not believe that this delay will occur. Will invest enough for this project finished as quickly as possible.
